Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: CMXCMX
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property and could not have had a better experience. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and located about a 15 minute walk (or 5 minute tram) from the main bus station. The platinum recognition here is as good as it is in any hotel in the Starwood family. Though clearly a luxury hotel, it comes without the pretentiousness you might associate with an upscale property. The staff was really great helping me learn about the property, get anything I needed and helping me around the town. The only thing I could say negative, which is really nitpicking, is that once housekeeping was loud outside my room for like a minute. It didn't disturb me, but I could see how it could if you were trying to sleep in. Could have been a function of the proximity of my room and the housekeeping room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible mosquito problem.”
Reviews.Author: Mimulynn
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, a block away from the Anne Frank House and all major monuments and squares. Amsterdam is truly a beautiful city and the hotel is very quaint and has lots of character. Service was good and food options were optimal. However, after our first night's stay I had at least 10 mosquito bites on my upper body, including my face, not good. My husband was attacked fiercely by the mosquitoes and his arms were badly bitten. We complained to the concierge who said they would spray something in the room but that never happened and the mosquitoes kept biting us until we managed to kill them all ourselves. They were so big there were little blood splatters on the wall whenever we got one. They need to get this issue under control, if this happens in cold weather I can't even imagine how bad it gets in the summer sitting right next to a canal.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: valerie D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend. The location is great. The staff is kind,helpful, and professional. The rooms are very comfortable, not over the top but nice. my only suggestion is that you may want to request a room facing the garden instead of the canal...It was a bit noisy (at times )in the middle of the night with happy people coming home from a night on the town. That being said it wasn't terrible and we were in Amsterdam:) Oh, and it was cold in the middle of April (I'm solar powered:)

Reviews.Title: “Ambiance, location, interesting!”
Reviews.Author: TracyAP
Reviews.Content: Lovely couples stay in a loft suite. Great location, architecture and atmosphere. Art gallery corridors and nested interior patios. Super concierge and evening bar menu. Lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan22
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a mini-break and we just loved this hotel. The room was extremely comfortable and the bathroom just a pleasure to be in. The breakfast is one of the best I have ever enjoyed in a top hotel and the staff were always welcoming and attentive. We will have no hesitation in choosing to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff, and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: hibariSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel- feels like a boutique hotel even though it is part of SPG. The location is perfect- central to every tourist destination but not on a busy street. I was so happy with the location because I could walk everywhere I wanted in less than 10 minutes. I searched and searched for a great hotel in Amsterdam, because during my last two visits I chose hotels with terrible rooms (for high prices) and with unfriendly staff. I feel so lucky to have come across the Pulitzer. All of the staff and concierge were eager to assist and to offer recommendations. I was actually surprised by how friendly people were, especially given my last experience in Amsterdam. The rooms were also a nice surprise, perfectly decorated, not overdone, with a feel of being in an classic canal house. I strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not as good as most reviews”
Reviews.Author: DMLLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at The Pulitzer. I liked the hotel and its location. But I have to say that I was somewhat disappointed, because many of the reviews I read prior to visiting lauded the hotel for excellence in virtually every possible way, and that's just not the case. The staff was truly excellent. By European standards the room was quite large and comfortable. The linens and amenities were to a high standard. Since we are Starwood Platinum we had breakfast as part of the stay. It was a fairly large buffet and was simply OK and well below the quality and diversity at the Westin Grande in Berlin, where we had stayed the week before. I would definitely stay here again but with lessened expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Place to recommend for its location & service”
Reviews.Author: subbuvenk
Reviews.Content: I recommend this property for its excellent location and quality of service both by staff and concierge. Don't have high expectation for a Luxury Collection Hotel standards. The Hotel is 10min walk from DAM square, The Green Line Canal Cruise is just in front of the hotel. Anne Frank museum is on the same lane, accessibility to shopping districts and flower market is excellent (10Min walk along the canal). This hotel is highly priced for the value it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Starwood hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: Cpatrick23
Reviews.Content: I only stay at Starwood properties when traveling. We chose this hotel to celebrate our 30th anniversary. We did use all our Starwood points for the first 5 nights of a seven night stay. We loved the location of the hotel the concierge was very helpful and the moring breakfast was the best. I have never reviewed a Hotel before but had such a negative experience upon check in that we never shook the feeling that we were not welcome because we were paying with Points. Our reservation was booked 5 months in advance yet the first room we were shown was dark,Uninviting in everyway with one smal window, And scraped up wood floors. By no means up to spg standards!! To upgrade to a room with light, and windows with a canal view was 50 euro Each night. This was hotel policy yet many guests post rave reviews stating they were treated royaly and enjoyed complimentary upgrades to canal view rooms. I found the front desk staff and managers to be argumentative and unhelpful! We would never return to this property and would certainly never recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel..........”
Reviews.Author: gidoc3
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 days and yes it is true the SPG upgrade to a canal view suite was fabulous. Had breakfast at the hotel every AM. Grand buffet by any standards. The bar is cozy and inviting. Would recommend everyone try bitterballen (for Americans it is a knish ball with a battered crunch on the outside) my wife is hooked and now we have to look for it in NYC as well ;-). The stroopwafels are amazing as well . We will be back without a doubt. Don't miss the boat ride (102 year old) that Winston Churchhill used. Very friendly service throughout the hotel. The passages are a bit quirky but added to the charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Amsterdam if you are lucky to have a street view”
Reviews.Author: Furman55
Reviews.Content: If you are a Starwoods Hotel member with high status, this hotel is for you, as they save their best rooms for upgrade guests which include canal views. Even then, the regular rooms are larger than most European rooms and the bathroom is fantastically large with one of the best shower heads ever. Staff was decently helpful, although the cab we asked for, and confirmed with the front staff for or departure the next morning, never arrived. Hotel is build out of about 7 canal houses so be prepared to walk a maze to find your room. The first time is the hardest, but after that it's a snap

Reviews.Title: “My Fave hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: GaryNewEngland
Reviews.Content: I haven't been everywhere, but I get around. And the Pulitzer is my favorite. After several years, most of the employees are still there, and remember me. There's not a thing they can't do or arrange. Place is friendly, relaxed and very professional. Food is great, bar is well-stocked, rooms are unique, location is perfect. Take the boat ride, too. A classic wooden canal boat. If you're headed to Amsterdam, go first class @ The Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: Evelina62
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through my Starwood points so I had no idea how it would turn out! Surprise! I could not have landed in a better location to visit all of Amsterdam in four days! First and foremost it is build between two of the best canals. The front door faces the Prinsengracht and the canal rooms face the Keisergracht. The receptionists are great and answer all questions you may have about getting around the city. We literally walked 5-10 miles a day and saw everything. There is a tram around the corner that takes you to the Central Station and the Schiphol Airport, so there was no need for a taxi. They also have terry bath robes in the room, the most wonderful beds and pillows, a workout room, sauna, bikes to rent and their own boat to cruise the canal. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “efficient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: pac111
Reviews.Content: This hotel manages a very difficult balance very well, that is providing efficient service combined with a relaxed friendly atmospeher. My room was large, clean and comfortable. Location wise, it is brilliant right on the canal ring, very quiet and within wallking distance of most attractions and lovely cafes etc. I was concerned about the sex/drugs trade but we were not bothered by this side of Amsterdam. I was disapoointed in the design and decor of the hotel, I was expecting a charming original building and if you look there for them there are some original features however it is really a seventies type building with a hot potch of styles.This is no way distracts from the quality of the stay. Thr only negative about the hotel is the steps and level changes: there are loads of them and the steps can be really very steep, I would be wary about anyone who is unstable on their feet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Josi100
Reviews.Content: Good location. Attention to details and friendly customer service staff. Breakfast is very tasty and restaurant has nice views to the canals of Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Hotel In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Anthony G
Reviews.Content: Whatever the time of year the Pulitzer offers an experience to savour. The fundamental concept, a hotel constructed from a block of original 17th century canalside houses creates a sense of intimacy which sets it apart from modern purpose built alternatives. True, it is a bit of a rabbit warren. But every walk around the hotel brings with it a feeling of discovery. And however many times I stay there (and that must be 6 or 7 by now) I never lose that sense. This concept also makes the most of the hotel's great location in the middle of some of Amsterdam's most attractive canal walks. In the week before we vistied there had been an impromptu concert on the frozen Prinsengracht right in front of the hotel's boat dock. The delightful central courtyard gardens (where lunches can be taken in summer) creates a feeling of openness and well being. We particularly like the small breakfast bar close to reception where you can sit by the garden window have a cup of coffee and piece of fruit rather than facing the buffet in the restaurant. And we love the bar, where if you want a nightcap, they"ll be as happy to make you a mint tea as to serve you a cognac. In our experience the rooms are peaceful and quiet, though I do know that some people prefer to avoid rooms on the ground floor with canal frontage. The beds and furnishings cannot be faulted. I have to save special praise for the concierge staff. Their helpfulness in dealing with our car and in recommending and reserving restaurants was exemplary this time, as it has been on every occasion we have visited. I am sure that there are hotels in Amsterdam which match the quality of the Pulitzer. I doubt whether there is one that beats it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay, amazing hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Lulunolu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pulitzer for 4 days and could not have felt more welcome and special. We were warmly greeted, often by name, by each member of the staff that we encountered. We used frequent flyer miles for our stay and considered it an excellent value for the mileage. Definitely consider upgrading to a canal view room. Ours was on the 4th floor and looked much like the room pictured on the hotel's website. The Pulitzer is centrally located, right down the street from the Anne Frank House on on side and the eclectic Nine Streets shopping area on the other. The bed linens were luxurious - wonderful after a long day of walking around the city. Thoroughly enjoyed this lovely hotel and the charming city of Amsterdam. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlanandSally
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam this weekend to celebrate my birthday and treated ourselves to three nights at the Pulitzer. We weren't disappointed - everything was top quality, from the warm welcome at check-in, to the beautiful canal view room, to the helpfulness of the concierge. The hotel's location was perfect for exploring the city and in easy walking distance of some excellent restaurants (we enjoyed Seasons - Herenstraat 16). The large bed was very comfortable and the ability to access UK TV Channels for the news over morning coffee was an unexpected bonus! A fantastic stay from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Brendan90
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the pulitzer for 2 nights with my girlfriend for her birthday, the staff were very welcoming and helpful. On check in we were assisted by extremely friendly girl named kirsten, they upgraded us as it was my girlfriends birthday which really made our trip. The Hotel itself is beautiful and has such character, the gardens are very nice and a great area to relax after a long day of sight seeing. The room we were given was a garden view and was extremely spacious. It was a modern room but still felt very unique and i think i may have had the best sleep of my life in that bed, it was ridiculously comfy. later on in the day, we recieved a delicious birthday cake which was delivered to our room with a card from the pulitzer wishing my girlfiend a happy birthday, we really didnt think the hotel could get any better and we were so impressed by this. That night we had dinner in the hotels restaurant "Keizersgracht 238", the setting is very nice with the restaurant looking out onto one of the adjacent canals. The food and service was superb, so good that we decided to eat here again on our last night. The hotels location is perfect, its only minutes walk from great attractions such as the Anne frank house and Dam square yet it is in a relatively quite and scenic area. I'd like to thank the staff for such an amazing stay and i look forward to the next time i get to visit the pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: AndrewBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Pulitzer is all about hospitality. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Great rooms and outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: NorthernHenry
Reviews.Content: Two night stay, about Eur 8-10 from station, poss a bit fair to walk with luggage, although do-able. Location good, far enough away from the noisey part but near enough to walk, 5 mins from Anne Frank House (go early gets very busy). Rooms, was on reward stay and SPG Gold, garden facing so very quiet, fairly small, extremely comfy bed. Small bathroom, and quiet tight for getting in/out shower in bath. At end of day not spending much time in the room.. No fault of the Hotel but likely a Starwood Management, absolutely stupid WIFI costs! Come on Starwood it is embarrassing for a hotel of this grade....luckily got it free with status, but I'd of been very hacked off paying circa EUR40 for our stay... Given this and seemingly unusual for starwoods sneeky revenue hunting tricks and a refreshing note, standard drinks at the bar and things like coffee's in the lounge weren't priced with the starwood 200% mark- up, as such people were actually making more use of them so credit for this. 238 Restaraunt very nice, again reasonable given the standard it's aimed at. Hotel boat looks nice, but given boat taxi's (hop-on/hop-off) stop outside, why pay over the odds? I wouldn't pay for breakfast if you have the choice, given the vast array of lovely canalside cafe's on the same block. Can recommend Bussia for a nice meal, About 30yds from hotel entrance, book if going at weekend. Overall a pleasant spot, our room was bit snug, but very comfy, nice overall atmosphere and friendly staff... Just walk round the corner to any cafe for wifi and breakfast etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MonroGroup
Reviews.Content: We arrived and had a smooth check in which was slick although a little mechanical. The room was of a good size and was situated overlooking the canal at the back of the hotel. The hotel is made up of six separate former houses and has plenty of history and yet all the facilities of a modern hotel which is a rare combination. The location is fantastic, close to the most famous sites, old quarter and in addition to this you have the main shopping areas only a short walk away. Door staff looked a bit tired but everybody has off days but this should not detract from making a reservation. To sum up, it calls itself 5 star but really a 4 Star + As this hotel is made of former historic houses the visitor gets the sense of history but with elevators, marble floors as well as outside courtyards, which in Spring are a treat. You won't be disappointed if you choose the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “could not have a more accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: equipmentmanager
Reviews.Content: Spent six nights at this wonderful hotel. Room was nicely sized, with room for a rollaway bed. Bathrooms on the small side by american standards, but certainly beautifully appointed, and anyway, you don't live in them. The staff was wonderful. While you expect this in a hotel of this caliber, all the staff seemed personally invested in whether we were enjoying our stay. As we were a party of five with different agendas, concierge staff often had to give us information and ideas for several destinations at the same time. They were always knowledgeable. The location was perfect, and we walked to all but one or two destinations. My only quibble is that its a little difficult to put on makeup as the lighting in the bathroom could be improved, but I would stay there again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Gale55
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a lovely area of Amsterdam. The location is superb. It was easy to walk to everything, and yet we were far removed from the seedier parts of Amsterdam. We had a deluxe room with a canal view. (Room 419) The room was extremely comfortable, but there was a lot of noise from the street (cars and people talking) that affected our sleep on Saturday night. It was better on Sunday night. If I were to stay in the hotel again, I would ask for an inner courtyard room as I suspect they are quieter. Also, we checked in at 3 pm and our room was not ready. The people at the desk could not tell us when the room would be ready, and suggested that we go out and do something for a while. We felt we had no choice but to leave the hotel and humor ourselves for a couple hours. We were not offered drinks or tea or a place to hang out to wait. We did not feel welcome to stay at the hotel. I have never felt that way at a 5 star hotel before and, frankly, think that for the price we paid for the room it should have been ready by 3 pm and, if not, we should have been made to feel welcome somewhere on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “My Amsterdam favourite”
Reviews.Author: ChadRogers
Reviews.Content: A classic old hotel made up of the better part of a city block. Not your hotel if you mind stairs or a lack of consistency between rooms. The pieced together, slightly maze like facility has pop art that cues a little toward garish, beautiful fixtures and furnishing and a top notch staff. The bar and cafe are delightful and the amenities, linens, etc are all of the highest calibre. This is a great example of a luxury collection hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were polite, Rooms small, historic hotel, great for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: lhaganmich
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in December. Despite arriving at 7am, we were able to check into our room at 8:30 am. (A plus!) Our room was clean and modern but on the small side. The bathroom was also very small. Also plus on a cold winter day- the heated bathroom floor. The bathroom had a combination bath/shower. I would have preferred a stand alone shower. Shower water temps fluctuated at times. Tea/coffee were free in the morning up until 7am? After that time, you had to order it from the coffee shop. Internet was free in the lobby at both the computers set up near the lobby desk and in the business center. There was no kettle in the room; instead you had to call the front desk for tea/coffee. We actually called- it took over 30 minutes for it to arrive. By the time it arrived, we had grown tired of waiting and left our room. I noted quite a few business travelers staying at the hotel. The location of the hotel is away from central station and dam square but close to Anne Frank's hotel. Overall, I thought this hotel was very nice. I gave this hotel very good due to the small size of our room, the lack of free coffee after 7am, and I thought the hotel staff, although professional, were a bit rude. The barrista at the hotel coffee shop made some rude comments about americans. I

Reviews.Title: “Top quality in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: talkingpics
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel in a superb location; you will read all about it elsewhere but this really is a top hotel. We had a lovely room - 419 - overlooking the canal. Everything is as it should be in a 5 star hotel and we would throughly recommend it. The only slight downside to the room was a little street noise on Saturday night but it was quiet at all other times. Give it a go - spoil yourselves and I'm sure you won't be disappointed. We weren't.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful canal house/hotel and conveniently located to cute restaurants, cafes and anne frank house”
Reviews.Author: travellingbug95
Reviews.Content: I only stayed a night since I had a stop over from Africa, but it was the perfect location. Upon arrival the staff was friendly and the facilities were charming and sophisticated. They leave stroop waffles as a welcoming and the concierge/guest services is very helpful with all our questions. Right outside the hotel is its own canal dock, you can walk 3 blocks to the Anne Frank museum and you are minutes away from plenty of cute restaurants and cafes. You must visit the hotel bar! You get to walk through the art gallery and arrive at a wonderful, dark library like bar. I ordered tea and when I asked if they had any stroop waffles, the waiter actually checked with guest services. As they did not, he showed up with surprise chocolates from the restaurant. Wonderful service. The beds are comfortable too, slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: Relay
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam. The Hotel Pulitzer must be one of the best hotels in the city. Its location, right on one of the central canals, cannot be beaten. You are literally minutes from the tram stop and Anne Frank's House. The staff at the hotel are brilliant. So friendly and professional. The restaurant was very good and the service excellent. The bar manager and his staff were outstanding. I really can't say enough about how good they are which makes The Pulitzer a true gem. The standard rooms are small (even by European standards) and the bathrooms even smaller! Having said that, they are exceptionally comfortable with wonderful big beds and top quality linens, pillows, etc. If room size is important to you then definitely upgrade to the bigger canal view rooms to avoid disappointment The weather during our stay was very cold and we so enjoyed returning to our comfortable, warm and cosy room. Turn down service (which you have to request) was great. Each night we came back to bottles of water at the bedside, fresh towels and the Bose Radio playing softly in the background. A little cardboard canal house was left on the pillow containing a delicious chocolate. What a great welcome back. As I mentioned, the restaurant was very good - excellent steaks - and the wine choice equally impressive. Ask the waiter if you can try a sip of the wine before you order a bottle. They offer almost all the wines by the glass and are happy to oblige. We didn't have breakfast in the restaurant but opted instead for room service. It was the only disappointing element of our stay - over priced and poorly presented. I'm sure breakfast in the restaurant would have been better but it was also very expensive so we had breakfast out for our remaining days. Apart from breakfast we couldn't have aksed for more. A wonderful stay at a simply wonderful hotel. If you like individuality, top notch service and comfortable rooms then I'd certainly recommend The Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “You know you're in a 5 star when....”
Reviews.Author: adamburrows
Reviews.Content: You know you're in a five star in Amsterdam when: - they leave little dutch caramel waffles in the room for you - they have an art gallery in the hotel - there is a chandelier in the gym - you're far away from the red light district - they have newspapers from every language Lovely five star hotel in a great part of Amsterdam - would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Pulitzer Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: LORRAINE d
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful weekend at the amazing Hotel Pulitzer in Amsterdam. If you are considering where to stay I cannot recommend this hotel and it's staff highly enough. The rooms are all unique as they are a collection of canals houses made into this wonderful hotel. The staff are so welcoming and nothing is too much trouble. They also have a private boat that Winston Churchill once used to take you around the canals in grand style. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ben G
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in to the beautiful lobby we knew we were in a 5* hotel. Staff - extremely polite, friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much hassle for them. Room - Immaculate. Location - Excellent location, close to all attractions but far away enough to feel like you're a local. General - The gym was unique. I've never seen such palatial surroundings for gym equipment. Chandelier and all! A superb hotel on all fronts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MakatiJoe
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with well appointed rooms. Make sure to get a canal view room. The service was excellent and the food in the restaurant was also good. We really enjoyed the overall atmosphere and location. The hotel is made up of 25 classic homes along the canal in downtown Amsterdam. The only minor criticism was the high fee to access wifi at 19 euro per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff But Lots of Stairs”
Reviews.Author: jelarv
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on business in February and have also been here with my wife for a get-away weekend. The hotel does a nice job of mixing the old Amsterdam architecture with the modern things needed in a hotel. Pros: Nice room, very friendly staff, nice restaurant, and GREAT location (the boat system stops right in front of the hotel) Cons: Expensive, some rooms are split level (bathroom and sitting area on one level and then narrow set of stairs up to bed loft -- they gave me a room like this but after I asked to change they kindly accommodated my request). Lots of stairs, even when taking the elevator. No Starwood Preferred club or lounge. Not a big deal, but the health club lacked much for resistance training (one piece of equipment)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff and service”
Reviews.Author: MichaelKoch66
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is in a location off the path and a short walk from the center of town, the hotel staff is exceptional and made up for any locale shortfalls. Located directly on a waterway, the water taxi can take you anywhere you need to go. The front desk staff is attentive, courteous and helpful. Don't be fooled by the coffee bar near the elevators, this is not the breakfast area, which is located around the corner. The room I had was on the courtyard ground floor and was small but had a terrific patio and view. A little pricey, but a good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect birthday in a perfect place”
Reviews.Author: MilenaDenisSavva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 days in Feb. the service, location, rooms design were just fabulous! It was our first (and for sure not the last )visit to Amsterdam for my birthday celebration. We enjoyed everything in Pulitzer even though our room didn't face the canal. we had the authentic brick wall in our room and heard birds singing and the church's tender bells music during all nights..fresh air, some great luxurious aroma inside the room (still can't understand where it came from, but it was really great), delicious breakfast...all these memories will stay with us as the most treasured ones :) the only one dream that didn't come true during our stay at Pulitzer, I haven't received any compliment from the hotel for my birthday, but as far as I know all Starwood hotels don' t have such a tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, definitely the most unique hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: chahe83
Reviews.Content: The staff was really courteous at check-in. I had ordered a package off Amazon before arriving and the hotel was nice enough to hold on to it until my arrival. How the hotel is built is pretty amazing, just a collection of buildings stuck to each other with passages built into them. The location is amazing, close to everything worth seeing in Amsterdam. The only negative point I have is the fact that my room was on the the top floor of the hotel, and had about 10 hours of direct sunshine a day, it was like an oven! the AC was not able to cope with the extreme heat. Resting in the room during the day was out of the question. Apart from that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Delivered on all my expectations”
Reviews.Author: JO4NNA
Reviews.Content: Staff were incredibly friendly and we were treated to champagne and chocolate cake to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. Would recommend this hotel to any of my friends and family. Great location to all parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: Masafar
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in the centre of Amsterdam. It is about 30mins drive from the airport. The service is first rate, and staff are exceedingly friendly and helpful. Rooms are a little on the small side. It is not a purpose built hotel so depending on the room you may have to go up or down a few stairs to get to your room once you leave the lift/elevator. Unfortunately, you do hear noises from other rooms and outside, so be aware if you are a light sleeper, or sensitive to noise. Breakfast is a buffet, and was not outstanding. Also, the food in the restaurant for dinner was average too. Overall it is a great hotel, but don't expect excessive luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: Jamisonsd
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Pulitzer and I have to say that I would gladly stay there again. The location is terrific, rooms spotless and service impeccable. We selected a deluxe room and had the great luck to enjoy our canal view room while the canals were still frozen so we were able to enjoy the view of people skating, sledding, walking and partying on the canal. Each person at the hotel with whom we came in contact was friendly and no request was too great. The rooms are nicely appointed with lush bedding and a luxury bath. It's walking distance to any attraction in the city center and a half-block walk to a convenient tram stop. This is our hotel of choice in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kmf54
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Putlitzer and it certainly lived up to SPG standards. The hotel has an interesting lay out, a bunch of row houses that are joined together. Our room was large and comfortable, and we also enjoyed the gym and the bar during our stay. The breakfast is worthwhile, particularly if you are receiving it complimentary with your stay (true for SPG elite). Don't know if I'd have been willing to pay for it. One note is to AVOID the room service! Our room service was inedible. I got a chicken sandwich where the chicken was cooked so long that it was hard. If I had encountered it on the street, out of context, I probably wouldn't have been able to tell you that it was a chicken breast. Really a waste of money. But other than that our stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “Character hotel overlooking canal”
Reviews.Author: ollie1952
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Pulitzer in Amsterdam on 4 separate occasions and it's the perfect hotel in a perfect location- better than the Dylan where we have also stayed. The hotel is made up of about 20 town houses all linked together which gives it lots of character. The downside is that rooms are generally quite small with limited wardrobe space. We go for room size rather than canal view. The bar is very atmospheric and buzzy and the restaurant is good too. But there are several good restaurants within 400 yards plus a mix of cafes, boutiques and quirky one off shops. Service is friendly and efficient. The hotel has their own vintage canal boat which is def worth a trip- usually goes about 5pm. Courtyard garden is the perfect spot for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JaJa_LuRVeS
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful hotel with a good location. Easily to walk to places like Anne Frank House, The Dam, The Red Light District coffeeshops ;) The atmosphere is luxurious however the elevator is rather small. We had a room on the 2nd floor so we took the stairs most of the time. I suggest to get a room with a canal view because Amsterdam really is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - cozy, good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: m f
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here end of January and overall would highly recommend for Amsterdam. Great location in trendy area with lots of boutiques and restaurant/bars. It was away from touristy area but easy to walk/tram to the touristy parts. Service was excellent all around. Loved the espresso bar in the morning and the lounge bar overlooking the canal at night. Tasty (and expensive) cocktails overlooking the canal were prefect way to wind down. Restaurant was ok, lots of other choices in area. The hotel itself is made up of a group of canal houses so it is loaded with charm. room was small but well appointed (love the heavenly beds). The laminated/hardwood floors were a little annoying when your neighbor above you strolls in at 3 am every monring and you have a meeting the next day. The staff also proceeded to hold entire conversation in front of my door at 4:30 am one morning as well. I don't mind city noise it would be expected but I do mind inconsderate noise. Higher level floors are better. Would definately return again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Bobbi1022
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel! It was a great location on the canal, a quick walk away from the Tram, Anne Frank House, pubs and restaurants. Definitely upgrade to a room overlooking the canal. The room itself was modern and luxurious yet still very quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location- Older hotel- Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: rammenon
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is a Starwood property and they have worked hard to modernize it. If you are looking for a modern hotel, stop right here. If you are looking for a nice hotel in the Old town of amsterdam, read on-Excellent location alongside the canal in Prinsengrach, Its a beautifully restored 1600's era neigbourhood and a walk every evening is worth your time. The hotel is really is a bunch of older canal house put together, and so there is a warren of corridors and the lift is for just one person- no luggage please. On the plus side, the staff are incredibly helpful and the bathroom/linens are Starwood quality. The breakfast is good. The rooms are a bit tired given the constraints of old rafters, leaky windows. and older brickwork. For americans- be prepared its very much a European style smaller room. Its a nice hotel with an older charm though I do wonder why the pricing is structured as a premium SPG property. The staff do everything to make your stay pleasant and that helps.

Reviews.Title: “A truly first class experience in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Gosnold10
Reviews.Content: We spent the week including New Years at this wonderful hotel. The hotel has been forged out of half a block of traditional center Amsterdam houses. The amenities are modern and the concierge was incredibly helpful in suggesting and arranging the details of our stay including a terrific walking tour. The hotel layout is cozy and yet still spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust8552024
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many luxury hotels, and this is one of my favorites. It is small, intimate, and the staff is incredibly acommodating. Breakfast is included in the price of your stay, and it really is a great complimentary breakfast. In addition, the rooms and beds are very comfortable. We had a room that overlooked the garden (as opposed to the canal) and thought this was just lovely. It had large windows and beautiful furnishings, it was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The staff went above and beyond to greet us on our arrival (we were arriving from Africa), and the three day stay was well worth it. I was a bit concerned before arriving, because I had read some mixed reviews, but I certainly found my stay to be one of the most memorable of my life. In terms of location, it is in a quieter neighborhood with cafes and high-end shopping, and is close enough to all of the major attractions to be ideally situated. I would most certainly come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Way to Start Off Amazing Trip!”
Reviews.Author: mccallud
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam at 7am with a check-in time of 2pm at Hotel Pulitzer. After a 20 minute taxi ride from the airport, we arrived to an amazing lobby with a giant revolving door with display cases in it! They informed us our room wouldn't be ready until at least noon, but they would do their best to expedite the process seeing how exhausted we appeared. The hotel is out of the crazy Red Light district right on the canal, but a short walk to city center. At noon I was feeling very ill and we returned to the hotel to a clean room awaiting us. The room was immense with a giant, comfortable bed, and large bathroom. We nestled in for a nap and ordered very tasty room service. For a prolonged trip in Amsterdam, this hotel is a great home base to sight see and experience all the comforts of home. The hotel is pricey but worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Floridian79
Reviews.Content: The negative comments on this website and negative feedback from an acquaintance left me a bit unsure but since we were using Starwood points, it was this or the Sheraton at Schiphol. I am so happy that we chose the Pulitzer. The room was spacious, clean, although a bit cold. The thermostat didn't seem to work too well but the time spent in the room was minimal so it didn't bother us. The stroopwafels (so good!!) and bottle of water were a nice touch. The location of the hotel couldn't be better! Very easy access from Centraal Station, trams, buses, lots of restaurants and shops in the area. The staff was amazing! From the attendant of the Espresso Bar to the concierge, everybody was so friendly, professional, courteous. One of the front desk attendants, Renske, notified us about the railroad strike in Belgium, helped us sort out our train situation (since our train had been cancelled), notified our hotel in Paris, gave us an upgrade for the extra night we stayed in the hotel. She really went above and beyond. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ruthierose1
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip to Amsterdam, and my stay at the Pulitzer made it the grandest. Extraordinary rooms and location made it fabulous. Helpful, attentive staff on hand. I will stay here again in a heartbeat. Very clean rooms, room appointments were perfect and turndown service was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every area”
Reviews.Author: travel810
Reviews.Content: Great location, outstanding food and service and very nice establishment. You really feel your in Amsterdam at this hotel. Plus there are many good restaurants and shops in the area. This is the third time we have stayed at the Pulitzer. Every staff member cares for your needs. They are so good that they even remembered the room we stayed in on our last visit and knew we liked it and gave it to us again - now that is service. It was our friends birthday who we were travelling with, at breakfast they came out with a special treat and they also sent something to her room. All we did was mention it was her birthday in passing. I travel a great deal and for me to recommend a hotel this highly it has to be good. You will not go wrong staying here. I complement the management and staff on a very well run hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel at the edge of Jordaan”
Reviews.Author: 10PerfectDays
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of staying at the Pulitzer a couple of times now and it is consistently fabulous. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are large and the beds comfy. The breakfast is good, though insanely expensive. There are better breakfast options a short walk away. The hotel bar is warm and inviting and we spent more than a few nights lounging about for a night cap chatting with the bar tender and other guests. The location is also terrific, as it's as far away from the red light district as you can get, in a great neighborhood, stunningly beautiful property, and one canal bridge away from Jordaan, which is another great neighborhood with lots of interesting shops and excellent restaurants, cafes, and pubs all within walking distance. The Anne Frank House is about a block and a half away as well as the train which will connect you to anywhere in Amsterdam. Looking forward to another stay at the Pulitzer in one of my favorite cities.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: wbiety
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Pulitzer over Christmas and were charmed by the place and the staff. The location is wonderful, quiet and near streets full of beautiful shops. It is a series of canal houses connected by greenhouse corridors and staircases. It feels very private as there are rarely any more than two rooms on a level. Ours was a garrett room with a maze of beams overhead, a compact but luxurious bathroom and a lovely view into the garden. The room was a good size with comfortable furniture but perhaps a bit short on hanging space for clothes. The buildings are the perfect blend of historic and contemporary. The staff is impeccable, down to earth and friendly. Special thanks to Joan, Vanessa and Lambert in the coffee bar and Bar. We had a light breakfast in the coffee bar every morning and they were helpful with suggestions as to what to see and were the perfect balance of conversational and professional. Every staff member we interacted with was excellent, including the maids. The place has a friendly, relaxed feel while maintaining a sense of the luxurious. The workout room was one of the most elegant that I have ever used and a great place to unwind. I would have to say that this is one of my favorite hotels and I look forward to my next stay there. Wm. B.

Reviews.Title: “The canal "bus" leaves from your front door!”
Reviews.Author: SLPOhio
Reviews.Content: Coffee bar had a young lady who did not understand our English as well as expected (a small coffee turned out to be an espresso). The lobby seating for coffee drinkers was lovely! We walked and took public transit to the art museums and the Concertgebaouw. We visited Anne Frank House, a block away, on a Saturday afternoon, and had no line! Christmas Day dinner was not too large, innovative, and delicious. (See our review of Bussia, just around the corner.)

Reviews.Title: “A luxury stay in an exclusive atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Travelart2010
Reviews.Content: From the minute you enter the lobby, you feel you are being cared for by the staff. The concierge service is very competent and always friendly. The reception staff give you full attention and you feel as if you were their most important guest. The rooms are luxurious and the breakfast buffet is marvellous.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave H
Reviews.Content: We have visited Amsterdam a number of times and after staying at a few other hotels, we have settled in on the Pulitzer. The hotel staff is efficient and helpful. Because the rooms are in converted canal houses, each one is different. Don't expect cookie cutter rooms - especially not the bathrooms. If you enjoy unique atmospheres and donâ€™t mind a few quirks, this is a great choice. The location in the â€œNine Streetsâ€� section of the city center is excellent. It is an easy walk to the major museums and tourist attractions. We love to end our evening in the bar. There are people from all over the world and the bar staff is so friendly. If you are so inclined, you may quickly find yourself in conversation with the barman and folks from several countries. Our stays at the Pulitzer have left us feeling welcomed and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “If you need a modern highrise, avoid. Otherwise, ENJOY!!!”
Reviews.Author: RickinShelby
Reviews.Content: IMHO, this is the best hotel in Amsterdam. The experince is quintessential Amsterdam -- old private residences on a canal, original artwook in the rooms and lobbies, and a bit quirky. That said, the staff is terrific! On my most recent visit I was only in the city for 36 hours passing through Europe. The staff were extremely helpful to help me arrange my time wisely so I saw all I needed to see. This was my 2nd stay here, and I will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: airborne1
Reviews.Content: The layout of this hotel was fantastic and unique. We were upgraded rooms by being a SPG member and this room had more than enough space and we had a good view of the canal in the front of the hotel. We were very pleased with the staff and Consierge service, they were very helpful everytime we asked for something. They even made us dinner reservations at a resturant they suggested. Its right outside the tram line and the Anne frank house is up the street from it also. A great breakfast buffet spread but the price was about 25 euro. Internet was not free but there is one computer in the lobby that you have to wait for. If you drive there you can opt for valet for like 50 euro a day or park it yourself about 3 or 4 blocks away at a garage that was about 40 euro a day. Either way its a pretty penny to park but you wouldnt want to drive around amsterdam because of all the bikes and pedestrians. Other than that i loved it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great Choice of Hotel when in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine10100126
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is a great choice when staying in Amsterdam. Location is very convenient, quiet, right on the Prinsengracht, and walking and biking distance to everything. Front office staff very professional at all times, very welcoming. Room set up was comfortable, and loved the breakfast room. Great place to stay, and when my travels return I will surely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice for visits to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: HotelFan06
Reviews.Content: Pulitzer has the charm of an old small hotel with the amenities and service expected of a larger modern hotel. Lovely rooms with wooden beams running throughout, indicative of the historical architecture of the canal houses. Exploring the hotel is fun with multiple passages throughout. Friendly staff who have always immediately sorted out the few issues that I have run into when I've visited. Good location for getting in/around Amsterdam - and if you're lucky enough to get a room overlooking the canal, enjoy the view. Gym has also been recently upgraded - good quality equipment. Breakfast is also better than the usual hotel breakfast fare. I'm on the road about 20 nights per month and Pulitzer is one of the hotels I look forward to returning to each time.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MCarames
Reviews.Content: A really original hotel. Adapted dutch merchant houses to a beautiful hotel. Luxury, but not as in a business hotel, almost familiar. Very kind at reception!!!! Awesome breakfast!!! We really enjoyed it. The only thing we didn't like was the cleaning service waking us up at 0830 am

Reviews.Title: “Cocktails amazing”
Reviews.Author: redwinefinedine
Reviews.Content: This place is truly beautiful... The lay out of the hotel is so interesting. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and cannot do enough to please you. Beds are extremely comfortable and tasted the best cocktails we have ever had in the bar (which is to die for.) Have a Beatrice flower, you will not regret it. A fantastic meal in the restaurant. Front office staff very poised, presentable and well spoken. A fantastic weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: Wyn M
Reviews.Content: We have been regular visitors to Amsterdam since 1977 and have at one time or another stayed in all the top hotels however, for the last 5/6 years the Pulitzer is the only hotel for us. We were last there in December (2011) and the service was excellent as usual. From the minute we arrived and throughout our stay, front desk, concierge, bar and restaurant staff were unobtrusive but there when you wanted them. The culture is right in this hotel, service with a genuine smile!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Shane A
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from another stay at the Pulitzer Hotel in Amsterdam and to my mind, you cannot stay in a better hotel. I have stayed at some of the best hotels in Europe and nothing compares with the Pulitzer in Amsterdam â€“ it is like coming home. The staff are professional and yet always welcoming â€“ they make you feel that nothing is too much trouble. Some years ago I bought two garden tables and without asking the tables were bundled up securely to protect them from the flight home. They arrived home without a scratch! The Service in the Restaurant is excellent and the food imaginative and delicious. I have eaten at other 'best' hotels in Amsterdam but there is something about the Pulitzer that makes it stand apart from the rest. The rooms are very well decorated and maintained to a high standard. The canal rooms are light and airy and have magnificent marble bathrooms. As the hotel is built within a number of canal houses, finding ones way around can be daunting for the faint-hearted, but all corridors lead to the well-designed enclosed passageway across the central garden courtyard. Check-in and check-out couldnâ€™t be easier and the staff at the reception are charming, efficient and knowledgeable. I shall be returning later on this year, as it is the only place to stay when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The most unique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stylo4444
Reviews.Content: As someone that travels quite a bit and is very loyal to the SPG program, in Amsterdam there are really only two choices for us. The Sheraton Amsterdam by the Airport, or the Hotel Pulitzer. I've been to the Sheraton before and it has been a good experience there, and this time I wanted to try something a bit different and more centrally located to the city itself. First off, when you get to Amsterdam Central definitely ask someone where the hotel is. It's in a bit of a discrete location between canals so it can be hard to find. Fortunately, Amsterdam has some of the most friendly people on the planet so they're always happy to help you. Once you get to the hotel, you can't help but notice the unique appearance. Is this really one large hotel connected by canal houses? You better believe it! The lobby itself is nice and quiet, I was greeted by a very friendly receptionist that acknowledged my status with the SPG program and then informed me that I had been upgraded to one of their Luxury Suites! It had been a stressful day of travel so to hear this was very positive. I was taken up to my room which was on the 5th floor, but was really the 3rd floor. And it was the only room on that floor. Confused yet? This is one of the very unique things about this hotel. It's very easy to get lost, but you just have to pay attention to the signs. There are over 200 rooms and it's all connected by 20+ canal houses. I've never seen anything like this before, and that's a great thing. The luxury suite itself was very large. It was two large rooms, very classic furniture and a very comfortable bed. It was indeed top notch quality, and the bathroom felt as if you were in a Ritz Carlton...but that shouldn't be surprising as this is a Luxury Collection hotel that is of the highest quality in the SPG chain. The staff here is very friendly and I was always greeted with a smile and asked if there was anything they could do to make my stay more enjoyable. I got directions to the RLD which is about a 10-15 minute walk if not less than that. It's very convenient, and better than taking the train from Schipol down to Amsterdam Centraal and then walking to the RDL which is the case with the Sheraton Amsterdam. The good things about this hotel are that it is a first class luxury property, it's incredibly unique, the rooms are in immaculate condition and the staff does its best to make sure that the guest is taken care of. One might find the hallways and the twisting around one side to the another a bit annoying, but this is just one of the unique aspects of this place. I got lost a couple times, but enjoyed every bit of it. You will not see many hotels like this around the world, so it's definitely appreciated. If you're an SPG member, you have a couple choices and this is a fantastic one. The Sheraton Schipol is still a nice hotel and the train station is right there. But the Hotel Pulitzer is much more closer to the action and for around the same cost I feel this is just a better choice. It's just one of those unique experiences that one will never forget. The next time I am in Amsterdam, I will definitely be staying here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service in an interesting hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Va2Broadway
Reviews.Content: The converted canal houses are a great idea and make staying in the hotel an adventure. The room was nice, it was an attic room, so small for two people well over 6 feet (but then again the whole city is), but it felt cozy and was fun to stay in. The best part of the hotel was the service staff. Don't listen to any other review about the service, it is exceptional here! Always willing to help out, very friendly, available with great suggestions. I don't know what the expectations of these unhappy customers were (must expect the service industry to grovel at their feet), but my expectations were truly exceeded!

Reviews.Title: “Service Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: oands
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at the Pulitzer. It is conveniently located, historically interesting, and a fabulous hotel. The service was beyond compare - not just the front desk but everyone we encountered. Each one seemed truly committed to making our stay flawless. They were friendly and helpful in such a graious way but yet not at all stuffy. This is a well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: telis
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for christmas holidays for 4 nights. we chose this hotel mainly cause it is an spg property and we are spg members and when we travel we try to stay only in spg hotels. as every hotel in the world this also had positive as well as not so positive aspects. positive: the location was good not far on foot from main attractions and in a nice quiet area. everyone was very polite , helpful,proffesional and friendly. check-in was fast and very welcoming. bathroom marble floor was heated -very rare to find this even in 5 star hotels. heating was excellent through out the hotel. the public spaces were elegant but not what i call luxury collection style. room service was fast, efficient and always with a smile. the restaurant was cosy and very beautiful. negatives: we were given one of the smallest rooms in the hotel with nice view to the gardens though. the room was small for a 5 star luxury collection property-it seemed like a sigle room. the bathroom was very compact and many times it was difficult to control the water temperature e.g from warm suddenly it became too hot and vice versa. the bathtub was not very clean. soundproof was limited -you could hear steps and various noises from the room above. very limited storage space. the decoration of the room in some parts reminded you ikea stores. the corridors were mostly like a good motel. in general in our opinion it is a luxuru collection hotel mostly only by name. if we stay again in this hotel?probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Luxury in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Arnie32655
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Pulitzer 3 times in the last 4 years...it is the only place I will stay in Amsterdam. The location is best...Near everything, but away from the "Dam Crowd". etc. If you get a canal view room, it is the most romantic place you can stay! The service is top notch, everyone wants to make your stay comfortable and easy. Every room is different, but all are charming with 5 star amentities. The gym has just been moved and enlarged..it is now great!

Reviews.Title: “I really like this hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: Pete312
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve previously reviewed the Pulitzer Hotel in Amsterdam and continue to stay there when in town on business (a few times a year). Since my original review, Iâ€™ve encountered a few service issues. To the credit of the hotel, management contacted me and made corrections. I mention this because problems happen at any hotel the key is how they are addressed â€“ the Pulitzer is a first rate hotel and the service is outstanding. Now for some concernsâ€¦ Given new hotel options that opened or have been remodeled in Amsterdam recently (Sofitel, Renaissance, Dylan) the Pulitzer is starting to fall behind. As a tourist hotel, it is highly competitive as the location is superb and the property is very charming (25 row houses adjoined in an ingenious yet slightly whimsical way). However, as a business hotel it is more of an acquired taste. Most rooms are very small and the furnishings are getting dated â€“ for example, most rooms have a very small armoire instead of a closet. The desks are reasonable but the internet connectivity is very spotty. The bathrooms (remember - these were 17th and 18th century row houses) are very small and need to be updated. If one is disabled, navigating the maze-like halls with stairs everywhere will be an extreme challenge. I like this hotel. Iâ€™ll be back in two weeks. I stay at the Pulitzer because of the location, the charming architecture and the very attentive service, but unless their rooms and bathrooms are updated soon, I may find myself drifting away in favor of more current hotel options.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mike V
Reviews.Content: A very quaint hotel in the heart of things to do in Amsterdam. Walk to Dam Square, Red Light District and shopping. Amazing breakfast /brunch in hotel. Lots of great resteraunts just round the corner. Staff goes the extra mile for international travellers to accommodate uncommon arrival and departure times. A Starwood Hotels gem!

Reviews.Title: “Very positive: you get what you pay.”
Reviews.Author: max_prox
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel on the Prinsengracht, which is located on 20 different old traditional houses. The small courtyards are very beautiful. Room is very cozy, traditional style, but very pleasent and not excessive. The bed is very comfortable. Obviously room was immaculately clean and the bathroom was perfect as well, with very good products. The staff was always very helpful. We had breakfast included in the price of the room (I suggest to take this kind of rate) and the choice at the breakfast was amazing: available both cooked and continental, very nice the pastry and the amazing mini-pancakes. During the week the breakfast is served until 11am. The only thing really missing to this hotel is a high level bar: only a very small bar with limited space. As a whole a wonderful place, with quite high rate, but if it definitely derserves to be visited.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Wilson L
Reviews.Content: Love staying at the Pulitzer. So quaint for a fairly large hotel. The staff was professional and friendly. Both Front desk and Concierge staff extremely helpful. As a Starwood Platinum member we were upgraded to a canal-facing room and it was lovely. Also a great location to stay in Amsterdam as it is within walking distance to almost every attraction. Have stayed here numerous times and won't be my last.

Reviews.Title: “There is only ONE Pulitzer Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stockdoc
Reviews.Content: The is only one Pulitzer Hotel! A unique assemblage of 20+ buildings somehow magically blend internally, while the individual canal house exteriors each retain that "Amsterdam charm". Well-located, fronting on a quiet canal, the hotel is within walking distance from almost everything. The rooms vary greatly in size and amenities (we were upgraded to a split-level suite), but all feature wonderful linens and all are meticulously clean. A large and well-landscaped interior courtyard serves as a backdrop for the owner's extensive art collection. And the staff: simply OUTSTANDING! Cudos particularly to Mauritz at the concierge desk and to Raymond in the dining room -- but literally every Pulitzer employee we encountered could not have been any more welcoming or accommodating during our 5 day stay. A classy - not a glitzy - hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Canselmi
Reviews.Content: We arrived pretty early in the morning and were able to check in. Staff was very friendly and the hotel is in a great location. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go (except the air port). Only problem was in navigating through the hotel. It is three or four town houses that were converted into a hotel so the lay out isn't traditional. It took us a while before we actually found our room. But overall, the room was very nice. Of the five hotels we stayed at during our trip, the Pulitzer had by far the most comfortable bed. So if that is important to you, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, all around”
Reviews.Author: sam1am
Reviews.Content: Wonderful friendly service, all around. Great location, convenient from Amsterdam Central train station (just take the tram a few stops). It can be a bit of a hike/maze to get to your room (make sure to use the correct lift if necessary), due to the nature of the construction of the hotel (multiple connected houses). If you can, check out the stairwell for the building you are in, in addition to using the lift, some are quite beautiful. Note that breakfast is quite expensive (but good!) for Platinum guests it is complimentary. I suggest trying the chocolate sprinkles on bread/toast for a 'local' treat.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, great location, modern gym”
Reviews.Author: RowerMomAnnArbor_MI
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in October. We were overwhelmed by the friendliness of the staff. The concierge made terrific restaurant recommendations, sized us up appropriately, sent us to places with food and drink that fit our tastes. The location was fantastic, an easy walk to the museums and action in the main city of Amsterdam. This is obviously a historic hotel. We liked this aspect and part of the charm and why we stayed here. Yes, people, it's old. What did you expect? There are lots of nooks and crannies, and all the twists and turns in the hallways can be a bit confusing. Upgrading to the canal view was definitely worth the extra cost. Our room had plenty of space, but our friends had booked a similar type room, and got a much smaller room. Maybe that was because we were paying full price, but they were redeeming hotel points? The gym was small (by American standards) but recently updated. We were pleasantly surprised. It appears to not get used much, as it looked brand new and very clean! We had it all to ourselves. It was well stocked with water, fruit, towels. My only complaint is that for the high price of the room, there was a charge for an adapter from the front desk (really?). Also, coffee was not complimentary, you could only get it by going down to lobby and purchasing, and it was quite expensive. Staff was very, very nice, but I'm grumpy until I've had coffee, and I don't want to have to get dressed and wait in line behind 2 people for 20 minutes to get it. How about a self serve carafe, just the basics? Or coffee in your room? Also, the breakfast was good, but extremely expensive. I didn't want to make an event out of breakfast, I just wanted to grab coffee and quick bite and be on my way to the museum. All in all, we REALLY enjoyed our stay at the Pulitzer, would definitely stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: pcm2010
Reviews.Content: Our main issue with the hotel is the management. We booked a double bedroom with Pulitzer Hotel through venere.com for weekedn at the start of November. At the time we booked it was a special deal at Â£460 or thereabouts. When we checked in at the hotel, the lady at reception took her time to act as concierge arranging dinner for current guests (even though there was a separate concierge desk and a queue waiting to check in) and kept us waiting. When we finally checked in, we were told that our room had 2 single beds and that the hotel had no concept of a double room - which is an absurd concept in itself given that no matter how rooms are described, they are either single, double, twin or triple. The hotel insisted we took the matter up with venere separately even though we had a clear written confirmation from venere that we had booked a double bedroom. The hotel claimed that venere had confirmed a twin room with the hotel given its lack of double bedrooms. Hard to believe that venere would take the time to provide separate and different confirmations. In order to provide us with a double bedroom, the hotel offered either a smaller queen room or an executive room (which is larger than the room to which we were entitled), the latter at a higher cost. We were not entitled to a reduced cost if we chose the queen room. This behaviour makes no commercial sense at all. When we refused to accept this proposal, eventually the hotel, somehow managed to find a room that was just cleaned up (NB this was at 8pm) and that room would be available to us. The experience marred our first day in Amsterdam and did not give us a good impression of this hotel. I would also highlight that when we checked in, we agreed to provide a credit card to back up the cost of our room, but the hotel failed to tell us that the deposit was Â£300 on top of the cost of our trip. We had to query this when we confirming payment. The room itself was a garden room - it was pretty but the room was not peaceful as one could hear the boiler/others using water and the pipes/ cigarette machine outside being used.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall hotel, top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: LovedaCaribbean2920
Reviews.Content: -Wonderful check in service and bellhop service -Interesting an unique rooms -AWESOME location (makes it worth the money alone) -Good bar; Was able to order a good meal at 11pm -Beds are SUPER comfortable like most reviews say -ONLY COMPLAINT: The gym is too small, if you intend to exercise, you won't get a good workout -Would absolutely return here, thanks for the memories!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Terri879
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with the Hotel Pulitzer. Although we had a nice view of the canal, our room was very small. The bed was clean and comfortable, but the room was so spartan and cramped. The chairs were not comfortable and the floor was bare and cold. We did not enjoy being in the room. The bathroom was tiny, with a tub/shower combo. The staff was poorly trained and not very welcoming. Housekeeping kept knocking on our door starting very early in the morning. The decor in the bar was nice, but we saw a mouse crawl across the floor! That about did it for us! Worst of all, the price was that of a 5 star hotel. On this trip, we stayed in some beautiful hotels in London and Bruge that were almost half the price and twice as nice. If we return to Amsterdam, we will not stay at the Hotel Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “The Pulitzer Takes the Prize!”
Reviews.Author: Taxilady007
Reviews.Content: I will make this short and sweet. The Pulitzer hotel . Beautiful! Charming, Great service! Location - Supreme! You will walk to everything and anything you could possibly want IF you can stop staring and photographing the obscenely beautiful views. The Pulitzer is NOT for the boring mundane or generic individual. Why? Because it is a charming luxe hotel facing the canals in the prime Amsterdam locale , unique, artful, possessing plush down beds, clean , tastefully decorated rooms in updated multi canal houses multi leveled and unique in every way. The restaurants are gorgeous , food delish, , ambience sophisticated and upscale. If I were to be picky I might critique the bathroom. Smallish, But The bed and comfort level, the view from our second floor room right out unto the canals made up for that, and the small bathroom became irrelevant. Hotel bar is typical Amsterdam-edgy , sophisticated, comfortable, and the cocktails are worth every penny (Euro!) We had a great time in Amsterdam - my daughter and I - and part of it was our choice of the Pulitzer Hotel! I will return and this hotel is my choice!

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm, top-notch service.”
Reviews.Author: newyorkbo
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend at this property at the end of September. I always choose this property due to its central location. All of the major sites of downtown Amsterdam are within walking distance. It is a ten minute walk to the Damrak, 15 minutes to the Rembrantsplein or the Leidseplein. The area in which the hotel is located, the Jordaan, is comprised of several romantic little streets filled with unique and charming shops and restaurants. It is, itself, one of the popular attractions (the 9 straatjes) of Amsterdam. The rooms all vary in their size and layout because this property is really an amalgamation of many small homes. I arrived at this property very early due to the arrival time of my transatlantic flight. I asked, at 07:30 in the morning, if anything was available. As always at this property, the young lady was kind but truthful - all of the rooms were occupied but since several people had already checked out she could expedite the cleaning of one of the rooms if I could wait 45-60 minutes. One hour later, true to her word she woke me up in the arm chair in which I was sleeping and gave me my room key, apologizing that an upgraded room (due to my Starwood Platinum status) was not available at that time. The next day I was upgraded to a lovely suite with separate living and sleeping rooms. At the first mention of difficulty with the wifi system I was visited by a member of the management staff who worked on the problem until it was solved. I am very impressed by the professional service provided by the staff of this property. It is a nice balance of service without subservience. I am always made to feel genuinely welcome and would never consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “weekend break, lovely base”
Reviews.Author: KentMadmum
Reviews.Content: Long weekend family break. We stayed here in October for a long weekend. The hotel is very nice, it is polished and lives up to its brand, We arrived at 2.00 but had to wait about an hour for our room and checkout was lengthy due to the other clients in front, but the staff were friendly, apologetic and helpful. We had a family room which had a well-furnished bathroom, (heated mirror etc,) tastefully furnished (not especially spacious). The childrenâ€™s beds were at high level on a mezzanine type attic space, which was very nice (not just a normal room with beds squeezed in), our children were 11, 13 but I am not sure how suitable this room would be for toddlers due to the steep stair access. The breakfast was very nice but we did not use the hotel for other meals so we cannot comment. It has a nice bar, and garden and all in all was a very pleasant stay, although the exchange rate is so rubbish at the moment luxury hotels seem that bit more expensive. Location is good, it took about 20 â€“ 30 minutes to walk from the station and the Anne Frank House is just down the street. The queues were huge for this but we had pre-booked with an English introduction, well worth it for the children and not having to queue. You should not go to Amsterdam without visiting here it was very emotional.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: I would say this place is special due to the fact it's an old building basically facing Anne Franks' house....place really clean...bed comfortable....amazing view of the channel...location Id say the best you can get in Amsterdam. Definetely recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kenmar5
Reviews.Content: A great location just Down the block from Anne Franks house. You can walk to the shopping areas, good restaurants and the palace. It is on the canal. It is a conglomeration of several historic canal houses so it keeps the feel of old Amsterdam. The beds were very comfortable and the room was spotless. The concierge was most helpful. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “very cozy hotel but bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: WellWiseTraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked on junior suite room, which was nothing amazing but old building and maze like corridor makes this place special. My room was located on 4th floor and took elevator and three stairs to get to the room, but hidden bit makes exciting about this place. I also had good view of cannel from the window. Hotel has lots of charm, nice breakfast, very helpful concierge and warm and friendly receptionist, they all take good care of guests. When I am visiting Amsterdam, I always pick this hotel although bit away from business district, but if you are visiting for holiday, this is very convenient place, walking distance to number of museum, pub district, yet lots of pretty cafe, restaurant in vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the central location”
Reviews.Author: PragueMarti
Reviews.Content: Loved how the old buildings were restored and turned into the hotel. We had amazing weather and to sit in the lovely courtyard and drink tea (or beer as my companion) was really lovely. Great breakfast. Thought my attic room was really charming. I really liked the wooden floor in the room - it looks great and I'm always a bit suspicious of the carpets in hotel rooms (they are almost always dark and I just can't help but wonder how clean...) which was not an issue with the spotless wooden floor at the Pulitzer. The meeting room had an amazing crystal chandelier and it felt like being in a castle. Food was great - generally liked by our otherwise picky team (unlike the Sheraton at the airport) both for the breakfast and what was served as part of the conference package was really tasty. Location - I ha no chance for sightseeing but the hotel is central located on the canals and it seems to be the perfect spot from which to explore the city. Staff at the reception and the guys looking after luggage and ordering taxis were all just perfect. However, I had some issues finding our meeting room and the concierge staff was not terribly helpful and also it took several calls and 45 minutes waiting for somebody to show up to have our meeting room set up and ready for the meeting in the morning which is why I give this hotel only 4* not 5*.

Reviews.Title: “We were in the same room as the Oceans series”
Reviews.Author: linda29355
Reviews.Content: When the Grand Hotel closed were were sad and had to go here. Best mistake ever. This is the kind of old school charm and service. It is beautiful and indulgent. We had a loft suite and the kids loved their own space. We had great service and the breakfast was wonderful. WE even took the kids to the bar in the afternoon for hot chocolate and strupwafel. Great memories.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Gary S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the Hotel Pulitzer to be excellent in all respects. What especially impressed us was the professionalism and friendliness of the front desk staff. They made excellent recommendations with respect to both visiting Amsterdam's many art museums and eating at local dining restaurants. We were also touched by how the staff at breakfast greeted an older couple who had clearly stayed at the Pulitzer many times. Multiple staff came up to say hello and inquire about their health. It truly was like the staff treated them as family. Yes, the rooms are a bit small, but this is the trade off for staying in a luxury hotel set among Amsterdam's charming canal houses. Otherwise, the rooms and bathrooms are first rate. The hotel's location is perfect if you want to immerse yourself in life along the Amsterdam canals. It is one block from the Anne Frank House and various options for touring the canals (e.g., personal electric boats). The hotel is not as convenient if you want to step out of your hotel and immediately be at the entrance to the main art museums.

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience”
Reviews.Author: OzkiwiSydney
