Reviews.Content: My first return visit to Amsterdam in 30yrs was a truly memorable one from the minute we entered The Pulitzer. We booked an Executive room for the extra room and the front desk quickly explained that really no rooms were alike, due to the hotel being made up of a large number of canal houses. We were given a very nice room overlooking the courtyard garden, quiet, sunny, easy access to the newly opened gym and breakfast room....perfect. Breakfast is a gourmet experience in itself. The buffet options were the best I have ever seen and the staff throughout are slick and efficient. A drink in the bar is a must....stunning.! A superb location, being on the same street as Anne Frank's House, right near great restaurants and boutique clothes shops.....perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Pulitzer Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nottingham-uk
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here and again everything was excellent. Courteous reception staff allowed us to store our bags as we arrived before our room was ready. When we did get too our room it was wonderful. It was only a standard room but was perfect for our stay as we were out walking for most of our 2 days. An excellent location just away from the main hustle and bustle, but close enough to walk to. This also meant that it was quiet in the evenings. This hotel is made up of connecting townhouses so there are lots of corridors and steps but this adds to the charm. Not the cheapest of place - but you do get what you pay for. Staff were superbly attentive. Breakfast is a must - a huge range and selection and a chef on hand to cook anything else fresh. A great hotel in a great place and well worth the money - although if it was slightly cheaper then it would be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: SUZIBB
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the hotel in August 2011, but we had to move 3 times because the airconditioner in rooms didn't work well. The front desk staff were very friendly, accommodating and they made sure that we were happy and comfortable. The bell captain and staff were great, they helped us so much when we moved rooms. We are gold SPG members. Great location, hop on, hop off canal boat stops in front of the hotel. Good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: skibuff
Reviews.Content: My second visit (using Sheraton Points) to this hotel was as good as the first. I arrived around noon and was quickly assigned a single room overlooking an interior small courtyard. Not much of a view but it did provide a good light. The room was large by Euro Standard and furnished sparsely with high quality items. A large flat screen TV, queen sized bed with two end tables, a comfortable and well lit reading chair and an antique appearing armoire completed the furnishings. The bath was good sized with a deep tub and shower combination. The dark bar at the rear of the Hotel had excellent if somewhat pricy drinks and a very good staff of waiter and bartender. I could even find it without help through the maze of corridors associated with this collection of old canal houses. The entire staff were knowledgeable and helpful. When I arrived at the desk early for my morning checkout, the concierge was prompt to call my prearranged taxi and move the meeting time up. They were also prompt in correcting a erroneous charge on my bill. All in all, this hotel met all my expectation for a good stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff. Luggage and parking a challenge”
Reviews.Author: Mark_from_Thailand
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October, 2011 with 2 work colleagues, for a week. The hotel is great - lovely rooms, newish decor, good facilities and large. It essentially reaches from one street (Prinsengracht), through the block to the next street. The staff are excellent - very accommodating & prepared to help. Especially the front desk and the room service/housekeeping. Great. Room are great. Roomy by Dutch standards & well equipped with nice bathroom, flat screen TV & a great bed. Extensive cable TV but TV channels have been restricted, so no movie channels, unless you want to pay for videos on demand. Restaurant is good, with very extensive breakfast buffet. A minor niggle is the breakfast coffee is machine made unless you ask for a fresh one. Even that is not to normal Dutch standards. However, that is a very minor niggle. The hotel seems to have been built, over time, by combining many Dutch houses. Hence, it is a rabbit warren - easy to get lost (I did once) and very hard to get to your room with heavy luggage. Even after using the lifts, you will be lugging it up (& down) several small flights of stairs to get to your room. One other issue is parking. There is none. You can choose 55 Euros per night valet parking, or 35 Euros per night at the parking garage 2 blocks away or play parking roulette along the canals & pay 20 Euros per night! Finally, location is great - a short walk to some great restaurants, the centre, even the Red light district!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: BTNHome
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, tastefully-appointed, conveniently-located, beds and pillows were as comfortable as I buy at home - perfect. We can't comment on the food, as we didn't eat much at the hotel. And the view! It doesn't get much better.

Reviews.Title: “Average diamond”
Reviews.Author: travnor
Reviews.Content: Its a good location and a nice place- The bar is in fact very charming and serves the best cocktails. Its old skool charm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property with tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: DblHShames
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very interesting as it is a collection of canal houses dating back to the 1600's. The layout is a bit confusing with corridors going this way and that and narrow hallways and stairways that make luggage a bit of a pain. The gym is tiny and does not have much more than a few cardio machines. The room we stayed in was pretty small and faced a wall and other rooms. However since no one room is backed up to another room there is no noise. The bathroom was okay, new everything just not particularly big. The bed was queen, the TV was a flat screen and there was a mini fridge. The hotel has a restaurant and a bar. I enjoyed their AMAZING breakfast buffet every morning. Usually I don't refer to a buffet as amazing, but in this case it really was. It was filled with smoked salmon, various meats and cheeses, eggs, breads, cereal, fresh fruit and fresh squeezed juices etc. The staff at the hotel was friendly, but not as helpful as I had hoped. It may have been a miscommunication on my part as I may not have asked the right question, or it could have been them pushing the things they are told to push. Who knows. The location of the hotel is stellar. The hotel spans two canals so either way you can't go wrong. It is very centrally located and not more of a stone's throw away from the Anne Frank house. I think the pricing is outrageous, which is why I can only give this hotel 3 stars. I feel that for an interior room with nothing special about it $450+ is a bit unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A total refurbishment is long overdue for this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ray S
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite from Friday 14th to Sunday 16th October 2011. There is no question that our room (388D) was not in a lettable condition. It felt grubby and was cold, the main bedroom was tiny,the bathroom (tiny) had mould around the window and where the grout had come away from the tiles, some of which were cracked, and stains were showing through the painted exposed beams in the sitting room. The space for clothes was totally inadequate and the TV entertainment system was either extremely slow to respond or did not work. I immediately advised reception that I was unhappy with the room only to be told that the size was typical of hotels in Amsterdam! After advising that I have visited the city many times and stayed in many other hotels, this particular excuse was dropped and several apologies offered. It came as no surprise that no other rooms were aviailable that evening but I was assured we would be moved the following morning. The apologies were welcome but did nothing to compensate for the disappointment and simple feeling that I was being "ripped off". I deeply resented the fact that I was being charged an amount approaching 700 Euros (including breakfast for 3) per day for a room that any B&B would be embarrassed to let out (no offence to all the great B&B`s in Amsterdam). The next day we were moved to a suite and by way of compensation were offered a 20% discount on the previously agreed rate for the junior suite as well as numerous apologies. A bottle of wine, bowl of fruit, selection of soft drinks and letter of apology quickly followed. I would add that we did not consume any of their offerings. I believe the staff response was all that could be expected, but the fact is that this hotel is very tired. It is not a 5 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination and senior management should be ashamed to proclaim and advertise it as a luxury collection hotel. We were keen to stay there due to the great location and the fact that it is not purpose built but was converted from a number of traditional canal side houses, so were anticipating a degree of charm that a purpose built hotel would find difficult to match. We did not eat in the hotel other than breakfast. This was a very average buffet style offering in reasonable surroundings. Next time (no, there won`t be one) I will eat out. The general level of service was just average, so perhaps disappointing on the basis of the 5 star luxury claim for the hotel. It would be nice to see hotels take their guests more seriously and not give the impression, as this one certainly does, that they are there purely for the purpose of having as much money extracted from them as possible. Something approaching value for money would be great; or even the feeling that we are getting value. They even charge 10 Euros for WiFi on top of the room rate and cost of breakfast. Amsterdam is a wonderful City with almost everything in walking distance. If you visit Amsterdam I would suggest you walk away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brendan O
Reviews.Content: This is the very first review that I have every written based simply on the experience I've just had at The Pulitzer Hotel. My wife and I have a city break every October for our wedding anniversary and Amsterdam was our 15th. As it is a special occasion we always ensure we choose a 5 Star hotel and expect a weekend of luxury! To our dismay we got a run down hotel with rooms that you couldn't swing a cat in, TV that barely worked, a bathroom that was the smallest I've ever experienced in any star of hotel, toilettteres that seem to have been bought in a cheap supermarket, towels that had seen better days, rooms that were bearly cleaned and staff that really seemed to be only going through the motions along with the hotel. Don't waste your money and if you are reading other reviews that say the Pulitzer is great and value for money and the rooms are great and breakfast is the best ever etc etc, I'd seriously think twice as this is how I got suckered into the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Great on the hotel side”
Reviews.Author: JorjeJaj
Reviews.Content: We checked in early morning after our flight arrived and for a reasonable fee were provided a modest room to nap while our reserved room was prepared. Nice option for red eye customers. Service was courteous. Only downside was dreadful room service food. Worth the stay, with plenty of restaurants in the city.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: PalosVerdesAviator
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam to celebrate our 25th anniversary. Our room overlooked the canal, what a great view! The rooms are well appointed, in a contemporary style and well maintained. The staff was extremely helpful, especially the concierges who took care of our various reservations, tickets to museums and restaurant recommendations. To our delight, the hotel restaurant was very good, not the typical hotel food one gets in the states. Without a doubt I would return for another visit and highly recommend the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: SamAmsterdam2066
Reviews.Content: Poor customer service: staff are haughty and argumentative, treating guests as an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “The loveliest hotel in the best location in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Chloe B
Reviews.Content: I went with my boyfriend to Amsterdam for his birthday in July. We chose the Pulitzer hotel for a few of reasons. Firstly it is one of only a few hotels that has facilities for disabled guests. Secondly, its location, you really do not get better and lastly its stylish decor. That is just three reasons.. after staying there the reasons become countless. I really do not think that there could possibly be a better place to stay in Amsterdam. The hotel itself is beautiful with the most beautiful terrace gardens to enjoy drinks, lunch etc... The position of the hotel again could not be better. Situated right on the canal making it the easiest place to enjoy the canals with cruises picking you up from the hotels private jetty. The hotels concierge organised a private boat trip for us which I highly reccommend. Talking of the concierge, This service is incredible and made our stay completely hassle free. The surrounding shops and restaurants of the nine streets are amazing. The hotel restaurant is great and I have to say serves up quite simply the best burger we have ever tasted. As for the breakfast, you could not want for anything, they have thought of everything. I have to mention the hotels staff, they were the most helpful, curtious, friendly and professional we have ever encountered. A special thank you goes out to duty manager Denis Deflam who personally made our stay extra special. We loved this hotel so much that we hope to visit again next year. Roll on July 2012!

Reviews.Title: “A fading star but still a bit special”
Reviews.Author: Rob A
Reviews.Content: Great Location Canal View room well situated but due a refurb Staff excellent Breakfast above average Stayed before many years ago If the owners just spend a bit a money on the hotel then i'm certain it will return to the top tier of Amsterdam hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: njschultz
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for two nights. The location is terrific...just a quick block to the Westkirke and Anne Frank House, about a 20 minute walk from the train station...and the area is very quiet all night (except for the church bells that ring on the quarter hour,which I found charming, but others may want to close the window). The room was on the 5th floor with a peaked ceiling and old beams. Can't say enough nice things about the really comfy and luxurious beds, and the bathroom was smallish, but with a great shower. However, the room wasn't ready when we arrived, the clerk asked us to wait and he would check right away, but then forgot us. When I inquired, he thought we were another party and then scrambled to find us a room. The following morning we were accidentally awakened for a wake-up call at 6:15 am and then a taxi call...mistaken room. There is free computer access in the lobby, but wi-fi in the room is 18-20E a day! Though the room is quite expensive, breakfast was not included and would have cost us 28E apiece. Luckily there was a lovely pancake house left out of the front door and two streets down. They served both savory huge pancakes and the lovely small Dutch sweet ones as well as the best fresh squeezed OJ (opens at 10 am).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pulitzer, it should win a prize!”
Reviews.Author: Perry C
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer and we can't wait until the fourth. Excellent location with many first class eateries within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: saralara64
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel is beautiful, furnished nicely and the beds are SUPER comfortable. The hotel has a lot of character and all the room are different since its an old building retrofitted to a luxury hotel. The front desk and concierge went out of their way to help us navigate the city and make our stay comfortable. Location was central and quiet. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would LOVE to stay here again on my next visit to Amsterdam. As a side note, I didn't travel with my kids but I noticed a swing set and small playground in the courtyard of the hotel which would have been awesome if I was traveling with my children. Also, the front desk had a special treasure chest and welcome packet for children which I found to be a really nice touch. Lastly, they treated us great even though we were redeeming spg points which was a pleasant surprise considering that the last hotel (the sheraton plaza) gave us so many issues for using our points.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SMBK
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and enjoyed the hotel immensely. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the hotel is in a great location. The staff gave us good suggestions on tours, transportation, and dining. The room was very comfortable. We will stay there again when we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location. Beautiful Buildings. Great Service & Food”
Reviews.Author: mpolatin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the wife for the first time last weekend as a Starwood Platinum member. And I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. We travel a lot and I'm generally not crazy about the Luxury Collection as I find them overly ornate and too old -- but the Pulitzer was just perfect. First off, the location is perfect. Just outside the craziness, but close enough to walk. It is set on a canal in a lovely neighborhood -- close to many museums. We walked everywhere. No taxis. No bikes...The buildings are very cool. The hotel consists of many connected buildings and getting to your room can sometimes be an adventure -- especially after a glass of wine or two. We stayed on points but got a Platinum upgrade to a suite on the canal -- without even asking. Now that's Platinum recognition. Also, the full breakfast is included for Platinums -- an amazing benefit. Both the food and service are great. This isn't one of those cheap 'lounge' breakfasts. This is the real deal. Finally, the staff was wonderful. Especially Frank, the Asst Front Office Manager who offered to help us in any way he could. I have to say we were very impressed, given that the relationship between service/attitude and price is often an inverse proposition. Beware, parking is 55 Euro, but that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pulitzer...Great choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Connie L
Reviews.Content: We're delighted we chose to stay at the Hotel Pulitzer in Amsterdam earlier this month. The location was perfect and the accommodations were excellent. The staff was very helpful in guiding us to restaurants and highlights of the city...we couldn't ask for a better experience! Connie and Uzi Lior West Orange, NJ

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: blackrooster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a bachelor party so perhaps my experience is a little different from most. While expensive no doubt, most hotels in Amsterdam are pricey, and you can bring the cost down substantially by using Starwood points. There's a wide variation among the rooms, which is part of the charm, but it could make a big difference in how you view the hotel. The staff was courteous and professional, even though we were on our bachelor party. If you have a large group, taking the hotel's boat out for a private tour is a great way to see the sights. The hotel's was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. I was a little put off by having 2 single beds in an Executive room, the 2 beds are essentially right next to each other so it's almost like sharing a larger bed. The breakfast was very well done too. If you can swing it, it's not a bad place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Theprimeminister
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days from Thursday (September 22) until Sunday (September 25). Plus: - Excellent location alongside the canal in Prinsengracht - The backyard is also excellent with a restaurant, lounge area and different kind of art/statues/fountains. - Minibar and 24 hour roomservice (but expensive) - Very good bed - Good service and mostly friendly staff Minus: - Noise between the rooms. Each morning we heard lots of noise from the room in the floor over us. - We were a bit disapointed when we got a room with view to the backyard. We knew we had to pay more if we wanted canal view but were hoping for a view to the terrasse area. Make sure that you ask where your room is situated and ask for a sneakpeak first - The room in it self was just average when you take the prize into consideration. Dark and low ceiling. I am 1,85 cm tall and when I stood in the bathtub (you have to shower in the bathtub) I almost banged my head in the roof... - A lamp was broken and was never checked/repaired during our stay - Expensive breakfast (25 Euro per person for continental breakfast). We always went to a nice cafe nearby instead - Very small bathroom - Shampo and shower cream was not of good quality. Bring your own. - The cleaning was in general ok, but the shower curtain smelled old urin... All in all: Excellent location but the rooms are quite average and the hotel is in general very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great for People with Nut Allergies and Foodies! Perfect Location! Take the boat tour!”
Reviews.Author: BrainyAmy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulizter's Restaurant Keizersgracht 238 is a dream come true. We ate five amazing meals there during our stay. If the restaurant was here in NYC we would eat there all the time. My husband has a severe allergy to tree nuts and the staff could not have been better. The pork chops were cooked to perfection--and they made my husband a lovely apple reduction (since the pepper sauce on the menu had traces of nuts). The next night he had the filet mignon, and again they made him a special sauce this time with truffles. At most restaurants the staff usually would not go through the trouble of making a new sauce and would have just served it plain. The hotel ordered in special bread for my husband as well, since I had informed them in advance of his allergy. The buffet breakfast included with the room was very decadent with many offerings. I have been to five star restaurants that had a larger selection, but this one has the best quality of food which to me is more important. The breakfast included a cheese offering of the finest Holland cheeses. Since it is not safe for my husband to eat at buffets, the staff prepared him his eggs in a separate area. They also included a nice mix of fresh fruit, nut free bread, and cucumbers for him. Everything was so very delicious. Also, stop by the hotels cafe for the best apple pie. My husband could not eat it, but I savored every bite. A little bit about the hotel. We would definitely stay there again. The location is perfect -- right in the center of everything. We were able to walk everywhere. The room was very nice. If you are older be sure to ask for a bathroom that does not have a high ridge to step over--this was the only thing I did not like about the hotel. We took the boat tour on the hotel boat it, which Winston Churchill by the way went on. It is well worth it. They had drinks and little snacks on the boat. We loved the architecture of the hotel--it is wonderful for those who like to stay in well-renovated historic hotels. Be sure to ask the concierge about arranging a walking tour. It is a great way to get an overview of the city and see some hidden treasures. Also, the tour arranged cheese, chocolate, and spirits sampling on the tour, to get the flavor or Amsterdam. The whole trip was just wonderful and the Hotel and especially the restaurant made it very special.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holiday127
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer in July this year in conjunction with a trip to see "Take That". The rooms were lovely and the beds were by far the most comfortable we have ever slept in. The hotel was very central for all the amenities and nice for a short visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to return”
Reviews.Author: NYGordy
Reviews.Content: Upgrade if possible. We first rejected two rooms but then ended up taking a 1 BR suite overlooking a canal and it was great. The staff was helpful. Try to get breakfast included. It was one of the best buffet breakfasts I have had in a Hotel in Europe. The location was perfect, near all of the top sights and shopping. We would definitely recommend this hotel. Also very close to some restaurants highly rated in Tipadvisor which we enjoyed (Seasons and Brasserie Vlading).

Reviews.Title: “A little for a lot”
Reviews.Author: Avbf
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer has the history and the location but the rooms are tiny and old. Lighting is also quite poor. Our room gas exposed pipes and wires which for the price we paid is outrageous. The lobby is also small and cramped but it is bustling, and the concierge desk is staffed with knowledgable folks. Overall, we found the Pulitzer a lot of money for very little. We would not stay here again without a major facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for the most part”
Reviews.Author: Patricia V
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here during the Grachtenfestival We arrived jet lagged very early and the front desk manager comped us for breakfast as our room would not be made up for hours. When it finally was, it took a long time to get our luggage up to the room. We actually came down twice to see if we could bring it up ourselves. Other than that, service was wonderful. The breakfasts were wonderful and staff was very helpful with recommendations. Housekeeping staff was excellent!!!Location is wonderful; with the major sites within walking distance and the hop on hop off boat just outside the hotel, it is the BEST location. This has been said before, but free wi-fi would be appreciated so we could use our own laptops, not just the one in the business center (long waits to use it). One comment - when we came back to the hotel after the finale of the Grachtenfestival, and we were headed back to our rooms, a lovely person asked us if we were guests of the hotel. A very arrogant staff member then immediately said in a LOUD voice "NO...they are just going back to their room." It made us feel like garbage; we were not attempting to crash a party, uninvited. Other than that embarrassing moment, all was well. And we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: PhilM186306
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in superb location. Staff very, very friendly and accommodating, Rooms large and beds extremely comfortable. Espresso bar ideal for grabbibg a quick bite

Reviews.Title: “Go for an upgraded room”
Reviews.Author: Lus10tig
Reviews.Content: I just spent two stays and three nights at the Pulitzer (before and after a cruise). The good news is that on both occasions they were able to check me in during the morning. If you just arrived from an overnight flight that is a great benefit as some hotels make you wait till 3pm or even later. The one issue was that the first stay they checked me in to a basic room and it felt and looked like an attic-very small, low ceilings and musty. I went to the front desk and they said for 50 euros more I could upgrade to a canal room. I did and a giant difference. I have gold status at starwood and the second stay they upgraded me to a garden view room. That room was equally nice as the canal room and the view is attractive as it is a beautiful garden. Bottom line, if you get a room that feels like an attic, I would pay the extra money for a garden view first or the extra 50 euros a night for the canal view. Major difference in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Pulitzer: Great Location, Soft, Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: SRTS44
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. Great comfy rooms, with supersoft pleasing beds that make you melt after a long trip. Great location, great service, beautiful hotel with great service, located right on the canal. Quite at night and stunningly wonderful. Highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis”
Reviews.Author: windcall
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, excellent location. What you'd expect from a Starwood property, will not dissappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Gem on the canal”
Reviews.Author: LowKey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in September and the room and hotel exceeded my expectations. It was one of the cheaper options and I was very pleasantly surprised. It was very convenient with a Canalbus stop right in front which is a great way to tour the city. 20 Euros for a day pass to hop on/hop off all throughout the city. The staff was excellent, very polite and I was upgraded to a nice two story vaulted ceiling room. Internet was also very good, the bed very comfortable and all amenities were new or close to it. It was a short walk to many of the major attractions. I recommend it to my fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelly186338
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Amsterdam and when I return I always stay at the Pulitzer. It has a great location in the canals and the service is good. In some ways it not as edgy or as cool as a lot of the other hotels in Amsterdam, but I am the kind of person who wants clean rooms and good service! There is a lot of charm with the Pulitzer as it is a hotel that is made up of many old canal houses, but unlike a lot of other canal house buildings it is all very modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in great location but needs an update”
Reviews.Author: DCAviator
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, lovely common area. However, the rooms are tired and in need of renovation. Service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel! Terrific location and beautiful interior”
Reviews.Author: ejcmhere
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with very, very comfortable rooms and beds. The breakfast is lovely and the wine bar is nice. Very, very good location. It's in an old building which has been completely refurbished. Getting to your room can be challenging, since it is a number of old row houses combined, but our room was large, the bed comfortable and linens top quality! This hotel exceeded all expectations, especially since I am usually underwhelmed by European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: hananir
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff is very helpful, pleasant, location excellent, will stay here next time too

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: SceneITNOW
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at the suggestion of our travel agent. It's probably a good hotel but we didn't get a good feel of the "luxury". First room they offered us was small and next the the elevator (pet peeve), then they said the only room they had to offer us was way int he back of the hotel for our 3 day stay. They must have leaks because we passed water buckets and hallway smelled of mildew. $10 a day charge for using your laptop in your room was outrageous! Room service trays in hallway next to us were left in hallway for many hours (gross). For the price of this hotel I expected better.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: fithiker
Reviews.Content: Great location, service, and ambiance. We had canal view rooms that were just perfect. In the restaurant, the food was good and the service was balanced. Good value for excellent quality. We'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most unique hotel experiences we've had as a family- we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: traci j
Reviews.Content: The staff was "uber" friendly and clearly passionate about their company and providing world class service! The facility itself- well, only in Amsterdam could you find a building with such charm. Truly a one of a kind and clearly a part of the luxury collection.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: jandd51
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Great loaction, great hotel . Service could be improved a little but all in all for an Amsterdam Hotel - pretty good

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here before”
Reviews.Author: Toppertwo2
Reviews.Content: Comfortable with excellent attention to details by staff. Be selective of accepting a room, ask and get what will make one comfortable. The check in staff took the time to show more than one room, selection process was easy. Good location, easy access to all sites and transportation. Restaurant for breakfast and dinner was very good. Not cheap, but comfortable, the essential element.

Reviews.Title: “Hope we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorDermatology
Reviews.Content: For me and my son(7 years old), coming to Amsterdam for art, music and culture, Pulitzer hotel (UNESCO heritage) with beautiful and different rooms, perfectly located near museums, on the most elegant canal(Gentlemen's canal) it was all we want! In the afternoon, you can eat some cakes (I recommend you the one with champagne) in the inner garden, a splendor in green! And the concert-clasical music, just in front of the hotel...was divine! We felt like VIP! Do not miss the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with interesting features”
Reviews.Author: araf
Reviews.Content: Three night break Saturday to Tuesday in late August. Rained almost non stop during the day. Paid for Executive Room facing into inner Courtyard (391). Large quiet room. Rate included breakfast and two free drinks in bar. Hotel much quieter on Sunday and Monday. "Business Centre" consists of one PC and so there could be queues. You can ask for tea/coffee making facilities to be delivered to your room for free (took the best part of a day however and they had to be reminded) Breakfast was excellent. Free water and waffle biscuits provided in room. Used concierges on several occasions and they were all polite and helpful. Used loan umbrellas a lot! Train from Airport to Centraal E4.20 each, tram from Centraal to Hotel number 13 or 17 E2.60 each , you can buy on the tram. All in all I thought that it was a very professional operation and liked the atmosphere a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Overall disappointment in noisy, overpriced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulioEngland
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Pulitzer Hotel in Amsterdam for a weekend break. The Hotel is situated in a central position on a canal and enjoys a decent reputation. Due to various noise issues in the Hotel i had need to change rooms three times during my two night stay ! This was predominately due to corporate events and guests in the Hotel. I was unaware of any events prior to my arrival. Nothing advertised on their website. Although apologetic, staff provided little assistance other than to move me, at my insistence. Hardly a needy guest, i was made to feel unimportant as they fussed around the corporate clientele. It must be remembered that this is not a cheap hotel and has a five star rating. Overall, very disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: bruce4623
Reviews.Content: Very nice smaller hotel. The staff was fabulous and went out of their way to accommodate all requests. Standard rooms were a bit larger then average for Europe. 4 teenagers fit comfortably. Very clean and enjoyable. They weren't able to upgrade me for my Platinum status (sold out, for concert in front of hotel), so the they gave us breakfast for 6 each day.... And it was a great buffet... Location is a bit of a walk (10 mins) to the main square, but being the only starwood in Amsterdam, we didn't mind. 2 Mins from Anne Frank house. Overall very good experience... P.S. If you are daring and want to have a great time, rent scooters (35 Euro for 24 HRS). We had a blast. 3 min walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT TRUST the concierge of this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Geechi
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is old but historic. It maintains that rather old-world charm a little too well. The actual stay at the hotel was not terrible. The beds are comfortable, the hotel restaurant does have good food and an excellent breakfast. Elevators are small for my liking but that's what you get in a historic place. This being said, the rooms are overpriced, most of the staff is rude, and the building is very moldy. My biggest complaint of this hotel comes from the concierge. This trip was part of a bachelor party with 5 of my closest friends. We had asked the concierge for a recommendation as to the night life. He said he could get us into a night club called Jimmy Woo for a 2 bottle minimum which he said would cost $450 Euro's as well as a $100 Euro deposit. Granted we were six guys and it would normally be very hard for us all to get into a club together, we decided to go for it. When we arrived at the club, we noticed on the menu that bottles were only $120 Euro's. Why would he tell us that a two bottle minimum would be $450? Also, we asked about our $100 deposit and the club had received no deposit. The concierge of this hotel cannot be trusted. He has stolen $100 Euro's from me and was very deceitful in doing so. As far as I'm concerned, the hotel has stolen from me and I certainly do not recommend it to anyone and if you do stay there, please keep your valuables in the safe and hope they cannot access it....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gdl_traveler1
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice if you are in Amsterdam; excellent buffet breakfast. DonÂ´t expect the typical omelet because you will receive a gourmet one. Well located, comfortable bed, just small bathroom, (but its Europe, must rooms are space reduce.) Good service.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a hotel in a super cool city”
Reviews.Author: brudawsky
Reviews.Content: I was traveling in Europe with my 21 year old daughter and we were excited to explore Amsterdam. The Pulitzer is located in a perfect, quiet area of a city that certainly has some crazy, seedy areas. The staff was very accomodating and nice throughout out stay. We loved the character of the hotel and the history of all the different canal houses joined together to form this hotel. Our room was very roomy with a great bathroom and tub. We spent our long days exploring the city but i do wish we had just spent more time enjoying the hotel and our room. The internet on the one computer in the business center was rather slow but that is really the only negative thing I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Racquel P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Airconditioning was not working at the first room. I called the guest relations person and we were promptly moved to a much nicer room with a canal view. Front desk person even left us a handwritten note expressing his apologies. Everybody in their staff from the front desk people to the porters were very warm and friendly. Would definitely recommend to anybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!! Beautiful hotel and city”
Reviews.Author: Anita J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely well run and ALL staff were friendly and helpful, especially Gilles and Sergio who made us feel extremely welcome. The hotel is ideally situated with the tram stop about 2 mins walk from the hotel. We stayed in a beautiful room which lead out onto the terrace. A wonderful tour of Gassan Diamonds was organised courtesy of the hotel and we were taken and returned by car at no expense. The weekend we stayed had the 30th anniversary of a classic concert on the canal. This did provide some inconvenience in getting in and out of the hotel on the Saturday, but in no way spoilt our weekend. Train costs 4.20 euro from airport to central station and 2.60 euro by tram which stops 2 mins walk from hotel (trams 13 or 17) so I wouldnt bother with the expensive transfers on offer! We took the cocktail candlelight tour for 29.50 euro which was well worth the money and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: LoisGriffin75
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the end of a wedding weekend on the coast and were so pleasantly surprised with the service. The bar is a gem and sipping coffee in the courtyard was brilliant. Really pleased with decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pulitzer? - Always again...”
Reviews.Author: amdrax
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our third stay in the Pulitzer Hotel in Amsterdam. Let's make it short: I love this hotel... One detail in advance: I'm a "frequent traveller" with SPG and the Pulitzer belongs to the SPG group. Therefore I usually get better rooms (upgrades) and cannot comment on the "standard rooms", but anyway... The Pulitzer is "a hotel with a soul". Yes, there might be some "extra corners" in the hallways compared to a genuine hotel and you sometimes don't find the way immediately, and sometimes you have to face the "acoustics" of a 17th century building, but this is just a consequence of the 25 canal house concept. But otherwise you would not have the chance of sleeping in a "real canal house" with wooden log ceilings, a view and tons of atmosphere. The bar and the restaurant are great, the canal boat "The Tourist" is just great with its looks and its history (Churchill was on it). So, go there and enjoy! The hotel is very classy, the concierge Ron is a lot of fun and if you have the chance to get one of the junior suites it will be the best hotel experience which exists... One area for improvement: The breakfast is decent for the level, but the service was slow and the scrambled eggs reminded me to "artifical egg" (and glasses which fit under the juice dispenser are of advantage...) But anyway: always again - hopefully next year?

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and experience!"”
Reviews.Author: YetiAspen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer at the end of a two week family vacation. Simply put, we absolutely loved this hotel. We had stayed in hotels in Stockholm and Copenhagen, which were less than great, and were not sure what to expect. Starting with the service and staff, the Pulitzer is top shelf. From the moment of our arrival, our interaction with each and every staff member was reflective of a great hotel. Everyone was accommodating, extremely professional and clearly part of a culture of service. We utilized the concierge services for many things, including a guided bike tour, and they were knowledgable and efficient. (Not to mention very nice.) Our bike tour was outstanding. The food at the hotel is quite good as well. We had breakfast each morning at the hotel, and it was a lavish offering. In addition to the great service and food, the location is outstanding. The property itself is lovely, with amazing courtyard spaces and an abundance of charm. The hotel is situated on a canal in a beautiful Amsterdam neighborhood, within walking distance to everything. The Anne Frank museum (a must) is literally just down the street, and it was easy to get to everything else. Our Amsterdam experience was fantastic, in large part because of this hotel. There is not doubt that we will return.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish hotel right in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Victor V
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, this being our second visit to the Hotel Pulitzer. We had two comfortable rooms with very effective air-conditioning; the beds were comfortable and there was no noise. The location is fantastic, being just a short walk from the Anne Frank House and therefore also within easy reach of all the city's main attractions. Parking was easy: our car was taken away as we arrived and delivered back to the front door in readiness for our deoparture. OK, so this does cost 55 euro a day, but where else could you park so easily in the centre of Amsterdam? Our rate did not include breakfast and we were reluctant to pay 39 euro per head for this. But you can get a range of breakfast foods (yoghurts, croissants, etc.) from the ground floor coffee-bar and then enjoy them in the courtyard garden. So in fact our breakfasts cost well under 10 euro per head. One small quibble: why are we still being charged for wi-fi? Most hotels of this calibre now include it as a free facility. I guess sooner or later they will.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Stay During Three Week Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Chellebell
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful suite overlooking the back canal. It was quiet and clean. There was absolutely no noise in the bedroom and I had the best sleep of the whole trip. It was nice having a bathroom and a half. The only negative was the old push button and hold hairdryer attached to the desk in the living room. I loved the history of the property, all the neat stairs and nooks and crannies, but I can see where those with mobility issues might have a problem. I'm a platinum member of SPG so the wifi and amazing breakfast in the restaurant was included in my rate. I loved my stay here, wouldn't hesitate to return and am so glad I choose Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Specify a Room that is Not a Closet”
Reviews.Author: 6101FCD
Reviews.Content: Public spaces were very nice, charming in fact. The bar - lounge was a most enjoyable space. I booked two rooms for the family. One was comfortable (both the room and the bath were fine by standard European measure), the other felt like a closet with a bed squeezed in and barely a window for air (I did not expect a view). I have stayed in older properties in Amsterdam before, so I know small, but this was postage stamp. When I asked reception if I could get another room, I did not get a polite apology for not being able to accommodate (I understand the constraints) -- it was as if the staff had all of a sudden forgotten their English. In the end the drinking and smoking made it alright.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, and Excellent Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: shashi101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Amsterdam via train, and we were thrilled to find that we could hop on the 13, 14, or 17 to Westerkerk--the third stop--and that put us around the corner from the hotel. The Pulitzer is in an affluent area that seems to be residential, but also had MANY choices as far as bars and restaurants. We booked this hotel with Starwood points for four nights, checking out on July 31st. We had read the reviews here online, and were a little worried about what the room might be like (reviews spoke of very inconsistent rooms due to the nature of the building--it is several converted canal houses), and the helpfulness of the staff as we also read that some were not as helpful as they could be, and others that said they were downright rude. I am happy to say that we did not encounter that at all. Upon check-in, Marleen VanRheen greeted us with a warm and friendly smile. We arrived earlier than anticipated and so were worried that room might not be available, but she assured us one was. I told her we were gold preferred members, and asked if we could be upgraded to a canal room. She informed me that we had already been upgraded to a deluxe room facing the garden, and that should we want it, we could upgrade to a canal view room for E$50 extra per night. I asked if we could see both rooms ahead of time before we made our decision, and she didn't skip a beat. She immediately made some calls and told us that would not be a problem. I was very impressed with her easygoing, professional and efficient manner. She didn't get at all impatient with us...even when I asked if we could have a room with hardwood floors (I feel like those are cleaner than carpeting)! We decided to stick with the deluxe garden view room, Room 238. The room was small, the bathroom was smaller, and the tub was very small and not very wide. It certainly wasn't what I would have expected from any other Luxury Collection hotel, but it was fine for our needs. I think it maybe would have bothered me if we had paid with cash instead of points. Anyway, the room was comfortable enough, the linens were crisp and fresh and changed daily (along with the duvet), and we had turndown service every night, with classical music playing in the room as we came back each evening. That said, i would hope that the next time we visit, that the hallways are redone and updated a bit. It looked and felt a little like a college dorm in the hallways--again, not what one expects from a Luxury Collection hotel. Throughout our stay, my husband consulted with the concierge who was great. I wish we had gotten his name--he was a redhead with blue eyes. Anyway, he was patient and helpful and always had a smile. There was one other concierge who i was less impressed with--he seemed a tad arrogant, which is kind of funny given what his job was...you'd think he'd be friendlier. Anyway, even he was fine and helpful enough. All in all our experience at the Pulitzer was lovely. Prinsengrachts is a great location for your home base, the hotel is clean, the staff is warm and welcoming, and the area is perfect for exploring. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: safdave
Reviews.Content: We arrived several hours before normal check-in time only half expecting to have a room ready in high-season Amsterdam. We were told there were two rooms available now but if we cared to wait up to 30 min. she could get us a better room she recommended. While we waited she offered us complimentary expresso and pastries in the lobby coffeebar. Waiting was a pleasure, the room was ready in less time than promised andit was a very nice, spacious room on the quiet courtyard side. Later in the day, we found a complimentary bottle of wine and cookies in our room with a note from the receptionist. That is outstanding!! Overall the service was tops, friendly and efficient. The rooms were clean and well appointed and breakfast was great. They even had great expresso and cappucinos in the breakfast room. This is where we will stay the next time we come to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent front desk”
Reviews.Author: JTBnor
Reviews.Content: Perfect Hotel for a great time in Amsterdam. Higly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: CasperBurger
Reviews.Content: We traveled here with friends July 28th, for several nights. Upon arrival (7am) the front desk offered us immediate access to our rooms - a 1st in Europe in several years! Our executive room was not available, but they gave us the choice of waiting for the room type or an early entry into a classic room. We chose the classic and it was great. The Pulitzer is made up of many buildings. At first it was a little odd meandering through the hallways (especially after a long flight) but once we got our bearings we found it to be fun! The hotel is situated perfectly, we loved the Tourist cruise, and the breakfast was fabulous. I must say this property is the best in AMS, and the STAFF & CONCEIRGE make it! They are over the top helpful in anyway. We would highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elana23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August. We were a family of 4 . The location is unbelievable. The front desk and the manager, did their best to give us a room which we liked. I was also impressed with all the hotel staff, strating with the valet, housekeeping, front desk, Bar. They really wanted to make you feel well taken care of. The Breakfast that came with the Hotel, was fantastic, it really made a great start for the day. I look forward to staying at other Pulitzer Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and would thoroughly recommend”
Reviews.Author: NDawson
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 4 night stay, the room was spacious and very very quiet for a city centre. We loved the location and the breakfast was one of the best we have had. A wonderful stay and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Traval
Reviews.Content: I was only there for one night and did not use the hotel much, so take this review in that context. The rooms are tiny (I believe mine was an upgrade through SPG Gold) and aside from the bathroom, not well appointed. Just a square shape that was perhaps 12x12. The hotel itself felt quite cramped even in the lobby area, but it was in an excellent location. It took forever to get a charger for our electronics, and once we received it, it didn't work. The hotel is old, so I don't imagine they can do much upgrading without lots of disruption. I have stayed at other Luxury Collection hotels, and this was an extreme disappointment. Sorry no room photos...there just wasn't anything worthy of a photo.

Reviews.Title: “It's quirky. Very conveniently located... and I love it.”
Reviews.Author: CdnUkPlat
Reviews.Content: I "lived" here for 6 months for work and have come back a few times since. Great / fun hotel that doesn't feel like a normal one, but you get all the perks of a Starwood property.... buffet breakfast is great, and there's a wide variety of rooms. Highly recommend the 5th "floor", where they've split-level rooms with tall ceilings...also the main floor looking out onto the courtyard with a nice little patio. It's conveniently located close to the centre... has lots of nice restaurants nearby and is just off one of the main canals. Great area for exploring (check out the Koh-i-noor Indian restaurant around the corner - consistently good) The staff are friendly and pretty good. After a few weeks the staff even gave me my choice of rooms and always reserved me the same one (I won't say which... my secret!). Downsides...? Funky stairs, can be a pain to get to some rooms.... getting a cab in the morning is challenging (not enough outside parking for them). The staff are good, but not "great". There's a few "loser" rooms that you'll want to avoid (anything facing out onto Prinzengracht on the main or first floors). The gym is small... but I rarely saw anyone there... so good enough for me!

Reviews.Title: “I continue to love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCshopper
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for years now and they always welcome me back! As a platinum in the SPG program, I received a free upgrade to an executive room on my first stay and a suite upgrade on my second stay...fabulous! A good way to describe the Pulitzer is that it is the "Hogwarts" of Amsterdam hotels. Stairways everywhere (and elevators...dont panic)....support beams in many rooms, little corners with chairs and a gorgeous garden in the center where you can have drinks/coffee listening to the churchbells ring. They combined 30+ individual canal houses to create this hotel and it really is quite impressive. Some rooms are very small and face internal ally's...however most have adequate light and many are truly fabulous. I used to ask for canal views however now I prefer the quiet of the garden. I had friends staying who LOVED their canal view and I found them in the afternoon reading by the windows watching the boats sail by. This location continues to be fantastic! Restaurants are everywhere as are shops and bars/pubs only steps away. I have stayed at the Amstel and the Del Europe on business before however I far prefer this hotel...it is quirky and warm... They have a great fresh breakfast buffet however the service in their restaurant is poor. Lots of people running around however getting a coffee or espresso is a nightmare...managers directing at 7AM? not a one! We also had a lunch here which took two hours to get our food and 1/2 of it was ice cold....There was NO coordination between the servers and the chefs...Management issues. Enjoy the food however don't expect too much on the service...They need an efficiency expert here as "Multi-task" does not seem to be in many of these peoples vocabularies. People have complained about the front desk. I always find them helpful and friendly however I hear some people asking ridiculous questions and going on and on talking about things that have nothing to do with their check in.....The front desk people are all business.....They are cordial and efficient and at times very friendly. However when they have 150 rooms checking out on a Sunday and a cruiseship has just pulled into their harbour...dumping 50 people demanding early check in in the lobby.....don't kill the messenger telling you normal check in time is 3PM. I have coffee in the lobby Nespresso bar and have seen some real nutters checking in.....I feel for the front desk at all hotels! I am not in love with the phone system at this hotel....not great. That said, all wakeup calls were received on time and I had no snafu's on several stays during July. If you are expecting a Ritz Carlton.big white marble bathrooms..go elsewhere! This hotel is like a luxury quirky boutique property which welcomes you "home" again and again. I really enjoyed my stays....can you tell? Enjoy the magic of Amsterdam! cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Synopsis
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms for my family of four. SPG Platinum. Rooms were just fine, didn't find them particularly small by Euro standards. Desk and concierge and restaurant staff were just great. We were treated very well. Location is great for walking, easily walkable for us to the Jordaan, Centraal Station, Rembrandt House, Reijksmuseum... Concierge arranged day trips for us at standard cost. We bought museum tickets from the concierge at same price as the museum, but were able to buypass the lines. Very classy, well done. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place to stay esay to get around, a litlle expesive”
Reviews.Author: liliaesther6
Reviews.Content: the best was the restaurant, the hotel its very nice, but for 230 dollars no 400 or more

Reviews.Title: “Great location; high quality hotel, but front desk lets them down”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for business, arriving just before lunch on first day. Front desk checked us in, with all the usual details, and then abruptly said our room wasn't ready anyway. We asked to be phoned when room was ready - but (if they did) they rang the wrong number. Not a good start - and the manager couldn't be bothered to call us about it. (A few days later, late at night a "duty manager" rang our room to check we were OK.) Having said this, the hotel location (between two canals in the nicest part of old Amsterdam) is excellent. Most staff are polite and well trained. The food was of high standard. Definitely a good place to consider in Amsterdam - but I wish they would train their front desk staff better.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: LiberatedMindFL
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel, surrounded by canals, was an unexpected treat! I knew from the photos that it was going to be a great stay... but it was more than that. It has personality, charm, ambiance and is centrally located to just about everything! An easy walk to the Anne Frank house, museums, and picturesque houses that are directly on one of Amsterdam's many canals. If possible, book a canal view room (the view was wonderful). The breakfast is buffet-style and there is a lot to choose from (healthy options too)! There was plenty of delicious choices to choose from and enough to keep you going for most of the day. There is a business center in the lobby (near the reception check-in area) with free internet on the computers there. Concierge was very helpful on several occasion and has great recommendations! Yes, one day, I will return to this fantastic place!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and location”
Reviews.Author: JanusH-DK
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with great atmosphere and good central location. Excellent restaurant with great breakfast buffet. Stayed in a charming family room at the top floor. Only drawback is the price...

Reviews.Title: “Great location...very tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: Brendanmclarke
Reviews.Content: On a scale of 1 to 10, would offer the Pulitzer Hotel a 8. This is a very quant hotel and the staff was all very friendly. I stayed for about a week, and actually paid for my room the night before my arrival so I could guarantee it was available for a 7am check-in. The good news it was, but the bad news was that the room was the size of a closet and could barely fit a bed in it. I called down to the front desk and asked if they had any other options available, as I was staying for a week and needed more space for clothes and my computer (I was here on business). They quickly said "no" without even looking. Being a Platnum member with SPG, I thought surely this was not an upgraded room (which you a suposedly entitled too). Everything outside of the room was fantastic and this is a great location. In the middle of all the action and the breakfast buffet was one of the best in Europe. Great staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: davidh31
Reviews.Content: Plus points - lovely canal view, quirky hotel, all the rooms are different, lovely courtyard garden, fabulous breakfast buffet which even includes a glass of bubbly, (note if booking room only the breakfast price is â‚¬29 per person!) friendly staff, spotlessly clean. Minus points - our room and bathroom (rm 180) were very small and only one person could use the bathroom at a time. (which is a bit steep at â‚¬360 per night and definitely not 5 star). There was only one armchair so you could not have breakfast for 2 persons, even if you wanted to! No tea & coffee in the room, (as I assume they want you to use the overpriced room service) and to cap it all, they removed the glasses from our mini-bar because we had the audacity to buy a bottle of wine from the local supermarket at â‚¬8 instead of from room service at â‚¬50 plus. We purchased a 'luxury package' the welcome bottle of champagne was a half of Moet, the 'Dutch Treat' was one chocolate biscuit, (for 2 people??) and we had to remind them about the flowers, which were lovely when they arrived. Maybe I am out of touch with European city centre (supposed 5 star) hotel prices, so in conclusion this is a lovely property, but I did not think either the room or the packaged deal were up to our expectations for what we paid which was pretty much â‚¬1,000 for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, charming and luxurious lodgings in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Yardena
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer for five nights in June, using Starwood Points and paying 50 euros a night for an upgraded room -- which was well worth it. The Pulitzer is formed of 20-plus canal houses connected between two main drags on the west side of the town (entrance is on Prinsengracht, and back of hotel is on Keizersgracht), so getting to your room typically involves a walk through a maze-like ground floor (around a lovely garden courtyard) and a ride up one of four different elevators. Take time to explore the way the houses are connected (with lots of glass covered walkways) -- it's fun. We liked the admittedly pricey breakfast in the main restaurant, Keizersgracht 238, with its whimsical sendup of a famous old masters painting in which the 16th (or is it 17th?) century diners are surrounded with modern day brand-name supermarket staples (e.g. Heinz ketchup if memory serves). Staff was really friendly and room was always made up when we returned, no matter how late we left. Concierge proved super helpful in finding restaurants and making reservations, and one of the managers sent us a free bottle of wine on my birthday (I guess the Starwood files have that info). We also liked the somewhat whimsical but comfortable chairs and sofas in the lobby, where you can also get a latte in the morning from the expresso bar and hang out with friends if you wish. Furnishings were what I expect in this level of hotel -- with the sole exception of the mini bar: the refrigerator wasn't working so beverages were never cold, grrrr. I also wish they had ice on the floor -- you can call for it but then you have to tip the waiter and that seems silly if all you want is ice. Still, the central location, the decor, and the generally terrific staff made this a memorable stay. We'd certainly return. (A little tip: I rented a Vespa instead of a bike; if it's under 50cc, which mine was, they count it as a bike and you can ignore almost all the one-way street signs and other traffic controls that apply to cars, just like the bikes do.)

Reviews.Title: “SPG Members Beware”
Reviews.Author: KThomasBenicia
Reviews.Content: If you are a Starwood Preferred Guest member using points I would advise against going to this hotel. My wife and I recently spent 3 weeks in Europe staying in 4 Starwood Hotels and 3 other hotels. The service in this hotel was by far the worst. We are SPG gold members and arrived at about 2 hours before normal check-in. We were told that we could check our bags then we should come back in a couple of hours. There was no suggestion that we could go to their bar or anything, just come back. (At the Westin Paris we were 1/2 hour before normal check-in. We were told that our room wasn't quite ready yet so she called over a porter to get our bags then gave us a couple of coupons for a free non-alchololic drink). When we came back after a couple of hours she was looking at their computer screen then conversing with another employee. None of the comments were directed to us so I don't know if as a gold member she was strying to get us a nicer room or if because we booked with points she was looking for the smallest room that they had. We were given the key and told how to get to the room. That is it. No mention of their bar, restaurant, breakfast buffet... I thought that I was checking into a Holiday Inn. They were polite but that is about it. Our room was on the second floor looking out over the outdoor bar/reception area. It was the smallest room that I had ever had. Since the window looked out over this outdoor area that normally had quite a few people in it, we had to keep our drapes closed so that we has some privacy. This made the room seem even smaller. Our reservation confirmation showed that we were confirmed for a king size bed, which we obviously did not get since the room was just barely bigger than a king size bed. I e-mailed Starwood Preferred Guest Services and expressed my concern about not getting what we were confirmed for. The first response was that we were not confirmed for a king bed at the Brussels Le Meridian. I e-mailed back and expressed my disappointment that she obviously looked at my next reservation instead of carefuly reading my e-mail that I was at the Pulitzer in Amsterdam. The next response was "here is a copy of your confirmation and I want to point out that you were confirmed for a queen bed." The confirmation that she sent was one that she made up on that date not a copy of the original one that I received months earlier. After asking for a supervisor the supervisor basically said that when you book a room with points nothing is guranteed, you get what is available and that is it. The overall service at this hotel is lacking. In most of the Starwood hotels that we have been to in Europe we are normally greeted by the employees when entering or leaving the hotel. Not here. When we checked out we walked out the front door and there was a light rain. We stood there a minute looking if a cab was available. The porter was just standing there and never offered to help. We ended up walking down the street as there is a cab stand behind where the Ann Frank House is. While we were at the Pulitzer there were several business groups there. It appears that these groups were what were important to the hotel. The way that we were treated made us feel like unwanted guests. I would not stay at this hotel again. While the location is nice most of the activities are down closer to Damn Square. There are a couple of true luxury hotels down there that would be a better choice. Also, SPG services is basically worthless when it comes to assisting you. My points and gold membership come from purchasing a Westin timeshare. On the maintenance fees and payments, I spend well over $11,000 a year with Starwood only to be treated like a second class citizen.

Reviews.Title: “Almost, but not quite”
Reviews.Author: Vic7272
Reviews.Content: I recently have been told that I'm going to need to travel to Amsterdam 2 to 3 times a year for over a week at a time, so I've been trying out different hotels looking for a home base. The Hotel Pulitzer is the second hotel I have tried. Good: It's a very interesting hotel. It's a series of the old row houses that have been jointed together and renovated into hotel rooms. The great thing about this is that the inside is really interesting, lots of passages and winding around. The negative of course is that you could receive any room from the old maids quarters to the what used to be a main room with a great view of the canal. Know that when you are booking the cheapest room in the hotel that you are probably not going to get the nicest one they have, and if you aren't spending a lot of time in your room I think the rest of the hotel is nice enough to make up for it. I booked an executive room with a canal view and was placed in a lovely room, but it's certainly not for everyone. It was on the 5th floor and overlooks the canal, but it had tiny windows, and I booked a canal room because it was July and I wanted ventilation as most hotels in Amsterdam don't seem to have real A/C. The room also was 2 story, which sounds great, until you realize that it used to be the attic, and you are basically having to go up a ladder to get to bed. It actually worked great for me because I was working most nights, and could spread out downstairs and not see it when going to bed, but any elderly person or someone with small children would not be comfortable here. The front desk must be very well trained on what rooms are acceptable and not for different guests. You might quiz them a little about your room and other types available in your price range before checking in, since it's not a cookie cutter hotel. The location is fantastic. It's very close to Anne Frank's house, lots of restaurants, and shopping. It's also close to Dam Square and the red light district if you want to go there, but not so close that you have to worry about the big crowds on the weekends, or the noise. Neutral: The breakfast buffet was included in my rate. It's a nice set up, with something for everyone, but it's 29 Euro and I probably wouldn't eat there if it wasn't included. I am a former Restaurant manager, so I know what people do to buffets and am reluctant to go through them, but they have someone who is dedicated to making sure it's refilled regularly and watches to make sure people don't sneeze on food, use fingers etc. Yes, I saw someone sneeze and the girl watch until he left and then take the food and replace it. So good there, however, the servers are obviously not trained to pick up the food plates quickly because I saw several tables get up and walk back to the buffet with their dirty plates, even though there are MANY plates to be had at every station. However, they had plenty of cheeses that were wrapped and fruit that you could peel etc, if you have a complete phobia. The 238 restaurant's food is good, and the service was great. The food at the Bar was about the room service menu, but since I don't like eating in my room that was fine. To all the American's when they say small bites they mean it. I ordered the Nicoise Salad and it was 2 pieces of Bibb lettuce, and about 3 ounces of Tuna and the regular green beans and olives etc. It's not intended as a meal, but I assumed that it was, and it was all I ordered. However, it was really tasty, great flavors, you just might make sure you order a side as well if you are used to big US portions. The guy next to me at the bar got a burger and fries, and it looked lovely, and quite large. He said it was fantastic. Also I think the bathrooms all are the same size in all the rooms. I took baths and the tub was large enough to soak in and the towels are nice big sheets instead of the tiny things that would only wrap around children. However, when I showered with the curtain in correctly it's a little narrow, and claustrophobic feeling. Also the bathroom has NO storage, so traveling alone I just set it all on the counter. If my husband had been with me, we would have had stuff all over the place. The Bad: The hair dryers. I'm a woman traveling on business from the US. I do not want to drag a huge hair dryer that is just going to break after a few days because they never seem to do well even with the converters. They still have the little tiny 1200 watt dryers that hang on the wall and you have to hold on the switch. REALLY???? I heard at least 5 comments on the crappy dryers while at breakfast. The hotel offers to make hair dresser appointments for you when you complain. NOT quite what I was looking for. There are no coffee makers in the room. Seriously, it's a 5 star hotel room, and you can't put in a Napresso? You don't have to supply a lot of stuff, but being able to come back to the hotel and relax with a tea or coffee while working and not having to wait on room service is one of my favorite things. I was really excited about Pulitzer, because I could get my Starwood points, and the location is Fantastic for a woman alone. But will probably look elsewhere next time. Yep the hair dryer and coffee machine are that important. I'm not ruling it out, but I keep assuming that I'm going to find somewhere that has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and good staff but food was only OK”
Reviews.Author: ieb1
Reviews.Content: We came to Amsterdam for a first visit. the hotel was lovely - good room, nice staff and i would stay again but we ate in the Restuarant one evening and the food was not great. Shame really as everything else about the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: meghan429
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a night while on a trip through Europe. The hotel has a very interesting setup. It seems that they have bought several of the beautiful old row houses around one another and connected them to create one hotel. From the check-in desk you walk through a series of connecting passageway to the different areas of the hotel. This was one of the few times I have ever given my bag to a bell-hop and it was SO worth it. The hotel has a lot of different passages, stairways, etc. It was a bit of a hike to our room and up some stairs. Our room had a beautiful timbered roof and the bed was very comfortable. Overall, we were very happy with the hotel. We were staying here on cash and points with Starwood so the value was definitely great. The reception wasn't overly friendly, but they weren't rude, either. There was a small business center in the hotel which was very helpful with checking into our flight out. The hotel was very close by to the Anne Frank house and within walking distance to everywhere else we were interested in visiting in Amsterdam. As a side note/tip, book the Anne Frank house ahead of time. We had cut the line tickets (you walk straight in with your online reservation form) and we skipped waiting in a HUGE line that would have taken at a minimum an hour to get through.

Reviews.Title: “Not my definition of luxury. Rooms dont live up to the label.”
Reviews.Author: Jaewriter
Reviews.Content: Enter the lobby and you may think you are entering a hugh end modern traditional hotel. But this assortment of linked buildings create an uneven and in some cases unwelcome tapestry of room offerings. My so called junior suite canal view room has a maze of tiny alcoves serving as bedroom, bathroom, living room with an odd and unusuable office loft space accessed through a ladder. The outlets shut off whrn you leave the room, which shuts off the clock radio and all chargers for room electronics. A towel is hung to cover one window. Leaks or light blocking? The purpose is unclear. The bedroom TV is hung from a rafter causing my neck to cramp whenever I try to watch the set. Insane set up. Not quaint. Not luxury. Not guest friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: mersedeh1970
Reviews.Content: We liked the location but by no means this is a 5 star property. Our room was not ready until 5:45 when the check in was at 3. After a long flight we wanted to rest so that killed the day for us. The rooms are really old but my major problem was the towels. The towels looked like the were 40 years old. We liked the breakfast and the staff were helpful. But we would not recommend this to anyone who wants to stay at a 5 star hotel. More like a 3 star but great location.

Reviews.Title: “Booked with Starwood points. Great location. Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: FULLYLACED
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the hotel, I realized that I've arrived one day late for my reservation. The English speaking staff was quick to try and resolve my problem and not only credited all of my original starpoints, but was able to book the same room for an additional day even thought the hotel showed no availability. The hotel's location was perfect. Right next to streetcars, the Anne Frank House, some great food spots and Jordaan (great coffee shops). It was a bit of a maze to get to our hotel room, but the journey shows the building's original character. Our upgraded canal room was spacious and worth the extra points. The bathroom was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation and new management”
Reviews.Author: PoshC
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room, but were offered a room without view and a stinky carpet. After complaining, we were offered a room of lower category, but at least with view and a wooden floor. However, it was much smaller and were were not offered a discount altough the room category did not correspond to what we had booked. Then, we took a coffee in the garden and were treated were unfriendly by the waitress who did not manage to bring us a hot coffee from the coffee bar only a few steps away. All in all, the hotel needs a more professional management and is in desperate need of renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: paulcoop
Reviews.Content: I thought the service and friendliness of the staff was excellent. They were always eager to help with a smile on their faces. Our first night was not a good one. We were in a room on the 4th floor with a malfunctioning air conditioner. The next morning the staff moved us to a nearby room with a better system. Although the rooms with a canal view are considered superior, I would recommend a rear facing room. Lots of noisy vehicles, sirens and late night revelers could be heard from our room. The rear rooms face a quiet garden. It is worth a visit to the garden to read and enjoy a refreshment. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than we'd been expecting”
Reviews.Author: BuffCrone
Reviews.Content: A friend told us to try this hotel but when we looked at the rates, it was more than we could afford.
