However, we discovered that we could lower the rate by being members of an association with SPG benefits. Then, when we pooled all our SPG points, we were able to get two nights for free. Then SPG had a "buy points" special so we got a third night at a substantially reduced price. That meant paying for only 3 of our six nights, and we pulled it off. I'm so glad that we did. We adore this hotle! The staff has been fantastic. The location is perfect. We have a garden room so it's lovely and quiet and we can smell the flowers when we open the windows. Breakfast was included and it is a really sumptuous buffet, with many breads, chesses, hams and salamis, as well as fruit, bacon, eggs, Dutch pancakes, great coffees and cappuccinos, all included in the price of the room. The wifi is free in the lobby but expensive in the room. The bath has a big tub and every convenience. As is often the case in Europe, the closet is tiny but there are drawers and a terrific desk. The room has a clean wood floor, comfy bed and pillows, and two nice chairs to sit and read. I can't imagine being happier anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but dated. Overall not good value.”
Reviews.Author: fogetmylogin
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here with wife and toddler. As a chain hotel but in a historic building/location we imagined it would be the best of both worlds, really I would almost say it was the worst of both. Chain Hotel lack of character with Historic Hotel inconveniences. The hotel looks like the major remodel was done in the 1980s. Despite being in houses that are very old, other than a few exposed beams peaking out it is the now cheap looking reno from 20 years ago that stands out. The main vestige of the old houses were the small size of the rooms and the inconvenient locations going up and back down stairs to get to our room. The Air Con system was also old, nosiy and either too cold or too warm. I should say we are SPG gold members, were staying on points ,and must have been given one of the worst rooms in the place. (Ground floor, no view, barely big enough for a queen bed). Maybe if you are paying cash and/or are an SPG Plat you could get a higher up or canal room which might be better. The location was good. A bit out of the centre but perfect for those looking for a quieter location, but still within walking distance of musuems and the historic centre. Service was good, as it should be for a hotel of this calibre. The usual overpriced breakfast and internet. Overall for the price I think you can do much better in a true boutique hotel or one of the more modern 5 star chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: JWUSA
Reviews.Content: Our favorite aspect of staying at the Pulitzer was the friendliness with which all staff members greeted us, stopping their work to say hello. They also gave us great restaurant recommendations and helped us navigate to all the places in and out of Amsterdam that my husband needed to be at for work and for the other family members to tour around. We had a room that overlooked the back part of the garden which made it very quiet and restful, and we loved the giant (and spotless) windows that opened. It was also fun that there were all sorts of elevators, stairs and ramps and corridors to get to our room. Our young son's favorite activity was finding the gym! Alas, Wi-Fi is expensive, as is the breakfast but we appreciated the free access to the Business Center and there were plenty of places to eat nearby. It's unfortunate we did not have more time to enjoy the garden, but hopefully we will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniant but not 5*”
Reviews.Author: Madame_XYZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive canal view room for 5 nights which was an additional Euro 50.00 per night. The total cost was Euro 439.00 per night. For this fee I expected something magnificent! The room was small when compared to international executive rooms around the world. Not enough space to store 2 large suitcases so 1 had to be stored on the writing desk. Not enough hangers in the cupboard to hang all our clothing. I had requested 2 separate duvets when booking the room. This never transpired. Upon call to reception to sort this out, the large duvet was replaced by a sheet and a blanket. And the duvet was folded and put into a corner on the floor of the room iso removing it. We did not want a blanket so resorted to using the big duvet and placed the sheet with blanket on floor hoping they would remove it from the room when cleaning it.....to no avail....it was still on the floor later that day. So we had to place it in the corridor outside! The mattress was shockingly â€œworn outâ€� and soft...in dire need of replacement. Once again upon request from the hotel to change this, they told us they do not have a new mattress and placed a board under the mattress...that did nothing! We ordered champagne in the room. The next day the empty ice bucket with water still in it was placed behind the TV and again not removed from the room. The bathroom is small with a shower above the bath with a bath curtain. Not what I had expected with the kind of price I am paying. The booking confirmation mentioned mini bar and coffee making facility...there was no coffee making facility in the room! We also kept our luggage in storage upon arrival but they could not find our luggage when we returned to the hotel. Thankfully that was resolved! Breakfast was mediocre. Service slow. The boat trip on the â€œde Touristâ€�, beautiful boat, was mediocre due to the fact that we had some youngster with little experience being the tourist guide. On the plus side, the hotel is well placed due to easy access to the water taxiâ€™s, various tourist attractions and within easy walking distance to most places. All in all for the price I paid it was definitely not worth the money I spent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: AyseG
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel! Staff is very helpful, polite and friendly. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “100% Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Farrun111
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was excellent. The staff could not have been more helpful. The room was large and comfortable. The concierge made planning our days very easy. Even the weather was great - though the hotel had nothing to do with that. We would definitely return to the Pulitzer if we return to Amsterdam!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great part of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LeoBBalHarbour
Reviews.Content: Away from crowds near the Leidseplein, and the raunch of the Red Light District is the lovely Hotel Pulitzer. A cluster of 2 dozen homes engineered to form a unique hotel experience, combining the charm of an Amsterdam home with the amenities of a 5 star hotel. We had a spacious canal view room, quiet, quaint, roomy and comfortable. The staff was welcoming and unpretentious, the concierge took us on an impromptu tour of the place to explain the layout. The area, "Nine Streets" is the best place to stay in Central Amsterdam. You'll be near a tram stop, and close to all the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel with Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Vinit2811
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fabulous experience to stay in specially if you are staying the canal view room,your room window overlooks the canal in Amsterdam,superb staff and excellent concierge service,also not to forget widespread of breakfast with great choices to select from.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: gayhatlerexplorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer for its location. We were amazed at the service!! The location is great for tourist activities because it is within walking distance to many major sites. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The room faced a canal and was larger than I have usually experienced in European hotels. The next time i'm in Amsterdam, I'll definitely stay at the Pulitzer!

Reviews.Title: “REALLY FRIENDLY and COZY. LOVED THE BEDS !!! GREAT LOCATION !!”
Reviews.Author: Loriegirl
Reviews.Content: Okay weird layout - the hotel is made of many houses put together to form a hotel . We were put up in a part of the hotel that used to be someones large attic and it had been made into a very large room with a pretty tiled large bathroom and large windows that actually opened and let in fresh air. LOVED IT !! The beds were HEAVENLY and we always fell strait to sleep. It felt like we were in our own apt. GREAT LOCATION!!! We were close to everything. The gardens were lovely at the hotel and we actually spent time in the evening relaxing there. Nice bar area and they have a lot of art on the walls. The staff was funny and really helpful. I would stay there in a heartbeat. It was a nice place that makes me smile when I think of it. ( or maybe it's because I was soo stoned ) any ways I loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Fran_from_Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel approximately 10am. As we figured (arriving so early), our room wasn't available but we were allowed to check in and leave our luggage with the porter allowing us to explore the city centre until later in the afternoon. As it was, we went back around 2pm and the room was ready. The room was nice, clean and light with a large flat-screen TV, minibar, fan, bottle of water and stroopwaffles. It wasn't a large room but we wouldn't be spending that much time in it anyway. The bathroom was clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in! We were on the 3rd floor and as we didn't pay extra for a canal view, had a view of one of the covered walkways - we weren't that bothered really! Hotel bar is stylish and the staff were very nice and remembered out orders even when we'd left the bar for a few hours! Here's the but.....at the time of writing, the hotel was in the process of taking Â£275 from my partner's account. We did not use the minibar or phone and the city tax was paid (with the same card but a separate transaction). Although we were aware that a card number is required in case you do use any services, at no point we were informed that money would be removed from an account - we had paid for the hotel room previously some months ago. At the moment, depending on how the hotel deal with this situation, they could go down in my estimation - it seems like this has happened to a number of people!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ML-NL-Amf
Reviews.Content: Although a resident of the country, I had to stay in Amsterdam overnight. Fed up with the standard international hotel chains, I decided to stay in the Pulitzer hotel. Good location on the canals. Great hotel with charm. Essentially a block of canalhouses tied together to an hotel. Nice staff. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Kamden
Reviews.Content: We are completing a 3 week tour of Europe and this is the best hotel we have stayed in so far. Excellent location, modern, spacious quiet rooms. Very friendly and helpful staff. Only problem was spotty WIFI reception within the room probably due to the bulding structure. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A small room with no view for Â£270 per night”
Reviews.Author: NCLPride
Reviews.Content: When our taxi arrived, the porters watched as we unloaded our cases and wheeled them into the hotel. No offer to help, but I would have hated to disturb their conversation. Our room was a dream for anyone who loves to see bare brick walls. A lot of the plaster was stripped away to show the 18th century brick work. The view was of an external smoking area and a deep light well with a single plant tub at the bottom. The Bose bedside radio was partly off the small bedside tables and the room was so small that when the two porters arrived to deliver our two cases and a single hand luggage (why two?) my partner had to go into the bathroom to make room for them! They left the luggage on the floor rather than on the luggage rest (which as there were two of them didn't leave much space to erect the same). When we were leaving we needed to return to our cases left with the porter. We were left alone with them behind a locked door to do as we pleased in private; we noticed at least a dozen other cases also left with us. Luckily we're not case- crackers! The boat trip on 'Tourist' cost about Â£40pp for 65m, but it is stylish and the guide is very personable. To get to our room you had to go outside (roof level) again after entering the hotel- this meant that you could escape the rain at reception but get wet by the room- no one thought to provide umbrellas for that part of the trip to the room! We got a very special offer price of Â£270per night for a double room (small double bed). The room was quite hot and we had difficulty cooling it down. Otherwise apart from these gripes, we found this was a full service hotel with everything you'd expect of a four star hotel. This was meant to be a 5 star. It is one of the "1000 Things to do Before You Die"- but I'm really not sure why.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Tybas
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Hotel Pulitzer. The staff was terrific, the location could not be better (one block from the Anne Frank House), and we loved the breakfast. Like most Euroean hotels, our room was on the small side, but we loved the canal view! We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, superb service, delightful location, very comfotable”
Reviews.Author: Uma3055
Reviews.Content: After reading tons of reviews and checking out various hotels in Amsterdam, I decided to stay at the Hotel Pulitzer. I couldn't have made a better choice. From the moment we arrived, throughout our stay, and till we left, the staff at Hotel Pulitzer ensured that we had a memorable and lovely stay. The location is Amsterdam at its best--canals, tree-lined streets, and classy. Centraal Station, Dam Square, and the Reikjsmuseum are all within walking distance. Our room was so comfortable and elegant and overlooked a tranquil inner courtyard. The quaintness of the hotel was an added bonus, including the narrow staircases, numerous corridors, etc. The staff was always smiling and ready to help. I must say that the concierge service was especially great. All in all, the Hotel Pulitzer will remain an indelible souvenir of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return next June”
Reviews.Author: WhereIsMyCabin
Reviews.Content: 25 beautiful old canal houses nestled among gardens and canals were connected to create an inner city paradise, the hotel Pulitzer. We arrived exhausted from the states and could not imagine a more pleasant greeting and check-in. The hotel accommodated my walking handicap so thoughtfully by arranging a ground level room for us. The room, on an inner courtyard, was blissfully quiet. The bath was stately and the bed might be the most comfortable we ever fell into. Was it a cloud? But, a hotel is not simply brick and stone. The human element is a huge factor to consider when judging a property. To the entire staff, from the friendly check-in to the room attendant who provided yet another stroopwaffel cookie to enjoy to both outstanding Clef d'Ors Concierges to Lambert in the Expresso Bar who treated us so kindly, we say Thank You. One cannot say enough good things about the Pulitzer. We cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattmike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer for two days on May 19 before a cruise. My wife and I had a canal view room on the 4th floor (highly recommended). The hotel is beautifully appointed and the staff was very helpful. The location was perfectly situated near the Jordaan and half a block away from the tram, which we used to get everywhere in Amsterdam. (We purchased the IAmsterdam card at the airport which was a great value) The restaurant is highly rated, but expensive so we didn't use it. If you can afford it, or can use Starwood points, we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricStoner
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, modern, wonderful staff. They and others need to get over trying to charge for internet and especially such a high price for a service one can find down the street for free.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rochrossi
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I went to Amsterdam and stayed at the hotel Pulitzer and we had a wonderful time. The hotel staff was very accommodating. It was very clean and in a great location. Walking distance to a lot of places and quiet and serene.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: CMGWine
Reviews.Content: I was there on business for 5 days, in a rush to get to my flight I left some personal item at home. When I got to the hotel and unpack realizing this I ask the concierge, where I can buy them so early in the morning, stores was close. This gentleman went out of the way to go get the items I needed and make sure that I was not missing my meeting. If you have a smart phone you may be able to download map of called "Amsterdam The Map", this is helpful if you get full with GPS in it. Great Tavels and Stay Safe....

Reviews.Title: “100 year celebration of the company”
Reviews.Author: BibiCalgary
Reviews.Content: Our company celebrated its 100 th anniversary at the Pulitzer Hotel and I was glad we made that choice. The staff served us nicely at long tables in the beautiful gardens. The service and the quality of the food could not have been better. The room were I stayed overnight was clean and very comfortable. At the door I was greeted by name that was a nice experience. I can certainly recommend the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Five very enthusiastic stars for Hotel Pulitzer!”
Reviews.Author: thetripchick
Reviews.Content: "Our unique hotel is comprised of 25 restored 17th and 18th century canal houses." It is a quaint, yet state-of-the-art facility and we just fell in love with the hotel the moment we entered. Run in effortless fashion as most of the Starwood properties are, the Hotel Pulitzer managed to be cutting-edge yet quaint at the same time. The room and bathroom were a good size and the natural light, even with an interior view, was great. The fitness room was a little small but worked just fine - and I am glad they included a map as we definitely needed it and the helpful signage to find it! The artwork in the hallways was wonderful and the outdoor gardens were gorgeous. One word of caution: the concierge suggested a boat trip on The Tourist, the hotel's 1909 boat that gives canal tours for hotel guests. We quickly signed up and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. However, in reviewing the bill at checkout we discovered that the boat tour was 76 euros. Oops, we should have definitely asked if there was a fee! The concierge didn't volunteer this when he signed us up but we also should have asked. Lesson learned, and it was indeed a beautiful boat and nice tour. We'll definitely stay at the Hotel Pulitzer the next time we're in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great place with just a couple glitches”
Reviews.Author: Jayinkigali
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a lovely week at the Pulitzer. The location is not to be beat -- it's perched among the nicest streets of Amsterdam. The staff are all extremely pleasant and we appreciated the gym which is modest but has everything you need including machines with built in tv. Glitch 1 was that my first night (before my wife's arrival) I asked for concierge for a restaurant recommendation and was told to hit Lucius (seafood) but that a reservation wasn't needed. On arrival at Lucius I was turned away because they were booked. Glitch 2, which management was well aware of, was a failure of the AC system. The management gave us a 20% discount off ONE of our sweltering nights (alas not both!) and free internet (ah-hem - when will the luxury collection get with the program and offer free internet like any other decent hotel on the planet?!). Count on about an extra 15 euros per day for internet. The newly redone restaurant is also a big plus (eat the cheesecake!) and the Pulitzer bar was our late night hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Trust the Doorman”
Reviews.Author: DietBoost
Reviews.Content: The hotel property itself is not bad - the location is great and the rooms, though, small were clean. I don't think it's a five star hotel, though - more like a 3-star. My disappointment with the hotel was generally with the hotel personnel. The woman at check-in put a couple-hundred Euro hold on my credit card. When I asked her why, she indicated that it was to pay for my room - which had was already prepaid! When I asked her to remove the hold, she said she simply couldn't do it, and the hold would be removed when I checked out. Later in my stay, I tried to hail a cab outside the hotel. When a cab stopped in front of me, the doorman strongly urged me to get into another, more luxurious cab. I politely declined, stating that I wanted to pay the standard cab rates, suspecting that the more luxurious cab was more expensive. The doorman insisted that the cab he was suggesting charged the same rates as all other cabs, so I took his word and got in. Turned out I was right - this cab charged ~10-11 Euros to get to the train station, and told me that the fares were posted in the hotel lobby and that I should have known that the rates were higher. I felt very deceived by the hotel doorman, and this set the tone for the rest of my stay at the hotel. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star - Excellent location/staff and staff”
Reviews.Author: eton1970
Reviews.Content: The term luxury collection is deceiving. This is an older (though well maintained) property that has the quirks that any older property (in this case a series of townhouses merged together) would have. Rooms are hit or miss in terms of size and view, the ones on the canal are pretty but can be a bit noisy. Location is excellent and staff very professional and delightful. Internet is costly as I thought 25 euros a day was a bit cheeky of them. Overall I'd you get a fair rate (200-250 euros) go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rake54
Reviews.Content: Great central location across one of the many canals in Amsterdam. 10 minutes to the dam area, five minutes to the Jordaan area. Tram station that brings you from Centraal train station is half a block away. Friendly and helpful staff. Great room with comfortable bed. would surely recommend this hotel...no brainer. Free internet in the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Sounds of Silence”
Reviews.Author: Oleoleolson
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is a peaceful retreat...emphasis on peaceful. We slept with our windows open for a week, which speaks to an urban center largely free of fossil fuel powered vehicles, but also to a hotel that doesn't have a whole lot going on. The hotel is comprised of 2 dozen or so historic homes creatively linked together facing on 2 canals with a beautiful garden area in the center. For a variety of reasons, we had the opportunity to stay in 3 different rooms and all were smallish, but bright and happy. Best part of the Pulizter is the staff - just extraordinary. Great restaurant too, but pricey. Overall, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, historic hotel with an incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: JJP5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. Comfortable beds, nice sized rooms, and within walking distance to great shops and historical places. The restaurant inside the hotel is amazing. The food is wonderful and the staff is very friendly!! I definitely recommend that people stay here when they are in Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lmgreen
Reviews.Content: Greatly enjoyed our 4 night stay. Excellent location - walking distance to Dam square and 1 block to Anne Frank house and tram system. The hotel consists of many different buildings that are connected but many up and down steps to reach your room - have a porter carry your bags! Excellent buffet breakfast with a lot of choices including cooked to order eggs. The staff were friendly. Only downside is that they have only 3 converters for the hotel. Make sure all your appliances run on 220V . No free internet!

Reviews.Title: “Beware, the church bells are relentless!”
Reviews.Author: globalexplorer
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Pulitzer was on April 23rd and April 24th. We had an executive room up high that faced the inner courtyard. Wonderful room and very nice view. Unfortunately, the room also seemed to "scoop in" the noise from the LOUD church bells nearby. The bells rang, to one extent or another, every fifteen minutes. At midnight on April 23rd the bells rang constantly for about fifteen minutes. During the day the issue is not so bad but at night - - whew!! Fortunately, I always carry earplugs so that helped to mitigate the ringing somewhat. Otherwise, the hotel is terrific. The breakfasts included with the executive room were wonderful. Also, although we arrived quite early in the morning and could not get into our room until later in the day, the hotel coffee bar provided us with coffee and pastries and bottled water at no charge as a courtesy. Nice touch, that. We found the hotel staff to be friendly, outgoing, and interested in helping us. Oh yes, the location is perfect. Anyway, I would recommend the Pulitzer - - just chat with the reservations clerk about which rooms are best to avoid the church bells all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Charming canal houses; excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: tljm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Queen's Day, and it was great. Even though it seemed that nearly every other hotel in town was already booked, the Pulitzer was happy to accept our Starwood points (seemingly without charging any premium over the normal prices). A series of canal houses set on the Prinsengracht canal, the hotel is idyllic. There is easy access to the tram system (a half block walk to the Westermarkt stop) and the pricey (and touristy) Canal Bus (in front of the hotel). As an added bonus for us, it happened to be within a stone's throw distance of our friend's house in the Westermarkt. What really set this hotel apart, though, was the staff. They are incredibly friendly and willing to go out of their way for their guests. Although its guests likely had no idea what Queen's Day was, the hotel got into the act, selling beer on the street and having a DJ spin on a stage next to the canal. The room we had was on the top floor of one of the back houses. It was very large and very clean. Our room also included a delicious buffet breakfast (with a good spread of meats, cheeses, eggs, baked goods, etc.). We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: bruiserdoc
Reviews.Content: We traveled from the US to Amsterdam, arriving very early in the morning. From the minute we got to the hotel, we found the service to be wonderful. From the check-in staff to the bellboys to the concierge to housekeeping, I cannot say enough about how helpful and friendly everyone was. Our rooms overlooked one of the canals with big picture windows and the beds were perfect for a great night sleep. The only criticism i can make is that the food choices at the hotel were limited and breakfast was quite expensive, but the concierge was very helpful in giving plenty of recommendation for other options. The location was also perfect as everything we wanted was within walking distance and the Anne Frank House was just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel -- can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Fussycathy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. If you enjoy walking, it is well located to Old Amsterdam and even the museums. It is in a great part of town (near the charming Jordaan area). It's made up of 25 old canal houses. Fresh flowers were everywhere in the public areas! Ask to see the old Saxenburgzall hallway and banquet room. We had a lovely room on the 5th floor. The room and hotel were wonderfully clean and maintained. The restaurant food was scrumptious (the best meal in Amsterdam that week). Every night guests relax in the bar. The staff at the hotel are marvelous!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Take the Bellboys advice and have your luggage brought to your room!”
Reviews.Author: TORN1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Great location, unique canal homes, excellent boat cruise option, spacious rooms, very comfortable beds, loved the stroopwaffles that came to the room daily, free ice delivery, overall a wonderful stay! Had read about the windy and long access to the rooms and it was certainly true for use! I think we had seven halls, four sets of stairs although some only two or three steps each. To me this was very charming and ads to the old World feel of Dutch canal houses. Just take the advice of the bellboys and let them deliver your luggage to the room and to the door on checkout! We had used Starwood points for the first two nights in this hotel and bought the remainder of the points for the last night! I would have hoped being a Starwood member using points we would have been upgraded to a room with a canal view as a kind gesture but to no avail, even upon calling the desk! Couldn't complain about the room in the least though! Very large, bright and comfortable for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from the horrid crowds”
Reviews.Author: leicamr
Reviews.Content: I'll admit it, Amsterdam is not one of my favourite cities. The main areas are overrun with tourists and drunken Brits on hen and stag nights. Thousands of bicyclists make walking a nerve-wracking endeavour- it's like dodging bees. However, on the occasions I find myself there I make it a point to dull the pain by staying at the Hotel Pulitzer. Located SW of the city centre alongside a quiet canal, the Hotel Pulitzer is in a perfect spot for exploring the more charming parts of Amsterdam. The staff are helpful, courteous and professional- even when they are being swamped by guests checking in/out. I have stayed in several different room types and they have all been well appointed and comfortable. The canal-view rooms are the most desirable but they do get traffic noise. On my last visit I was in an attic room that was quiet but didn't have a great view. The interior of the Pulitzer could probably do for a makeover- the halls and stairs are getting a bit warn but the common areas- reception, lounge, gardens and breakfast room are in better nick. I am especially fond of the bar. It has two large rooms with tall windows overlooking a canal. It is comfortable, the service is not intrusive and there is no blaring music. A very nice place to relax. The breakfast is good but expensive. There are many small cafes in the area and I would recommend trying them first. They added an espresso bar since my last visit and it's a nice touch. As with most European hotels, the wi-fi is slow and expensive (â‚¬19 for 24 hours) so avoid it if you can. The gym is small but functional. If you are not dragging along too much luggage, you can easily walk from the central station- it takes about 15-20 minutes. Dutch taxis are some of the most expensive in Europe and the ones the hotel calls seem to be even pricier. Best to go to a taxi rank or take a tram. The areas directly west and south of the hotel are filled with great little shops and restaurants. Walking north-east lands you amongst the horrid dives and clip-joints that make up central Amsterdam- avoid at all costs! Tip: around the corner from the Pulitzer is one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever been to- Bussia. Charming, great food, great service and a lovely building.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but four stars is more realistic”
Reviews.Author: Bambi0920
Reviews.Content: I agree with many other reviews that this hotel is in a pretty good location with nicely decorated rooms, historic charm, and I found the room and bathroom to be clean. As with many historic hotels, it does tend to be noisy - almost anything going on in the hallway is easily heard in the rooms - and the hardwood floors within the rooms don't help with that either. If you have a room facing the street, good luck. Though I had a good experience, I know others I was travelling with did not. While the staff was friendly and accomodations were nice, I was surprised to find this is a 5 star hotel. There was nothing extraordinary about it... 4 is more realistic.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and I'm extremely picky!”
Reviews.Author: cruisecouple202
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location- down the street from Anne Frank House, surrounded by outdoor cafes, nice dining, and unique shopping. We even walked 15 minutes to the museum district! Our rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful as we drove up in a large van with 6 of us and our luggage. The doorman immediately helped us by finding a parking spot for our van - not an easy thing to do on narrow canal streets. Then they helped us find a place to return the van and find great places to go for dinner. Very charming rooms that looked out onto the canals. Couldn't beat this hotel and would am looking forward to coming back again because we loved Amsterdam. Everyone was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: imcat2
Reviews.Content: what a great hotel! the location was right in the middle of where you can walk to and from or catch the boat. the room was luxurious, the breakfast buffet had more than enough on there and the grounds just lovely!! the only complaint were with the concierge staff. they couldnt be bothered to give you the exact directions where you needed to go and in that city you need to know! make sure you pin them down to the exact location and give you landmakers to look for! they are also not great at giving you the low down on what to do either like buying tickets ahead of time for the Anne Frank house. and Yes i sent an email request ahead of time without a reply from them! they need all new staff on such an important desk! but our room made up for their lack of professionalism thats for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Facebook Concierge Tips”
Reviews.Author: Dave R
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Pulitzer! Great location! Especially appreciated weekly tips on Facebook from the Concierge for restaurants, sites to see, shopping, etc. We followed these tips for months prior to our stay, and was extermely helpful during our stay! We also greatly enjoyed taking the canal tour on their boat --- The Tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not good enough for 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kisyulja06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pulitzer 5 nights at the end of April. First night was a disaster....The room we got was very nice....comfortable bed, nice linens, good bathroom with the tub....super clean! Room was on the first floor overlooking the hallway. Not much fresh air, but who cares when air condition is on. Guess again....air condition was not running and nobody told us. 3AM I woke up feeling like I was in the sauna. I called reception and they brought a ventilator/fen pretty quick and we attempted to sleep the rest of the night, but it was not easy cause it was still pretty hot and we could not open windows cause people were walking passed out windows all the time. Next morning I asked to be moved to a room higher up, so we can have the windows opened since finally we were told that they are having problems with air condition and working around the clock to fix it. However we were denied a request to move with lame explanation that it's pretty warm weather for Amsterdam and even on the higher floor with windows open we will not get any fresh air and we need to wait for the air condition to be fixed which will solve all the problems and that they are booked solid. We were offered more fans and more water if we need it. When we returned in the afternoon nothing was fixed and in our room was impossible to breath. I went to the reception and said that I want to be moved to the higher floor and I will complain to Starwood if I have to. And suddenly there was a room available and since we were on our way to an excursion this room would wait for us since hotel suddenly is not that booked. The room was just as nice and just as clean, so no complains there. Overlooking the small court yard we were able to keep window open all day long and got some fresh air at night, even though it was not enough and 2 fans helped. Fixed air condition was not working at all....perhaps Amsterdam is not used to such warm weather. But since global warming is a reality, I can not imagine how uncomfortable it is in this hotel during summer months. On the good note....staff is pretty helpful and well trained... We saw people paying tips to the concierge for some advice, I find it interesting since it's their job to help with restaurant and excursion reservations.Perhaps they have to deal with more delicate requests on occasions.... Location is superb..still in the center of the city but away from most touristy noisy streets. Breakfast is outragesly expensive. Internet is not free, which is also ridiculous, most of the hotels have free wifi if not in the room, at least in public areas. We found plenty of nice cafes near by with wonderful food and free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Not as " LUXURIOUS " as I had expected, but nice~”
Reviews.Author: Juju1976
Reviews.Content: We had come here with high expectations, because this is the first Luxury Collections of Starwood hotels that we will be staying in Europe. However, though it didn't turn out bad as a hotel, but certainly didn't give us a " wow" as Des Indes did in Den Haag. First, about the room. As a SPG platinum member, the front desk, specially, told us that we were given an upgrade to an EXECUTIVE room. The room though spacious, there are some disappointing facts: The bath room is extremely small - no separate shower and bath but a shower in a very TINY bath. Only ONE 500ml complimentary bottled water for 2 GUESTS??? There's no tea/coffee facilities(compliments) in the room at all, which I find it very very strange!! Many Starwood hotels we stayed even have coffee machine in the room (eg, Des Indes, Sharaton in Shanghai China, Le Meridien in Brussells), or at least has a kettle and instant coffee & tea bags; but in this EXECUTIVE ROOM, NOTHING??? I know, if I call room service they will bring hot water, but I guess, with the amount of the guests they have, it takes min. 15 - 20 mins wait for any one to provide any service to the room ( I will talk about this in service area). And the room we had is just by the corner of the corridor on the ground floor, we hear everything going on outside, especially when kids running around, and we could not open all the curtains, because then, we are transparent passer-by at the corridor... So I have to say, though the decoration's nice, the bed is comfy, but I wasn't so happy with the room. Now, service: Indeed, every one's trying hard and friendly, but to be on the top notch classic hotel, I think the training and the details are not good enough. While we checked in we ask concierge to book two restaurants for us, one for the night, one for the next; when we came back later that afternoon, we did received a little card on the table saying that the restaurant was confirmed for the night; so we just presumed that next night will be no problem too. Not until the next evening when we got back to the hotel feeling tired and asked the concierge if he could call the restaurant to cancel the reservation, only then we discovered that, in fact the restaurant was never booked at all, no one had followed up... LUCKILY, we didn't want to go, what happen if we had gone to the restaurant and turn away with no reservation? As there's no kettle, I called for hot water for my medicine, it takes about 20 mins for them to come; same for the computer technician to come to check on the internet connection, also around 20 mins... And though the bath room's clean, but the crew were careless, the amenities were not replenished properlyl, we found no shower caps, cotton buds, etc... Had to call house keeping, and again guess how long they before they turn up?... Any way, over all, I found the hotel interesting;and it's in a very lovely neighborhood, prime position next to the canal; and all the staff really willing and trying, but I guess just some fine details and finesse were still missing~

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: wpmurphy
Reviews.Content: My hotel stay was outstanding! From the great customer service to the excellent location, I could not have been more impressed. For those looking for a luxury stay in Amsterdam, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of Luxury Collection Status”
Reviews.Author: spicycaesar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at best worthy of 3.5 stars. We stayed in a family room which consisted of a small room with a small queen sized bed and a loft (accessed by very steep steps) with 2 single beds for our kids. The bathroom was tiny (even by European standards) and the shower (advertized as a rainwater shower) merely a slightly oversized shower head. The large hotel has 2 very small elevators which were slow and oversubscribed. It was full of large tourist groups (mostly loud, older US cruise ship types). The concierge was not well organized (slow and made an incorrect booking for us which later could not be rectified). Parking was 55 Euros per day (!) and there was an additional city tax which was not specified when booking. Use the safe for valuables as the hotel cleaning staff were quite dodgy. On the positive side the hotel is well located. Overall, a very average hotel with very average service at well above average prices.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and incompetent bar staff”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchman06
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful Queen's Day, the Dutch national day, we headed to the Pulitzers Bar for a night cap. The Bar, according to its menu, is famed for its cocktails. That memo apparently did not reach every bartender. The bar was quite busy, and it wasn't immediately clear whether they would serve drinks at your table, or whether you'd have to go up to the bar to get those drinks. At the bar, it took a while before I could ask for the drinks menu, and (upon selecting both drinks and something to eat) I went back to the barman. I asked whether the kitchen was still open, as a burger was taken to guests at a neighbouring table just as I was walking up to the bar), and I failed to understand his reply - perhaps because of the noise of the busy bar, perhaps because Dutch didn't seem to be his mother tongue. Upon my asking to repeat that answer, he angrily said that the kitchen was closed. He then didn't recognize the name of the cocktail I was ordering, so I said that I was ordering a cocktail from the menu that he had given me. He turned to the menu bewildered, and in such a begrudging fashion that I, astounded, asked whether that was too much for him, and whether he preferred we'd go to a different place. He said "Yes, Go Away". Which, of course, we did. Not quite the treatment I expected being an SPG Gold member in a Luxury Collection Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location-”
Reviews.Author: paulandkarenUk
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights at the hotel pulitzer and eventually had a wonderful time, however, not without problems at the beginning of our stay. When we first checked into the room we were very disappointed with the room allocated. We had paid for a deluxe room with king sized bed and found ourselves in a small cramped room with normal double bed overlooking a roof and staircase with air conditioning units - very un-attractive. I called reception to ask them to confirm this was a deluxe room and was told yes by a rather unfriendly and un helpful receptionist. When i insisted she change our room she said we would have to pay extra 50 euros per night for a canal view room. We went down to reception and spoke to an assistant manager called William who was wonderful.He apologised saying the room wasn't a deluxe room and would move us. We moved to a far better room with views over the garden but within a few minutes the door was opened by an American couple who had also been checked into the room. after calls to reception it was decided we should keep the room and the other couple were moved ( hopefully not to our previous room!) The hotel was very pleasant in a truly lovely location and service from all staff was excellent, but two other complaints are that our room wasn;t serviced until after 6pm during our stay except on checkout day when the maid showed up at 8.30 and breakfast was an expensive 29 euros each ! we declined this and went to a corner cafe about 50 metres to the left of the main entrance which was extremely good for about 9 euros each. I still rate this hotel very highly and Amsterdam is a wonderful city to visit and would recommend both the hotel and the city to anyone, but if you check in and are not happy with room or service - go find William ( wish I knew his surname) he was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful...”
Reviews.Author: seasatin
Reviews.Content: Booked an executive twin room through the internet, this room type being the third best category. Arrived at the hotel at 14:00 and asked for check in as we had a meeting at 16:00. Girls at reception said that there was no room available and were doing their best to give us a room the soonest possible, I pointed out that we booked an executive twin room and this was my second stay at the hotel. We checked in at 15:00 and the room they gave us was utterly not we paid for: a duplex on the ground floor, next to the road, bedroom was on the second floor climbing a narrow staircase and a double bed. I went straight to the front desk and pointed out that the room had a double bed. And I got the most amazing reply: we know that but there are two separate duvet covers!!! I was astounded, they must have thought we were retards, this was a terrible start and I was very angry. They send a manager who was very kind and showed us to different rooms, and we settled for a lower class room and he offered us a discount. I am very disappointed at the Front desk and the was expecting to get what i paid for, discount was complimentary but nevertheless, did not make for the inconvenience and ruing our stay. Although I was a returning customer I do not think I will ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and private, perfect for couples or for business”
Reviews.Author: Sims36
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of working in Amsterdam for a three month stretch. I had the option of renting an appt or staying at the Pulitzer for 4 days a week for three months. This hotel is probably my best hotel experience to date. The service was impeccable, the charm and design of the hotel lends well for both couples and business travellers seeking privacy and comfort in a very elegant setting.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel on a picturesque canal and a few steps from the Tram!”
Reviews.Author: SibellaJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Amsterdam for 3 days and stayed at this fine hotel. We were able to prepay our entire stay for a discounted price on the internet. I liked that this hotel was affiliated with Starwood Hotels, because I had always been impressed with their hotel quality and service. We flew into Amsterdam rather early on a red eye flight and went up to the reception desk at this hotel rather bleary-eyed and begged for any available room. They were very kind but said they could not check us in until noon at the earliest, but that was 3 hours earlier than their usual check-in time, so they did the best they could. In the meantime, we enjoyed a free breakfast in their incredibly elegant and beautiful restaurant which was in the hotel. To get there, we walked through their courtyard and garden and looked at the paintings and sculptures in their art gallery. Yes, they have their own art gallery. Breakfast was amazing. They have a pastry table, a fruit salad plate, and a hot buffet with eggs, bacon, sausage, and, of course, crepes and pancakes. We wandered around Amsterdam and came back at noon and they gave us a room with a terrace on the courtyard, literally 2 steps away from their Espresso Bar and courtyard. This was beneficial in some ways and challenging in other ways. The bed was extremely comfortable and we slept well. However, we were on the first floor and near the espresso bar, so we would get woken up most mornings by noise fr the espresso machine and deliveries, etc. The walls are thin and we had to wear ear plugs most nights to get to sleep. The bathroom was elegant and beautiful, but the tub was narrow and deep, causing me to slip and trip getting into and out of it. There was plenty of hot water. The room is itself composed of hardwood floors and a cathedral ceiling. Another aspect of this hotel that we liked was that it located 3 blocks from the Anne Frank House and 1 block from the nearest Tram stop. It is also 1 block from Westerkerk, a large church with a high spire that we could easily spot if we were lost or trying to get oriented to the geography of the city. The location of the hotel to the Tram stop was key for me. I love taking public transportation and liked that the hotel was not directly on the street where the tram was, but close enough for a short walk. We will definitely return to Amsterdam in a few years and when we do, we plan to stay here again, except we may ask for a room that is not as noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: letsgofire
Reviews.Content: I imagine this is a somewhat polarizing hotel. The rooms were...interesting. The hotel is comprised of converted canal houses, so the layout of the hotel is rather unusual. We had an excellent room with a strange configuration but really enjoyed it. I usually stay in chain hotels and this was a fun authentic hotel. We found ourselves wandering around the hotel looking at interesting things a few times. The breakfast is AMAZING! This is one of the best hotel breakfasts I have eaten. Eat there. As Amsterdam is a compact city, this has a good location for seeing most of the sights. The concierge staff was grumpy each time I went to them. Not sure why...

Reviews.Title: “Can't Really Complain Much about the Hotel Pulitzer!!! Love the beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: superrayz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week for three nights with a friend as part of a bachelor party in Amsterdam. Based on the varying reviews posted beforehand, most is fairly true but at the end of the day, my stay was fine as I had no serious expectations. Although I am a Platinum member, the best benefit from this was having complimentary buffet breakfast at 238 Restaurant in the mornings. Selections were very, very decent although I can imagine paying for it would be too much. We got a corner room in #421 and was very clean and neat. Had some free munchies and water too so that was a nice touch. First time ever staying in a room with bricks as walls so it was unique. The beds we had were amazing...my friend loved it so much he fell asleep as soon as he laid on the comforter and was out in minutes!!! The bathroom was a bit small especially the shower/tub but was thoroughly clean and stylish as a classic marble bathroom. Did I mention the beds were real, real comfortable?? That was indeed the best highlight of our entire stay there. The walkways and stairs through the various houses was a neat experience so unless you hate walking, this is not for you, but not a big deal at all for us. Located 2 blocks from Anne Frank House and a old restaurant (dating back to 1600 or so) on the corner of the Prinsengracht street and is only 3 minute walk from the tram at Westermarkt made travelling out and about very convenient!! If I return to Amsterdam, I'd consider staying here again definitely with my family if I still can enjoy and utilize my Starwood membership.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: M_Teo
Reviews.Content: The layout of the hotel rooms is like a maze, thoroughly confusing and extremely difficult to find your way around. Even the new staff we spoke to share the same problem. Added to the confusion are the steps to get up and down enroute to the rooms. So its definitely better to leave the luggage to the porters. The room we were allocated were relatively small. However it is clean, well maintained . Reception and restaurant staff were friendly and approachable. The concierge team members Robin, Ronald and Robert were truly awesome and did a great job. However there were some issues that upset my stay: A) Had booked room using cash and points based on US$ and when I try to settle the bill, found the hotel exchange rates most unfavourable . B) Booked a big cab to the airport and was told by the staff it was 50 Euro but was eventually charged 55 Euro by the driver. C) We told the staff to book a metered cab to the red light area but instead he booked us one which charged us 50 Euro per hour. It would be wise to double check the rate with the staff and driver before boarding!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it! So charming and great location.”
Reviews.Author: ceDR350
Reviews.Content: I really really loved this hotel, it's really a unique setting and so much cooler than your average chain or corporate hotel. I had a great experience there and would definitely come back. First of all the location is great, you are right by all cute and unique boutiques and restaurants nestled in the 9 Streets area, and also close to the Ann Frank House which everyone should see. This area is really precious in this day and age of cookie cutter stores and chain restaurants, it's great to see that unusual boutiques and cafes and such still exist. The hotel makes you feel like you are one of the locals since it is basically in a huge grouping of the old canal houses, and it fits in seamlessly in the neighborhood. It's got a somewhat ecclectic artsy feel, and they have some nice artwork throughout which gives it a sophisticated touch. My room looked out over a cute little courtyard which I am sure is even better in the summer, you can tell it's probably really beautifully landscaped and even with the cold and snow it was really charming. I also loved the room I stayed in, it was really cozy and inviting. It had light colored wood floors which I love not only for the look, but also because hotel carpet is really gross if you really think about it. Both my colleague and I agreed that we wouldn't mind just hanging out in our rooms watching the snow come down in the courtyard. I also have to say the staff were really helpful and genuinely friendly, which I don't always find. Even the man cleaning the baseboards in the lobby was friendly! The concierge got us a great reservation at one of the restaurants that was hard to get into, so we were very pleased with their help throughout the trip. Hotel Pulitzer is really unique and I hope I can make it back some day! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: yarny
Reviews.Content: We returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. The room was a lovely large room (we opted for one of the biggest, non-suite rooms), the bed was very comfortable and the room was always well stocked with plenty of towels. The problem was the location of the room. We were given room 272 and paid 50Euro extra for the canal view. Now I understand the canal rooms can be a bit noisy, but our room was right over the restaurant and every morning at 7am either a delivery was made or the trash was picked up. I never got a chance to sleep late during our whole trip. The thing that makes me mad about this is my travel agent specifically asked if the canal rooms were noisy and they said no, tell your client not to worry. I should have requested another room, but I never did. I would forgo the view and pick a non canal view room. If it wasn't for the noise, I would have been very happy. I know the center garden area was being renovated and should help the look of the area between the houses. It is a bit confusing to get to the rooms since the hotel is a collection of canal houses. Once we figured it out it was not a problem. The breakfast was included in our room price and we were very happy with the quality and selection of the food. The gentleman that worked at the concierge in the evening, Andre, was very helpful and made very good suggestions. We were supposed to stay at hotel 717, but changed to this hotel due to a fire before we arrived at the other hotel. I think if I return, I might try hotel 717, however the location of Pulitzer was very central and the tram was very close.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but...”
Reviews.Author: lotus4660
Reviews.Content: Overall great hotel, and location. our room (357) was a Deluxe single room, this room was large for a european canal house. House keeping is a bit slow, and they have sticky fingers. Some of the houses and the garden are under constuction, but it is still beautiful. breakfast at the hotel restaurant is 29 euro($41), but its an all you can eat!!! Maybe we had jetlag, but we couldnt find any retaurant that was open before 8:00 am. There is a great little spot called Nelson's, it right around from the hotel. Steps away for the Anna Frank, The Dam is five min walk, the Red Light District is just behind the dam, and east of the hotel is the House boat Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: esrubilsky
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be an agglomeration of a bunch of buildings that have been joined together over the years. It sprawls over a chunk of a city block. The common/corridor areas are positively ugly. In parts it looks like old hospital corridors. But the room I had (481) was roomy and very charming. The bathroom was also beautiful but small. My only complaint is about the bath/shower- I barely cleared the ceiling with my head (I'm 180cm tall), it felt really cramped. I didn't use any of the hotel's amenities so can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not a 5 star!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mar068
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and the location is great but it is not 5 star standard. We stayed for 2 nights, breakfast is 30euro pp so we didn't try it but we had food in the bar and it was average as was the service.Everytime we wanted a drink or to make our food order we had to go up to the bar even though there were 2 staff behind the bar chatting and the bar itself was very quiet. You would think in a 5star they might come over and ask if you would like anything! The room was nice, clean and the bed was heaven, the bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel. The maid tried to come into the room twice at 9am. I should of hung the Do not disturb sign out on time but I did not think that she would be trying to get in so early on a Sunday morning. There was a couple of really friendly men at reception but mainly the reception staff belonged in a 3 star. We were overcharged on our bill leaving and when we asked the lady concierge to check out flight time she was unpleasant and slow. I think that this hotel had the best location and it is a very nice hotel all in all but we have stayed in 4 stars that were far more superior.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Doug161
Reviews.Content: Just back from a very enjoyable stay at Pulitzer . It has a fantastic location and our room overlooking the canal was perhaps small but well appointed and atmospheric. Everywhere seems walkable and Ann Franks ( must visit) is a 2 minute walk away. Buffet breakfast was great with a wide choice and staff very attentive in this area. Only downside was our air conditioning which wasnt working. A small gesture was offered by the hotel for this failure. Wi Fi in rooms is v expensive 19 euros a day! Room service also crazy prizes. That said we had a very enjoyable stay and if in Amsterdam again would return to the Pulitzer

Reviews.Title: “too expensive for the offered quality!”
Reviews.Author: savvastzeve
Reviews.Content: In a very good location, friendly people, very polite in the reception but also in the restaurant. Rooms are ok but nothing special. first i had an executive room, it was a large room, carpet on the floor and very small bathroom, no shower with view to the patio of the hotel. since i didnt see any executive features on this room i asked to move to a deluxe room with view to the canal, which was a smaller room, with wooden very clean floor, again very small bathroom without shower. breakfast was good but not special. reception area was poor. Last think to consider is that the hotel is a connection of very small buildings so you have to walk around, get into stairs, get down to stairs till you get to the point you want. (if you forget something to your room and you are already to the reception you think twice to get back to your room). i wouldn't consider as the best choice for me in Amsterdam, if it would not be that i am a platinum member in SPG i would try another hotel for my next stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KB310
Reviews.Content: A very lovely hotel in a convenient location. Less than a five minute walk to the Anne Frank house and a short walk to other attractions. The woman who checked me in made some great recommendations for me. The rooms were very nice - I'm not sure I'd say "luxurious" as the name implies, but certainly above average. The layout of the hotel was a bit confusing, but overall it was charming.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: woofdoc31
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my two nights here. SPG platinum helps...treated like royalty by entire staff. If you don't get upgraded to a canal view...pay for it...absolutely incredible. The bed is incredible...you don't sleep...you sink! Robbin is a phenomenal concierge...more than happy to help. Walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amerstdam”
Reviews.Author: therealCanuck
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Pulitzer. We had a deluxe room overlooking the central garden and cathedral next door. While the room was not large (by N. American standards) it had CHARACTER. Vaulted ceilings, exposed wood, large original windows, dutch tiles in the bathroom. While we could not see the canal, we had a lovely view of the rooftops and the sunrise was breathtaking --- not to mention the soothing churchbells! Really set the mood of the place. Indeed, every room is unique and different. Last time we stayed here we were lucky enough to get upgraded to a business room overlooking the canal. While that was fantastic, I can't really say the room was any nicer (apart from being slightly larger) than the deluxe room we had this most recent stay. Amenities in the room were up to the level of a 5 star. Since it was winter, the heating in the room was perfect, including the HEATED bathroom floor! Nice touch. Slippers and cozy bathrobe was perfect as well. We replaced the feather duvet/pillows with foam, but it was still one of the best hotel sleeps I have ever had. Since this is Europe and a 5 star I think they just expect you to pay through the nose for niceties such as coffee/tea, breakfast ect... but what can I say, it was all worth it. Sure coffee to your room is about $10 a person, but they serve it with a smile, and it tastes so good. The room service was fast, the concierge knowledgeable. If you can get a good rate on the breakfast package do not hesitate to do so (especially if you like to eat a heavy breakfast!) You'll get your money's worth. There is a large supermarket 5 minute walk down the block if you want to purchase cheap snacks and booze. ;) This hotel is of course all about the ambiance, if you don't like the idea of paying extra for the privilege to wonder about winding and creaky hallways and corridors to find your room, this hotel might not be for you. Indeed, I can imagine that some rooms are superior to others by virtue of their location. I have been lucky to get great rooms with a view both times I have stayed here. Try as I might, I can't fault this hotel for anything (just remember you get what you pay for).

Reviews.Title: “A really happy vibe in this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ottomania
Reviews.Content: This seems such a happy, well-run hotel - everything seems to work like clockwork and the staff are brilliant, going well beyond the call of duty to sort out problems. Our stylish room was a pleasure to be in with good-quality linen, excellent shower etc. and the public areas are lovely, including a garden, an espresso bar and a little art gallery. The nicest surprise is the restaurant. Really good, well-executed food, hugely atmospheric (you look out across the canal) and surprisingly good value. All in all, the best kind of luxury hotel, not pretentious at all, just very welcoming and efficient . Only one criticism: 19â‚¬ for a day's WIfi access! Get real, Pulitzer!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogfamNy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pulitzer for one night on our way back from Kenya. Our flight arrived at 5:30AM, and we arrived at the hotel at 7AM. The staff couldn't be more accommadating, giving us an early checkin. The staff was both friendly and professional, and the room was very spacious. Location was excellent, in a lovely neighborhood one block from Anne Frank's House. The conceirge was extremely helpful, telling us to buy our Van Gogh Museum tickets at the hotel (no surcharge) which saved us waiting on a very long line at the museum. only regret is that we only stayed one night!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful One Night Stand”
Reviews.Author: canwegoalready
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent service. We stayed here on our first day in Amsterdam before moving into an apartment for the week. After an overnight flight and sitting in the airport for hours while the airline unsuccessfully tried to locate our luggage, we wearily checked into the Hotel Pulitzer and were greeted warmly. The front desk hostess gave us an immediate room upgrade to a large room facing the canal. We explained our luggage situation and she reassured us that they would take care of our luggage even if it arrived after we checked out the next day. Our luggage did arrive the next day and they held it for us until we were available to come and pick it up. The room was perfect. The shower and bed, robes and slippers were amazing after our long flight from the US. We slept soundly and woke up the next morning to a picturesque view of the snowy Prinsengracht canal. Other than the internet, we didn't use many of the hotel's services, but I loved the character of the hotel. It was a great introduction to the city and will definitely visit again on a return trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for a unique and comfortable experience.”
Reviews.Author: trojanchick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unlike any other; you are served like it's a quality hotel, but it feels like home in some ways, especially since the hotel is located in a neighborhood setting. The bed was comfortable, the room was spotless, the shower and water pressure were very good and the feeling I got when walking into my room after a day out was "cozy". The only con is that if you want a room over looking the canal, the charge an extra â‚¬50 per night which is so not worth it. An extra â‚¬15, maybe--but unless you plan on staying in your room all day, it's too much money. In any case, we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuvVacays
Reviews.Content: I looked forward to returning to the hotel every night because I enjoyed it so much. The balcony overlooks the canal which was super nice. The amenities are great - robes, slippers, nice soaps...I will definitely stay there again. The city is very charming. I rented a bike a few blocks away, the area had lots of little shops and local restaurants nearby. It was quite a central location IMO, I walked/biked everywhere from the hotel and I didn't feel tired or exhausted.

Reviews.Title: “THE location to stay in Amsterdam - and the hotel is cool too”
Reviews.Author: NYLady4
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to Amsterdam -- the first time I stayed at the Amrath near the train station. I much prefer this hotel. Nothing too luxe or anything, but a very cool design with comfortable rooms. But what truly makes this hotel great is its neighborhood. I am a walker of cities and explored every nook and cranny of the city proper, and found this location and the blocks that surround it THE most picturesque, with the nicest shopping, restaurants, and other Amsterdam tourist-type establishments. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Dam and about 15 minutes to the Red Light. If and when I return, I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a fantastic staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: amyras
Reviews.Content: We used Starwood cash and points for this room, although we upgraded to the canal view for an extra 50 euro. I'm ambivalent about that decision, because I could hear all of the canalside traffic overnight, but it did not seem to bother my daughter in the least. The staff was extremely welcoming, and had a room ready for us at 13:00, instead of the normal 15:00 check-in; we were expecting to drop our bags off, so that was a pleasant surprise! Given the complexity of the layout, we were given a map of the hotel, but was assured that if we got confused, we could call on any hall phone and would be promptly rescued! This was somewhat intimidating, but not necessary as the place was not as confusing as we were led to believe. The front desk employees were so enthusiastic to help us, providing us with goodies, maps and loads of advice. The room was bright, clean and nicely furnished, and my daughter says that the beds were the best. The bathroom was beautiful too. The art gallery lining the halls of the ground floor was beautiful, the bar and restaurant staff were as pleasant, helpful and enthusiastic as the front desk personnel. Everyone spoke perfect English, which was very helpful to us. Breakfast was generous and plentiful, and a good value for 12 euro. Within a stone's throw of the Anne Frank House, we could easily walk to most of the city's locations or grab a tram to the places too far for eight year-old walking. Beautiful and well-located with great staff; we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Hotel, Extraordinary Service; small rooms unfortunately”
Reviews.Author: asantiago2004
Reviews.Content: wife and I spent christmas week here, and it was a wonderful experience. ALL personnel exude "service"...we were treated extremely nice. OK, yes, the rooms are small, but then again it is Amsterdam. If we find ourselves in Amsterdam again, we would stay here without question. This is a fine property, and recommend it for romantic getaways. hotel is close to everything so there is no issue here. To pulitzer management: thank you for having a great staff that made us feel welcomed -- from the roommaker to the manager. Big Props to the concierge staff (for getting us good deals on tours) and to the gentleman running the bar (for providing a chicken broth - free of charge - to help me feel better after coming down with fever while there)!!! i also recomend BoCinq restaurant about a mile from the property.... enjoy Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “Dutch charm and a great location made my stay great.”
Reviews.Author: WOPDingo
Reviews.Content: I was in Holland for business and spent 5 days at the Pulitzer. The staff were very friendly and all spoke English quite well, perhaps better than many native speakers. The hotel is on right on a canal and from the outside, is indistinguishable from the other canal houses that line the streets of Amsterdam. It's quaint but comfortable. It was really quite pleasant. The hotel's website mentions that the hotel is a series of interconnected canal houses. This makes some of the hallways labyrinth-like and may not be the best choice for people who have mobility issues. However, if you're perfectly mobile, the movement from one house to another is perceptible, but adds to the charm of it all. My room was on the 5th floor and afforded a view of the hotel's interior courtyard. Not a bad view, but a canal-side room would have been much better. However, my room was deathly quiet at night, which was a considerable bonus. The room itself was quite spacious and the vaulted ceilings made the room quite airy. The bathroom was a bit small but amenities and hardware fit nicely. The shower, however, may be too cramped for anyone even slightly taller than average. Water pressure was great, though temperature fluctuated every so slightly. The daily bottle of water and stroopwaffle cookies were a pleasant touch. The linens and decoration were very nice and gave the room a very classy-yet-homey feel. The heating system was very efficient and lent to the coziness of the room. The location is excellent. Three trams and several buses stop within a 1-minute walk from the hotel. From there, you can go anywhere in the city. Plus, the Anne Frank house is a 3-minute walk, as are several sights in the city. It's a tiny bit on the outskirts of the main downtown area, but it's nothing a short walk or tram ride can't cure. A few cons: Internet connectivity was expensive. It really irritates me when a 2-star hotel provides free internet but a member of the "Luxury Collection" of Starwood charges exorbitant fees for what is nowadays a requirement akin to running water. I requested a queen-sized bed...and reserved just that. However, my room had two twin beds, pushed together, made with separate linens. I effectively reserved/paid for a queen bed but slept in a twin bed with another twin bed right next to me remaining unused for the duration of my stay. I feel this is highly misleading, especially to couples traveling together that may want to share a bed. The hotel really needs to advertise this more clearly on their website. But, to the hotel's credit, the bed was quite comfortable and I slept very soundly. The elevator was unbearably slow, to the point that I rarely used it to climb all five floors; it simply wasn't worth the wait for the elevator to arrive followed by the tortoise-pace climb up to my floor. Overall, I had a very positive experience. The cons, generally, are a Starwood Hotels issue, and not necessarily limited to the Pulitzer, so I suggest potential guests take that into account when looking at the Pulitzer. It is a beautiful hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Reba_Again
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pulitzer last April for a week with my teenaged daughter. We had a wonderful experience but I wouldn't have written it up had I not found myself on Trip Advisor once again, looking for a hotel in another city. I am remembering how difficult reading the reviews makes the process of picking a hotel. Last year we had read a review of the Pulitzer where the author claimed to have found a tick on the bed. Though it became a kind of joke, I remember that it made us pause at the time. Anyway, I was surprised to see that the Pulitzer was not higher up on the list of Amsterdam hotels so I decided to write this. The staff was wonderful. I had trouble with my knee at the time and they made sure I had a room that did not require having to do any stairs. We were on the second floor and faced the canal and were just to the side of the entrance. The room was lovely. The bathroom modern and clean. We purchased tickets to museums through the front desk and they were very helpful with suggesting walking routes. We had room service a few nights and we both enjoyed the food. We loved the breakfast. It was a great location. I'm so glad we didn't end up staying in the busier part of town. The hotel is in the midst of the "9 Streets" (I think that's what they were called) and there were dozens of charming shops and places to eat. I think I remember having to pay for the internet but perhaps that has changed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Old World Feel”
Reviews.Author: missnyc16
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff...clean rooms, old world charm...that is what this hotel is all about. Even know it is a Starwood brand hotel, it feels very boutique. The staff is attentive and willing to help at any moment. Amsterdam is a great city! We hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Dutch Treat”
Reviews.Author: RafeNewYork
Reviews.Content: Amazing location right in the 9 streets area. Great restaurant at the back of the hotel. Make sure you get a canal view. Robin, the concierge gave some really good tips on where to eat, what to see and other insider tips. There's also a boat cruise at night which is nice. Great restaurants and bars within walking distance from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AnacoTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer is a bit odd in that it is a connected maze of canal houses forming a single hotel. It is likely not odd for Amsterdam, but unusual for a visitor staying there. The very central, canal side location is terrfic for easy access to all of downtown Amsterdam. The public parts of the hotel are compact, but attractive. Our room was also compact but had all the requisites for a comfortable stay- better than average bed, linens, towels and toiletries. Front desk service was always friendly and helpful- but they always seemed overwhelmed and long waits were routine. Like most expensive hotels they charge for internet access- not sure why less expensive houses offer free access and multi-star expensive ones charge, but that seems to be the trend. We had both dinner and breakfast in the restaurant. The service was at best average in both cases and the food average or a little better. Breakfast was overpriced; dinner about normal.The stay was too expensive for value received. While anyone would appreciate the location and a good enough experience you just have to decide if the tariff is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and very comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: hexamine
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 503 directly on the canal for 3 nights over Christmas after upgrading from one of the more basic courtyard facing rooms which had a small bed and small window. Our room was a good size and very comfortable. We were particularly impressed with the quality of the bedding and mattress, it was one of the most luxurious beds we have slept on. Only negative point to make would be the valance on the bed had dirty marks all round it but we didn't complain as it is just a decorative thing. The breakfast is very good and worth having although the cost is high. We only had it because our upgrade included it. Our biggest complaint about the hotel is this high cost of wifi. We travel a lot around Europe and nowadays hotels provide free wifi in both the rooms and public areas. This is not the case at The Pulitzer and we felt that at the very least, Executive or the most expensive rooms should have the priviledge of free wifi. Another minor complaint is that tea/coffee making facilities and bottle opener etc should be in the room for your free use.
