They are free but you have to request them and then feel obliged to tip room service when it is delivered. These things should be provided in the room without you having to ask. Minor complaints aside we really had a lovely stay at this hotel and the service was wonderful. We had read some bad reviews about the service before we arrived and were concerned that the reception staff would be rude and unpleasant but fortunately I can say that they really were lovely to deal with and very professional. We will definitely return to the hotel but would make a request for one of the canal rooms on a lower floor with larger windows so we have a fuller view of the canal.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional location with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: j75fr
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to stay in Amsterdam. Strengths: - location - extremly friendly employees - nice and cozy rooms - big hotel but feels like a small luxury hotel - free of charge breakfast for platinum members Weaknesses: - parking fees: 55EUR (eg. Sofitel is about 30 EUR) - breakfast is good but nothing exceptional (I would not pay for it) - gym is small

Reviews.Title: “Unique "Business Grade" Hotel in beautiful, quiet area of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mile high traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in July and had a courtyard facing room on the top floor. It's a great hotel with very unique design. The room was quiet and very comfortable. Certainly, I have no complaints. However, I can't say that there was anything truly special about the hotel that justified the cost. The overall experience of staying at this hotel is somewhat cold and sterile. It seems that this property could deliver a truly memorable experience if they stepped up the service and value for the money. It misses some of the nice touches that boutique hotels should offer. Overall, it provides excellent, professional service for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noise issues”
Reviews.Author: SDT
Reviews.Content: I had a mixed experience here. I paid for one of the nicer, canal view rooms. The room was nice, but very small. It had too much furniture in it and the room felt cramped. The bathroom was also small, but very nice. On the good side, the bed was very comfortable and the rooms were very clean and well kept. I realize that this is a historic hotel and the rooms are smaller, but you might want to price them accordingly. The street noise from the canal view rooms is very bad. Perhaps I should have expected this since it is a historic building, but I did not. When I spoke to the front desk, they only offered the same room one floor higher, or a room facing the courtyard that was even smaller and had tiny windows. It felt more like a cell. Unless you are a sound sleeper, the street noise could be a problem. It was for me. I did enjoy the atmosphere in the hotel. There is a nice bar and lobby area and the area around the hotel is beautiful and a great location to stay. While I do see why some people love this hotel, I think there are better options. I know all the rooms vary, so maybe I would have had a better time if I had received a nicer room in a more quiet part of the hotel, but at this price level, all rooms should be exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “A Dutch treat!”
Reviews.Author: Pete312
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is lovely and unique hotel in the Jordan section of Amsterdam - - terrific location. Made up of 13 traditional Amsterdam row houses on Keizersgracht (canal) and 12 on Prinsengracht, it is not exactly ADA friendly. The connector halls go up and down stairs - some quite challenging. I've taken my parents to this hotel and made sure to secure a room near an elevator because many rooms are not at all accessible if walking up and down stairs is a challenge. But, despite the odd configuration the hotel is very charming! The service is discrete and polite. The restaurant and bar are inviting (breakfast service is very good by Amsterdam standards). The gym is tiny but I rarely run into other guests using that facility. It is a romantic, historic and interesting hotel. Not everyone will love it though. The bath is small and depending on which room you get, it may have an odd layout given that it is a room in an old row house. The bedding is wonderful and I always sleep quite well there. The best attribute of the Pulitzer is the location. It is close to all Amsterdam attractions and nestled in the "nine sisters" area...an area of nine small streets of shopping, bars, cafe's etc. I always opt for a canal view room, but they can be loud - - a courtyard room is a better bet for light sleepers. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great option away from the Dam, but still centrally located”
Reviews.Author: AB121212
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week on business. When visiting Amsterdam I like to stay away from the noisy crowds and stag parties that linger around the Dam. This hotel is a great option since its very close to the famous Dam sites, but still in a quiet neighbourhood. This hotel is located on 'de 9 Stratjees' with some of the best boutique shopping around. There is a tram at the end of the street so its easy to get around. My favourite part of my stay was the bed. I never had a bad nights sleep. The only odd thing was that the hotel staff insisted on coming in to re-stock our mini-bar at 10 or 11ish on a Saturday when we were just getting up. I think at a place that touts itself as high-end they would wait until a guest left the room to re-stock. Other than that it was a fine place to stay on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best...”
Reviews.Author: leo-chan
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, the hotel is physically elegant and charming, both in its location and design. Not my first trip into Amsterdam and certainly not my last, but can say with confidence that this hotel will not see me stepping foot in it again unless major structural changes in the management happen. Being my second stay, I really had hope that things would be different this time around, but it was not to be. 1. Front desk staff who would launch into a tirade when room key cards don't work Having to endure a 10-minute lecture from the front desk team on how the key cards should not be stored together with other electromagnetic devices such as mobile phones, iPod's, etc. - obviously something that was prevalent among many guests or this "electromagnetic" lecture would not have surfaced. A genuine luxury hotel would have apologized profusely that the key cards didn't work, and would have done something about the system if there were enough complaints / inconvenience to the guests to justify. And no, I did not keep my key cards with my mobile phone, iPod or whatever. The cards simply did not work for whatever reason. I was and am still not interested in explanations and lectures. 2. Concierges who are really nice, but have no clue. Wake up calls that were not done, newspapers that were not delivered are among the many things that didn't quite pass the mark of a decent hotel, what more a "luxury" one. Borderline patronizing in my opinion. 3. Front desk staff that gave the "You are an idiot and I'm doing you a favour" vibe. I spoke with the front desk staff member because I doubt very much the concierge would be able to assist me RELIABLY. And seriously, if it pains you to call and confirm an airport shuttle, you should not be in this job in the first place. Rolling your eyes indignantly, did not help either. 4. Trainees left unsupervised at the front desk, poor handling of common questions and product knowledge. Answers to common questions like "what time is breakfast?" were met with "please wait a moment, I need to check". "Could you please book and confirm an airport shuttle tomorrow at 1100hrs" were met with "I need to check whether we can do this (or not)". Understandably, they are trainees and are trying to their best, but what is most surprising is that permanent staff members on duty standing 1 foot away from the mentioned trainee, did not even bother to intervene to assist although they were not doing anything at all. In conclusion, I personally find the hotel's level of (non) service repellent, especially given the price levels the rooms are going for. One notable exception was breakfast service which was good. It is also obvious to me that they are not too bothered by this. A shame for such a charming property. The stark difference and lack of consistency of service from an exceptional Luxury Collection (Grande Bretagne Athens), to this "exceptional" "Luxury Collection" is shocking. Wrote to corporate customer services in Starwood and was replied immediately with an apology and compensation - a sign that these issues were not new. Nevertheless, will definitely not stay again, nor recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and terrific choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sabos93
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer provides a wonderful old city experience. Located in 28 row houses between Prinsengracht and Kiesergracht, the hotel just two blocks south of West Church (Westerkerk), the Anne Frank Museum, and the cannal bus stop for the red and yellow lines. Pulitzer is also is adjacent to the Jordaan shopping area and short one kilometer walk to Koninklijk Paleis and "The Dam." The decor is understated but comfortable and the property offers all the basic amenities including an espresso bar, restaurant, and cocktail lounge. We spent our evenings unwinding in the bar. Though it was a bit expensive, the staff is terrific and has wonderful insights on sightseeing and local dining tips. They also make a great Manhattan. No two rooms in the hotel are alike, and getting to your room can be a journey as you cross through corridors and move up/down stairs and through small elevators just to reach your room. Still, the experience is fun and the rooms are very comfortable. We stayed in a terrific canal view room with one of the most comfortable beds I even had in a hotel. The hotel offer wired and wireless Internet in the rooms. the bathrooms are a bit small but well appointed. The Hotel Pulitzer can be reached on foot from the central train station but I wouldn't recommend it for most people. Instead, consider a cab ride for about 12 euros. If you want to take a taxi directly to/from the airport, the trip will cost you about 40-50 euros during peak hours, but you sometimes negotiate a rate of about 35 euros in the late evening or early morning. During your stay I highly recommend a canal bus pass for at least a day. Its a fun way to get around the city, especially when you're tired after walking or riding bikes. The pass allows you to hop on/off at over 40 stops around the city. Be sure to return the boat at night when you'll be treated to the beautiful lights along your route.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but expensive rooms for what you get”
Reviews.Author: lebus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Amrath when we first visited Amsterdam 2 years ago. Decided on the Pulitzer this year on the back of the run of generally positive comments on Tripadvisor, and the option of cutting costs by paying half cash and the rest in Starwood points. Very good position. Central location. Upgraded to a canal view room - extra cost of 50 euros per night. Room 445. Nice view of the canal. Odd sort of room but hey, this is Amsterdam and you have to expect surprises given the architecture. Bathroom very small but clean. My wife commented on the fact that the shower curtain appeared to be new - replaced with every new guest she wondered?If so-impressive. Booked a trip on the hotel boat. More expensive than other tours I am sure, but nice. Paid for breakfast one morning. 29 euros each, and you should expect top quality for that price. Pretty basic really. Scrambled eggs cold - that's lazy catering. Cook in small batches and keep repleneshing, and you have warm scrambled eggs. It might seem a petty point but at nearly Â£30 each for a breakrfast, I reserve the right to be petty. Concierge service good. They got me a reservation in a restaurant that had refused me a table on the grounds that they were fully booked 5 weeks before the trip! Problem with printing boarding pass off due to KLM glitch. Receptionist very helpful, sorted it all out for me and left boarding passes in my room. Nice friendly staff generally. Generally hotel is ok, but looking jaded and needs a little TLC. Rooms are expensive for what you get, but our room was quiet and we slept well which is always a big plus. Nice bar with quick service By the way, if you are planning going to Amsterdam soon, go to see the Cirque de Soleil. We went to Amsterdam this time specifically to see Totem, and it was one of the best Cirque de Soleil productions we have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Going the extra mile !!”
Reviews.Author: stephenwilson
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel in a great location very central. I had already checked the hotel out on trip advisor before i went as i do in most cases and was pleased with the comments. On return i got the usual corporate questionnaire which i completed with a very positive reply other than a slight problem with service at breakfast. To my amazement by reply i got a very nice email from Sanne Luijten Duty Manager who said the matter was being looked into most impressed. This is a lovely hotel in a great location with helpful staff restaurant was also good .Some Americans might find the bedrooms a little on the small side but that is all a part of the character and due to been built many years ago and originlly over 25 canal houses joined together.It was great they took notice of feedback on a minor comment when everything else was so good well done on them,would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expected more”
Reviews.Author: calster
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, right on the canal. It's a quick walk to everything in central Amsterdam and close to several of the tram lines. We walked everywhere....stumbled back after Game 5 of the Series at the Leidesplein. Only took a tram once, back to the Central Station. A small grocery store is located just around the corner as well. The breakfast was included in our rate and was extensive. Again, more than enough to fuel up for the day and not need lunch despite the walking. The Executive room with a canal view was very nice, but quite small. The bathroom was tiny. Yes, I realize it's Europe but it just seemed quite small. The bed was really fantastic. I didn't want to get out because it was so comfy. The staff was quite friendly. Very responsive and every request was dealt with very quickly. The Business Center is located right in the lobby with two computers with internet access. You can print your boarding passes from there. The gym is in a maze of corridors and stairwells in the southeast corner of the hotel. It's quite small with two treadmills, bikes and ellipticals and free weights to 22 kgs. Bottled water, fruit and towels are provided. There isn't much room to do much and it was crowded at 5:30 am. Overall, a very nice hotel. I liked that it was a bunch of houses that have been consolidated into a hotel. It fits in the neighborhood and makes you feel almost local. It just does not seem much of a value. It's very expensive and doesn't seem much different from another chain hotel except for it's location. I'm not sure the canal view is enough for me to come back. I would still recommend, but next time, I'm going to look into another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: flowergal80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the pulitzer in the beginning of october... and everything was great!!! The location was awesome, our room was a little small, but impeccably clean and very comfortable bed... the bathroom had heated floors.. so very nice!! The best thing about the hotel was the fact that we were one day late because our flight (easyjet.. ugh) was delayed 24 hours... and they didn't charge us!! i thought that we would automatically have to pay for the night that we didn't show up for... but they actually told us first (w/o us saying anything) that they would waive that night!! we were very pleasantly surprised... and extremely happy. Great service and great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “City break in Romantic Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RobertOudshoorn
Reviews.Content: What a dream! Hotel Pulitzer is definitely one of the most unique and cute hotels I have ever stayed. In the city heart of Amsterdam you will find a hotel offering you a true Amsterdam experience. All of their guest rooms are in lovely canal houses and if you treat yourself to a canal view room. WOW! The hotel has a warm ambiance with friendly and helpful staff, a great restaurant with a superb breakfast buffet and cozy bar. They have amazing garden and all together a very home touch! All the nice shops are around the corner along the 9 streets of Amsterdam (ask the concierge).

Reviews.Title: “A reflection of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GLMM22
Reviews.Content: This is a very differant quirky hotel. Being a Luxury collection it is very nice and of course you will find everything you need. The Pulitzer really leaves you in no doubt as to where in the world you are, with it's spiralling stair cases, high beamed ceilings and the general feel of the place is very authentic which sometimes big chains tend to have trouble with. Bathrooms were a little small but none the less nothing to complain about. We had a great stay and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy but expensive if you pay the full price.”
Reviews.Author: JDBonthemove
Reviews.Content: This place is located just steps from the Anne Frank House. And, it's not a bad walk from the train station unless you're carrying a steamer trunk for luggage. Rather than being a single building, it is comprised of what seems to be the majority of the houses on the block. So the ground level is a maze of hallways, covered walkways, and courtyards connecting them all together. Our room was near the main entrance but was surprisingly quiet. With all the usual amenities of a higher end hotel, it was comfortable and very clean. But, I must say that I fell in love with the heated bathroom floor... an wonderfully pampering touch upon returning from a chilly/damp excursion on the town.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places in the world!”
Reviews.Author: AustinAussie
Reviews.Content: Situated in a row of former factory houses, the hotel Pultizer is a gem located in Amsterdam. Apon arrival we complained that our room was located too close to the street noise and they graciously upgraded us to a spacious suite in the attic area. I could hear the bells of the church Anne Frank described in her book. To stay in a room similar to the one in which her family lived, was quite an experience. The hotel is simply fabulous and a pleasure to explore all the twists and turns and hidden halls. We found the staff very attentive and when the hotel accidentally shrunk my silk sweater, they comped our room service breakfasts. Our stay here was one of the best weeks of my life!

Reviews.Title: “I feel cheated by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Demandthebest
Reviews.Content: I booked a deluxe room with a King bed. Without telling me I was given a room with two single beds. Isn't that fraud? I was expected to pay for a product I had not ordered. But with this hotel they could do nothing about it, claiming the hotel was full. There was no offer of compensation whatsoever. They knew I had no option to find another hotel because it was a late check-in. And to add insult to injury the following week I got an email from the manager saying he hoped I had enjoyed my stay and wanted to tell me about other so-called 'luxury hotels'. How laughable! And I must agree with the people who have said this is not a five star hotel. I feel so angry about this stay that I have dropped being a Starwood customer. My advice: stay well away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good but no cigar”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl078
Reviews.Content: this recent stay was iffy. the location is great. our room was small but nice on the ground floor with doors to the garden. bathroom was good. it was almost as big as the room. service though was a bit up and down. depended on who was on duty. television and phone were not good. room sevice was practically non existant. called for for coffee (no coffee/tea maker) at 2300 after birthday dinner out. No answer. called front desk who said someone would call back as they have room service 'till 0200. no joy, no decaf, no call. left the next day in a grumpy mood.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Delraypete
Reviews.Content: The Good: staff, cleanliness, breakfast, uniqueness. The Bad: small rooms, uniqueness (multiple small staircases in the hall to get to our room). The staff here was second to none. Check in, room service and check out were all terrific and quick. Incorrect charges at check out were met with, "no problem, we'll take it off," however there were quite a few. Additionally, I had been told by room service that a bucket of ice would be a $4.50EU "cover charge", but that did not appear on the bill. Strange, but glad I didn't have to pay $10EU for a couple buckets of ice. Buffet breakfast was terrific and plentiful. The biggest disappointment was our room. We booked the "Family Duplex" for 4 adults and were expecting at least a living room with 2 small bedrooms. What we got was a very small hotel room with a king-size bed and a tiny, difficult to access loft above it with 2 twin beds. The bathroom was sufficient, but also on the small side. Luckily I received a reduced rate or I would have been very upset. That's probably why our room was so small. Also off-putting was a $130EU/night charge for 2 people because despite being able to sleep 4 people it's "a 2 person room". So despite the good service, I would probably look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SDTraveler909
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Pulitzer could not have been nicer! Everyone spoke excellent English and the concierge was very helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful and is centrally located so you can walk to everything. We only had one night in Amsterdam but I look forward to visiting again and staying at the Hotel Pulitzer!

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Doglover925
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood advocate, but staying at this hotel, I am questioning my loyalty. I will never stay at Hotel Pulitzer again. My room overlooked a courtyard. I was fine with that since I didn't want to pay extra for a canal view. What I didn't expect was to overlook a courtyard where they were storing large, stainless steel appliances (refrigerators, etc). To make matters worse the air conditioning did not keep the room cool enough to sleep. Finally, the inside doors of the elevator were never cleaned. The same spills and fingerprints were there my entire stay. If they can't clean elevator doors, do they really think I would eat there. Extremely lazy management. The front desk personnel are aloof and unfriendly. When I complained to Starwood, I was offered an upgrade next time I stay at Hotel Pulitzer. Why would I ever stay there again? There are a lot of other great hotels in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: fifim37
Reviews.Content: Perhaps our disappointment was inevitable after the lovely hotels we stayed in in the days prior but we found the Pulitzer to be a downer. I felt like I was in a hospital - all corridors, stairs, and doors with safety glass panels in the top. I know yes that it is a group of old canal houses that have been joined so a rabbit warren is inevitable but I felt it lacked charm. The rooms themselves were clean, the breakfast was great. The gym was crazily small and yes, the gym matters when you are eating your way through Europe. There isn't even room for two people to stretch. We had booked for three nights but cut our stay short and moved on.

Reviews.Title: “With time quality go.....”
Reviews.Author: Andy11081977
Reviews.Content: down, are at least 4 years 1 or 2 times a year, that I/we go to Amsterdam in the month of may and I always stayed at the Pulitzer and unfortunately I have to admit that with the time the quality is on the down trend. The front desk check in or out is a mess and if you ask the concierge for a restaurant well they always tell you the same one........the rooms are very small but ok, the extra 50â‚¬ a day for the canal view is a little too much....the breakfast is very good and there is plenty of choice. The hotel is not the cleanest one I have been. In terms of location is perfect. I will go back after my last stay? no I will look for something else in the same range of price, considering what the Pulitzer cost well in Amsterdam there are so many hotel..........;

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here before and the service is not great”
Reviews.Author: Ayeletb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times and this last time was not great. The hotel's layout is confusing. My room was by an area where they had a huge outdoor party for hours and people were sitting in my private patio. Luckily, I had a business dinner and when I got back, I asked them to move since I was jet lagged and wanted to sleep. They "forgot" to pick up my laundry, which made me realize that I need to pack more selections. The service seems to come with an attitude. And it is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: yptee
Reviews.Content: Stay in the hotel for 2 nights upon recommendation from my cousin (was going to book Intercontinental Amstel before). Paid EUR50 per day to upgrade to Deluxe Canal View room. Check in was ok but when we were going to bed, we discovered there were some stains in the bed sheet. Didn't make a fuss as it was nearly midnight. Bed was very comfortable. Second morning we were planning to stay in bed late but we could hear all the street noises. Our room was on the second floor, maybe it will be more quiet on higher floors but the windows should have been sound proof. It was raining everyday when we were there. Tried to borrow an umbrella from the hotel but was told they ran out! I would expect them to get a few more umbrellas or even have 1 in each room if they are charging something like EUR300 per night! Also the concierge only have 1 person every time I was there. I have used the concierge 3 times and was made to wait at least 10 mins twice. Another thing is the internet connection... EUR19 for 24 hours access when I am already paying EUR300 per night. This is year 2010 now!!! Wi Fi should come free in all rooms. I don't think I will stay here again. The best hotel I have stayed in Amsterdam remains the American Hotel, very good value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “Live Like the Stars”
Reviews.Author: BarneyMate
Reviews.Content: If you want to get a preview, watch Ocean's Twelve - this is the hotel used in the movie. We took my Mum and Dad here to celebrate his 70th. The staff were superb from start to finish. We were waiting in one of the corridors, which are decorated with contemporary art. A passing waiter returned in less than five minutes with a tray of coffee and biscuits! On another morning, my wife was still abed while I had breakfast. As I tried to put a sneaky plate together for her a different waiter took the plate from me, asked if she'd like tea or coffee and delivered it straight to our room. I could not fault the place. Really enjoyed the trips to Keukenhof Gardens, where bulbs always seem to be in bloom. Volendam, with its old Dutch sailing regatta was a Vermeer brought to life!

Reviews.Title: “Worst check-in experience; front desk...”
Reviews.Author: traveltweet
Reviews.Content: Worst check-in experience; front desk staff sucked

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nunuflies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a buddy for a 4 day romp in Amsterdam. Used points (SPG member) for the first 2 nights, and we paid for the 2nd two. Upon arrival, the woman at check in was happy to let us check in at 10:30am, and was delighted to let us know we had a room on the 5th floor on the corner overlooking the Keizergracht. It wasn't quite a canal view, but if you looked out the window, you could see it (more on this in a few). The hotel is really cool. It's 25 canal houses comprising an entire square block between the Keizergracht and the Prinsengracht. Right on the fringe of the Jordaan, and about a 10 minute walk from Dam Square/RLD, you really couldn't get a better location in Amsterdam. Labyrinthian would be the best word to describe the inside of it. There are multiple courtyards in between the houses, which makes for a really beautiful scene when it's nice out. Our room was as quiet as you could get I think (albeit a little bit of a challenge to find when....*ahem*.. inebriated at night), and was bigger than most (I'm guessing) with a large bathroom (others mentioned small bathrooms, which isn't a big deal to me, personally - ours was huge though). The neighborhood is quiet in its own right, so the noisy people on the canals wouldn't really be a huge problem anyway - it's far enough from the main night life that this would only be an issue until 11pm tops. The service was excellent, our rooms were sparkling, and the staff was very helpful. The only cons I suppose would be the fact that Wifi costs money (it's 2010 people...), and the breakfast is outrageously, almost extortionately expensive. That seems to be how Europe rolls though.. anyway, I'd absolutely stay here again, and may make this the only hotel in Amsterdam I'll stay in in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet elegance”
Reviews.Author: alanbill16
Reviews.Content: Constructed out of several historical buildings on one of Amsterdam's most important and pleasant canals, this hotel provides an elegant stay, while feeling very much a part of the old city. The hotel is physically quirky, with lots of stairs and connectors between the old buildings. The rooms are all different. i have heard that some are quite small, but ours was a very pleasant size for a European hotel. The staff were absolutely wonderful, especially the coffee bar man who offered much of the city's color. I particularly liked the two courtyards on the ground level for morning coffee or an evening wine. The location is central but also quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A Tale Of 2 Hotels....So conflicted about how to rate this..”
Reviews.Author: ferndalemale
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into the hotel the room given was in the back of the hotel off of "Elevator B." It was rather small but not a problem as I've been to Amsterdam many times and anyone who has knows space is at a premium. That said, this is a "premium hotel" and it should be expected. That said, we paid for the most inexpensive rooms and that's what we got. This first room though small, was adequate, but had no view, only of a the other hallways and the elevator. Still, for what we paid, I was ok with this. The problem was the bathroom which was very tiny. The shower head attachment was broken so it would slide down to waist level. The shower curtain was not what I would call luxurious by any stretch. And then, in this particular room (don't remember the room number... 170 something?) there was an awful odor. I've read other reviews saying that they've smelled something similar. Having been to Amsterdam there is often this canal old water kind of smell from the drain and that's I think what this was. Luckily when I complained the upgraded us to a much better room and that is where the attached pictures are from. And that was a totally different experience. In the new room we had three windows overlooking the Prinsengracht canal. It was a large room with a luxurious bathroom and beamed ceilings and really just an incredible arrangement. I imagine that this room was not even close to our price range. Long story short, I've been to the city many times and if you are trying to book their most inexpensive room I would opt for renting an apartment or a houseboat, which won't have the service that this hotel has, but will have a larger more authentic feel. That said, if you can spend, this hotel is really quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjg87
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is a member of the Starwood Luxury Collection and it lives up to the name. Lodgings were first rate, staff was helpful and 100% English speaking, location is excellent, and the buffet breakfast is as good as it gets without an omelet station.

Reviews.Title: “Small - but luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: martandrews
Reviews.Content: I can definitely recommend the Pulitzer hotel in Amsterdam as it is in a central location of the city, providing luxurious rooms. It is quite pricy, but worth it. Designed in typical Starwood style (like Sheraton), and very clean and charming (it's in a very old building) it provides the perfect environment for a rather romantic vacation.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints but small room”
Reviews.Author: chelle10010
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was pleasant, and it had a great location. I didn't rate the service because I didn't really interact with anyone at the hotel. At least not enough to warrant a rating. Overall I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I only had one issue that I would like to bring up. We had an executive suite. The room was was cluttered and small. We really had no where to put our things comfortably. I am not one to nit-pick about things, but I felt that it was too small for a suite. I would have enjoyed my stay more if I could comfortably unpack my things. Perhaps the other rooms are better. We had an odd one off to the side that was by itself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: yhigashi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, clean, and in a decent location. However, the level of service was subpar compared to most other Starwood properties. I spoke with four people at the front desk regarding (check-in, my room, etc.) over the course of my stay and only the gentleman who checked us in was pleasant to speak with. The other ladies we dealt with were not at all eager to help us or even make us feel welcome. To make matters worse, one of the nights during our stay the hotel was hosting a private concert on the canal in front of the hotel. We weren't allowed to leave through the front door, unless we were with the private party so we had to walk through the restaurant and go through a back door in order to get in and out of the hotel. I felt really awkward walking through a maze of tables while people were eating their dinner every time I wanted to step out of the hotel. Since this event was going on during most of our stay at the hotel, and we were not with the private party, we certainly felt as if we were second class guests. Service is always the most important quality of a hotel to me, so next time Iâ€™m in Amsterdam I will choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel review”
Reviews.Author: sandybdagurl
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, friendly staff, great location. very nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, dead quiet, attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: alohomora713
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had stayed in Amsterdam before and chose a hotel that we ended up being unhappy with, so it was with trepidation that we chose the Pulitzer. We were incredibly delighted and relieved with our choice. The Pulitzer faces one of the canals, is on a quiet street and has a lovely spacious lobby. The staff greet you in a very Americanized smiley/happy way, which is something I love. Very genial and pleasant without any air of falseness about them. We were checked in very quickly. Whenever I check into a hotel I always request to be placed in a room on a high floor, as far away from the lift as possible and in a corner room if there's one available. This ensures you're going to get a quiet room, with little outdoor foot traffic and because it's on a corner might only share one wall with another hotel room. Sometimes this technique works, sometimes it doesn't. This time it most certainly did. Our room was accessed through several corridors, small stairs up and down, around a corner, up more stairs and then onto a small landing that we shared with only one other room across the hall. We never once heard any other guests. The room had incredibly high ceilings (for a top floor room) where the attic had been converted and broken through from the floor below, where our room was. It was airy and bright and felt very spacious. The bathroom was small and had a bath with a step-in shower, which I never like, but it was certainly adequate. Any staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Any of the room service staff that came to our room were gracious, smiley and polite. The concierge was very helpful and informative. The hotel is a stones throw from Anne Frank's house, so there are plenty of bars, restaurants and convenience stores around the corners. I found the price to be very reasonable, certainly not extortionate. I would have given this a 5 star review but for the bathroom. One last tip - we were able to access a wireless network from the surrounding area that didn't have a password so we could go online the entire time for free.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value: a very disappointing small, dark, viewless bedroom and tiny,smelly bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: weary2feet
Reviews.Content: A major draw of this hotel is its picturesque location and I was promised a view when booking, so I was very disappointed with my small, dark bedroom with its 'view' of corridors and the lift. The bathroom was tiny with just a shower - and it smelt of drains! There was no tea, coffee, biscuits etc, just one small bottle of mineral water and a minibar. For the approx Â£300 charged for the cramped room (excluding breakfast), this felt very mean. Also the maid disturbed me in the morning, way before check-out time. From descriptions, I expected the lobby and other public areas to have a charming, boutique-hotel decor and ambience. Unfortunately, the feel is much more anodyne, like an international/American hotel - but with low ceilings and a few beams. Also we had to wait a long time to check in and then weren't able to see the rooms. The only positive aspect was that the bed was comfortable and clean. Also the staff are quite efficient. However, this hotel thinks it's a lot better than it really is; it offers poor value.

Reviews.Title: “Best of breed - superior staff in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Happyfeet59
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in the last month,once with a friend and once with my spouse, both times for some R&R. on both occasions, I was thoroughly impressed by every aspect of the hotel. The rooms were HUGE for Europe, and VERy nicely appointed. The bathrooms were lovely, although on the small side - with the requisite robes and slippers. The public spaces were lovely - the hotel was created from some 20+ canal houses, and getting around is like a maze sometimes, which is very entertaining. I ate in the restaurant several times, both for breakfast and dinner. Seeing as how we had all of Amsterdam's culinary delights at our disposal, it's a testament to the restaurant that we chose to return a second time for dinner. The food was really good and exceeded my expectations. Check out the very interesting oil painting in the dining room - a talented modern day take off of a famous Frans Hal painting! Other amenties - my husband used the gym several times and seemed pleased. Loved the koffie candies at the front desk! And the garden patio is truly a peaceful oasis for spending a quiet afternoon reading in the sun. I'm saving the best for last, however. The service provided by the reception and most outstandingly by the concierges. One in particular, "Ron", went out fo his way to help us find restaurants and sights we would enjoy. He will be my gold standard, going forward, of what a truly excellent concierge should be like. I can't say enough about his service. I really enjoyed my stays here and look forward to getting back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice People, What's With The Early House Keeping”
Reviews.Author: phjodie
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel, and the staff were so very friendly and helpful. To keep this short, I agree with the positive comments that most people have written (also the location, superbly convenient) - the only problem is with the house keeping call. Each morning, I'd get a knock on my door just before 8am for house keeping. So early, especially on the weekend - who's up and out of their hotel room before 8am on a weekend? Other than that, though, beautiful hotel and a nice place to stay. No problems with the room size either, definitely heaps of space.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoundOttawa
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer is a series of old Amsterdam Canal Houses linked together - it makes for a very interesting and unusual hotel. The initial room we were given for three people was incredibly small. When I asked for something larger, the staff were quick to oblige. The Hotel is well located within walking distance of just about everything and anything you would want to see and do in Amsterdam including Canal Tours, Anne Frank House, etc. While the hotel was lovely, we didn't dare eat there as we found it very, very expensive. My husband and I made the mistake of having 2 glasses of wine each in the hotel bar and were presented with a bill for 48 Euros - our mistake as we should have checked the price first....but just a sample of just how pricey it is. Parking is also incredibly expensive - more than 50 Euros per night in the hotel parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stoneman99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer for 5 nights in May 2010 and couldn't have been happier. The location of the hotel seemed a bit away from "downtown" on the map - but in reality it is a 10 minute walk to the Dam Square. Even more, we liked the area that the hotel is in much better than the city center. Great restaurants within a block or two - Envy and Pancakes! (mmm poffertjes) were particular favorites. And we walked down to the Leidesplein on a couple of nights to catch live music - again, just about 10 minutes beautiful walk (or 3 minute bike ride) down the canal. Anne Frank house is 150 meters away - we kept checking the line until we got a chance to walk in one evening with absolutely no line and just 4 or 5 people inside. Great little neighborhood pubs just around the corner. And for strolling, nothing beats the Jordaan anyway -- just across the canal. Rooms were not huge, but nicely appointed and the staff was accommodating. Rooms were also very unique - not another generic hotel room. Ours had a huge high ceiling with large open beams and a huge window that swung wide open onto the canal - very cool. Nice to feel like you're in Amsterdam even when the door shuts to your room - and not be in another room that feels like a business trip! Bed was awesome, and may have cost me a couple grand in replacing our bed at home. It's become my wife's new Gold Standard for mattresses. Overall, we loved the feel of the hotel. It is a bit of a maze, but that really adds to the unique character of the hotel. It is really neat to look out the window of one of the famous canal houses and actually be staying in one! Pulitzer nicely combines the quaintness of a B&B with the privacy and amenities of a large hotel. I think they had a couple of trainees at the desk when we were there, so it wasn't a high point of the hotel experience - but all of the staff were very helpful if you stopped and asked them a question. Good travel advice from the concierge on getting to Brugge by train. The breakfast buffet is a bit pricey, but it was outstanding - try it at least one morning. Tip - rent bikes when you get there and park them in the front of the hotel for the duration of your trip. By far the best way to get around and just adds a great feel to the whole trip. We went into the rental shop around the corner (across from Westerkirk) and didn't get a great feel for the place as others were returning their bikes. We opted instead for Bike City on the Bloemgracht on the other side of the Prinzengracht a couple of blocks away toward Anne Frank house and they were very friendly and the bikes were great. Overall - we were very happy we chose to go to Amsterdam when we could have gone anywhere in Europe. Such a fun, beautiful and relaxing city - and you won't find a better home base than Pulitzer. ...only downside is the king's ransom they charge for internet access! Funny that all of the hotels that cost half or less than the Pulitzer include free internet, while all of the more expensive hotels charge an arm and a leg for it. Leaves a bad taste in your mouth when you're already spending quite a bit more for a nice room. Should be included. I know it's pure profit for them, but you shouldn't charge for it just because you can...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Location but a bit too nosiy”
Reviews.Author: kunster86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and the stay was average. The hotel was very large and the staff didn't mention all the features about the hotel when checking in. I'm platinum with Starwood but my room was on the 4th floor facing the street which made it extremely loud and noisy at night. The bathroom showers were really small if you are over 6'2 you might have a problem. The A/C is not the best system in the world, it took 10 hrs before the room was cool and it was 90 degrees outside.

Reviews.Title: “Bit noisy but otherwise a beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: Astroph
Reviews.Content: Room 105 I used a points redemption of 29k points for two nights in a executive canal room. I think the included breakfast and a somewhat larger room is worth paying the 14.5k vs the 12k a night, it's too bad they do not include free internet with the room for non-plat. The front desk wanted to give me a regular executive room and not one with a canal room, but after a little push they gave me one on the first floor. The first thing I noticed is how horrible the street noise was, especially from people walking by the room and vespas speeding by. The room was very beautiful and spacious. The road noise was not terrible after around 11pm. I had some other problems with the room. I've seen on here and tripadvisor comments about the water pressure, it is as weak as other people had mentioned. The is not much in the way of lighting in the bathroom and the electrical outlet was non-functional. The wireless internet was also a problem. The connection would drop out every 15 minutes, it seems to be provided by an outlet in the room near the desk. I contacted the desk several times and they provided me with a cat5 internet cord, but this did not solve the problem. They did not look into the problem any further. It took several emails to the hotel manager to get refunded the $43 for two days of internet. I was not very impressed with the staff in the lobby, but the manager that I contacted via email was very helpful. Otherwise the room was very comfortable and the free breakfast in the morning was great! They recommended a place called Orange Bikes http://www.orangebike.nl which was about two blocks away to rent a bike. This was a great way to get around town. The location of the hotel is not far from the center of the city or the museums. The bike was a much better way to go than taking the cabs with the shady cab drivers. I also suggest using the shuttle to and from the airport for under 25 euro round trip. http://www.schipholhotelshuttle.nl/s...sp?HotelID=346

Reviews.Title: “Charming historic hotel in perfect location for sight-seeing!”
Reviews.Author: WeightwatcherLdr
Reviews.Content: We loved this quirky hotel with its maze of stairs and elevators connecting the old town homes which used to be merchant's homes. Many of the rooms have canal views, although our faced the courtyard. It was small, but very comfortable with a true queen-sized bed, and air conditioning which was controlled in the room. They charged for use of the internet in the rooms, but if you went to their business center, it was free, so we were able to check our email and keep in touch with family back home. It is walking distance to many of the tourist sights, museums, and shopping areas. Virtually everyone who works there spoke impeccable English, which was very helpful in getting directions, booking restaurant reservations, advice for shopping, etc. Since it is a Sheraton, you get Starwood points if you happen to be a member. We were fortunate to be there during the World Cup and got to see how enthusiastic all the Amsterdam natives were in cheering for their team!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, but not good recommendations from the front desk”
Reviews.Author: jrubin50
Reviews.Content: Brilliant, beautiful, quiet hotel. I would definitely stay there again. The staff are lovely and the beds comfortable. Their recommendation for a bike rental place, however, turned out to be a disaster. DEFINITELY AVOID Amstel Rent a Bike opposite the big Wester Chuch (right out of the hotel, right at the next street). They are complete thieves ( specifically "Nina") who charge you for expensive unnecessary repairs to the bike you have just rented. The hotel charges you 15 euros per day for wi-fi in your room (can you believe that?) but at least the business center in the lobby has free wi-fi and a printer.

Reviews.Title: “Now your talking!”
Reviews.Author: CruiserDeluxe
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Pulitzer in Amsterdam. Very nice property. Extremely attentive staff made our short stay there memorable. From the moment we arrived we were pampered. The room we had was smallish by US standards but large by European. We did not eat in their restaurants but asked for recommendations. They mentioned an Italian restaurant around the corner which was a 10 by my standards. Their small canal cruiser is great and they had no issues with giving us direction after direction. Small luxury hotel it is!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ut4txt
Reviews.Content: The service in this Hotel is impeccable, the staff extremely helpful and friendly, the concierge is the best we ever found. Make sure you have enough cash to leave the tip he deserves. Great location, pretty much everything is within walking distance or you just take the boat that leaves close by. It is by far the best hotel experience we had in Amsterdam and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel - one large mistake changed my rating”
Reviews.Author: jaym1101
Reviews.Content: I was quite excited to be staying at the Hotel Pulitzer. It is in a great location of Amsterdam. Minutes from the Anne Frank House and a very vibrant part of the city. My overall rating was changed though when my girlfriend and I are about to go to bed the first night and we smelled a disgusting odor. It was an unforgettable smell. We realized that the blanket that was on the bed had not been changed from the previous guest or possibly previous guests. The hotel was quick to rectify the situation and compensated us with additional starwood points, but the damage had already been done. The beauty of the hotel and all of the other good things I mentioned still warrant a 3 star rating. This could have easily have been a 5 star stay in my book if not for this little mishap with the sheets :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: laKalandria
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of everything, walking distance or biking. Awesome view of a canal right from the exit. There are courtyards and paintings where you can relax and a cozy bar. Rooms are quite small but I guess that is the structure in the town. All in all this was not an issue. Front desk service is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in AMS. Needs Refurbishment Though”
Reviews.Author: choth21
Reviews.Content: This is an ok hotel. Europe is full of old hotels that rest a bit on their laurels and charge outrageous amounts for breakfast. The Hotel Pulitzer falls in that category. I guess I'm more of a modern type guy, but this hotel feels old. The furniture is old. The lobby is old. The bathroom is tiny. Also, my room was unbearably hot. But at least the bed is comfortable. Breakfast at 30 euros is way too much, especially when the breakfast buffet isn't all that great. There are lots of other options nearby that are much more pleasant. This hotel is in a very good location, which is the best thing about it. Next time I go to Amsterdam, I will choose to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel choice in Luxury market”
Reviews.Author: longtimetraveller16
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have made a better choice for our vacation spot in Amsterdam. Being Gold SPG members we were upgraded to a beatiful room on 2 levels. I will admit that if climbing stairs is a problem, this isn't the room, however, I understand there are many other amazing rooms. Every room is different. The space was perfect, the location on the ground floor near the reception area even better and the service was impecable. I had heard from previous reviews about the chimes of the church nearby. We weren't bothered by it at all. Furthermore, the room we had on the ground floor made for some noise infiltration from the street. (voices, laughter, cars etc). But because the hotel is on a small canal it's not a very heavily travelled street and these noises were mnimal. The service was great!! Nothing was too much trouble. The concierge was very helpful and dealt proffesionally ,informatively and friendly with each request. The breakfast was healthy and fresh with some lovely Dutch treats! We didn't have dinner at the hotel restaurant. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better; a block from The Anne Frank house, central and easy to get to anywhere. We walked the city very easily. The stores and boutiques and restaurants in the neighborhood were wonderful and abundant. I'm usually a very picky traveller and I happily give this hotel a 5 star rating!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett_o13
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i went to amsterdam to visit the city and to relax a few days. we like luxury hotels and that was what we were looking for when we booked the pulitzer. the hotel was "nice", but nothing near 5*. i cant even imagine how theyve ever been granted 5*. the room was very small with no views whatsoever, the bathroom tiny (for one person at a time), the tv outdated, the decoration and amenities mediocre, no turn-down service... the only thing that was 5* were the prices! we were disappointed, because we were expecting something entirely different... the hotel did not spoil our vacations though, because the location is great! the hotel is in a beautiful and very quiet part of the city, only a 5 minutes walk from the centre / dam square. something important to know for everybody: when you check in they ask you for a credit card to "get an authorization code" to cover possible extras in case you leave without paying. when we checked out we paid our minibar consumptions and city tax. nevertheless, a few days later back home i found out that they had actually charged my credit card for 200 â‚¬. i called the hotel, but the only response was that they did not charge the card and that i should not worry... i decided to send an email to the front desk manager, but received no reply whatsoever. we could not understand what was happening, as we had paid our extras and had already left... three weeks later the money was transferred back to my account, i guess they realized their mistake. to sum up i would say, go there if you can get a good offer, but dont pay the full price! dont expect a 5* luxury hotel or you will be disappointed. and be careful with your credit card! enjoy amsterdam, its a great city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: csch24
Reviews.Content: We did a Weekendtrip to Amsterdam and stayed in this fantastic hotel. The location directly at the channel (well, almost everything is at a channel) was great and we were actually overwhelmed by the city live. The drive was not that easy and I was happy when the porter took my car and parked it. Bikes are all over. The room was clean with all ameneties you expect. In case of the historical structure the room was not very light but it didnÂ´t matter that much because of the weather and the city we had to explore. The Concierge in the evening was a great help and we really want to say thank you for the information and help he gave us. Really a great experience and we love the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great people in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BHelf
Reviews.Content: We liked the Pulitzer very much and found both the staff and the location to be great. Rooms are, typical of European hotels, a bit on the small side but they are well appointed and enjoyable. It would be nice if the hotel provided free internet service but they do offer two computers and a printer for use for free in their business center. The daily breakfast buffet is absolutely excellent but expensive. This is where we would stay if we ever go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: UKonthego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and had a great stay there. The hotel is in a beautiful area, right on the canals and very close to the Anne Frank House. The room was spacious but nothing special. The bed was very comfortable and we slept very well. The staff at the hotel was very friendly; especially Adri van Sambeek, the duty manager who assisted us during our stay. He was very helpful and extremely pleasant! Also, the front desk agents were very welcoming and friendly. Overall, a good and pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful building”
Reviews.Author: Bettyboopy20
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a short trip in Amsterdam last week, stayed at the Pulitzer from Friday to Monday. We arrived Friday morning, there was a misunderstanding with the reservation. We booked from June 18 - 23 with request for early check in (pay additional E 50 only), but instead they booked us straight away from June 17 without telling us. Well, my boyfriend didn't want to argue, so we took the room. We went to the room and straight away he spotted the chair near the desk was dirty. So, on the way out, we asked the receptionist to inform house keeping. When we came back to the room, the chair was still dirty. We gave up. In general, the stay was pleasant, concierge was helpful especially the little lady with dark hair. She was very nice. We didn't try room service at all, as we always ate outside, so many good restaurants near the hotel. We got what we asked, which is the room with canal view. Location is great and quiet, I guess the part of the canal where the hotel is located is one of the best canal area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great beds, expensive internet, rude bartender”
Reviews.Author: saurin13
Reviews.Content: Location was great. Walked everywhere from the hotel - all over Amsterdam. Saw all major museums and cultural places. Nightlife and RLD minutes away as are many restaurants. Also a bunch of great shops are close by as well. I took the tram from the central amsterdam and it was basically 3 stops away. Superb location; I felt very safe walking around by myself at night! BTW The IAmsterdam card is well worth it. The bed was superbly comfortable and room was large (for Europe) with excellent shower. Very clean. However Internet was expensive at 20 Euro per day! The bartender in the hotel was very rude to me. I went in and had not decided what beer/drink I wanted yet and sat down in one of the chairs, watching the TV. The bar was empty at the time (maybe 4 other people in it). I noticed someone had left their bag at the bar. So I told the bartender that someone left their bag - and he told me "so! who cares and why do you care." I couldn't believe it! He then went on to tell me "Either order something or get out. You can sit in the hotel lobby if you don't want to spend money." I was pretty angry at his tone with me and I left the bar and complained at the front desk - they told me that his behavior was unacceptable, but no reparations were made or offered.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat emptor--not the Pulizter's problem if other guests ruin your stay”
Reviews.Author: Trumphodge
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Pulitzer; we liked the location and enjoyed our first experience. We were happy to pay a luxury price for a luxury experience. But on the first night (June 2) we were awoken about 11 pm by people entering the room above and making a good deal of noise as they apparently moved in, for about 45 minutes. It was irritating, but we understand that late arrivals occur. The wooden floors transmit footsteps, especially shoe-steps, to the room below much more than carpet would. (note the previous review) We got back to sleep after midnight. On the second evening, about 6 pm while we were relaxing before dinner, they came back to the room and were very noisy, both heavy continuous walking and argumentative talking. After 30 minutes, we were very concerned about the prospects for later in the night, so my husband went down to speak to the desk about getting a different room. No other room was offered, but security went up to tell them to be quiet--we could hear him at their door and then they were quiet. After coming back for dinner and going to sleep, we were awoken at 2 am by more loud noise. At 2:30 my husband went back down to the desk to request help. We could then hear the knock at their door to again tell them to be be quiet. This was nearly 3 am. They were quiet then, but we did not get back to sleep and had to be up before 6 in order to eat and make our plane. So both of our nights' sleep were interrupted, the second ruined, by this repeated noise. The only compensation we were offered was waiver of the 19 euro (rip-off) internet fee. So I asked to be contacted by the manager. His email: "Of course it is not good to read that you have had some inconvenience during your stay. I did some research myself about your complaint. The guest above you gave the hotel in general a lot of trouble. It is not an excuse from our side but only that you are aware what happened and that this is an exceptional and unfortunate incident. I do have to say that indeed the wooden floors give somewhat more noise than carpet but this was a situation we almost never experience. On a next visit we will give you a nice upgrade. Also I will give you 5000 SPG points." My response: You acknowledge that the wooden floors are noisy and that the guests above us created other problems. Your offer is for a future upgrade and hotel points that are worth about 1/3 of one night's stay at your hotel. We paid 689 euros for these two nights, both of which our sleep was interrupted or ended. $848. His response: "From your reply I get the impression you feel offended by the email I send you. This was however never the intention of my email. The reason why we do not give you back a full night complementary is because the inconvenience is not directly caused by the hotel. Another guest has made the disturbance and we as a hotel took our responsibility and took action where needed. As we do appreciate your feed-back and are sorry that your stay was not up to your expectation due to the noise disturbance, we would like to offer you 8000 SPG points for the inconvenience caused including a free upgrade on your next visit. We do feel this a very reasonable gesture on our side." Starwood replied, when contacted by us, that the hotel had responded sufficiently. So if you get lucky in your neighbors you may have a fine stay. But tough luck if your neighbors are ACKNOWLEDGED problem types--apparently you're expected to make them be quiet on your own.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the hotel, despite its downsides....”
Reviews.Author: tracyk45
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have noted, the Pulitzer's location is superb! Our room had a canal view, and from the 4th floor perch we could watch the city go by on the water. The fact that several row houses were put together gives the hotel a very different structure and meant going up/down short flights of stairs to get to our room. Not a burden, unless one was dragging suitcases. The biggest drawback was the closet space. Two women beginning a month-long vacation...and about 12 inchoes of usable space for hanging clothes! We asked for and got -- after a full day of waiting -- a rolling rack for clothes which helped a lot. Also, the floors are wooden which is fine except when we had an apparent army of kids above us jumping, running, banging well into the night. A complaint didn't work until several calls were made...finally silence. The concierge staff, however, we really good and very helpful with recommendations for restaurants, etc. Also free Internet/use of PC in the lobby business center which was great. Breakfast in the restaurant was nice, if unremarkable. I would stay here again because of general pluses...perhaps bringing fewer clothes!

Reviews.Title: “This is Amsterdam - and not in any other hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ewout
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam - if you want to experience it as any local would love to? Then you'll need to book a room in the Pulitzer. I lived five years as a student in Amsterdam and was never able to live in the city center, as rent was just unaffordable. And now I was able to stay in a hotel as pure as the Pulitzer - with it's charm of searching for your hotel room for 10 minutes! I haven't had a laugh for ages! Step up, step down - corridor in - walk over the roof in between two canal houses - steps up, there was my room! Amazing! I hope that next investment will be a nice nespresso coffeemachine for the rooms and a cd in the Bose clockradio with more than one song (?) and than it's my dream hotel... Waking up with the Westerkerk' clocks is just amazing! If you want to experience Amsterdam this is your hotel - I'll not give you more hints... My final request to the hotel: STOP greeting every guest in English. I am in The Netherlands and I speak Dutch! Why can't we greet all the guests in dutch, so that they can experience Amsterdam a bit better? We are in The Netherlands, right?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel indeed!”
Reviews.Author: Marumbi
Reviews.Content: We were in Amsterdam for a few days during our Europe trip, then we went to Paris. So we've chosed Pulitzer as it as located in the city center. No idea about other Amsterdam hotels, but this one has a perfect Dutch sence and character. Composed from 25 or 27 typical old Dutch housed Pulitzer is a true labyrinth, with a lovely yard. First time we needed about half an hour to find our room after check-in, as there are few lifts marked with different letters... But at other times it was like a sport, or game, who first would find its room :-) Also we enjoyed their breakfast with a fancy picture in the wall. Meals were great.

Reviews.Title: “Look for cheaper alternatives”
Reviews.Author: callycem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Pulitzer, which was nice, but ungodly expensive. The restaurant and bar are very nice - friendly service - good food (deep dish apple pie!). The gym is small, but functional - free water and fruit! That is another nice perk, the free water left in the room. The staff was very friendly and there's free internet on the computer in the lobby. It's a maze of corridors though as it was originally a bunch of different residencies. After walking around, we realized that there maybe wasnâ€™t such a leap from hostel to upscale like our travel agent had said - there were many nice looking hotels around (at least from the outside). There was a cute place down by the park. Stay away from the strip from Dam Square to Central Station, at least for now. It was owned by the mob and the city is in the process of re-claiming it - those hotels looked mighty sketchy. I have friends who stayed in a hostel there and got evicted!

Reviews.Title: “Not as luxurious as luxury collection designation would suggest”
Reviews.Author: luxlovernyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Pulitzer and there are some great things about it and some no-so-great things. Pros: Fabulous location. Best part of the city -- pretty and easy to get everywhere. Lovely views of canals. Public space is lovely and the garden looked wonderful although weather wasn't conducive to using it while we were there. A good coffe and breakfast bar in the lobby was more reasonably priced than regular breakfast and had good coffee and croissants. The service was helpful and polite, although we were told on arrival (very early in the AM) that we would be upgraded to an executive for a small upcharge and later were told "someone had made a mistake." Since we were staying for points, I could hardly object. Cons: The room decor. While the size of the room was ok, the furniture was both unattractive and odd; heavy wood of no discernable style (looking a bit long in the tooth) and as someone else noted placed oddly (probably cause of configuration of the old canal houses) making it hard to put suitcases down, etc. The bed was great, as is typical at all Starwoods, but the only chair in the room -- an odd yellowish velour -- had a huge stain. All in all, if I had been paying the going rate for this deluxe room, I would have been disappointed. With some refurbishment, these rooms could be really charming. As it is, the hotel is lovely but the rooms (other than the bed) disappointing. Still, I might still recommend it on location and service along, so long as someone went in knowing the room situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for European Standards”
Reviews.Author: marasis111
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam as part of a 10-day trip in The Netherlands and Spain and we had a very pleasurable experience at this hotel. The city of Amsterdam overall is a very walkable city and the Pulitzer fits into that description very well as it is conveniently located and on a charming canal. The room was on the smallish side, but we found that to be the case throughout Europe and I think this is more of the European standard. We had a courtyard view which was just fine, obviously a canal view would be an upgrade and more stunning. Overall it was clean and the staff was pleasant. The shower in our room was of the bathtub variety and we did find it to be a bit narrow - that would be our only complaint. We booked this hotel with points, as my spouse and I are both Starwood GOLD members. We are typically offered a free upgrade as a Starwood member of this level, but were not at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “appalling service in restaurant 238”
Reviews.Author: bmwlya1
Reviews.Content: Booked a three night stay for the wife's 40th birthday and subsequently booked a reservation in the hotel's restaurant -238 - for 8pm on the 20 May 10 Arrived at the reception desk at the restaurant at 8pm , no one present, waited 10 mins and decided to complain at the front reception. Went back to the restaurant at 8.20 pm still found an abandoned reception desk. After a further 8 mins another couple joined the "queue" and a passsing waiter showed us to a table where we sat for a further 13 mins without any attention. Left the restaurant disgusted Overall the hotel was fine , good duty manager and friendly front of house staff. room was also first class. The prices however at 19 euros a day for wi fi and 27 euros for breakfast are outrageous given that free wifi is available just outside the hotel The restaurant however and its staff let the hotel down badly

Reviews.Title: “Big thumbs up - the best hotel of this trip”
Reviews.Author: walkdaearth
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two week trip through London - Paris - Amsterdam. Pulitzer was the highlight of the trip. Stayed at all cat 5 or 6 Starwood properties the whole trip, and Pulitzer wins the prize. Why? 1) The location is amazing. Amsterdam is a small city, to be sure, very walkable, etc. But this location is on the prettiest stretch of the canal ring, facing both Prinsengracht and Keisergracht canals, a block away from Anne Frank haus, adjacent to Jordaan neighborhood to the west and The Nine Streets shopping district to the south. 2) The concept of taking 25 canal houses, and attaching them altogether to get one hotel is great, and it's done very well. It's interesting - the floors don't exactly match up from one house to the other, so there are these interesting split level-ish stairs as you transition from one building to the next, but all of it adds to its character and is done well, not just "duct-taped together" 3) Nicely furnished, good amenities - probably the best hotel bed I have ever slept on. And I've slept on LOTS, as I travel tons for work, and then I travel some more for pleasure. Nice modern furnishings, lamps, chairs, etc. Clean bathrooms with good robes, good toiletries. The usual understandable things like slightly slower drain, etc. But you know what? I've stayed in plenty of expensive places where the shower drain was slow and they did not clean up after it, which is what makes it gross. This place, not so - the tub was spotless and shiny clean each day. 4) Canal views are wonderful, but I got a courtyard view this time and it overlooked the garden - very quiet, very nice. 5) It's clean. I can't tell you how important that is. Nothing is more frustrating than experiencing that "ick" factor from dirty corners or stained bedskirts etc etc when you stay in what is supposed to be a top-notch place (see my review of Prince de Galles) 6) It just works. When you come "home" to the Pulitzer after a long day of walking around, it is clean, it is peaceful, it is nice, and you're happy and relieved to be there. It's not superfluous or overly ornate or overly "done up" - it's just luxurious enough to be comfortable, nothing more. I had a Deluxe room (290). Big, plenty of space. Could not hear the neighbors. 7) The breakfast was included in my rate (I think due to SPG platinum status) and was very good. Croissants, oh the croissants... 8) Internet was likewise included for me because of the SPG status, but can understand how it would be expensive if you had to pay For me a big thumbs up, would highly recommend, would go back in a heartbeat. And I plan to!

Reviews.Title: “Talk About A Room With A View!”
Reviews.Author: ATL_Travel_Guy
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here on recent trip, upgraded to a canal-front room, which was quite a large room with beamed ceilings, and a view that had the "WOW" factor. After our small room in Paris, this room was quite spacious with 3 sets of double windows. Thought the location of this hotel was just perfect for exploring Amsterdam's sites. Easy walk to everything, but not right in the middle of everything and not the least bit noisy. It was fun meandering through the hotel, seeing the art gallery, and center courtyard was quite pretty. Had breakfast in the hotel both mornings, and while certainly not a bargain, found everything very well prepared and suited our needs for both days.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: RalphRob
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. I found the staff to be great and helpful. With a hello and smile and able to recommend and direct me to where I wanted to go. Beautiful court yard and comfortable quite room. Great location and I will definately will be staying there again. I wish I was there now.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, interesting space, POOR service!”
Reviews.Author: Denali92
Reviews.Content: I used to love this hotel, but the service was really poor, and in the end we had a very disappointing stay. There were not enough front desk staff and their knowledge of Amsterdam was surprisingly poor. A real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property...Good Service...Some Rooms Better Than Others”
Reviews.Author: pachelad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer from April 15-16, then again from April 22-24. We had the unique experience of checking-in twice and using two different rooms. First, the property is a very beautiful location in the "Nine Streets" area of the Western Canal Belt. It provides really easy foot access to Dam Square, Leidsplein, Museumplein and the Jordaan. The location could not be any better. Arriving from the US, we knew we might have to wait to check-into the hotel. The front desk was very pleasant in terms of communication and service. We just wish we could have checked-in earlier. However, this seems to be de rigeur for most European properties. To add to their woes, the Icelandic volcano had erupted, so guests were probably hesitant to check-out. The first room that we had was wonderful. It was wonderful and faced the courtyard below. Though it was small, it had a very pleasant layout and a charming bathroom. Blackout curtains lined the windows. We slept very well with no interruptions whatsoever. The room type we booked was "Executive". This was an amazing kickoff to our stay in Amsterdam. By the way, try Cafe Duende in the Jordaan for authentic Spanish tapas. It was delicous and priced well. Very happening scene for all ages. In addition, you should book a room rate at the Pulitzer that includes breakfast. The breakfast buffet selection is nothing short of amazing, the staff is friendly, and the setting is charming. On our return to Amsterdam, we checked in again. We were quickly given the key to our room. This room was a little different from the first. This room was very large. It had beautiful architectural details with beams that lined the A-frame ceiling of the canal house. All this beauty comes with a price. Unlike the first room, this room was not as well insulated. We could hear the houskeeping singing while cleaning the next room as well as the antics from another couple in the room next door. To add to this, the room was close to the bell tower of the church. Stunning beauty that requried earplugs. Overall, this hotel's location and staff were truly amazing. The room quality varies from one room to another. We saw many couples changing rooms in the morning. I would like to call out a person that made our stay incredible. Marleene, a front desk manager, made our stay amazing. The personal touch and her friendliness really came through. She is excellent at her job and made our stay far beyond our expecations. Sometimes, hotels managed by a large chain can be impersonal. Marleene made a boutique hotel managed by Starwood feel like a true boutique hotel. Congratulations! Hopefully we will see you at a Four Seasons sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor even for a cheap hotel - at these rates very bad”
Reviews.Author: Chiswicktraveller
Reviews.Content: Despite their 3pm check-in time our room wasn't ready until 4.30. Reception desk were unhelpful and only grudgingly provided coffee and water whilst we waited. Although the building from the outside is a traditional amsterdam canal house the room was designed t eliminate all character and make you feel like you are in an executive box anywhere in the world. Even worse, the external floodlights shone straight into the room and there was no blackout. All in all, very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a self described luxury hotel.”
