Reviews.Author: calilregit
Reviews.Content: We just returned to the states after being away the better part of three weeks. The last three nights we stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer. Alas, both my wife and I found the hotel, especially the service, disappointing. The quality of the food and its preparation was also lacking. We stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vier Jahreszeiten in Hamburg before arriving in Amsterdam and the contrast between the two was striking. The staff is very friendly at the Pulitzer but talk is not the same as service. Despite having a room overlooking the canal (which seemed to be a hot commodity), the accommodations were second rate. The common area had some enjoyable settings (the breakfast restaurant and the courtyard) but based on our experience the hotel has little to offer other than an outstanding location to use as a base to explore Amsterdam. Everythingâ€™s relative, and this was our only stay in Amsterdam, so I donâ€™t know what other hotels in the city have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Super Unique Hotel Experience-- Great Location- away from Redlight”
Reviews.Author: Katieorange
Reviews.Content: This is one of my Favorite and most unique hotels that Iâ€™ve stayed at. The Hotel Pulitzer is so fantastic. Its in a perfect location, right on around the corner from Anne Frank Haus. The hotel is made out of something like 28 houses that have had the walls in-between removed to connect the hotel. The inner courtyard is covered by gazebo like glass tunnels that wind and turn up and down connecting many different buildings so that you feel like you are in a fun labyrinth with a different dozens of different staircases that lead to different buildings-- a â€œAmsterdam inducedâ€� experience through the hallways is â€œhighlyâ€� recommended. There is an art gallery in the lobby, the bar is very cozy with couches. Rooms are small, but so is everything in Amsterdam. Super interesting hotel that you shouldnâ€™t miss out on.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: kingsubbu
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel towards the end of March. We had 2 separate stays booked - the first for one night and the second for 2 nights...for two nights in between, we made a quick trip to Brussels and stayed there for two nights at the LM Brussels. Overall, we had a great experience and cannot wait to return! We landed for our first stay fairly early (around 9am) - I had been in touch with the hotel early on to check about early check-in and was advised that they would try their best to ensure a room. They also mentioned that they would charge a fee of 50 Euro if the room were to be ready before 9am (which I was fine with). The hotel had pre-upgraded us to an Exec Canal room (the standard Plat upgrade) but that room was not ready upon check in. We were given a choice of waiting for a couple of hours in order to check in to the upgraded room or check in to a regular room...given that we had just come off a 9hour flight, we decided to check in to the regular room. The room was comfortable but quite small - we were too tired in any case and just spent the day resting. We checked out the next day to go to Brussels and came back two days later to check in. The hotel had pre-upgraded us once more and gave us a choice between a Junior suite and an Exec Canal view room. The Junior suite was very quaint and we loved it, but unfortunately the beams were a little too low for us (we are both 6 ft. tall). We decided to take the Exec Canal view room which was terrific - spacious, luxurious with a fantastic view on the Prinsengracht side (See pics). We had no issues with noise as reported in some earlier posts. The hotel treats SPG Platinum guests very well - the Plat rooms are definitely a great upgrade from the regular room (MUCH more spacious and a much better view). The free breakfast provided to Plats is a nice touch - the buffet spread was great, and comes with made-to-order omelets which were superb. The internet connection was fast and worked without any problems - when we checked out, they had added the breakfast and the internet bills to our folio by mistake but readily removed them on being reminded that I was a Platinum guest. Each room also has 2 bottles of complimentary bottled water. The hotel itself is simply gorgeous- very traditional with a great location right in the heart of the Jordaan neighborhood. The rooms are fairly luxuriously appointed and were on par with other luxury properties we have stayed at (for some strange reason, the toilet paper resembled those found at airports - hope they replace it with paper of better quality). The beds at the Pulitzer have to be hands down the best beds we have ever slept in...we love the Westin and W beds but these beds blew all those out of the water. We had a really tough time waking up each morning! The hotel has a maze like interior which we had fun exploring. There are multiple wings and stairs but there are ample signs everywhere. Some of the steps were quite steep (see pics below) but we used the elevators for the most part. Overall, it never really felt like we were at a chain hotel...we felt more like being inside a house (and I mean this in a positive sense) - having access to such unique properties is one of the reasons why we continue to remain loyal to SPG . There are tons of great cafes within walking distance (Vyne, a wine bar next to the hotel was especially superb - great for dates ). There are also some good ethnic restaurants - Poorna (Indian) and Sampurna (Indonesian) both had great food and an upscale ambiance. We did not really try the restaurant at the hotel except for breakfast. The staff were exceptional - right from the front desk to the waiters at the restaurant. Everyone spoke flawless English and seemed eager to help. Unfortunately, the hotel no longer offers a local gift as a choice for Plat amenity...they did offer some cookies instead of the points and we took the points one time and the cookies the next. The hotel also runs its own 10-seater boat (the explorer) and we took a tour of the canals on it one evening...a fun experience (38 Euro each). Overall, we were very happy with our stay - I had booked this on a Cash & Points rate of $90 + 4800 Starpoints a day...and the cash rate was well in excess of 250Eur for each of those nights for the most basic room. At these rates, it was definitely great value for money...Amsterdam is a lovely city and staying at the Pulitzer made our trip even more memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Dennistravels
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Starwood hotels for a few years now after taking advantage of the Starwood Points program. The Pulitzer Hotel is in the luxury line of hotels that Starwood owns and has its own charm and personality. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location close to the tram line, shops, cafes, restaurants, etc. Getting to the hotel is very easy via public transport â€“ once at Centraal Station, exit onto the street and take tram 17 or 13. One hour on the tram is 2.60 Euros, or you can purchase a 24 hour pass for 7 Euros (good value if you are planning on travelling around the city). Approx three stops from Centraal station and the hotel is within walking distance of the stop (look for the big green flags). The hotel had scaffolding on the outside but there was no active renovations taking place in the interior. We arrived early in the day but the hotel managed to get our room ready in two hours and kept our bags for us while we explored. Staff were very pleasant and attentive to our questions and requests. The room itself was cozy â€“ hardwood floors, comfy king sized bed, in-room safe and mini-bar. The bathroom was quite spacious given that we were in a European hotel room. We were given a gift when we got to our room of a blue delft tile with typical canal houses and the Pulitzerâ€™s address on it. A very nice token from our stay at the hotel. There is a business centre with two computers and free internet for a limited time period. There is also one more computer in the lobby area for guestâ€™s use. The concierge keeps tickets for both the Van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum. If you are interested in attending either of these places, purchase your tickets in advance from the hotel concierge. When you arrive at the museums, you are able to skip the line with tickets in advance. We skipped both lines which would have been at least a 1 hour wait without our pre-purchased tickets. We also purchased tickets online for other city attractions at the business centre and printed them off prior to going. The only downside of the hotel is that we must have had a family staying in the room above us â€“ given the age of the building and the hardwood that each room has, we could hear EVERY movement the family made at various times throughout our stay anytime they were there. We didnâ€™t feel it was worth it to request a move since we werenâ€™t staying much longer, so the hotel may have done something if we had mentioned it. Overall, a lovely stay â€“ great location, clean hotel, comfortable bed. When in Amsterdam, you wonâ€™t want to spend too much time in your room anyway, there is just too much to see and do!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - not sure it is worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Rubster
Reviews.Content: I am on the fence about the value in this hotel. Great location and staff. The bar is very nice and the gym adequate. We had a canal-view room but the view of the 70's building across the way is not particularly interesting. The ground floor garden rooms might actually be a better value as the garden is quite pleasant and it gets some sun. They charge a ridiculous rate for WI-FI which should be free at this point in any hotel. And our bathroom could use a redo.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: gone_tripping
Reviews.Content: I was afraid of being disappointed after having read some of the reviews on your site. Simply cannot understand why people were so critical. We were utterly impressed and satisfied with everything. We were upgraded to a deluxe canal view room in honor of our anniversary. The breakfast - thankfully included in our excellent room rate (1800 hotels) - was fabulous and the atmosphere so relaxing. ( The only criticism we have is that the bacon was funny smelling.) A great way to start a day of siteseeing in such an atmospheric neighborhood of Amsterdam. The reception staff were pleasant and always friendly and helpful. We could find no fault with anything at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect of a Starwood Hotel, albeit expensive for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: robski_korsikoff
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. Check-in experience was smooth and quick, whilst my room was a good size and the bed very comfortable. The in-room entertainment was excellent, with numerous TV channels in many languages and many radio stations and film options. Just one criticism - my bathroom was very small. The shower was in the bath and very limited floor space. The standard of fittings was high, but the space did rather let it down. The breakfast was good - lots of fresh fruit and cereal/bread choices too. There was a hot buffet offering, although I did not try this. Location is good - close to the centre, and on a canal. For a business guest, this was an excellent choice. It does seem to be very expensive for Amsterdam though. Try and get some deals on the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: carlParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a we, and had a very good time. Our room was on the top floor overlooking the canals and very romantic. Parking is a problem and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not really "luxury". We had a nice room but the other rooms they showed us were small”
Reviews.Author: FoodWineFunSF
Reviews.Content: I was happy with our room but I think we may have had one of the larger rooms. The first two rooms they showed us were tiny with dingy carpets but with nice furniture. I was expecting something luxurious but the lobby was absolutely unimpressive and when they took us to show us the halls seemed dirty and old and not in a charming way. They did give us a modern, loft room which was great , room 105. It had a nice view from the bedroom of the gracht. We loved it but not for older people. The bathtub was a hazard. It sloped right where you need to stand to get out and the step down was about 4 -5 inches lower than you'd expect with nothing to hold on to if you slipped so if felt very dangerous. It was also next to impossible to get the water temperature right. It could get scalding hot which added to the precariousness of taking a shower. They had chain hotel shampoo, soap, lotions, etc. in other words, nothing special. The steps to the loft were narrow and very steep. After staying three nights we asked to stay another night but they said we'd have to book it online. I never have been to a hotel where the reception couldn't book you a room. We went online and the prices were over $400 /night (we paid about $230/night). I would have been really disappointed had a paid the rates posted online. It wasn't a hotel of this caliber. We moved to a lovely room at the Hotel Esterea for 119 Euro /night. The staff was professional. I would recommend this hotel if you get the right room at the right rate but not for over $230/night.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: sorjue
Reviews.Content: We added Amsterdam to our honeymoon at the last minute as we couldn't find a cheap way to add Spain or other countries. Best add ever. My wife's dad works for Starwood so we got this hotel at an amazing rate ($100US) per night but I would have paid full price and still be this happy. Firstly, the staff is so incredibly nice. Every single person was always smiling and so friendly. The room was absolutely gorgeous. It was huge with wood floors. The bed was so comfortable. There's free internet in the business centre which was nice as I was away for 3 weeks so didn't bring my laptop. The food in the restaurant was great but the staff was even friendlier. The first night we ate at the restaurant proper and my wife had their 3 course lobster based dinner (even the dessert has lobster in it) and I had ala carte and it was delicious. The staff was so nice and chatted with us and we even got a bonus appetizer for free. The 2nd night we decided to be cheap and so we went to the bar to get cheap burgers or the like and the bartender/waiter asked us if we were hungry. So he said... "no problem, don't order the burger, I'm going to give you the Surprise special. Do you want meat or fish?". We chose one of each. We said we were being cheap (but we had a Starhot card that gave us 50% off food) and he said "don't worry, I like you, you look like a nice couple and I'm going to take care of you". First thing he asked us was what kind of drink we wanted. We said we don't really drink alcohol as we don't like the strong taste. He said no problem. He came back with a drink that had a bit of alcohol but tasted amazing (and I hate the taste of alcohol). I think it had champagne in it. We didn't know what to expect and then the appetizer came out. We both had the same one and it was this king crab meat wrapped inside a piece of fish. It tasted amazing. The entree's came out and we were blown away. The meat plate had basically one of every type of meat offered in the regular restaurant menu and the fish plate had the same, every type of seafood. It was so good and so well made. Finally dessert. He brought out this huge platter that had one of every dessert on the menu. I think there were 8 different desserts on there. We were so stuffed at the end but we were afraid of the bill. It came out to 60 euro total so for us it was only 30 euro for 2 and he didn't even charge us for the alcohol! The amount of food we got would have cost over 200 Euro easily if we ordered it from the restaurant. Even at 60 euro I would have gladly paid double that for the food and service. Everything about this hotel is so memorable that it is one hotel I want to go back to even if I have to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and style in a chic setting”
Reviews.Author: Reddevils73
Reviews.Content: I took my partner there for a surprise romantic weekend. It did not disappoint. The bed was supremely comfortable in the deluxe room, and the TV had hundreds of channels so if you did not want to venture out, there's a vast selection on TV to keep you entertained, aside from the usual BBC World Service! Breakfast was included and was scrumptious. The pastries melted in your mouth and there was an incredible selection including fruits, cheeses and hot cooked breakfast. Service was impeccable and there was no hard sell. Close to all the sights and was a very romantic setting for a valentines rendez vous. I would highly recommend this hotel and cannot believe it is not higher on the trip advisor ratings. It must be due to the costs as it is quite expensive but worth it. Go on treat yourself today! Oh and check out the art gallery in the hotel, some amazing canvasses to daze at and if you like a smoke there are some beautiful courtyard gardens to mooch around in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service, perfect location for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: asiatravelmonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend in Feb 2010, and it was an excellent base for shopping and seeing the sites of Amsterdam. The hotel is charming, if a little quirky - the merged townhouses that make up the hotel can make it quite easy to get lost on your way to your room at times (!) but add to the hotel's character. Though a bit pricey, it delivers. The staff were extremely helpful yet unobstrusive and I received a free upgrade to a canal view room. The room was a good size (by european standards) with excellent facilities and comfy beds. The gym is a plus, as few hotels seem to have them here - it's small but sufficient. I only ordered room service twice, but the food was excellent and fast to be delivered. The location is also ideal - high end and trendy boutiques, the city's oldest shopping center, the major tourist attractions and a slew of great restaurants and bars are all within walking distance. The hotel is also about a 10 minute cab ride from the train station. The only downside was how extortionately expensive the internet access was - 35 euro per day!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Atlanticist79
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel that is made up of a collection of townhouses connected by walkways through a courtyard. We were 3 individuals and the staff were very kind in accommodating us in a room that could very comfortably fit a rollaway bed. Service is top notch; the room beds and the rollaway were very comfortable; and the location unbeatable. I've stayed here both for business and for pleasure over the years and would highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “No where better to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: spikeynorman
Reviews.Content: Have been to the Pulitzer many times over past few years and though there are cheaper hotels (have stayed in a number of these) the Pulitzers location in the Jordaan,the friengly staff and lovely rooms will make it number 1 choice of where I will stay in Amsterdam each time. I will definitely be booking to go again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: cruisingthew0rld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer the weekend before Christmas, when Amsterdam changed into winter wonderland. There was lots of snow and the gardens of the hotel looked like in a fairy tale. We thouroughly enjoyed the warmth of the rooms with the wooden beams. Service was discrete but there when needed and the cosy restaurant served us a really nice dinner.

Reviews.Title: “bed bites”
Reviews.Author: Mosvold
Reviews.Content: Family stay in Amsterdam for a weekend. A few of my family members got severely bitten my bed bugs, or other insects during the night. Picture proofs submitted to hotel. Hotel deny responsibilities and refuse compensation (except a bad of candy on checking out of the hotel) Will I use them Again â€“ NO

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: ocarrollm
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is a fine hotel. The rooms are exceptionally comfortable, modern, clean and well equiped. They are however a little small. We booked with 1800hotels and the deal we got indicated breakfast was not included. We were delighted to find on arrival that it was!! We were there for the New Years Even period and breakfast was served until twelve which is a nice touch. Having said that the breakfast room was decidedly chaotic and the buffet was running out of everything, probably due to all the light night revellers turning up at the same time!! I always find Amsterdam hotels are a little over priced, particulary the ones in good locations, and the Pulitzer is no exception but reletive to other hotels the price stood up well. I love this area of Amsterdam, much nicer than the city centre. Loads of restuarants bars, cafes etc are within a short walk of the Hotel along the beautful canals. All said a tumbs up for the Pulitzer

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Hoyamd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated just few blocks away from everywhere you want to be. The rooms are so nicely decorated. We had a view of the inside courtyard and were very comfortable. The service was amazing and everyone was so friendly. We had breakfast buffet and my wife and I loved it. Would highly recommend this hotel as launch point for exploring amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: NfromTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed the the Hotel Pulitzer for two nights at the end of December and loved it! The location is great, the hotel is beautiful, the room was larger than average and tastefully decorated, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was lovely, and the guest services are superb. We traveled with a sick toddler and the staff was very friendly and helpful. In comparison to other Starwood hotels in its class, we found the Hotel Pulitzer to exceed our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant, memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: marcopolotoronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights and absolutely loved it! It was quick and friendly, close to everything. Situated in a quiet, picturesque area, with beautiful traditional rooms, this was one of the best stays in our European tour in the summer of 2009. I would definitely stay there again next time I visit Amsterdam. Parking is a bit of a pain but this is a general rule in the city, the valet parking is the only way to go at this hotel and a bit in the expensive side of things. In this light I would recommend visiting the city without the hassle of driving a car.

Reviews.Title: “A very good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: marcougolini
Reviews.Content: A very expensive and luxurious hotel. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Large Room”
Reviews.Author: livingitlarge
Reviews.Content: We're Platinum Starwood members and got upgraded to an Executive Room on the 3rd floor with no view, but the room was lovely and large with a raked ceiling. In typical European style, it had two single beds pushed together, each with their own bed linen. We found out on the canal cruise we did that the hotel was created from 32 canal houses knocked together, so it's on VERY many levels which might not be suitable for people who aren't good with stairs. Our room was around so many twists and turns that I felt like I needed to leave a trail of string behind me to find it again. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on that. The concierge sells international papers each day (fabulous), and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The location is great, just down the road from Anne Frank House (a must visit) and canal boats leave from docks up and down the canal outside. We walked from the central railway station to the hotel, but only had a light bag. We had breakfast at Sarahs Pancake house (turn right outside the hotel, then the next right onto the main street and walk a few hundred metres) and it was great. Have the bacon as a side, glorious. The ginger bread that comes with your coffee is amazing and the staff are friendly and speak good English.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - not sure why it's a Luxury Collection”
Reviews.Author: Qflyer
Reviews.Content: To be honest, this is the first Luxury Collection I've stayed in - and don't quite know what makes it one. It's got a lot of character - in terms of inter-connected houses making up the hotel. But the rooms are small-ish, amenities average and service reasonable, not great. I would probably stay here again, but only if I could get a really good package (e.g. including breakfast). Otherwise, it's nothing to go out of my way to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here.”
Reviews.Author: JudithRenee
Reviews.Content: I am a gold Starwood member and I usually love this brand of hotel. However, the Pulitzer was a huge disappointment. This was surprising because I had stayed in the Pulitzer about a year ago and liked it well enough to revisit. This time it was not so nice. I was charged 50 Euro for local phone calls which totaled about 20 minutes. When I checked out I was stunned by the price and asked for the manager who told me basically too bad so sad. She said there was a notice in the room and therefore I had to pay. Funny, I never saw the notice and I can tell you that I certainly would have used my cell phone if I had. It would have been much cheaper for me to roam on my cell than use the land line. But really what ticked me off was the attitude of the manager, my husband and I spend a lot of money at Starwood and I really didn't appreciate her nastiness. Especially her sarcastic "is there anything else I can help you with" after I paid the bill. While paying an outrageous phone bill was what tipped me over the edge, there were other things that were unsatisfactory. Everyday I was there I had to get my keys recoded as they didn't work. Housekeeping doesn't clean under the beds - which is really disgusting when you drop something and it rolls under the bed. It also looks like they don't change out the bed skirts which was obvious when I had to lift it up to get the item that rolled under the bed. It looked like ketchup or blood had splatted down the side. And as I didn't dump anything down the side of the bed I can only assume it had been there for a while. I can only say I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Bed, Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: YoyoMar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Cash & Points from SPG with 4800 points and $90 per night. (very good value in my optinion!) We tried to take a cab to the hotel from the train station, but because of a marathon that day, cars were not allowed to go on the streets. That said, we easily hopped on the 17 tram and it took us 1/2 block from the hotel. Hotel is a cute and right on the canal. Room and Bathroom were both good size. The bed was heavenly. Once you hop on the bed, you sink right into it. The staff was also friendly and helpful - making great recommendation to local restaurants. As for location, you can walk everywhere around the hotel. It's 3 minute walk from Ann Frank's house. 20-25 minute walk to the Van Gough and other Museums. It's also about at 20 minute walk to the town square and red light district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: filbert10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer because we didn't want to be in the more tourist oriented areas like Dam Square or Leidesplein. The Pulitzer is on a lovely and quiet canal. Only a 10-15 minute walk from most of the sights and attractions and quite near to a metro and tram stop. The Hotel is also close to the Jordaan and Nine Streets. The front desk staff and concierge were extremely helpful in suggesting restaurants and suggestions on how to get places. We would definitely stay there again. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “super friendly”
Reviews.Author: L3506041
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is charming, unique, in a great location and the service is pretty close to the best you could expect. Sure the rooms themselves are nothing too fancy and their not exactly cavernous, but that's pretty normal for Europe. The rooms are clean and functional and because this is in such a great location, we tended to only come back to sleep anyway. I'd recommend this place to anyone, whether its for business or pleasure. I've been back twice and it feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds”
Reviews.Author: wlmcdonald
Reviews.Content: I was initially advised not to stay at this hotel though a bad review. I don't know what they were talking about. This was a wonderful experience. I have a bad back and the bed and bedding are what I was expecting in this hotel. It was awesome! high thread-count linens, oversized down pillows and a wonderful down duvet. Most comfortable hotel stay I had in 35 days. Front desk very friendly. FREE INTERNET! but only two computers so it's sometimes very busy. Great restaurants, shopping, museums and sites all within walking or bike riding distance. TIP: Rent a bicycle. Better than a cab and a quick way to getting around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to end any European trip”
Reviews.Author: starchixx325
Reviews.Content: After a 2 week trip in Europe, we drove to Amsterdam for the last 3 days before flying back to the States. There was no better way to end our trip than relaxing in Amsterdam and have the comfort and luxury of Hotel Pulitzer. After bouncing from city to city, Hotel Pulitzer offered us the quiet environment, privacy and accomodations that we needed. We were upgraded and stayed in Room 288 - a lovely and large room with a king bedroom, 2 bathrooms, and large living area overlooking the canal parallel to Prinsengracht. The room was beautiful - the bedroom and master bath were immaculate but with retained old world charm. Because the hotel is relatively central, after each outing, we returned to the hotel to rest or have a snack or a drink. We had a small empty refrigerator in the room to leave drinks and snacks in. It is also in a very artsy, intellectual section of town where you will feel safe walking around, there are great shops, restaurants and bars, but is also quiet enough for a bit of peace. For those looking to experience the real charm that Amsterdam has to offer, Hotel Pulitzer is an amazing location. Try walking around at night nearby to see the newly renovated or very old and rustic canal houses that neighbor the hotel. The hotel staff was very helpful - we were immediately helped to check in and the hotel was able to accomodate our request (a month in advance) for a 2-hour early check in - luckily for us, they were able to reserve a room for us a bit early. The concierge was very knowledgeable and helped us to find the drop off for our car rental, gas station, train tickets for the airport, reservations for a night show, recommendations from friends on places to go and things to try (which include: 1. freshly made french fries - there are small carts in front of the large, colorful church (Western Church) which is a 3 or 4 minute walk from the hotel with different sauces and the man who works there is incredibly charming and fun to talk to 2. Long Pura restaurant - we didn't get the chance to try it, but it's very close to the hotel and is supposed to be great! 3. Pancake Bakery - a 10 minute walk, I'll be writing a review of them next, but it was a fantastic, fun experience and very good! 4. Boom Chicago smoke boats or Boom Chicago improv comedy show in the Leidseplein and 5. 3 Sisters Steak House.) I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a getaway in Amsterdam. My parents are booking for next fall!

Reviews.Title: “The Ideal Hotel for a Short Amsterdam Visit”
Reviews.Author: JVtor
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Pulitzer in August as part of our 30th wedding anniversary "european tour". Here is why the Pulitzer was the ideal hotel for us: 1) The IDEAL location part 1 - can't beat the central location, you can walk to almost everything (A. Frank building, the Dam, restaurants, bars, red light district, bike tours, etc...) 2) The IDEAL location part 2 : situatated bewteen two canals , great architecture, pretty views 3) The IDEAL ROOM: the executive suite was spacious, clean and had a beautiful canal view. (Worth the extra Euros) 4) The IDEAL Staff; ZERO complaints, the staff was great, friendly, helpful, etc.... (when the turned down the bed in the evenings, they also gave clean dry towels. 5) The IDEAL building: an clean, intriguing complex of 20 plus original buildings tied together with a maze of walk ways , a beautiful courtyard, nice bar and pretty restaurant.. Definitely NOT your MARRIOTT / HILTON north american square tower complex. Loved it! The only watchout: IT's Not Cheap, but you get what you pay for. This is not the hotel to stay at if you're counting your euros day to day. Overall: Loved it. Recommend it! Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd room was wonderful! Great hotel, friendly staff - funky layout.”
Reviews.Author: lisampls
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a quick 5-day in four cities Europe trip. Our last night was in Amsterdam and he wanted to use SPG points - which led us to Hotel Pulitzer. The hotel is like many hotels in Amsterdam...in converted row houses. With that, the layout is a bit funky and maze-like. Check in was very fast and we were in our (first) room within a few minutes....well, kind of. We wandered around for about 5 minutes looking for room 311 until we found two employees who helped us look (they weren't sure where it was either.) Ends up we walked right by it as it was literally off a main walkway, which was odd. To make it more odd, when we walked in there were two sets of three stairs going up on either side - kind of like a mini split level. (I'll post pics) On the left was the bath and up on the right was the bedroom area. My fear was that I'd get up in the middle of the night and take a digger down those stairs on the way to the bathroom, so my boyfriend went to the front desk and asked if we could get another room, preferrably with a canal view. He came back successful - they were moving us to a different room - which was good because he said he could actually see right into our room when he walked the main hallway back from the lobby! YIKES! SO! Onto our new and improved room! Room 217! Whew! This one made us both very happy! First and foremost, we had a lovely canal view - but the room had some very lovely features other than the view including hardwood floors and a wood-beamed ceiling - and overall it was a good size, much larger than hotels in Paris or London. There was very comfortable king bed with wonderful linens, two side tables, a desk, a chair and table, an armoire that housed an area to hang clothes (and a few drawers) and the safe. There was also a cabinet that had the TV on it that held the mini-bar. If you are staying a long time there is not a ton of space to unpack your things, but for us staying only one night it was more than adequate. The bath was small, but very nice with lots of marble and a heated floor! There is a real tub and hand-painted tiles on the wall. The sink area is small, but again, for one night it was fine for us. They had nice bath products, but felt they were on the florally side. Good for me, but perhaps a bit too feminine for my boyfriend. There is a hairdryer as well. Other stuff: * The road is right in front of the hotel, but with the windows closed we weren't really bothered by road noise. * I want to say internet was around 27Euro for 24 hours, but don't quote me on that. * We had coffee delivered the morning we left but that was it as far as us checking out their restaurant. * There are plenty of steps here and there down hallways (two or three at a time), so be prepared to lift your suitcases up and down those steps on our way in/out. * The location is very good and only a few blocks from the Anne Frank Huis. We took a cab to and from the Rijksmuseum / Van Gogh Museum because we had limited time, but we did walk to Dam Square and the Red Light District. * There are a million boutiques, bars and restaurants in every direction so it's easy to find what you're looking for - and the concierge was helpful in giving us directions and suggestions, so don't be afraid to ask for assistance. * Note that while the bars stay open late, many restuarants close by 10:00 pm, which we found disappointing. So if there is a place you have in mind, make sure you find out their hours. * One tip, we asked for a taxi to come pick us up and take us to the train station...but while we were waiting, the bellman told us we could grab a ride on the Stop and Go - a hop on/hop off van that only costs 1euro! It was perfect! And of course saved us about 15euro! We didn't explore too much of the hotel, so I can't comment on it's ammenities, but from what we did see, we were happy with our stay. Had we stayed in room 311 and had I broke my leg on those goofy steps....I'd have probably not been so happy....but we loved Room 217! With that, I'd recommend this hotel. If you have any questions about the hotel, feel free to email me. Happy Travels! Lisa

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Collection Embarassment”
Reviews.Author: BigDrop
Reviews.Content: I have travelled heavily in Europe and North America on business for over 30 years. During this time I have probably averaged 125-150 days a year on the road with almost all properties Marriott, Westin, Ritz, Luxury Collection, etc. This hotel is among the most distressing of all the hotels I have ever stayed in. On this trip my wife was with me. The canal view rooms are very small with literally no closet space at all. There are no closets. The only space for hanging clothing is in a cabinet which also contains the only drawers. The result is the absolute inadequacy of the room. The bath rooms are similarly small. *Hot and cold water flashes occur when others turn on their showers or faucets. This happened numerous times in the five days we were there. *Lighting is inadequate in the room AND in the bathroom. *There was not a full length mirror in the entire room. *We stayed in a "deluxe King Canal View." I also requested being able to see an alternative room for the second day since we were so disappointed with ours. It was no different. *We asked the concierge (one of many-often the desk clerks cover for them and don't write tasks in ledgers to note that they were done) if we needed a reservation for the hotel restaurant for dinner for two @7. They said that because it was a weeknight it should not be a problem. We could just go. An hour later when we came down (around 7:30) we walked to the nearly empty restaurant and asked for a table. We were told that they were fully booked and there was no room for us. When I mentioned that we were staying at the Pulitzer (for five days no less) and had been told by the concierge (please call!) that we did not need a reservation we were firmly told, no, they were booked. I then asked if I could have the food from the Pulitzer served in my hotel room and was told yes, "of course." Then, I asked if the same kitchen was going to prepare it and they had so many empty tables, why could we not have dinner IN THE RESTAURANT? Another firm no. We left and I went to look for the concierge who was nowhere to be found. Nor the evening manager. Curiously, the next day we talked to another couple in the lobby and told them our story. They laughed and said, yes, the exact same thing had happened to them the night before! It also infuriated them. *I asked the concierge to cancel a reservation for a restaurant for one night because it was raining heavily and we did not want to walk. They told me that they would. Thirty minutes later, walking by to go to a restaurant next door I asked if they had made the cancellation. The answer was yes. That night, when we returned to our room @11:00PM there was a message on my answering machine from the restaurant understandably upset that we "had not cancelled." They "were in business to make money and had turned diners away because they saved our table for us." Because of us they lost several hundred Euros that evening and thanked us for our complete lack of consideration that they were operating a business." I was floored. I went down to the concierge and was told that she had gone home. The next day she was not in but there was a different concierge. I asked if a note had been made in the ledger for the restaurant's cancellation. There was none. Simply, this is unacceptible behavior at any hotel, by any staff but especially at a hotel on this level. *On our last day we left a wakeup call to dress for the airport. It never came! It never came! Twice, I called down to confirm that it would be done. I even called down to have a second wakeup call fifteen minutes later. That never came either. Starwood needs to take a serious look at this property-it is an absolute embarassment to be called a Leading Hotel of the World. The hotel is in an interesting location: primarily residential it is still close enough to the center of Amsterdam that I would consider it a plus. It IS charming by a larger canal and the views from the windows are lovely. But this is a hotel that is step below a Luxury Hotel because of the size of the rooms as well as the amenities (including sufficient closet and drawer space). It needs new management and also to understand that at E300+ per night for the lowest rates you cannot treat people like this. IN 30 years I have never written another negative review of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with great service”
Reviews.Author: LasseH
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Hade done a little research before the trip, and wanted to stay at a good hotell. We were not dissapointed. The service and attitude of the staff was exemplary. The breakfast was ok, I have had better i Sweden at Scandic hotells on business trips. However, to be seated at breakfast was very nice. The room we hade was quite small, but very comforable. The beds were amazing. The bathroom was extremly small but had everything that you need. Our room was on the fourth floor with a beautifull wiev overlooking the canal. And we were not disturbed by noice from the outside. There is a lot of small stairs and landings all over hte hotell beacuse the it's a whole block of 25 converted canalhouses. So it's a good idea to get someone to carry your suitecase.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall experience _nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: ErwinFromBelgium
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer enjoys a great location and is a remarkable building. Valet parking (pretty expensive at 55 euro) and check-in was smooth. I had a room upgrade from an execuctive room to a junior suite_room was huge. all amenities in place, though room needed some refurbishment. Room service was very prompt, and offers a modern menu (ie. inclusive of eg. low fat items etc.) at night, room was a little noisy (it's a pretty big hotel, so you just have to ask for a quiet room). The bar is pleasant. Breakfast is up to standard. Fitness is average. Charges for internet/wifi are silly. All in all, if you can find a deal this is a good hotel, both for business as for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: zeno66
Reviews.Content: Had a few stays for business. The rooms are rather comfortable. However note that considerable variability between rooms, so make you sure you find one you like. I found the staff efficient and helpful with everything I asked of them On the downside, check out always seemed to take 10-15 mins due to the amount of people, it was taking up 20 mins to get a taxi in the morning, so I started booking taxis the night before, but still had to wait an average of 10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the high costs; not very Platinum friendly”
Reviews.Author: Neil_in_Morristown
Reviews.Content: Just completed a weekend visit (two nights) at the Hotel Pulitzer. This is one of the rare times when I booked a hotel without much research as the hotel is the only Starwood property in the heart of Amsterdam and I was able to stay at my company's expense On the positive side, you can't beat the location of the hotel - its a short walk or quick tram ride to almost everything. There are a plethora of restaurant, bar, nightlife options that surround the hotel. The setting right by a beautiful canal is rather breathtaking at night. And the king size bed in my room was very comfortable. However, I'm at a loss at how this is a "Luxury Collection" property and worthy of paying Category 5 (out of 7) prices in the Starwood system. First, this property is the least attractive property for Platinum members I've ever seen (I have stayed 250+ nights in the last 3 years at SPG hotels around the world). To be fair, I booked on a sold out weekend and was not upgraded - so I won't hold this against the hotel. However, there are no real special Starwood privileges at this hotel for Platinum guests. There is no lounge. Breakfast is NOT included (rare for Plats to pay for this when there is no lounge), and neither is Internet (35 euros for 2 nights!). My room only had 1 free bottle of water that may be given to all guests. There is no happy hour for Plats. To me this is no way to treat your best customers. It seems that the experience at this property can vary by room - mine (160) was on the first floor and had very minimal lighting. I've never seen a room with less lighting. There were too many noises that could be heard in the room, from outside noise (e.g. a bell that rang at the top of every hour, even 3am) to internal plumbing. For some people this type of property is considered old school and charming. To me it felt more run down and not very luxurious at all. Even the gym that is touted on the website is quite small with a few treadmills/ellipticals and some dumb-bells - not one weight machine. The staff was OK - sometimes friendly, while other times not really paying attention. For instance, the one Plat benefit I exercised is 4pm checkout (avail at all hotels) and mentioned this to the staff the night before so it could be noted in my records. The next day I was awakened to a phone call asking me when I was checking out. It felt pretty typical of the service - inconsistent. Overall I would only stay at this property again if I didn't plan to spend much time in my room AND I was not paying the bill. Otherwise, for the high costs, there must be a better option in Amsterdam than this. And for Plat members who are used to some perks, having to pay exorbitant prices for breakfast and Internet with no real perks does not make this a place worth resting your head.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at a perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: pghtraveler26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our honeymoon. I absolutely loved this place! You must book a canal view room. This hotel is clean, comfortable, charming and in a great location. It is within walking distance to everything, but is in a nice, quiet, residential part of town. I felt very safe. The food from the hotel leaves something to be desired, but the staff is very friendly and helpful. We had to walk through what seemed like a maze to get to our room, 272. We had a very large room with a large bathroom and a beautiful canal view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel, staff could be better...”
Reviews.Author: kaymet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Pulitzer for 2 nights. The location was great, situated in front of the canal and very close to the Anne Frank Haus. The rooms were clean (I think they were all recently renovated). The only problem we had was with the reception upon check in and the concierge. We arrived just after 3PM and the room wasn't ready although check in time is 3PM and also informed the hotel our estimated arrival time. Took a while to get checked in and got told we had to wait another hour so we asked the concierge where we can have some lunch. We've asked for a nearby restaurant where they can recommend but was told that there are only cafes around and was also told that it was not in their culture that people have a nice late lunch!! We were tired and hungry after traveling so we asked if there was anywhere to eat in the hotel. We got directed to a restaurant which was closed and got then directed to a bar where they served some food. The quality of food wasn't very good considering the fact it is a 5 star hotel. The next day when we had more of our bearings around the hotel, we saw many cafes/restaurants opened around 3PM where alot of people were having a "late lunch"!! We were very annoyed by how the concierge was being unhelpful when we just arrived. Apart from the service we got, the hotel is nice to spend couple of nights for a city break. I will not eat in the hotel as there are many places to eat very close to the hotel with a reasonable price. Although we didn't have a good concierge on the first day, we did have a very helpful one the following evening and gave us a very good recommendation for a very nice restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but loud”
Reviews.Author: kngo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The beds were amazingly comfortable!! What I loved best was that this hotel was in a great location, but not in the middle of "Tourist Town." It was an easy 10 minute walk to the center of Amsterdam but the hotel was situation in an area where you could be apart of the locals. There are a lot of great restaurants nearby and the you can take river cruise booked through the hotel! The staff was extremely helpful. My only complaint was that it got quite loud at night. I could hear all of the commotion and conservations happening on the street. I don't think the windows were completely sealed and I had to sleep with ears plugs one of the nights I was there. I was a little disappointed about that, but overall, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “not a top hotel”
Reviews.Author: panda58
Reviews.Content: stayed only one night.location is nice, although there are even better places to stay.we had an award stay and were appointed ar oom with courtyard view. although not anything wrong with the room, size ,interior,and bathroom not matching 5 star international standards.hotel consists of different buildings and if one has to walk from one to the other, the impression is somewhat clumsy.doors of ugly storage rooms are left open. old buffet stand left unattended.breakfast room very nice,food OK.left car at valet service, which is of course expensive in amsterdam.But at check out, garage had technical problems and we could not leave until technician had solved the problem.This seemed to happen more often; unacceptable in my opninion.In conclusion, good hotel, but not worth the price and better hotels available in amsterdam at better rates.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: seamonkey03
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great location, and very comfortable rooms. Has lovely view of the canals.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend, very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Portillo_Pritchard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights in June 2009, in an executive room with a canal view, and unfortunately the hotel is the only thing that spoit an otherwise perfect weekend. We were willing to overlook the dirty stains on the carpet, lack of amenities and the fact that a member of staff knocked on our door to fill the minibar when we chose not to be disturbed (relunctantly going away), but when arriving at breakfast with 45 minutes left of service time we found it appalling that hardly any food was left. My husband had to wait a considerable time for more items to be cooked and I managed without. The restaurant staff were apologetic and informed the front desk that our breakfast should be refundable. However, as we had prepaid our accommodation and breakfast the front desk would not issue a refund (even after asking the Manager and clarifying for a second time). They only offered some points or an upgrade on our next visit, both declined as we will be staying elsewhere!!. I find it incredible that you don't receive a full refund if they fail to deliver the service you have already paid for. I accept that if we had changed our plans the money would have been lost, but for the fault being on their part?! Totally unacceptable and not at all in keeping with a "luxury" hotel. We will certainly go back to Amsterdam but will stay in other hotels which offer clean rooms with exceptional service, which does not include the Pulitzer!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location, wonderful hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jlovesb
Reviews.Content: We got a better rate through Starwood and loved this hotel. The location was even better than Dylan and we thought the room was quite, the bathroom nice and the staff was very helpful but not overly formal. They are voted best breakfast (very expensive if it's not included) but it is very nice. If you don't want to pay for a big breakfast there is a great cafe one block away with eggs and anything you could ever want that we loved on our last day. The hotel has a small but adequate workout facility and the garden rooms are better than canal rooms if you want a quiet room (we do). Very nice sheets and extremely comfortable bed. Rent bikes from Bike City (5 minute walk from hotel) and be sure to eat at D'Theeboom (sp?) and Proverjy (nearby) for great meals. LOVED Amsterdam thanks to the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, relaxing stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: mattwillco
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam proved to be a very interesting city, seemlingly switching from a hubbub of tourists and trashy souvenir shops, to arty and architectural landscapes in a flash. Thankfully, the Pulitzer lies in the latter, a welcome place to be whether it be for the overnight stay or just that midday pitstop. Located on one of the nicest streets (Prinsengracht), there are none of the odd waifs and strays, nor is it in sight of the seedy and strange red light area, though should you be that way inclined, it is within easy reach. The hotel is well situated, in amongst some nice galleries and luxury apartments. Inside the hotel itself, the staff are pleasant, speaking good English. You will not discover Coffee and tea making facilities upon arrival, but staff will bring it to you without cost. The king-size bed is supremely comfortable, the TV is a large flat-screen Samsung and there is even a Bose CD/Radio/Alarm player. Some money has clearly been put into this holiday. Whether you be in Amsterdam on business or simply for a sightseeing adventure, the Pulitzer is well worth the extra outlay.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in a quiet location with great staff”
Reviews.Author: mgd1977
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and five friends and we were all thoroughly impressed. It's a short tram-ride from Centraal Station or you could take a leisurely walk in less than 30mins. A great base to explore Amsterdam from. The staff were really first class in all parts of the hotel. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Could be worse”
Reviews.Author: KathySShermanOaks_CA
Reviews.Content: One needs to remember that European standards are different from American standards with regard to accommodations. I would rate this a 3 for American standards but probably a 4 for European. Also, there is great variability from room to room within the hotel. Location is great. Trade off for canal view is the amount of noise. The bathroom was very clean and updated. Beds are excellent. Furniture is a little outdated and carpeting could use replacement. I would agree with other posters that the concierge and front desk staff are not very knowledgeable. I booked the shuttle for airport return TWICE with the concierge and the shuttle service still had no record of me for pick up in the a.m. Luckily I had allowed plenty of time due to a previous review of this hotel that said that a flight had almost been missed due to poor shuttle service. This is a good hotel to use with SPG points but would have been upset if I had to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Never again - get me out of here !”
Reviews.Author: MJMS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pulitzer for one night whilst on business. General standard of hotels in Amsterdam not great, but this place is shoddy. Am not sure they have spent one $ on the place since the 1970s. Very run down. Seem to get most of their business from package guests - cruises, miles programmes, last minute websites. If you are paying rack rate on business, you find the overall standard very frustrating. How this can be a Luxury Collection hotel is a joke. My room was in the attic somewhere off a rabbit warren of corridors. Venetian blind over the window was delapidated with some manky, dirty cord attached to it. Bathroom so small there was not room for a mirror! Am all one for character but this place I am afraid is threadbare. The "Garden" is full of underused/never used tables, broken umbrellas, pieces of concrete acting as door stops... Anyhow, you get the point. Sheraton, encourage the property owner to spend some money doing up this place. Close it down for a year and transform it. It has a nice location so not all is lost.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get a top level room.”
Reviews.Author: Mikal81
Reviews.Content: Pulitzer is a lovely hotel and we got it for a great price on Expedia. As we all know by now, the international star rating is a waste of time and although Pulitzer has 5, it's definately not. But it tries well... The staff are super friendly and helpful. The place is clean and I loved the location, away from the grime of Dam Square and on the coolest canal in Amsterdam. Our room/s were lovely and the beds were incredibly comfy. I say rooms because the first night we had to change because of the noise. Pulitzer has very thin floors and walls. We could hear all our neighbours walking about upstairs and having showers. On the first the night, our ceiling creaked all night and the noise of people walking up the small flight of stairs in the corridor kept us awake all night. One room move later (technically only 1 room further away from the stairs although on the other side of the hotel) and we accepted that this was just a noisy hotel. I couldnt help thinking that the people on the top floors must seriously love this hotel, because everything else about it is great. But we however came back with a few bags under our eyes which thankfully Easyjet don't charge you for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful gardens”
Reviews.Author: Utahk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, using Starwood points for my husband and teenage sons. The hotel was beautiful, location convenient, and staff pleasant. Our rooms were standard (given their rewards nature) but more than comfortable. The best part of the hotel, certainly from my sons' perspective, was the fabulous breakfast buffet. It was well worth the money, as it tided us over until dinner. And the quality of the food was exceptional. I'm from Dutch extraction, and it was fun to see some of the traditional foods out for breakfast. To make the hotel experience better, they could use a few welcoming amenities -- a welcoming cocktail hour, or something to make it feel a bit less corporate.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel in every way....if you score the right room”
Reviews.Author: LWL3333
Reviews.Content: We first were given a small ground floor queen room right off the noisy lobby, with a view of a cement wall, and we were very disappointed. But since we had a rate that was "3 nights for the price of 2" we glumly felt that we couldn't expect much. Then we were moved to an upper floor superior king room with French doors and a Juliet balcony overlooking the extensive gardens and our entire outlook changed. Breakfast was about $40 extra per person per day, but there were several bakeries and cafes within a block or two which were more than adequate for breakfast at about $100 per couple. The indoor or outdoor bar were perfect places to unwind after a day of sight-seeing. All in all, we were very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They speak and charge luxury, but don't deliver”
Reviews.Author: DAJSYR
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a great neighborhood. However the follow through on various matters by the hotel was conspicuously absent. 1- We made reservation by phone for 2 adults and 1 child, the email confirmation included just 2 adults. 2- We emailed twice to clarify ths situation - no response. 2- On the phone, while making the reservation we asked the price of a cot and was told there would be no charge. On arrival we were told 45 Euros/night. This was waved when we agreed to an upgrade to an executive room. 3- On the phone we asked if there werea kettle in the room and were told there was. Upon arrival there was no kettle and at first they refused to supply one. The chamber maids did not replenish the tea bags the 3 nights we were there. 4- The stopper of the sink was broken and despite requests was not fixed by the time we left.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in an incredible city.”
Reviews.Author: CityGirlGoneCountry
Reviews.Content: You know it's a good hotel if you remember the name 2 years later. This is on my Top 10 favorite hotels. Great room, comfy sleep. Informative and willing to help concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, Great service And Great location”
Reviews.Author: gl0ryb0y
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped inside the staff were warm and friendly. The hotel was in a great location. The rooms were a little dated and the plumbing was poor. (when in the shower/bath the water got half way up your legs) it didnt runaway quick enough. The a/c was not cold enough, and sometimes the corridors were too hot. Be careful of the taxi company the concierge use ( they overcharge). The restaurant and bar were very good and the quality was high. However, the bar staff had to be asked about bar snacks, before they offered them. ( this is supposed to be a chain standard) Re room locations. The garden/ courtyard rooms are much quiter than the canal/view rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great service”
Reviews.Author: SKD13
Reviews.Content: We were in Amsterdam for 2 days as part of a quick tour of several European cities. We used our SPG points for the room so no free upgrade to a canal view for us! The room is typical European -- small! But as with most SPG properties the bed was very comfortable and all of the amenities in the room were top notch. The location is excellent and as we had limited time we appreciated that we were centrally located to many of the things we wanted to see. The service for our visit was exceptional -- from check in and check out, but especially Robert at the Concierge desk who was friendly and helpful several times with suggestions on restaurants, the order of things to see and booking transfers to the airport. As with most higher end hotels, the restaurants and bar were expensive, but at least in the case of the bar, the service was attentive and generous.

Reviews.Title: “building is nice, all else disappoints”
Reviews.Author: willfchicago
Reviews.Content: regular biz stayer in amsterdam, this is a backup hotel since i like to get starwood points hilton is much cleaner, better service but less good location intercontinental is good but very stuffy and expensive this place just does not cut it, couple of examples from this week alone i put my breakfast tray outside my room on Tuesday morning, it was still there weds night and amazingly still there thursday morning also i am nursing 5 or 6 mosquito bites from the mosquitos overall, avoid if you can starwood seriously needs to delist this as a luxury collection property, it just does not meet any kind of quality or service standard

Reviews.Title: “Hospitalility at its best”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleWslaughter
Reviews.Content: Top-drawer hotel, staff and experience. Location: excellent. As an SPG PLA on points, Pulitzer generously upgraded me to an Executive Room over-looking the canal. Over-sized room included flat-screen TV, Bose Wave radio, comfortable bedding and small, but impressive bath. View from room: Five Stars!. Other ample and well-appointed rooms overlook courtyards that charm . Nice bar, restaurant, small fitness room and business center complete your experience. Nice, one-of-a-kind property!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ij_gallagher
Reviews.Content: Although expensive this hotel is really well located in a beautiful part of Amsterdam. I used to live in Amsterdam and often wondered what it would be like to stay in the Pulitzer. Returning after 5 years I found it a perfect place to rediscover the city. Rooms are expensive and reasonably small although this is typical throughout Amsterdam. However they have a 'genuine' feel about them - our room had one exposed red brick wall and wooden beams across the ceiling, very much in keeping with the canal house theme. Food is expensive but Amsterdam is a wonderful city for restaurants so there are plenty of options. We didn't get a chance to take the hotel's canal tour but it looked a beautiful boat - far nicer than the public tours. Would highly recommend bike rentals for at least part of your stay - the hotel will point you in the direction of a friendly rental shop.

Reviews.Title: “5 star?”
Reviews.Author: HikingCanuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 2009. Hotel is in very good location. Close to all tourist sites and lots of restaurants. However, rooms are very small and basic. No coffee machine, iron etc were provided. They also messed up our reservation, so instead of having two single beds we had 1 queen and would not move us into another room, they provided a cot... yes a cot in a 5 star hotel! Rooms are also not sound proof and all hallway noise as well as neighbour noise can be heard. Beware of the cleaning staff though - they enter your room at 8 am every morning without knocking... for this reason make sure you don't forget to have your do not disturb sign on, as it can be quite annoying. Overall, very nicely decorated downstairs on the main floor, good location - but as for the services provided - nothing close to what i've come to receive from other 5 star hotels. Would rate it 3 1/2 at most.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service! Totally overrated!”
Reviews.Author: travelpartner72
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 days pre cruise. Room 171. Two nights in a row, room service makes so much noise outside my room - talking and banging trays full of dishes on a space heater that I woke up. It was 4:00 A.M. Dwi, the employee, knew there were guests sleeping in the rooms nearby. This hotel is part of the Luxury collection??? Pathetic. Needless to say, on the return trip to Amsterdam (with a group of five) , we will be staying at the Marriott. Better also understand that the church bells ring on the quarter hour from 5 A. M. on. Some rooms are very spread out. "The long and winding road..." Don't say I did not warn you.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelinShane
Reviews.Content: I used points to stay here... so the cost to me was free. Its an amazing hotel, with free internet terminals in a great area. Beautiful and excellent service. Its not cheap (which is why I used pts). If you can afford it, you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Better late than never....”
Reviews.Author: mattkap20
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Pulitzer 3 times in the last 3 years. Every visit has been fantastic. Its the little things that have won us over. The regal looking bar that is the perfect chill spot after a long day of sight-seeing. The water in the fitness center for a long day of walking. The computer in the lobby is the perfect spot to do a quick check of emails..etc.. The location is pretty central and has some great side streets to discover. Can't say enough about this place.... We love it so much that we are going for a 4th straight year.......June 5-10. I wonder if i can get an upgrade to the Brad Pitt room....lol. Great Job Hotel Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, but one major flaw and a few minor quirks”
Reviews.Author: Southside
Reviews.Content: Just back from what on balance was a very nice two-day stay at the hotel. To get the major flaw out of the way, we arrived at the hotel at about 12:30 p.m., were told that our room was not ready but that it would be by the 3 p.m. check-in time, arrived back at 4:15 p.m., and the room still wasn't ready until after 5 p.m. If we weren't jet-lagged and exhausted, and if this wasn't a "Luxury Collection" hotel with high standards, this would not have bothered us. And I realize that the hotel was pretty full while we were there. Still, under the circumstances, it was a real drag. The few minor quirks involve some inconsistent concierge information and availability, a few funky aspects of the hotel (such as the elevators), a breakdown of communications between the front desk and the doorman regarding our taxi request when we departed, and a bit of rudeness from the doorman. On balance, though, we had a very nice stay. The aforementioned quirks notwithstanding, most of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Due to my Starwood Gold status and/or because I shelled out some extra points (14.5K as opposed to 12K) for a better-than-regular room, we had a very nice room on the top (5th) floor, overlooking the canal and with a staircase leading up to a sleeping loft from the small living room below. Not recommended for folks who have trouble navigating narrow stairways or who might make frequent bathroom trips during the night, but we liked it. And not super-deluxe by luxury hotel standards--but like the hotel as a whole (which comprises about 25 former townhouses that have now been connected), it was charming in a quirky (in a positive sense) sort of way. I suspect the canal view room is noisier than one overlooking the hotel courtyard--I slept with earplugs in--so it's a bit of a trade-off. Also, as others have noted in other posts, staying in a regular room on the ground floor might make the place considerably less charming. The hotel does have a great location, very central so that in one direction you can delve into the tourist heartland and in others you easily get a bit off the beaten track. Breakfast buffet was nothing outstanding, but certainly sufficient and served in pleasant surroundings with efficient staff. Also, at least on the weekend days we were there, it was served until 1 p.m., which was great. I give the hotel only three stars because of the drawbacks I mentioned and because I think at least some of the ground floor rooms are much worse than the one we ended up with. Still, if we had the assurance or likelihood of getting a good room again, we would definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with just one issue”
Reviews.Author: olympicnut
Reviews.Content: We got our room through United Vacations for a 4 night stay, May 18-22 for a little over $800. Not too bad for such a nice place. The staff are fantastic. From the front desk to the housekeeper, everyone was so amazingly nice and always greeted you with a friendly hello. Always! We never ate at the restaurant, but we did enjoy the bar one evening. Our cocktails were superb. A little pricey but what do you expect from a hotel of this caliber? The bartender, as with everyone else in the hotel, was again just as friendly to us and acted as if we had known him for years. The hotel location, as stated by everyone else, is indeed in a terrific spot. It's close enough to pretty much everything to walk to, and if you don't want to you simply take the trams. It takes a little while to get your bearings but once you do you can easily navigate the streets and canals of Amsterdam. Use the maps the hotels give you when you check in and you should be fine. I bought a laminated street map before we left the States and never used it, the one they gave was superb! Now, here's the issue we ran in to. We had a 6pm flight out, and had reservations for the Connexxion shuttle bus to pick us up. We asked the concierge what time we should have them pick us up and he instantly said "4:00 will give you plenty of time to get there". I questioned him on the 4:00 time, thinking 3pm might be better, but he insisted it was just fine to leave at 4. So, I trusted his knowledge and went with it. 4:20 came and the shuttle finally arrived to pick us and another couple up. Unfortunately we weren't going straight to the airport. We had to drop another couple off at another hotel, then pick another couple up to take TO the airport. By the time we got to Schipol it was 5:30pm. We actually made it onto the flight (after having to run through the airport to get on the plane as they called us over the intercom to rush there as they were holding the plane for us). Unfortunately, our luggage did not make our flight and we got to our next destination without them for the night. Luckily the bags made it out on a later flight and we got them the next morning for our journey back home, but it was an unnecessary inconvienience we had to deal with because the concierge insisted 2 hours was plenty of time. Bottom line, if you use Connexxion to get to and from the airport to the hotel, make it 3 hours just to be safe. Other than that this is a superb place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Love vacation time
Reviews.Content: The highlight of this hotel was the staff particularly the concierge desk. Maid service (both night and day) was excellent. The bathroom had a 30 inch (approx) pullman. Would have liked a little more area of shelving. The bath tub was slippery so be sure to ask for a rubber mat. The back of the tub slopes up. An unlit magnifying mirror was provided. The tub and shower were one unit. In addition to the shower head, an additional hand wand was provided. The water did change temperature during the course of a shower. Fair lighting was provided in the bath room. The room including the bath room was approximately 300 feet. The room had wood flooring. Houskeeping was excellent. Good lighting by the bed. We were in room 207 and commanded a nice view of the canal. We were within walking distance of most major attractions (we love to walk) We took Sandeman's free walking. It was excellent. The river cruise was fair.....I would suggest just taking the walking tour. The Van Gough Museum was wonderful.......audio sets are provided. Reserve in advance on the internet. We also took a Red Light District Tour.....fun to see.....once in a lifetime! It might be more fun to enjoy!!!!!!! The best restaurant we encountered was Proeverij......a short walk from the hotel. I enjoyed my filet of pork. My wife had a vegetarian item that she enjoyed. We shared an unusual ceasar salad. The kobe beef our friends had seemed a bit tough to me. The Sweet Breads were good. All dishes were presented beautifully. About $100 per couple. Each couple shared an appetizer, we had no beverages, no desert and we each had a drink or wine. Tempo Doeloe was a B- and Casa di David was a C.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else...”
Reviews.Author: mogabs
Reviews.Content: The location, staff, and room were great. Within easy walking distance of most of the sights in Amsterdam, and right on 3 tram lines. Room was big and faced the interior courtyard, so very quiet. We were there during Queens Day and the hotel was the perfect home base.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable location and service”
Reviews.Author: yrtx4e
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Pulitzer and will return for sure. Yet, there is still room to improve in both hardware (amenities) to be substantially qualified as Luxury collection. Location: Impeccalbe quiet, picturesque location, you can almost walk to all tourist attractions. Stop and Go bus (Euro 1/hour) stop in front of the hotel, Canal bus stop is just a stroll away. Ann Frank House & West Church is just around the corner. We are glad that we chose Pulitzer. Service: Overall the staff are very helpful and friendly. All the front desk staff are nice. (some posters said they were cold, not that we had encountered). The concierge is helpful and knowledgeable. The porter, some are cold, but Carlos is an excellent exception, Carlos is cheerful , helpful and make you feel warml welcomed. The housekeeping staff are also very friendly and efficient. There was no turn down service. The business center offer free internet access, you still can have internet access without paying the Euro19 /day internet charges. Room The featured rate is not really low at this economic turmoil. yet we got a 30% off at SPG.com which si a steal. So our room of course is not the most desirable. In light of the hotel is a link of many canal houses into a quadrangle, so there are many short flights of stairs linking the buildings and level. I now know what does one poster talk about room under the stairs. I at first worry too. In fact, the room was in a good size, very bright, facing the inside small courtyard, no view, in the front building . Some rooms are in the back canal houses, you have to walk through a patio courtyard There is free coffee/tea maker but you have to ask upon check-in. The tiny squishy bathroom is a fact. The amenities in the room is ok. I was surprised, there is no cosmetic cotton wool, cotton buds and show cap which are very standard in 5-star hotels in Europe. The faucet in the bathtub link with the rainforest shower head is a bit tricky to adjust. Some posters mentioned about the physical placement of the furniture in the room. I agree. The bed is very comfy. Restaurant: Unfortunately, the Pulitzer restaurant was closed for renovation and the menu is disappointing. There are many cafe, restaurants nearby, The Michelin mentioned restaurant Envy is just a stroll away. It's a nice restaurant with good tasting menu. I echo to the concierge if you want a quiet dinner, then don't pick the bistro (tapas) style ENVY. We enjoyed the food at ENVY. Transport The hotel canal cruise sails at 6pm it is nice. If you are short of time, don't ever buy the canal bus day pass, the canal bus(boat ) is too slow and frequency is 25mins. The tram daypass (7 Euro) takes you everywhere. I believe taxi from Amsterdam Centrale station is around 10Euro, we got ripped off for 16Euro. If you go to the airport, order a airport shuttle from the concierge, it costs 14.50Euro per person, pick up from hotel to the airport, the shuttle may have to pick up passengers from other hotels. We were lucky, there were only two of us on the shuttle that only took 20mins to Schipol airport. I have no hesitation to recommend Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Just Plain Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ScubaWife
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights April 4 to 7. We are Starwood members and booked the room using cash and points so it only cost $90 per night. I had expected that because of that we would get a "bad" room but we got a great room. No it did not face the canal, it faced an inner courtyard but it was very large and had 2 windows and was quite bright. The bathroom was nice and the shower had good water pressure.
