The location was very convenient. It is 2 blocks from the Anne Frank House and the canal boats. Its one block from the tram lines that you could take to get to Central station, Rembrant House, museums, etc. The staff are wonderful and responded quickly to our request for a blanket instead of the duvet which was too heavy for the spring weather. Someone came up to our room within 10 minutes of our call and took the duvet and made up the bed with a lighter blanket. All of the bedding is very soft and plush. We did not eat there but we had breakfast of coffee and croissants or bagels at a small cafe next to the Anne Frank house. The concierge was very helpful as we wanted to go to the Zeiderzee Museum. He printed out the train schedule for us and recommended restaurants for dinner. Try Chistophe on the block after the Anne Frank house. It was fabulous. He also recommended a Dutch place called The Silver Mirror that was a 15 minute walk and in a building from 1614! The only complaint I have is the price of using internet in the room. It was 19 Euros! But if you go into the business center, its free and you can even hook up to the internet there using your own computer. All in all it was a fabulous stay

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - Great location - Has Character”
Reviews.Author: pcs1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at Hotel Pulitzer and enjoyed our stay. We had an "executive" sized room overlooking the canal. In the future I won't pay extra for a canal view room -- it would have been quieter to have an inside room overlooking the lovely garden area. The room was not large -- but that's to be expected in a city hotel. Bed was very comfortable although I could have done without the huge down duvet which was way too warm for spring temps. Bathroom had very limited shelf space. It would have been nice to have a tea kettle in the room. Lighting was good. Breakfast buffet was a little limited -- their restaurant is undergoing renovation so it was in the "Garden room". Nice "gezellig" bar. The concierge staff were very helpful. They helped me with great resaurant recommendations and with reservations. I selected from their recommendations and all the resaurants were great! The location is very good. Within walking distance of most attractions and close to The Jordaan area with good restaurants. Amsterdam is a very busy city so it was good to be somewhat off the "beaten path" for tourists. All in all a very enjoyable stay - hotel has local character which is great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantstic location, wonderful ambience, extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Geographyrocks
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly recommend the Pulitzer Hotel as a base for sightseeing in Amsterdam and the surrounding area. Its location on the Princengracht Canal is terrific. Everything is within walking distance and the street has a fantastic atmosphere, night and day. The hotel has several beautiful courtyard type gardens for relaxing in between sightseeing and the bedrooms are lovely. The Concierge and reception staff are always willing to answer questions or find out information for guests. It is easy to walk the sights, or hop on a canal boat for a leisurely trip around the city. The Ann Frank House is in the next block. The museum quarter is a 15 minute walk from the Pulitzer and the Artis Zoo is a must for families (can be reached by canal boat). I would recommend taking bus from Central Station to Volendam (on the Ijsselmmer) and the surrounding area which is great for cycling, wildlife etc. The seafood restaurants at the harbour in Volendam are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “This is a brilliant hotel...”
Reviews.Author: EurotravelCologne
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed in the Pulitzer Hotel in Amsterdam to celebrate my birthday. We had a superb experience in this lovely hotel. We were greeted by smiling staff who gave us a warm welcome and immediately recognised that it was my birthday. The receptionist try to give us an upgrade, although the hotel was VERY busy that night. So instead she gave us the requested deluxe room, but it was very special. After explaining how to get to it (up several staircases and over a roof top) we set off, and soon arrived in a double height room that expanded into the beams of a gable roof. It was very romantic, and although didn't have a great view as such, was tucked away, private and a great size. The bathroom was beautiful marble, and the furniture/decor very tasteful without being fussy. The ultimate attraction to the room however, was the bed! There are so many reviews on here about the beds in this hotel, and they're all truE. Firstly it was HUGE! The mattress was amazing, so comfortable, and the bedlinen was divine. Although we didn't spend much time in the room (how could you in such a beautiful city?!) it was wonderful to come back to after a long day sightseeing. The hotel is in the most fantastic postion, right bang in the centre of the most impressive district of Amsterdam. The canal houses it is situated in a sympathetically restored, and the bar had a wonderful view out onto other such buildings and the canal. This is the district to be in, the shops are amazing and there are som many cafes and restaurants nearby. We had an excellent expererience at this hotel, and would definately stay here again (although we always make it a rule of thumb to never stay in the same place twice!) The attentiveness of the staff throughout the stay was exemplary, and despite being a chain hotel, it has the feeling of a luxurious individual residence. On my birthday we returned to the room to find a present and card from the front desk staff (definately 5* service). We paid an excellent price through hotels.com, and it's definately worth looking out for deals. Iff you want a luxury hotel in a great position within walking distance of everything, this is the one for you! (Cologne, Germany)

Reviews.Title: “This is why I love staying at Starwood hotels.”
Reviews.Author: eigenwijs
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in Amsterdam, very good restaurant and luxurious enough to bring along your clients. I have stayed in Starwood hotels before and they never let me down. Hotel pulitzer in amsterdam really is worth the stay. Big rooms, quick and attentive staff and me and my clients very much enjoyed the restaurant. The only point of critic is the room service, that could be faster. Highly recommended for staying in Central Amsterdam with business clients.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: james_carly
Reviews.Content: This may not be a fair review because we didn't have to pay for the rooms ourselves, thanks to work. But the hotel is gorgeous with quaint rooms and huge comfy big beds that you would expect in a 5 star hotel. Location on the canals is great and the gym, though small, was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location/Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mario-MC
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at Pulitzer Amsterdam with my partner. The location of the Hotel is great, at walking distance from city amenities and attractions. The Hotel itself is like a "village" in the town....it's made by many small typical Amsterdam houses! The most lucky customers have rooms with view on the canal. I booked my room with SPG fidelity points, so I expected a quite old and small room. Actually we had a very nice room, recently renovated, warm and functional with a small private garden! The service was extremely good (we arrived very lat in the night and asked for a late checkout). Room service very good and efficient. Overall a very nice experience. Would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in a city where clients flow automatically”
Reviews.Author: pprhh
Reviews.Content: I used the Pulitzer for a business stay in order to avoid to sleep at schipol. The location at the Prinzengracht is great. My SPG status upgrated me in a room with viez which was very nice. Room was pretty big and freshly re-decorated with modern tones.the rest of the hotel gives the impression that clients flow in anyway and no special attention is required. The staff was nice though and gave me a great tip for a dinner on my own in a nice fashionable restaurant 50m away from the hotel. I consider negative comments of other travellers auite unfair when it comes to the standard of the hotel. Amsterdam downtown is a difficult place to have a big superior hotel and the Pulitzer is doing an ok job. Expectation are so high when you go to Amsterdam !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but I would like to see free internet connection”
Reviews.Author: gardkarlsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Pulitzer in Amsterdam from March 16th to March 18th on a work trip to the city. I took it as they could offer a good deal on 2 night stay and as it was a Starwood hotel and Iâ€™m in the Starwood Preferred Guest program. I had to pay 207â‚¬ per night for the room. First of all: you got to love the internet. Yes, I did book the hotel through the internet (on the Starwood page) and I also used http://www.maps.google.com to check which was the nearest tram station and which line would service that station. So when I arrived at Schiphol airport I took a train into downtown (centralstation) and from there I jumped on the right tram line and jumped of at the right stationâ€¦it is Westermarkt by the way :-) When I arrived, the check in was fast and I got room 331. The guy that checked me in was very helpful and pulled out a map to show us where we were located and I also asked if he could recommend a restaurant near by and he booked a table for me at Moeders (Mothers) â€“ but that is a different story. Room 331 is located on the 2nd floor and the first impression when walking in was quite good. At first glance it was a room with light wooden floors, light walls, golden curtains and big beams in the ceiling. It is also located right next to a canal so the surroundings are quite picturesque - not that I got to experience much of that as I got windows facing a courtyard ;-) When I first came in I had a lot of problems figuring out how to turn on the light. But after fiddling around with the light switches I finally figured it out. The room was dominated by a huge bed which turned out to be very comfortable â€“ it even had a proper duvet and some nice pillows. Apart from that there was a nice flat screen TV on top of a mini bar. But as always in hotels the prices are ridiculous â€“ 4 â‚¬ for a Coke, 6.5 â‚¬ for a Heineken are just a couple of examples. There was also a wardrobe with some hangers, a mini safe, a holder for a suitcase and of course a work desk with a couple of chairs. I did try to activate the air-con by the way as I like to have it cool when I sleep but that did not seem to work. Maybe it is only in operation during the summertime. This made the nights a bit warm for me as the duvet was quite thick. I could have opened a window of course but note that there is a church nearby where the bell tolls like every half hour even throughout the night so if you a sensitive to sounds, be aware. The bathroom seemed pretty small to start with but it was not bad at all. It was tiled in various colors, there were heating in the floor, the towels were big and fluffy and the shower curtain option was not too bad (but I still donâ€™t like the shower curtain option to start with). There were not that many amenities â€“ only the usual shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and lotion. When it comes to the bathtub/showerâ€¦I wonder how many really take a bath when they stay for a couple of nights at a hotel. I seldom use the bathtub option and in this hotel I would much rather have a better shower option than the bathtub but thatâ€™s just me I guess. I only stayed at Hotel Pulitzer 2 days so it is hard to give them a proper verdict after such a short time. It seems to be a nice modern hotel in an â€œold shellâ€� as it is located in an old refurbished Amsterdam house located right on the edge of a canal. But being here on business I would have loved to have stayed connected by having access to the internet. But access to the net was not complimentary and came at the price of 19â‚¬ for 24 hours or 35â‚¬ for 48 hours. That is just ridiculous if you ask me. Another thing that is insane is the breakfast prices. A full breakfast cost 29â‚¬!!! Iâ€™m sorry that I sound stingy but there is only so much a person can eat for breakfast and I doubt that anyone can eat for 29â‚¬. Another thing that surprised me was the price. I think I paid about 200â‚¬ per night for the hotel room but that was without breakfast: I think with breakfast it would be about 270â‚¬. So it is actually cheaper to book the room and then buy the breakfast separately â€“ how silly is that? On day two when I came to breakfast the guy at the reception was quite laid back â€“ so he told me to just grab something to eat and then tell him on the way out what I had eaten to determine the price. So after 10 minutes I walked up to him and told him that I had a banana and some cereal and a glass of juice (which is my regular breakfast) and he was like â€œIs that all? Get out of hereâ€�. So I didnâ€™t have to pay anything. Again I wonder how many people actually eat a lot at breakfast at hotels like this. A business travel canâ€™t stuff himself/herself full of food every morning when traveling. But all is all â€“ I would not mind staying here again. The location of the hotel is not bad as you can walk to Dam within 10 minutes, the bed was huge and comfortable and the room was modern and looked great. The staff was very helpful and approached me very fast when I was looking for help. So all the staff ranging from people in the restaurant, the reception staff and porters were all excellent. To round of I would just like to recommend Amsterdam. I went there on vacation a few years back and I enjoyed it. But I had almost forgotten how charming this city is â€“ after this trip I would like to return once again on vacation to re-discover it. So if you have a chance to go here, donâ€™t hesitate

Reviews.Title: “Too epensive”
Reviews.Author: stevenBrussels
Reviews.Content: Wet stayed a weekend in the hotel. I bookedn endless weekend rate on the website paying 30 euro extra comapred to standard price. I phoned the hotel if breakfast was included in the endless weekend rate. Which they confirmed. AT the hotel, it appeared breakfast was exluded and had to pay over 60 extra for breakfast for two !!!! Room was very small, clean and quiet. The bathroom was reallly very small. There were no slippers. One bathrobe ? ??? did they gave us a single room ?? Parking fee for one night â‚¬ 55 !!! Next time, I will stay agian in the Banks Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Top Shelf Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2Traveler
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days at the Pulitzer we had a Deluxe Executive Room. (#422)Great and it was plenty big for our needs. Flat screen TV nice bathroom. This Hotel is not "cheap" so if you are looking for a "super bargain" this is not the hotel. The staff was very attentive to any needs. The room included breakfast. Would highly recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: mayla
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights in a room overlooking the canal. It was the priciest hotel of my three city tour, but the nicest. Very scenic Amsterdam neighborhood. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Helpful staff. Good breakfast (included in my room charge). Free use of Internet. Only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is it's a wee bit overpriced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Location , location , location”
Reviews.Author: yandinazetland
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer is a luxury hotel where you are welcomed and treated just as you want to be treated - you want service it is there in spades - you want peace quiet and discretion you can have that too. The hotel is twenty minutes walk from everywhere - the old town , the museums , central station , the canals , the shops , the cafes , the bars and more canals. The room we had was on floor 5 overlooking the canal - the room was fitted with all you could ask for - do ask for the tea and coffee making facilities - the bathroom equipped with a power shower , full bath and enough toiletries to float a canal barge on. The bed - just to say it is the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in - turn down service - if you want it. It is expensive particularly with the present euro/pound rate - the mini bar is a no go area - the main bar to be treated with caution - I arranged for breakfast to be part of our room rate - well worth it - anything you want cooked to perfection. The staff were all very professional - from doorman to receptionist - i enjoyed the stay - I repeat that the main plus is the location

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: trvlnmom
Reviews.Content: especially enjoyed the intimate bar. the location was ideal. We used miles so it was free.

Reviews.Title: “pulitzer prize”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl078
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. As picky travellers (my husband spends about 1/2 the year in hotels) we both found this delightful. The location is excellent, staff were helpful and friendly. Our room was spacious, very comfortable had windows overlooking a canal. It was charming. As far as food goes, we had room service the entire weekend and all of it was above par. Much better than what the dutch usually pass off as 'cuisine' . Sorry dutch folk but food and Holland are really not exciting. Hubby stated that the room service menu and quality were one of the best. All in all, we had a lovely, comfy weekend and with the TV having UK channels and WiFi we were quite happy not to leave the room. Okay, I went for a short walk and bought a postcard. The location is great however if you do want to explore. Lots of nice shops, museums and such in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: doublebooked
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pullitzer on Starwood preferred points the night before New Year's eve. As a Dutchman usually staying with family when back in the Netherlands but occasionally staying in hotels when visiting, this stay was perfect. Maybe the freezing cold and, hence, frozen canals as well as the light dusting of snow on New Year's day made the picture rozier, however, I think that even without these very romantic and picture perfect Old Dutch Mssters circumstances, our stay would have been wonderful. Complaints from other reviewers about indifferent or rude staff; not our experience. However, this hotels is a collection of a multide of buildings hundreds of years old, hence no huge lobby and multiple check-in desks but a large enough lobby with three staff memebrs manning the check-in. We have waited longer in other and bigger hotels of this caliber. and the service was pleasant and excellent: with for the hiliday bowls of "oliebollen" and "appelflappen" (Dutch traditional New Year's pastries: fried doughnuts with raisins and apple beignets) plentiful available for guests/visitors. Our room was on the ground floor (for americans:1st floor), renovated and spacious with a beuatiful bathroom, not huge, but sufficient (larger than NYC Waldorf Astoria suite bathrooms!) and the bed was outstanding. With a view of a courtyard,it was very quiet. at night. Breakfast was very good and service pleasant. Which hotel, by the way, allows breakfast until 1PM on New Year's Day (11 on regular days, also excellent) The location is great, a 7 minute tram ride (line 13 or 17) from the Central (train) Station, which is only an easy 20 minutes train ride from Schiphol Airport. Most (tourist) attractions are in walking distance and restaurants and pubs a plenty in the neighborhood. Yes the Dutch could have demolished these beautiful buildings and put an ugly modern hotel here ( as some advocated in the 60ies). Fortunatley, they thought the better of it. You now see a beautiful collection of old buildings not easily recognized as a great hotel, with all the modern amenities you expect or want. We'll be back there for sure if we decide to spend a night (or more) in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel all around”
Reviews.Author: LilPaolita
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pullitzer was a great place to stay at. Very conveniently located, we were able to walk everywhere. The service was wonderful. Everyone we came in contact with at the Hotel was so nice and helpful. The agent who checked us in was very welcoming and took the time to explain where we were at, how to get around and made a few recommendations of must see/ do things in Amsterdam. The bellman gave us his personal umbrella to use during our whole stay. As far as the accommodations, the room was actually pretty good size considering how small rooms are in Europe, the bed was very comfy and the bathroom tile floor was heated (my personal favorite!). Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny tiny room very poor hotel staff great boat tour”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: This property is not a Luxury collection property. The front desk staff were horrible - have never seen worse at any Starwood property. They simply did not care about the customer at all. The room was among the tiniest most cramped I have ever stayed in. I think it was supposed to be charming but it was a little scary. The property has neat glass walkways to get to the restuarant definitely worth checking out and the neighborhood was very nice. The hotel offers a boat tour of the canels and this tour was wonderful and rescued the hotel's image in our mind it wa sthe best part of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Watfordchaps
Reviews.Content: If you want a very good hotel, with real Dutch feel in a great location then you must choose the Pulitzer. Within 5-15 minutes you are in walking distance of all the attractions, the tram stop is 2 minutes from the hotel if you don't like walking.The hotel is right by the Prisengracht canel, all around the hotel there are great little authentic Dutch resturants,bars and specialist shops, well it is in the trendy Jordaan area. The hotel is luxurious,all the staff are polite, friendly, helpful and informative.The rooms have that added touch, with beds, as my wife described, as like sleeping on a cloud, slippers to use, a dressing gown, toileteries in the bathroom, flat screen t.v. with over 40 channels in English and Dutch and great views from the windows. We have stayed in other hotels on previous trips to Amsterdam, the Pultizer is the best for everything you would what from a city break, it matches, in our opinion it's 5 star rating, we will definitely be choosing this hotel for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect it to be a Luxury Collection, it's a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: mbdpope
Reviews.Content: We stayed over New Years using points. We have been Platinum for 10 years, but we were told no upgrades were available and the hotel was sold out. Of course, we found out later that they were not sold out, and suites were still available, even on New Years Eve. We had dinner in the restaurant on NYE, and it was terrible. It wias Prix Fixe, with no options on each course, and it took forever. Their excuse: It's NYE. Then do not open for it, and make everyone angry. They lock the doors and require you to hit the bell anytime after 2am. Hopefully, they will be awake so you don't have to stand in the "dangerous" outside until they wake up from the back. The room was fine, and the location was pretty good. We will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not the level of luxury expected”
Reviews.Author: justice_j_usa
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on New Year's Eve in a reward room so it was free. Room is on the small side (smaller than most Sheraton standard rooms), but bed was very comfortable and bathroom luxurious. Hotel was built from combining many canal houses thus it felt like a maze navigating the property, but nonetheless fun. Room service is nice but not great. Room was in the middle of the houses so the window opened to nothing but view of the corridor outside. Rooms facing the canal may get much better view. Located close to tram stop and walking distance to Anne Frank Museum. 10 minutes tram ride from Amsterdam Centraal train terminal. 45 mins from airport by train. Would probably not stay here if were to pay for the room. (advertised rate was 380 USD)

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory, but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bucsonice
Reviews.Content: We booked a three-night stay using Starpoints, arriving December 30, 2008. We arrived around 6 p.m. and had to wait about 5 minutes to check in. I am a Starwood Platinum, and I was informed that no upgrades were available because the hotel was sold out for new years eve. We were assigned a "lovely garden room," room 134. The clerk did agree to include breakfast because an upgrade was not available. Later that evening, I checked the hotel's website and saw that the hotel was not sold out. There were Deluxe, Classic, and Executive rooms available for a three-night stay starting December 30. That was something of a disappointment. I cannot imagine that any of those rooms would not have been an upgrade over room 134. It was tiny. We could hear noises in the hallway, from the room above us, and from the heater. Also, the towels were ridiculously low quality for a hotel that is part of Starwood's Luxury Collection. The positives were the exceptionally comfortable bed and the breakfast. The hotel also provides use of a business center free of charge. Overall, our stay was satisfactory. However, that's not good enough for a hotel like the Pulitzer. Next time in Amsterdam, we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Feel in Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: debbierich
Reviews.Content: We loved the Pulitzer Hotel for its location and its ambiance. We traveled from the airport via train to Central Station and via tram from Central Station to the West Market stop, all with the help of local people we met upon landing. It was a 1/2 block to the hotel from the tram stop. The hotel is a series of canal homes linked together so that the historical ambiance of the streets isn't marred by a big boxy hotel. We loved our room, the beds were heavenly, the bathroom very comfortable, the flat screen TV great and having hard wood floors made it feel very clean. The location was extremely convenient and we walked everywhere. The Ann Frank House was a block from the hotel and the fantastic Pancake Bakery just beyond that. (Don't expect American style pancakes and embarrass yourself like I did-"pancakes" here are crepes!) Its about a 10 minute walk to the Dam. All of the restaurants that we tried in the immediate area of the hotel were excellent. We used the hotel's business center often and found the front desk staff friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “1st class location, Basil Fawlty staff”
Reviews.Author: madtravel78
Reviews.Content: The Hotel's location is brilliant, and within walking distance of the rest of the city. The Moroccan door and bar staff likewise were helpful, polite and efficient. Bad news is that the Dutch (and/or European) staff on reception and management were lazy, rude, complacent and could not manage anything without conflict including the printing a bill when checking out. After refusing them a carte blanche on my credit card they remarkably had a working computer and printer, after claiming "billing problems". They then tried to pull the same trick on Asian members of my traveling party. When I left, the lobby resembled the port at Rotterdam all morning because someone could not organize somewhere else (e.g. an empty conference room?) to put the luggage of a German coach holiday. Given the attitude of the senior staff, I think they may be getting more English stag parties and elderly coach tourists than those the Starwood group desire.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: wellensian
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in upmarket canalside area, yet only two minutes from the tram stop, and ten minutes' walk from the Dam. The clever linking of rows of traditional canalside houses into one hotel makes this more like a boutique property than a hotel owned by a multinational.. I can imagine that no two rooms could be the same. Certainly, mine was unique, off a landing with only two rooms, in the "attic" of one of the houses. Sloping ceiling right to the roof truss, gave the room a dramatic feel, and the fittings lived up to the room; polished oak floor, huge bed, flat screen television and a beautiful bathroom with power and hand showers. The dining area is broken into different rooms so that you are not staring across acres of space, and the buffet breakfast was superb, whether continental, Dutch or hot. (I recommend the Pancakes (crepes) with crispy bacon and mushrooms.) I found that the hotel fully lived up to everything I would expect of a luxury hotel, with the addition of unobtrusive good service, charm and character.

Reviews.Title: “laptop stolen by hotel housekeeping from room”
Reviews.Author: bostonguy505
Reviews.Content: a member of the hotel housekeeping staff stole my laptop from my room. Obviously I did not have a great stay. The hotel knows who was in my room at the time the laptop was stolen but cannot do anything. It was a sony viao laptop

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites in the world”
Reviews.Author: HungryinSavannah
Reviews.Content: What can you say? We had nothing to complain about, and only praise for the hotel, from the location, the front staff, our room, the food, the winding corridors and interestingly maze-like nature of the hallways and buildings. I can see how some elderly guests or handicapped guests might have challenges, but this place made my girlfriend and I so happy. The huge brunch on the weekends, with a funky view out the windows of steam rising and people strolling by. I can't wait to go back. Whenever we go back to Amsterdam, we will stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't work out, but they were professional and helpful”
Reviews.Author: rachilde
Reviews.Content: We had made reservations for this hotel but there were several problems and the place did not fit my needs. To the front desk's credit they very professional and understanding when circumstances forced me to cancel my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Metzgermeister
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is just a great hotel with a very convinient location, just a few walking minutes to Dam Square and directly on a canal. Although it is not a small hotel, it has so much charme and individuality, something I would expect in a small boutique hotel with just a few rooms. Due to its architecture (over 20 small Grachten-Houses were combined to one hotel) the Pulitzer has so much charme. Throughout Amsterdam everybody was very friendly - so in the hotel as well. We felt very welcomed throughout the entire hotel. The breakfast buffet was okay and offered several variations, but was not amazing. Therefore my favourite spot in the hotel was in the Restaurant in front of a very large, satire painting. Really funny! The barkeeper was very friendly and also showed a very good memory of his guests. After the first day he knew our name and room number throughout our stay. From the Concierge we received a great Restaurant Tip for the Restaurant Proeverij, just 5 walking minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: npgPhilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer in Amsterdam for 3 nights from 9/20-23. It was one of the best hotels we've stayed in. Our room was newly renovated and very quiet. The down bedding was so comfortable that it was difficult to get out of bed in the morning. The courtyards are charming, there is beautiful artwork in the common areas, and free coffee in the morning outside the dining room. Internet is free in the business center only. The hotel staff were very accommodating. We did book this through Starwood and used our points for 2 free nights and one night at a reduced rate. The hotel had no problem getting our reservation correct, unlike some other reviews I read on this site. The location is great, 5 minutes from the Anne Frank House, on a beautiful canal, and next to the 9 Streets shopping area. If you are interested in going to the Anne Frank house, get your tickets on the internet before you go and you won't have to wait in line there. The hotel can sell you tickets to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. We enjoyed a half-day tour to see the windmills in Zaanse Schans and the fishing villages of Volendam & Markham. We used Lindbergh tours and highly recommend them, even though the Pulitzer deals with a different tour company.

Reviews.Title: “Is this the same hotel as some of the other reviews?”
Reviews.Author: UKgooner
Reviews.Content: Slightly bemused by the mixed reviews - luckily I didn't check tripadviser before booking. My second visit, and both times I was pleased with the service and the room. I agree with comments about value - some of the rooms can be small for the money, and i did move rooms because of this, but it is a very old building, so the character compensates. The beds are usual starwood quality ie. excellent. Location is ideal - in one of the nicest parts of Amsterdam, and they have their own canal boat for tours. Not a sensation, but I still like it, and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovelyhotel & staff, expensive breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Newsy7
Reviews.Content: A very clean friendly hotel within about 10 minutes walk of the main square in Amsterdam, tram stops available at the end of the street. On arrival the reception staff were very helpful and were able to provide good local information and maps. Room was light and airy and the bed was probably the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Breakfast was buffet style and the breakfast cost was my only reason why I did not rate this hotel higher. I would recommend this hotel for any visitor who wants to see central Amsterdam and stay in style, I will be staying again however will probably eat at the nearby cafe's and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but not as good as i expected”
Reviews.Author: stephers84
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for one night of our six night break for a wee bit of luxury. i was looking forward to it for ages but when it came to it, it wasn't any better than the hotel we had just left. The room was small and the bathroom was tiny! The paint work was shabby and part of the bathroom pannelling was falling off which isn't what i expected for luxury collection hotel. There were no tea/coffee making facilities either. Good points were the location- right in the center on one of the canal. The bed was amazing too, it almost cancelled out the bad points. Nice bar, the cocktail list was good and the food was more reasonable than i was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experience again!”
Reviews.Author: bolts
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Pulitzer, mainly because of their location, style of rooms and most important.. they allow small dogs :) We came with our chihuahua this time and stayed a consecutive 11 days and loved every minute. This was during the gay festival, a very busy time. Make use of the concierge, he was very professional and helpful with all sorts of restaurant suggestions, steering us away from most tourist traps. Although a little pricey, I would go back if it was a shorter period.

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: devious0ne
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in July with my family as we where heading to my wedding in Norway. Let me tell you that after a 22 hour flight and 7 hours in layovers, the hotel service and staff is by far above and beyond. Okay Let me start, I arrived at 7:30 in the morning and my room was available immediatly. The room I stayed in was freshly painted and remodeled. The A/C- Well I live in hawaii so fresh air was great. The front desk, bell staff, and the waiter staff, literaly go above and beyond service to see you smile. Saide - the bellman is the man to go to for any questions you might have about dining, drinks, etc. etc. its amsterdam. I would like to give a personal thanks to David (the night time orderly) for making my stay the most memorable, with the 3:00am room service. I think I say this for everyone in my party that we wish we could have sit down and had a few drinks with you, and not in a gay way. The only thing I wanted to address was that the concierge Shawn I think is his name a very tall, slender blonde hair individual in his late 20 or early 30's. He was very rude and a cold individual I noticed through out my stay. The thing about this hotel is that its like a maze, but lined with artwork and as my feet already had blisters from sightseeing everything amsterdam had to offer. The weather started to take a turn for the worst with a cold down pour at 67 F . I asked this gentelman for an umbrella as he had 4 of them behind the desk and told me he didnt have any, and insisted I go to my room to get an umbrella in the closet. Well there is only one and if you have 2 people staying in your room, well i dont think i need to do the math. I pointed this out to him then he insisted he didnt have any left. (But there was 4 of them behind you) Other than that, I still give this hotel a 5 and still want to point out that the staff is very friendly, and helpful, and I will be returning to this hotel in November.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: rickyxx
Reviews.Content: After 25 visits plus to Amsterdam we were pleased to get a great deal for the Pulitzer which has always been out of the price range I want to pay for a short city break. The room was small for a 5 star hotel but bigger than most I have stayed at in Amsterdam. Bathroom was good size and the bed was massive! Very helpful staff and I have to say the choice at breakfast was superb, a full cooked or continental buffet is available together with breads, pastries, fresh fruit juices, meats and salmon! Only downside is that the courtyard is used as a smoking area by guests because of the new smoking ban so if you are unfortunate you may find people disturbing your sleep in the morning at 6.00 am, they were drinking champagne however which may have contributed to the noise! Overall I would go again at the same price of Â£125 a night, the hotel tarrif listed in the room was 525 euros per night for 2 with breakfast. ouch!!

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Pulizter Hotel - Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Worcs
Reviews.Content: You really feel you are in Amsterdam staying here, standard rooms are not huge but the character of the place makes up for this. Friendly and efficient staff, excellent location 5/10 mins to Dam Square area and 15 min walk in the other direction to the museums and shopping areas. The area around the hotel is definately upmarket, away from the noise and tourists of the more lively areas. I walked everywhere, didn't need to take public transport once. The only negatives I could find - the gym is tiny only 4 or 5 machines and the food is OK not brilliant but overall I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. Good value for money for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “they don't know how to say "no"”
Reviews.Author: jandsboston
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nites at the Pulitzer this july--couldn't be better ! Fabulous location, wonderful room with top level amenities in every respect, and one of the most pleasantly staffed property we've ever enjoyed. Front desk/concierge/floor staff could not do enough, and always with a smile. Big bucks, and worth every penny. sandjboston, newton, ma.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: aandrontheroad
Reviews.Content: The hotel was delightful, staff very helpful and courteous, and the location fantastic! We wish that we could have stayed longer! We also had a two level room.The hair dryer was in a strange place - attached to the desk drawer, The big problem with that was that the desk was on the 2nd level, accessed by a ladder type stair - very inconvenient. However, I requested a hair dryer and one arrived within minutes, so no problem. Breakfast buffet was very good, and all in all the stay was a lovely experience. Travelers from Columbia,MD

Reviews.Title: “Not a prize-winning hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Noodles79
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hotel Pulitzer. I mainly chose the property for it's location (I used to live in the neighborhood and absolutely love the area). Unfortunately, my recent trip to Amsterdam followed two stays at true five-star hotels. 5 Issues: 1. It's overpriced and they charge you for everything. When you request a "canal view room," be aware that even if it is available and the hotel is not full, they will still charge you for the view and not even consider a courtesy upgrade. 2. The front-desk staff is friendly, but makes a lot of mistakes. They seem to be a little behind on information regarding your reservation (what is the point of calling Starwood to update your credit card info if they aren't going to update the system and you have to do it again with the front desk person?). There was a lot of confusion around what my reservation entailed (breakfast, payment with reward points, people in the room) and I had to correct them about not having breakfast, not paying with reward points, and being the only one in the room. 3. The rooms are in desperate need of renovation. How odd is it to get the same room twice? Well I did, and since staying in it 3 years ago, not a single thing changed. I was surprised to find chipping paint in the bathroom (which is also poorly lit). 4. It's not really all that clean. My first hint that the cleaning staff wasn't up to speed was when they knocked on my door at 11 am and I requested another hour and they rolled their eyes at me. In addition to their attitude, cobwebs and dust were prevalent and the only thing that changed from day to day was a made bed. Turn down service didn't even include a foot mat after my first day and I had to request a room service breakfast menu from reception when they didn't leave one after the first day. 5. It's not really all that luxurious. The bathroom is not grand and fabulous (where's the spacious tub, state of the art shower, flat-screen tv, and comfy chairs that are synonymous with luxury???). The bed is comfy...but that's about it. 3 Positive Aspects: 1. The location. You can hear the bells of Westerkerk and the canal location is exquisite. You are inside the centrum, which is key and you can walk everywhere. 2. The concept. Staying in a canal house is an experience and makes the hotel very unique and Dutch. 3. Some staff members. The room service staff and bar staff were friendly and professional, not to mention prompt and courteous. Overall, it's not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not great considering the advance communication and the price”
Reviews.Author: Lisenboathouse
Reviews.Content: I had communicated 6 months in advance, requesting Canal side room with access to elevator as my travelling partner was my 76 year old mother. Confirmed in email by the hotel for this advance request. Yet, arrived on date planned. Arrived at 11:00 am and requested early check in but no early check in available unless willing to pay for an additional night. Declined early check in. Assured by front desk room would be availlable by 3 pm which is the check in time. Sat and waited 4 hrs, came to desk to get checked in at 3 pm, no canal room available and no other room available at check in time. Promised room would be available as soon as possible. At 4:00 pm again addressed the desk, they then decided to "upgrade our room to an executive room" and we were escorted. For a 5 star hotel, this behavior is intolerable. I will never stay at this chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Seaplus
Reviews.Content: We loved the Pulitzer and will stay there whenever our travels take us to Amsterdam. If you are not able to climb a few stairs--don't stay here. That's the summary--here are the details: Check in was flawless and, contrary to some previous postings here, the staff was warm and friendly to us (Americans, traveling with a child). We had booked an "executive" room, with a rollaway bed for our son. When they saw that my wife walks with a cane, they quickly changed us to a room that had fewer steps so that she would be less challenged by the hotel's layout. They were gracious throughout. On arrival to the room, we were in the attic room of the canal house next to the building in which the lobby is located. We took an elevator to the third floor, and then walked down a hallway which ended in a stairway that went up six steps or down six steps--almost like you had to ascend to the 3.5 floor, or descend to the 2.5 floor. It had a Harry Potter-at-the-train-station feel. The reason for this is that the hotel consists of many townhouses which have been combined into a hotel--no two rooms in the entire hotel are alike, and the reason for the many stairs is that the floor levels in houses that did not originally connect were not at the same level--hence the need to go up or down a few steps while passing from one building to the next. It is rather maze-like, and you do need to be able to go up or down a few steps, possibly several times, in your path between the lobby and your room. It is for this reason that I do not recommend this hotel if you have mobility problems, use a walker or cane or any sort of other assistive device, have difficulty climbing stairs. They probably do have a few rooms exactly on elevator levels, but I personally wouldn't count on it in this hotel--avoid disappointment and book elsewhere. The room itself was great. No closet, but a big freestanding wardrobe in an alcove. Safe was in the wardrobe. Refrigerator with minibar stuff in it. Cable TV. Bed was great. Rollaway was comfortable, but it was tight moving about the room when the rollaway bed was unfolded. Given that we were in the executive room, I venture to guess that it would be VERY tight in a standard room if a rollaway bed were in use--but there are so many rooms in the hotel, I may be wrong in this assumption. Air conditioning was effective and cooled the room nicely. Room was spotless. Bathroom was nice, decorated with Dutch tiles, very pretty. The highest water pressure I've ever had in a hotel shower, and plenty of hot water too. The breakfast buffet, as mentioned by a previous poster, was outstanding and delicious. It is VERY expensive, but was included in our room rate--I believe the price would have been something like 81 Euros total for 2 adults and 1 10-year-child. That's some serious cash! If you have a way to get it included in your room rate, I recommend that you do so. The Prinsengracht (that's the canal that the hotel is located on) neighborhood is very safe to walk around at any hour, there is a tram stop about 2 minute's walk down the Prinsengracht, there is a big grocery store (Albert Hein) 3 minute's walk, the Anne Frank House is less than 5 minute's walk away (on the Prinsengracht as well), and the Hop-On Hop-Off Boat tour stop is on Prinsengracht too, about 3 minutes walk away. There are a ton of good restaurants in the neighborhood including the famous Pancake Bakery (about 5 minutes walk further down Prinsengracht beyond the Anne Frank House), and a nice little restaurant serving great Dutch food about 30 seconds walk from the front door of the Pulitzer--it's called "Bij Ons" (pronounced Bee-YAWNS). Highly recommended. Amsterdam public transportation is outstanding--I highly recommend that you do NOT rent a car--parking is impossible, gas is a fortune, and between the trams and buses, you can get anywhere. You can buy a "strippenkarte" (a multi-ride transport pass) at the Albert Hein grocery store, as well as pre-made sandwiches, pre-cut-up apples, oranges, carrots, and all the supplies you might want for a picnic or to take on a train ride if you take a day trip. Speaking of day trips, the tram on the corner can take you directly to the central station in about 10 minutes, where you can then board a train to practically anywhere in the country, or to the airport. If you have only a little luggage, you could take the train from the airport to the central station, and then take the tram to within half a block of the hotel. We took the Connexxion bus from the airport directly to the Pulitzer--you buy the ticket at the airport and it's a LOT cheaper than a taxi; it's an 8-passenger van with possibly a stop or two before your hotel. Americans may recognize the concept if I say "Blue Van/ Super Shuttle" All-in-all, except for the stairs which might make moving around the hotel to be physically challenging, I can't think of anything about this hotel that I can criticize, or that might cause me not to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: Beaverhousen
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Pulitzer early in the day and I do agree with a previous post that the front line staff come off a little brisk and irritated ( with Americans...I don't know but I did not feel welcomed). We didn't get our room despite informing them we were coming in an hour or two earlier. That being said, I have to say that the Prinsengracht location, the unique canal house feel to the place and the other staff made this such a wonderful stay. The a/c was a little warm-ish but that was because we had a large canal room with a really high ceiling and it we had a few hot days. Coming from Frankfurt though, this was still a big improvement. The weather cooled a little towards the end of our week and it was perfect. A friend had dropped off season tkts to the museums and the front desk lost them. Lisa, the supervisor came through with shining colors. She was efficient and found them. In the meantime, she provided us with museum tkts and did everything to make us very happy. The breakfast buffet was fabulous and the staff was so friendly and helpful. We spent almost a week but by day 3 they recognised us already. The housecleaning staff is excellent. They were kind, helpful, prompt and efficient. We got our fill of the complimentary delicious stroop wafels and water they put in the room everyday. The safe and great location could not be beat. It was nice to stay somewhere where we could walk to lovely shops, wonderful restuarants (Long Pura and Moeder's can't be beat!), nice sights, the canal boats, etc..There is even a dry cleaners round the corner from the hotel too. We never tired of walking. There was always something worth seeing over the bridge or around the corner. The location is very central and is only 10 mins by cab to the train station, 20 mins to Arlanda Airport. Despite a few hiccups, I'd definitely stay here again, would recommend it to friends and the Trip Advisor community.

Reviews.Title: “if it wasn't free, i would never have been there.”
Reviews.Author: angrysamoan
Reviews.Content: So, we used starwood points, otherwise we would never have been able to afford to stay at the Pulitzer. The front line staff exhibit a disdain for American tourists. The cleaning and restaurant staff though are excellent. I would not have paid money to stay here. Plus, I don't think I could afford the rates. The airconditioning did not work and when we called the front desk at 2am, we were told that many rooms' air con were not working. We could not change rooms until the following day. The concierge and the valet all seemed to give us wrong information at some point. They were lazy and did not want to check and validate their information. The business center internet is free. So, they don't completely nickel and dime you. The breakfast is amazing, I seriously can't get over how amazing it is. I have never seen something so tasteful. They really know how to do that right. The rooms were blah. The decorating was bland. At least the art work wasn't tacky prints. The beds were comfortable. The "art" in the gallery near the lobby was tacky. No pool, spa or anything of the like.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a five star, not really luxurious”
Reviews.Author: josensd
Reviews.Content: By no means this is a five starr hotel, although the price says it is. Not in service, not it ammenities or facility. The bed was comfortable, there is a bose wave radio in the room, but other than that, nothing else was out of the ordinary. Be prepared to pay extra for anything else. THere is wirless internet in the room, but pay extra 20 euros a day or 5 euros for an hour. There is room service, but you have to pay extra for it. Briging ice to the room is considered room service if you want to buy anything from the minibar. The location is very nice though. Away from the noise and very safe and clean area of the city and at a walking distance to all the important sites.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected, but nice”
Reviews.Author: phalex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer some time ago (August of 2007) so some memories are lost. This will be short: 1) The Staff: Did a good job, answered questions as they should have, but did not got out of their way to be helpful. I'd give them 3 points out of 5 2) The location: Very good; convenient and upscale neighborhood. We had a friend that stayed in a neighborhood closer to the red light district, and let me say...we spent a lot more time in our neighborhood. Lots to see in walking distance. Give the location a 5. 3) The Food: Great buffet breakfast can not be missed. we didn't have any other meals there, but the breakfast was top notch for a buffet. Give the food a 4.5. 4) Amenities/little touches: interesting layout, a bit of a maze, but that made it quieter and more intimate. We arrived to our room with a gift of a bottle local liquor...a whiskey, and it was very tasty. Free waters in the rooms. They have their own canal boat for tours and private use which is nice but pricey. Amenities and attention to detail, 4.5 5) The Room: Room is small, but that is the norm for Amsterdam apparently (when our friend came over he said his room was "pretty much the size of our bathroom...no, seriously!"). We were on the first floor on the canal, but was a bit noisy from road noise and some construction work being done. In fact, there was this big green work trailer parked in front of the canal by our window that turned us off a bit. Give the room a 3. All in all, a good place to stay, but maybe a little too much to pay for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Way Out of Our Price Range”
Reviews.Author: ElJayBee
Reviews.Content: Mr. ElJayBee and I enjoyed a wonderful 3-night stay at the Pulitzer in early May. If it wasn't free on Starwood points, we never would have been able to afford it, as the "rack rate" for the room was about $750/night. We had room 105, a 2-story suite with just about every amenity you can imagine and a canal view. The bed was heavenly. The location was perfect, just a few blocks from the Anne Frank House and within walking distance to everything we needed. The service at the Pulitzer is top-notch. The breakfast buffet (included for free with our executive room) was nicely laid out with an assortment of breads, rolls, sweet breads, waffles, pancakes, eggs, bacon, mushrooms, tomatoes, cold meats, cereals, fruit and more. It's about 27euro/pp though, so if on a budget (well...you wouldn't be staying at the Pulitzer!), take a left out the front door of the hotel and walk to the corner, where a cute little cafe serves breakfast all day for about 5euro/pp. My only complaint with our room, and it was actually part of its charm as well, was having to navigate a steep staircase to get from the bed to the bathroom in the middle of the night. That, and the bathroom light may have been on some sort of timer or motion-detector thing because twice, in the middle of a shower, the lights in the bath turned off completely!

Reviews.Title: “Great service at Starwood's Hotel Pulitzer in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: WhippetsRule
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at the Hotel Pulitzer. The rooms were excellent and I loved the historical aspect of the hotel.. constructed by taking lots of canal facing historical homes in Amsterdam and stringing them together with lovely atriums and gardens. Fantastic concierge services and all the help was very friendly. Everything was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: vicki1812
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in May 08, in an executive canal room. Good stuff The location is the best in Amsterdam, away from the noise and sometimes seedy side of Amsterdam. The hotel is situated on a quiet picture postcard canal and our room (282d) had lovely views of the canal on the 'back entrance' and the houses with big tall windows and was light and sunny - worth staying here for location alone - only the Dylan would compare if you want quiet and upmarket residential area. Staff were friendly and most were helpful Great restaurants and bars nearby - would recommend the Koh i Noor indian around the corner - book in advance as it is small and well used by locals. Bed was superb - very comfortable, excellent linens and choice of pillows. Room very clean and housekeeping did provide turndown service etc Lots of hot water, marble bathroom good shower & tub and plenty of toiletries refreshed daily. Towels soft and plentiful Did the hotel boat trip - went for 11am sunday which was quiet and wonderful and much better than the big tour water buses - worth the extra Food at b/fast was excellent although it did get very busy Bar was excellent although pricey, service very good. Free internet access and printing in the business centre - ideal for online check in conceirge helpful Disappointing Whilst we had a good stay the hotel did not live up to 5 star expectations. The room was very small by luxury standards and the bathroom very very small - also it just did not seem like a 5 star hotel - great location but lacking in finess and service. The room was dated and showing signs of wear and tear - and this was very true of the whole hotel - lots of scuffed walls and dated carpets and the reception needs remodelling - we did ask to change rooms to something larger and more 'luxurious' but were told that ours was one of the best executive rooms - and we were shocked! As the hotel was full then no upgrades were available Due to the lack of soundproofing noise travels and we had noisy neighbours next door and above us which impacted on sleep. Our trip was a special occasion and we had booked champagne and flowers - neither of which were there on arrival and had to be chased - eventually delivered the next day - and the champagne was only a half bottle which was very mean - however the booking option does not say a full bottle but for the difference in price I had assumed it would be! Due to the hotel being full, which it seems to be every weekend, and offers on for cheaper b/fasts before 9am then the best time seems to be about 9.45 am - peak time is 11am, and b/fast is served until 1pm on the weekends. Food was very good and plentiful (with freshly squeezed OJ) but the service struggled to keep up on saturday and sunday morning - monday was much better for service as a whole and I guess that during the week is much better and quietier. However they do have great coffee and lots of choices on the buffet. Overall a reasonable stay, not 5 star (perhaps somewhere between 4-4.5) but the location and the bed/linens would mean that we would re visit - but would book well in advance to get the best rate - if you wait the rate only goes up! We left it too late and paid too much for what we got. If you were getting this hotel 'free' with points it would be a bargin espiecally if you could get a canal view room - however if booking again I would state a room on a high floor as the canal can be noisy at weekends with the locals taking to their boats.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: JPinZRH
Reviews.Content: Everything with this stay was not luxurious. Room was small and cramped even though I had been 'upgraded' as a Starwood Platinum member. Food was sub-par and overpriced. Room service was never delivered. Bath amenities cheap and flourescent lighting in the hallways!!!!! Staff didn't answer phone calls. Service was non-existent. If you have high standards and expectations, don't settle for this property stay at the Dylan. Truly a foul and overpriced experience. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: polija
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hotel Pulitzer and I just love this hotel. It is in a great location with easy access to many of the tourist sites. The front desk staff were helpful and courteous when we checked in. We paid using Starwood points and did not find this to be an issue at all. The concierge staff at the hotel is wonderful. They helped us with planning a day trip to the Keukenhof Gardens -- which is amazing and definitely a 'must see'. They recommended two great restauarnts within a short walking distance from the hotel (Bloem and Proeverij 274). Both of these restaurants were fantastic. And we also did one of the guided bike tours organized through the concierge. This was a great experience as well -- the guide was knowledgeable and we truly enjoyed our time with him. During our stay at the Pulitzer we took the boat ride offered by the hotel and that was a nice excursion as well. The bar in the hotel is great and is a nice spot to relax after a day of sightseeing. We also had the breakfast buffet which is a little expensive for 27 euros a person but the convenience can't be beat. The quality of the food is good and the staff were very pleasant. I would highly recommend this hotel and will be staying there every time I travel to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Pitch26
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in March of 2008 to celebrate my Birthday. I was really hesitant in booking since the reviews online were very mixed but since I was using points and the room was free I wanted to make my own judgement. They listed things like the hotel being not nice to customers booking with starwood points, mold in the bathroom, rooms being small, no drawer space, noisy on the canal side, hearing people walk above them, mice, food poisioning etc. I have to say with all honesty that I am a very picky person when it comes to the hotels I stay in and expect alot whether I am using points or paying for the room. I did not find one of these things listed to be accurate. We arrived at 7:15am from America after being on a flight all night with little sleep. The hotel gave us a room until our room would be ready after 3pm. They didn't have to do that - as a matter of fact most hotels would have just offered to hold the luggage. I found every person from the front hotel desk to the concierge nothing but nice. They treated us like they couldn't do enough for us. We were using starwood points. Having a bad back I requested a room all on one level without stairs near the elevator. We were upgrated to an executive room facing the canal. The room was beautiful. They called after we went up to make sure we liked it and to ask if there was anything they could do for us. They knew it was my Birthday and even left me a present which was a very nice touch. There are also 2 bottles of complementary water in the room. There wasn't much drawer space but I felt there was plenty and I bring everything but the kitchen sink. The bathroom had heated floors, the shower pressure was great and the water really hot. Plenty of towels and amenities were left daily and replaced. They came in every night to turn down the beds, left us chocolate and a cookie and turned the radio on very low. The beds were super comfortable. They even left a note with pillow choices. I hated to leave the room. I looked for all the dirt people talked about in their reviews but didn't find any - I also didn't see any mice. I have also posted pictures so you can see the room - it was room 704. The conceirge made all our dinner reservations which were excellet. Two of the places we went were The Dylan and Moeders all in walking distance. This area is the Jordan district. Its very safe and quiet at night. We took a day trip to Brugge - they printed all the train schedules out for us and brought them to the room. The converter I had didn't seem to be working so I made a request to borrow one - they had it up to me in less than 5 minutes! I travel alot and can be very critical when it comes to judging places - the service here was excellent. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't speak for the food, but we found a great place for breakfast right around the corner. There is also a great bar at the other corner. We spend a considerable amount of time there. This hotel is about 6 blocks from Dam square so its convenient to everything. The tram is 1/2 block away but since its a very pretty town we walked most of the time even though we had bought a train pass. I highly recommend the private canal tour the hotel offers. It was worth every penny of the 38 euro they charged per person. Our guide was so pleasant and knowledgeable I am so glad we decided to do this. We also went to the Ice cold bar, Anne Frank House, Dam Square, Red Light District, Flower market, Rijksmuseum, Alpert and Waterlooplein Markets and many other places all within walking distance or a short tram ride. I will tell you though that you must be careful of bikes, there are more of them than cars so be mindful when crossing the street. This was my second time to Amsterdam. The first time I stayed closer to the Dam area which was noisy. This location was great because with a short walk you can get to all the action but also get a good nights sleep. I definately recommend this hotel and would even stay here again even if I had to pay for the room.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: wineglobelovers
Reviews.Content: We stayed on points and because of Platinum status and availability we were upgraded to a two-story loft overlooking the canal in the front of the hotel. The service was great, the location was perfect, and we loved every minute of it. There are a few scuffs here and there and if you look closely there are signs of wear and tear, but the overall experience was great. Would recommend to others, but understand that the experience may be dependent upon room choice/rate.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally comfy bed!!”
Reviews.Author: Tubster
Reviews.Content: Arrived too early for check-in ( 9a.m) but wanted to leave our bag with the hotel so that we could go exploring. The very helpful front desk lady said that was no problem and our room would be ready in an hour ! Our room overlooked an internal garden, not the canal, but as we were only there for one night it was not an issue. Bathroom was quite small, but very good shower, plenty of toiletries and towels, and two bathrobes. Highlight of the room was the bed. It was like being swallowed by a huge marshmallow! Very, very comfy with good linens. When we arrived back around 10.30p.m the bed has been turned down, the radio was playing quietly, slippers placed by the side of the bed and chocolates had been left. It's always nice when someone else does that for you! The hotel runs a boat tour with its own private boat that leaves from in front of the hotel. The boat is almost 100 years old and has been superbly restored with woods, brass and stained glass.The tour leaves at 5p.m and we arrived back around 6.25p.m. It was worth staying at the Pulitzer for this reason alone.As the boat is smaller than the larger tour boats, you can go different places and if you see something of interest, the captain is happy to stop and descibe things to you.Excellent tour. After check-out the next morning, the hotel was happy to have our bags until we left for the airport, and when we arrived to collect them, the porter remembered our name. Couldn't fault any of the staff we met, all very friendly and helpful.Room was clean, bar service excellent, hotel in great location ( far enough from the madness of Dam Square, near enough to walk). We had a great , if short, stay.

Reviews.Title: “walking up stairs in a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankfile
Reviews.Content: This hotel meets my definition of a five star hotel and obviously doesn't meet the standards of some other reviewers. First of all, the Pulitzer Hotel has a great location. Its "front door" and its "rear door" are each on beautiful canals. The hotel is a collection of 25 old and well maintained 17th century , ~ 5 story townhouses that are intricately connected (a maze). Elevators are there but we had an upgraded, canal view "executive" room (top floor with cathedral ceiling) that needed 15 attic type stairs to access! The room was a good size with marble bath and tv, but to be picky, the two single beds were lousy. Transportation (Trams 13 and 17) and a "Connection" bus are a half block away. Tour ("Key Tour") buses are a brisk 10 minute walk away. Nearby sights include the Anne Frank house and a canal boat stop for cruising and hop-on/off cruising options. The fact that our 5 night stay was essentially free (on award points) certainly made a big difference - I wouldn't/can't pay 369 euros per night for a late March, 2008, 5-night vacation!!! Drinks in their bar were 12 euros each - ouch! - with restaurant prices to match. Fortunately, there's lots of neighborhood restaurants and cafes with excellent food offerings for breakfast, lunch and dinner - some however have odd business days/hours. There is a large Catholic church and a large Protestant church in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but certainly noteworthy”
Reviews.Author: pixel79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually quite a quirky one. It consists of a number of former houses all converted into one grand hotel. As a result the place is a bit of a labyrinth and easy to get lost. The staff at the front desk, although rather slow to serve, were very friendly and extremely obliging - I was very impressed. The room itself is a good size, quite well equipped (though not perfect) and the big plus is wi-fi access in the room. The hotel have really hit the mark with the way they've implemented it. Firstly it was very reliable and "just works" from the moment you connected to it. Secondly, unlike most hotels, it was reasonably priced at â‚¬5 for an hour or â‚¬19 for a full day. I've paid up to â‚¬15 for an hour of internet access in a business hotel before so this was great. Breakfast is superb - a great spread and once again very friendly staff. All things considered I think this is my new favourite hotel in Amsterdam. Well done to the staff. Whilst I don't plan to go back to Amsterdam anytime soon, if I did then I'd certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lost its flair”
Reviews.Author: LordBenford
Reviews.Content: What a shame, having stayed at the Pulitzer for 9 years, I have to admit that the standards and service has lost its pizzazz. We stayed over the first weekend of March and I regret that this will be our last stay at this once 5 star hotel. We have had many a happy stay, but I have seen a gradual deterioration in the standards over the past 9 years. I understand that over a period of 9 years I can not expect the accommodation to not show wear and tear, however that would be acceptable if the efforts on general house keeping where maintained. Our first room was a lovely room with a canal view, unfortunately the only opening window opened onto a blank wall, due to a storm we then changed room as water was coming through the window. During our first night we never received our turndown service and started the following day with damp towels. Our second room was larger but did not look like it had been used for a little while, the surfaces were dusty, and the toilet had a mould stain from lack of cleaning. There was only 1 dressing gown which was old and torn. Its such a shame that this once 5star hotel is now really only of a standard of a 3star. I hope that the Luxury Collection will be addressing this hotel as a matter of urgency, and polish their service to when we first visited. Beware this hotel is now overpriced dirty and not giving a 5star service. There are many 4 star hotels in central Amsterdam that would offer you better value for money and we will be trying new hotels on our next visit. 9 years and at least 3 visits per year will cost this hotel and I am sure others will be doing the same. Come on Pulitzer MAKE THE EFFORT!

Reviews.Title: “The Story Behind the Gables”
Reviews.Author: Local-Beer
Reviews.Content: These old merchant houses that have been combined over the years to creat and recreat this Hotel make for wonderful reading ijn the Hotel brochure, be sure to do this. Arrival from the train station was quick and the welcome mat was out the minute I stepped out of the car. The doorman greated me and once I gave my name, remember it the rest of my stay. The front office was very courtious and the ladies are very pretty and polite. I had a package sent to the Hotel, it was waitng at reception with my check-in folio. The room assignment was quick and the room was beautiful and unusually spacious for Europe. Plenty of towels and very clean. This location is just a block from the Ann Frank House and in the neighboorhoods, so walking is a must to explore and appreciate the archectecture of the Old World. I had wanted to see the Heinekin Brewery but alas it was closed for renovation. So the Concierge sent me to the Bols Liquor on this Tuesday. Well, my one complaint, Bols is closed on Tuesday. But a great walk and I found a nice sandwich shop and a cold beer during my trek. One thing I do not normally do is take Hotel tours but the Hotel has it's own boat for a nightly canal tour with on board coctails and the Captian narrates the trip. This is worth every euro and I would not hesitate to take it again, especially if romance were in the cards. On my day of departure the Hotel had transport ready for us and we were whisked reluctantly to the airport. If you are on a tight budget this may not be the place but I found it worth more that The Grand Amsterdam, currently a Sofitel, which has previosly been my Hotel of choice in Amsterdam. Stay here and get out and expore this beautiful city and meet the people. Remember take the small glass for beer after foamed and scraped. Have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Total disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: nano80
Reviews.Content: The room was small and dusty. There is nothing luxurous int this "5 star" hotel. It deserves 3 stars, no more. The area is nice though. Nothing is for free (not even Internet that is very expensive...) When you ask for a taxi, the hotel charge on top of the bill 10 euros. They tried to charge me an extra breakfast. Anyway, don't go there for nice holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, but room can use a little dusting”
Reviews.Author: linbay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thought this hotel was "centrally located." It was close to everything, but far enough so that we don't hear all the noises. It was in a quite neighborhood with beautiful canal view rooms. The hotel has it's own character and charm, but it's nothing we would write home about. We were slightly disappointed with the room since it was not modern, but we understand that it has to maintain a cerain character. Our room has a very small spiral staircase that leads to a small loft/attic, we were very excited to see that. We took a few pictures of it when we first arrived, and pretty much never went up there again. Our favorite: Comfortable bed & Location.

Reviews.Title: “Good..... but not quite luxury”
Reviews.Author: emceeManchester
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good in many ways, it's just that I can't rave about it. The location is great, the staff were all polite & attentive, the bed (& sheets) were fabulous (reminded me of my previous trip to the Westin in New York), the breakfast was wide-ranging & plentiful. It's probably the room itself that lets down the hotel. It was quaint but also a little tired. Exposed beams add the quirkiness but the dust sat on top is a bit of a letdown. The bathroom was clumsily designed in the corner of the room & the crack in the basin & mouldy grout in the bath/shower should be attended to. One man's "luxury" is another man's "okay". My previous stay at the Urban in Madrid is poles apart from this property. That was modern, chic & new. This hotel is quaint & quirky. It's good but not luxurious. For the money you could probably find comparable accommodation elsewhere in the city. What I would recommend is the canal trip with the hotel's own small boat. It's pricier than the standard tour boats but you travel on a 100 year old (refurbished) boat, with excellent & informative information from the skipper, with alcoholic drinks whenever you wish, a must for seeing some of the canals the larger boats cannot access. Also check out the bar. The staff are friendly & gave me a good recommend for a local Indonesian restaurant, Long Pura.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect grandiose”
Reviews.Author: ritzB8
Reviews.Content: For 300 Euro a nite, this hotel was incomparable to our other hotel stay in Amsterdam. On the first day, two hours after we had checked in, we were awoken from our nap. The guy staying above our room was making so much noise and dropping things, heavy footsteps, etc. We complained to the front desk to please move us to another room. They said they would call the person staying above our room to quiet down. I said it was not his fault that we could hear everything. On our floor and upstairs, there were wooden floors with no area rugs or carpet. We stayed there two nights and couldn't wait to get out of there. We were disappointed that they did not try to accomodate us with our special request. I don't think they are a 5 star hotel as quoted. When we were checking out, we mentioned about it to another front desk person and she apologized. We suggested they lay carpets or rugs to prevent the noise. Also complained that we did not get proper rest because of the noise. I also had food poisoning from the lunch we had at the hotel restaurant, pumpkin soup with cream in it. Think the cream did it. Was laid up all day. The good thing about this hotel is the bar/lounge. The two bartenders are great. Very personable, funny and entertaining. You can tell they love their job. Check out the huge murial in the restaurant. I chose this hotel from this painting. It is a spoof on Rembrandt painting. Has graffitis, men with mickey mouse ears, rappers, etc. Great painting done by a French artist,

Reviews.Title: “A Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lighttraveller1
Reviews.Content: This would have to be one of the Starwood Hotels better Hotels. I booked this hotel through the hotel website and found it to be the cheapest prices. The hotel is made up of several former townhouses, however there is one drawback and that it is a maze to try and find your room. But if you remain a little patient and focus on how the bell boy took you there you should have no problem locating your room next time you go out. The service at this hotel was impeccable, there was no request or general query too hard for the staff and everyone made me and my wife feel very welcome and comfortable. The location is great right near the 9 streets (great shopping location) and just a couple hundred meters from the Anne Frank museum.
