I must warn that the bed are a little too comfortable and if you have a bad back you may need to ask for a board under the bed. We had to order one because of my wife's back problems, but this request was attended to immediately and didn't for one second take away the overall total enjoyable experience at the Pulitzer. The buffet breakfast was fresh and very tasty and the freindliness of the staff made this stay very enjoyable. I would suggest that you get a taxi or shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel. The cost isn't too much about 15 euro per person.

Reviews.Title: “Great on the Outside - Beware the Inside”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 3 nights. Beautiful hotel on the outside. They have combined about 25 historic old buildings together to form a sprawling hotel with courtyards and gardens at the center. I am a Starwood Platinum member and checked in assuming I would be given my upgrade to the "best available room" (this wording according to policies by Starwood). I had reserved a Deluxe room. They said they were upgrading me to an "Executive Room" because of my status. The room didnt appear to be any different than the room i had booked. Because these are old historic buildings, they are typically small rooms. I understand that, but when Starwood says you will be upgraded to the "best available room" and the hotel is not full, and it has junior suites available that are much bigger, and you have been given a small interior room with no real view, you begin to wonder. I stayed one night because I was jet lagged. But i called the duty manager the next night and asked for a larger room. At first he fed me some story about small rooms. I insisted and was about to call Starwood in the US (that usually works, by the way) and he said he would give me the junior suite. The manager acted like he was doing me a favor. But the back of my platinum card actually spells out the policies. They tried to just give me an upgrade to the next class of room, not the best class. BEWARE - if you are entitled to it and you dont make progress with the local manager, call Starwood Preferred Guest in the US. Other things to note: PROS: 2 free stroopfwaffles each day; GREAT BEDS! (some of the most comfortable i have slept in); good assortment of toiletries; plenty of electrical outlets (pet peeve when they dont have enough); helpful concierge; fashionable and good restaurant; GREAT location for walking to everything; BEAUTIFUL views on that canal, said to be one of the best in the city. CONS (in addition to feedback shown above): expensive wi-fi service (19 euros for 24 hours); mold/mildew in the shower areas (in both rooms i saw); repeated requests for extra towels went ignored; not very helpful valet. Other things to know: the large revolving front door is locked after midnight at some point - you need to press the green lighted button on the bellstand which then rings the night manager inside to let you in; the cafe off the main lobby is expensive for coffee - plenty of local nice places on the "9 Streets" which are literally on the next block down; concierge desk has plenty of umbrellas at their desk if you need to borrow one; lighting inside the rooms seemed a bit sparse if you like it bright; you cannot put anything in most of the room refrigerators because they are the automated mini bars where if you take anythign out it bills you -- the junior suite had a small regular refrigerator though; they have plenty of papers to choose from; some bathrooms seemed to have heated marble floors - nice on a cold morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: The_Chancellor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights in January. It is an excellent hotel in a very smart part of Amsterdam, between the city centre and the Jordaan on Prinsengracht. The rooms are very comfortable and well-equipped, if slightly smaller than one might expect, with particularly comfortable beds and a BOSE CD player which is a nice touch. You also get a good range of international TV channels. I did notice a sign that the rack rate for our room was â‚¬475/ night, we paid a fraction of that and I suspect if you had paid that you might have been disappointed. Because the house is a series of canal houses knocked together, there are some warren-like passageways particularly from the main entrance to the bar and restaurant. We didn't eat in the hotel as we had reservations elsewhere and the breakfast seemed a bit overpriced and large. Americans who seem to make up a large proportion of the clientele. There are some excellent cafes and shops within 2 minutes' walk where you can get something closer to a typical Dutch breakfast and which is well worth trying out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Woo4uk
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed three nights at the Pulitzer in January this year. It was very enjoyable. The hotel is located on the canal front in a charming area close to the "9 streets" and is well located for all of the attractions of central Amsterdam. Within easy walk of the hotel are numerous boutiques, cafes, bars and restaurants. In Particular, the cafe on the corner if you turn left coming out of the hotel is excellent for breakfast (I recommend the bacon and cheese omelette!) but if you are there on a Sunday, have a backup in mind as this place is closed. The hotel staff are friendly, helpful and very effecient. The room we had was spacious for a city centre hotel, clean and very comfortable. I had booked online via Expedia and paid in full however, the hotel then charged 5% city tax per night. This is standard in Amsterdam and worth bearing in mind. The city itself, is great. Really friendly and laid back. The famous Red Light area is tacky and a bit seedy. The same can be said of the "English breakfast " joints of Damsrak but the canal area Jordaan (near the hotel) is charming. The Netherlands is not really known for its food but we ate well in the Fiyf Fliegan (five flies) and Tempo Doelo (an brilliant Indonesian). If you are interested in Coffee Shops I would steer clear of the thoroughly awful Bulldog and try somewhere like the Grasshopper instead. Beer drinkers will love In De Wildeman Bar (Kokstrat 3?) which has 16 or 17 beers on tap and a menu of bottled beers extending to several pages!

Reviews.Title: “Wrongfully Charged for Room cancelled”
Reviews.Author: sdcruiser
Reviews.Content: We had made a very early fully refundable reservation to stay at the Hotel Pulitzer through a travel agent but had the travel agent cancel the reservation a couple of months before our arrival date because we had a found a better deal. Though our travel agent promptly cancelled the reservation, the Pulitzer still charged us and refused to credit us despite the fact that they could provide no documentation to explain their position . It was not until months later that the credit card company resolved the matter in our favor. I am shocked at the way this matter was mishandled by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location! great seervice! would reccomend!”
Reviews.Author: seattlemufc
Reviews.Content: loved the location. a bit expensive and I'm glad i only had to pay $90 a night plus starwood points. minutes walk away from the Anne Frank house and dam square. nice restaurant. they have their own canal boat although didn't use it as i thought the ride was a bit expensive. I recommend a canal view room. would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: RobbertS
Reviews.Content: *I stayed 2 times in this hotel in a Royal Suite the last months and it is in 1 word GREAT!! *It is in the middle of the city centre, next to the shopping, main attractions. *The rooms are absolutely excellent, spacious and clean! *The staff is helpfull as they can be! When they charged me accidentally for my breakfast, the reception took it of my bill immediately!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: kebpitt7
Reviews.Content: Pros: Wonderful room, fantastic bed and bedding, very clean, bright and beautiful interior Cons: I booked the hotel 3+ months in advance. As a Platinum Starwood member, I am to be upgraded if the rooms are available. Upon check-in, I was told there were no upgrades available. I later learned this was not the case. All in all, still a great hotel. However, this is not a 5-star (especially in terms of service) along the lines of a Ritz or Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: Gammydodger
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well located about 1/4 mile from the Anne Frank house. All the central areas of Amsterdam were walkable. The staff in reception were polite and efficient however our room was not ready when we arrived at 2pm which was a little disappointing. The hotel is a row of houses on the canal and is a little maze like to get to our room, but the room was gorgeous, we had an attic room with exposed beams. The bedding was sumptuous and the bathroom was great. Ordered room service one evening and that was excellent too. There are very good bars and restaurants on the same street as the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nan_22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the renovation of old traditional houses; that is the characteristic that makes it unique. Outside it looks like the rest picturesque neighborhood, but inside it combines this traditional feature with a modern art gallery. Our room was an executive room with canal view, which was really very romantic, especially in the night, and it was large for an Amsterdam's hotel. The service was excellent and the people were really helpful. When we arrived our room was not ready and we have to wait for about half an hour, but due to that, they offer us drinks at the bar (very atmospheric bar) at that time and on another occasion, a small gift from the hotel, bath cosmetics and many apologies. The concierge was very helpful with the booking of good restaurants. The hotel is located in a very nice quiet area which is close to the city center, abt 10minutes on foot. I think the location is much better than staying in the city center where there is a lot of noise and traffic. It is also next to Anna Frank's museum and the canal boat's station.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mozza47
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton "Luxury Collection" Pulitzer is a block full of old city houses connected together to form an eclectic mix of rooms. It's a bit of a rabbit-warren; and easy to get lost. But there's always impeccably presented staff present to escort you up and down sets of stairs, around corridors to your 'lost' room! It is on a canal, a couple of hundred metres from 'Anne Frank House' and easy walking distance of everything in central Amsterdam. Car-parking by the valet was offsite, and required 15 minutes notice, but on the couple of ocassions we called for our car, it was always waiting at the door. Be sure to rent a very small car if you must have one here ;-}. One of our best city hotel experiences in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Luxury”
Reviews.Author: traveljack1
Reviews.Content: Should have written long ago on a wonderful trip to Amsterdam. My "friend" is quite the cannibis conniseur, and had a blast, but I was there strictly for some luxury relaxation and escapism. This was THE place for it. Room services including cleaning and food services were seamless and efficient!. Our room faced the front of the hotel ( and was nearly directly over the front entrance with a generous view of the canal Prinsingract--sp? It was late fall and a little cool but everything about the hotel spelled deluxe. Our room was VERY large for a standard room and was about 200euros nightly but well worth it. We were afraid we were going to be stuck with the average "European Suite" the itty bitty room with the giant price, but not so. It could see how difficult it would be for a physically challenged person to navigate for there were many, many steps up and down through the connected houses as you moved toward your room. The room was well worth it however. The bath was all marble with a rainshower head sprayer and a couple of other fixtures there that I havent ever seen since elsewhere. The turn down service was timely as well. The hotel restaurants were VERY expensive and so we ventured down to Dam Square for good eats of all different nationalities. Overall, the cleanliness, classic style and spaciousness of the hotel room and general helpfulness of the staff made this hotel stay worth the price. I would stay here again in the warm season and request the same room for a fabulous view!

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate service”
Reviews.Author: nightcrowler
Reviews.Content: If I need to say just one thing about this hotel, it is the service. That is what makes this hotel so well-reputated. The rooms are fine and well maintained. I was upgraded to a room with a canal view, and both the room and the view were so nice. The room was relaxing, the bathroom was perfect, the housekeeping was more than perfect. Also, the hotel staff at the breakfast room were all very kind and polite and attentive. Before my this trip to Amsterdam, I was in London and stayed at Sanderson and now I can easily judge that there was no service or housekeeping at that Sanderson hotel at all (I posted a review). If I ever go to Amsterdam again, I would definitely stay at this Pulitzer hotel again. Any downside? Well, very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarieUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break in Amsterdam. My husband booked the trip for my birthday, and as usual we used TripAdvisor to research the hotels, and once again it came up trumps. The hotel Pulitzer is located (in our opinion) in an ideal location. It is a 5minute walk to Dam Square & all the other sights are within walking distance, yet it is away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre, yet well placed surrounded by bars, cafÃ©'s and restaurants. Room: We had an executive room which had a split level with two further beds in the loft area, accessed by stairs. This room would be ideal for a family, but not with very small children as the stairs were fairly steep. We didn't use this part of the room, but it made the rest of the room nice and airy with exposed beams in the ceiling. The bathroom was fairly small, but not a problem, lovely toiletries were provided. The room itself was great and we had views out over the gardens. Hotel Staff: Very polite and helpful. When we arrived our room wasn't ready (we were early) so they offered for us to leave our bags (checked in with a ticket) and provided us with a map and pointed out some local sights. When we returned our room was ready and our luggage followed 5mins later. Staff were always happy to offer their personal recommendations on restaurants. Breakfast: Superb, one of the best breakfasts we have experienced whilst travelling in Europe. There was a lot of choice and we never needed lunch! Sights: Visited the Anne Frank House (very moving) & the Heineken Brewery (good value and fun). Would stay in this hotel if we were to return to the city City Tax - beware, if you book through Expedia etc you need to pay a city tax on check out. Although this wasn't a great amount, when the rooms are fairly expensive, it wasn't expected, would have been nice to know about this on check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: gilwong
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel considering it is a collection of old houses (which is part of the charm). The hotel is next to a canal and in a trendy area of Amsterdam. Service is excellent and the beds are very comfortable. We had a room with a loft. The main floor had a double bed and the loft had two single beds. The staircase to the loft was steep and difficult to navigate. All tourist attractions are within walking distance. Overall, I recommend staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, charming hotel, wonderful staff...”
Reviews.Author: traveler2307
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer for two nights, and would have loved to have stayed longer! Immediately upon arrival at the hotel, we were impressed by the level of service. At check-in, Dominique at the concierge desk offered our daughter a complimentary backpack with treats and notebook inside...we were charmed from the start. Our room was beautiful, overlooking the canal. It wasn't huge, but plenty big for the three of us. The sounds from the street and the canal are what allow you to truly experience the surrounding area...if you are worried about smaller rooms and noise, I would recommend staying at a newer hotel near the airport. If you are interested in soaking in the charm of the Netherlands, Amsterdam and the Jordaan district, do not hesitate to stay at the Pulitzer. We had an unfortunate illness during that time as well and the hotel staff were very helpful in getting us immediate assistance to the hospital. They inquired after us and allowed us late checkout later that afternoon. I would recommend the hotel's canal boat tour; the boat was originally used to tour Winston Churchill around the city after the war, and after a seven year refurbishment is just beautiful. I would recommend the Hotel Pulitzer to even the most discerning travelers and I know that we cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Canal View”
Reviews.Author: MintChip17
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our five night stay at the Pulitzer. Our room had a very nice view overlooking the canal, though i need to point out that we were originally brought to a much less desirable room in the back of the hotel with absolutely no view (unless you count rooftops). While the first room was no doubt given to us to accommodate the roll-away for our 12 year old, we were happy to sacrifice on space to end up with a smaller though more impressive room with a view in the front of the hotel (and lucky the hotel could make a room switch during such a busy time). Although the bathroom was a bit small, the room was well appointed with all the necessities and a very comfortable bed. The concierge desk was very helpful in assisting with dinner recommendations and other activities. Overall the hotel is very nice and in a great location and has one of the best buffet breakfasts you could ever expect to find in Europe. All of the staff that we encountered (houskeeping, restaurant, front desk, etc.) were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Deeply disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fruitcat
Reviews.Content: Having booked a deluxe room at the Pulitzer, we were very much looking forward to our one night stay. However, from the moment that we had to walk through a series of corridors that got darker and more tatty the further we went, our expectations were disappointed. Finally, having lugged our suitcases up a winding and dirty staircase we got to our room. It was small and smelt very strongly of smoke. When booking, I had ticked the non-smoking preference and neither of us felt comfortable in such a smoky atmosphere. When my husband returned to reception to ask if we could change rooms, he was told we had requested a smoking room, which was untrue. The woman at front desk was unprepared to do anything to rectify the hotel's mistake other than to offer to have some air fresheners sent to the room. We were extremely unimpressed by the quality of service we encountered. Further, there was damp on the wall behind our bed, the view was of ugly air conditioning units and the bathroom was so small that you couldn't stand up to use the toilet. The high price we paid to stay here does not represent value for money as far as we are concerned and we would choose to stay at an alternative hotel in Amsterdam in future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jrou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during my first trip to Amsterdam. I was greated warmly and checked in with ease. As a SPG I was updated to a wonderful room at the end of the hallway. ALthough it wasn't a huge room by any means it was big enough for me. I did have some troubles with the in room internet connection but these were fixed by the second day. The bathroom was well appointed although the only disappointment was that the tub stopper didn't work so my luxurious soak was cut short. The hotel area is wonderful -you should definitely check out the Anne Frank house. I took a nice stroll one evening and enjoyed the canal views. I found the staff friendly for the most part and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: bobhub
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel at the start and finish of a cycling holiday and were delighted with our room. I had stayed at this hotel previously and knew that the location was perfect for us. On checking in we were offered the opportunity to upgrade to a room overlooking the canal which we accepted. This turned out to be very entertaining as the Gay Pride parade was about to start with a flotilla of decorated barges passing the window. We took lunch at the hotel as we were tired from travelling and found the service to be very poor for this standard of hotel. After being ignored for ten minutes and seeing the waiting staff attend to people who arrived after us, I had to raise the point with the manager. The food was good but the service level never rose above average. This and previous experiences show that there are far better places to eat only a short distance away. For a treat, the french restaurant Christophe will delight people who love food. This was recommended by the concierge and did not disappoint. For breakfast there are numerous small cafes where you can sit outside and watch the city awake, much better than the hotel provides. The room was spacious (room 217 - request it early!) and the decoration and fittings were of excellent quality, with a good bathroom. Other rooms I have stayed in here have not been so big, but have still had a quality feel. As a base this hotel is ideal, and we will certainly use it again. Avoid eating in the hotel or taking expensive hotel organised trips. Walk everywhere or use the excellent tram network to get the most out of your stay. The cycling part of our holiday was outstanding and we used the highly rated barge 'Elodie' (Google it) which gave us a fabulous flavour of the dutch countryside and towns. This is the only independently owned and operated barge for this type of holiday and the quality of bikes, food and service means that we will be booking a trip next year. Well done Michel!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Pulitzer!”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTN0828
Reviews.Content: A friend highly recommended the Pulitzer, so my husband and I made reservations for 4 nights, requesting no smoking room with a canal view. We checked in at 8 AM (after a transatlantic flight) and planned to check our luggage and walk around until our room was ready (check out is at noon). The friendly, helpful, reception staff recommended walking routes and nearby locations and cafes. We returned from our walk at 11 AM and our room was ready for us with everything we had requested. Our room was very big, well-appointed and comfortable, with large french windows that opened onto the canal. The location of the hotel could not be better - around the corner from Ann Frank House and a tram stop that will take you directly to the art museums, the train station, or anywhere else. You can request a coffee and tea maker to be brought to your room at no charge. The hotel provides coffee and an assortments of teas, which we highly enjoyed. The hotel had two concierges on duty at different shifts while we were there - one was a bit distant and cold. The other was fabulous. We had many , many questions and he was consistently very helpful and friendly. As other reviewers have noted, the street/canal sounds through the hotel windows can be a bit noisy, especially on the weekend nights. However, the noises of small motor boats going down the canal and pedestrians talking outside our windows didn't bother us. We slept very well. If you want quiet, consider not staying in central Amsterdam. Some friends stayed in nearby Haarlem and took the 15-minute train ride into Amsterdam each day to see the sights and enjoyed that. We liked staying in Central Amsterdam and the Pulitzer is in the Jordaan, a lovely walking area very convenient to many of the sites. We rented bikes from nearby Bike City (recommended by the friendly concierge) and enjoyed bicycling around Amsterdam and out along the Amstel River to a nearby village of OuderKerk., about 4 km outside Amsterdam. We passed old-timey windmills and lovely flower gardens. Then we rode back along the opposite side of the Amstel, and, after returning our bikes, enjoyed a good meal at a cafe across from the Westerkerk, just around the corner from the Pulitzer., ready to fall into our comfortable bed. I would recommend the Pulitzer to my friends. Next time, though, I will ask about getting a rate that includes breakfast. The free internet in the lobby is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But Not a Five Star”
Reviews.Author: DoxieMomof2
Reviews.Content: My husband is a Starwood Preferred guest and our stay at the Pultizer was on points. We spent four nights at this hotel in late June and early July 2007. Our room was on the third floor facing the canal. The room was large and well appointment. The bed was extremely comfortable. Bathroom was luxurious, but there were so many handles and trays it was hard to stand in the shower and not bump into them....it made the shower feel very narrow. We did not find our room noisy. Our only complaints were the carpeting in the hallways and the lift seemed worn and needed an update. The breakfast was extremely overpriced at 29 euro's each! When checking in, there were several trainees who wouldn't take the next person in-line until someone was there to oversee them. They did not ackowledge us or even say, "I'll be right with you." Not what you expect from a 5 star hotel. The location is great with the Anne Frank House, the tram and canal boats just a few minutes away. In addition, the free Internet downstairs was great.

Reviews.Title: “Awful stay at the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: liblaw
Reviews.Content: I just read some of the bad reviews for the Pulitzer and I couoldn't agree more. Last year the hotel was still getting raves and it's about time that the reviews reflect how bad the place really is. First off, we booked through Starwood and after flying in from New York via London the staff couldn't find our reservation. After much pleading we finally got our room. What a disaster. We didn't get is changed until the next day but at least we faced the courtyard instread of being in the attic. But as bad as that first room was the staff was terrible. The concierge consistantly gave bad advice if he gave any at all. My advice is to stay away from the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Staff requires intensive training”
Reviews.Author: InSearch0fExcellence
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is average OK, no great shakes for a 5 star hotel. My room was probably the smallest in the hotel, tiny window with a bad view of the courtyard â€“ not much bigger then the size of the bed. And make sure you are not placed too close to the lifts as I could hear them all night. Granted, the hotel is near the center and right on a canal, but these facts certainly donâ€™t make it 5 Star. My biggest complaint and the reason I am writing this is that I found the staff to be untrained, unhelpful and snooty. The issue was that I requested checkout one day prior to my scheduled departure, the person behind the counter told this was OK and no charge would be levied. However, when I did checkout the extra night charge was placed on my bill â€“ along with the fee for the entire mini bar, which I did not use. When I mentioned the mini bar the women said this happens all the time. Also, when I complained to two of the managers about the extra night no refund was offered â€“ even though I pointed out that this was discussed the previous day. To date no refund has been given and no apologies either. Now I have heard the Dutch can be cheap â€“ but bad at business? So if you decide to stay here, make sure your bill is correct AND that the information you are receiving from the staff is accurate! If you want luxury, you had better look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: kissel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Pulitzer for two nights on the first stop of our honeymoon and were plesantly surprised, especially after reading the mixed reviews on TA. The hotel is located in a great part of town, one block from a tram stop and Anne Frank house. We were upgraded to a large and beautiful canal view room. The bed was fantastic, especially after the 10 hour flight from LA. The staff was extremely helpful and professional. Although we used Starwood points for the room and therefore can't comment on value relative to other hotels in the area, we loved our stay at this unique and comfortable property and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingMidwestGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pulitzer the first week of May. It has a great location, right on the canals, and the attention to detail in the furnishings is evident. The courtyards are very nice too. But I don't think the hotel provides the service level, especially the concierge's desk, to justify the high room rates they charge and a 5 star rating. For example, I emailed the concierge 3 days before my arrival and listed several restaurants I was interested in dining at. I said I was totally flexible regarding which night where. When I checked in, nothing had been done regarding dinner reservations. One of the concierges also seemed irritated at times when I was asking questions about transportation and specific recommendations for tourist activities on any given day. And one of the concierges didn't have a very strong command of English. A 5 star hotel concierge desk would have been all over dinner reservations, the individuals working there would all be extremely fluent in English and their attitude would be totally focused on customer satisfaction. So great hotel from an aesthetic perspective, great location, just not the best value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikkitampa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times in the last 4 years. As platinum Starwood members we were upgraded on this trip to a suite. The suite was a 2 story apartment: foyer, kitchenette, 1 bathroom, 2 bedrooms and living area. The architecture was fantastic: beamed ceilings, glasswalls - very quaint. It overlooked the canal. There were 2 adults and 3 children and it was perfect. The architecture inside and out is beautiful. We find it very appealing. The only difficult part is sometimes finding your way to your room with all of the turns and steps, etc. The service as always is so personal, friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet has the typical European fare along with some American favorites. The bar is also very relaxing with outstanding service and ambience. The location is great for sightseeing. You are very close to the Anne Frank House, Dam Square, Jordaan neighborhood, flower market, and tram stops. We also walked to Centraal Station, Rijksmuseum, VanGogh museum, Leidesplain, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityElle
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself lies along a grand canal in a beautiful and historic Amsterdam neighborhood. Everything about it is five stars...service, elegant and comfortable rooms, food, etc, etc...My husband and I went for a romantic weekend and are already getting ready to book again for the holiday season! Perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Hereford_7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 days in early June for our wedding anniversary and were very impressed. Ticked all the boxes- great location, very safe, staff amazingly friendly and very helpful in guiding us to good restaurants etc. Hotel food excellent although pricey. Room good size- ours overlooked the gardens and was obviously previously part of two of the canal houses. Despite the large number of rooms it had all the attributes of a small family hotel. Gardens are great to relax in after a days sight seeing! Overall would rate very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: londontravellista
Reviews.Content: Is worth being a member of Starwood hotels (or Hiltons, etc) as you get great offers and no exception with this hotel. Great location (check the restaurant and wonder of the big painting), close to shops (some nice original shoes, girls), great architecture, some 30min walk to Rembrandt house. Our room was located on the second floor and had to remember how to reach (involved several sets of stairs and corridors) but nevertheless was great fun. I think Ocean 11 was filmed in there, recognised the entrance, or could be wrong. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Nice Rooms, Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: TS7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pulitzer for two nights on business in early April. Check-in was about a 3 minute process, no issues. They asked if I was a member of Starwood, and I said I thought I had signed up for it, but had no ID card on me. No matter, she had my info in about 5 seconds just based on my name, very nice! Other staff interactions were with the porters, and they were very friendly, and anticipated your needs sometimes before you even had to ask. Room was small and very efficient. Nice view from the 3rd floor of the back of the building, a large courtyard with trees, flowers, and little cafe tables. Bathroom was great, one of the nicest showers (comfort, pressure, temperature) that I've used in Europe. The bed was the standard (seemingly) of most European hotels, with a comforter for a sheet, and a little lower to the ground than USA beds. They had the "pick your pillow" option, where you can get a different pillow if you'd like, but I was fine with the one's provided. The room had an internet drop, 20 euros for a 24 hour pretty fast connection. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the park in the center of Amsterdam, where the Picasso museum is. It's about a 30 second walk to the Anne Frank house. I was very pleased, and I'd consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Pulitzer!”
Reviews.Author: travelswithdiane
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just spent five nights at the Pulitzer using Starwood points. All those we encountered at the hotel treated us with efficiency and smiles, the front desk folks, the concierge, and the doorman. My friend uses a walker and they were concerned about her. They put us in room on the lobby level so she would not need stairs. We had a large, lovely, quiet, clean room off a garden. After reading some negative comments from other reviewers I was a bit concerned about what we would encounter, but as I mentioned the room was large with comfortable twin beds. Not heavenly beds as someone mentioned, but they were fine. The garden turned out to be a blessing as we were there on Queen's Day and the room/garden offered a quiet place in which to escape the crowds and noise. The bathroom had a combination shower/tub. It was difficult for us to climb in and out and the tub was a bit slippery. It was also difficult to adjust the water temperature. But, those are the only complaints of this charming hotel. We liked the location, too. The hotel is not in the center of tourist activities, but very close to the Anne Frank House and less than a block to a tram stop. We enjoyed this neighborhood and had dinner there all five nights. Many, many options of restaurants and shopping. The buffet breakfast at the hotel was very good even though at 27 euros per person it was a bit expensive for me. There were plenty of options of what to eat and there was no way I could sample it all. I especially enjoyed the hash brown potatoes that were more like potato pancakes and the hot chocolate. The service was adequate and the staff seemed busy, not rude. We liked the restaurant a lot and tried to dine there for dinner on Queen's Day, but to our disappoint they were fully booked. When I needed help using the pay phone to call my bank in the U.S., the concierge left his post to help me. As I mentioned, the staff at the hotel was great. I stay in a lot of hotels while traveling for my job. In my book, this hotel is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Way Behind the Times/Poore Service”
Reviews.Author: johnee99
Reviews.Content: I will state at the start: I am a Platinum Starwood member. I am used to getting treated nicely and for properties like the Pulitzer to go out of their way to get me an upgrade. My wife, child and I checked in and were given the noisiest (non-upgraded) room in the hotel (#209). Nice canal view, but at 4am the trucks start downstairs for 2 hours!!! Impossible. Next, the internet connection fees are outrageous, without even a free zone in the lobby. Perhaps the worst business hotel I have ever encountered from that perspective. This place is great for people in their seventies...the staff seems to reserve all of their charm for the older guests and investment bankers, but absolutely ZERO for an American family. I usually don't post reviews because I am usually not treated so shabbily, but stay away from this place unless you absolutely have to stay there. The neighborhood is great with alot of walking streets, which is the only redeeming quality at this point...especially for 300 Euros per night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK... but fabulous for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: LondonBlonde
Reviews.Content: I currently work in Amsterdam and tried many hotels between January and February whilst I was waiting for my apartment to be ready. We stayed in the Pulitzer during bad weather as we were unable to travel home due to storms... The Pulitzer is just OK - no more and no less. It's a beautiful location and has fantasic canal views. The rooms are all different - and some of them are quite odd sizes as they have been fitted into the old houses. The beds are comfy, the bathrooms nice (not all have bath tubs), nice products and the decor good general standard. It just doesn't stand up to the hype or to the price they charge. I would, however, really recommend visiting the Pulitzer for breakfast... it is an excellent buffet in a bright sunny room... love it and always take all my vistors to Amsterdam there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value for money”
Reviews.Author: pcinbk
Reviews.Content: Non-existent service, poor food, rude attitude, overwhelmed staff, noisy, stuffy rooms. Not one good thing to say except for location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent authentic Amsterdam Canal House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pineappleeurope
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Pulitzer and our stay was amazing. We were greated by a smilling doorman who carried our bags in and check-in took only minutes. We were upgraded to a delux room which was huge - big enough for an extra bed for our nine-year-old. The bath room was large with a tub - nicely furnished with marble in subtle colours. We arrived late and ordered room service dinner for us and our two kids. The food came late and the order was not correct. But after having travelled extensively all over the world I have learned that all hotels - even the best in the world - sometimes make mistakes. How you rate the hotel is based on how they correct the mistakes and I have to say the Pulitzer did great. After less than 5 minutes our order was corrected and we were not charged at all. Plus the kids got ice cream and cookies,-) Breakfast is fantastic and served in a wonderful cafe decorated with ample and unique pieces of art. The staff are kind and personal - always smiling and recognis you from day to day. The Pulitzer is not your typical chain hotel - thank god - but rather a boutique style hotel set in 24 beautiful unique canal houses along one of Amsterdams most beautiful canals. Also the area is amazing. Around you will find the 'nine streets' which are famous for the small designer shops with great Amsterdam treats. I stongly recommend 'Dutchies' - a local leather handbag designer a few streets from the hotel - once you have a custom made bag from here you will never buy LV or Gucci again. And best of all there are only five of each bag made! When in Amsterdam, Pulitzer is your choice;-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, No Negatives”
Reviews.Author: magchand
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5-night stay at The Pulitzer and it was fantastic. I was disturbed by the criticisms in some of the reviews, especially regarding rats, but was pleasantly surprised. All staff were very helpful, breakfasts superb, concierge great, rooms were spotless and well furnished. The hallways were a little dingy, but who cares. All round excellent stay and would totally go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanwSandsPoint
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Amsterdam and stayed at the Pulitzer. We loved the location, right near Anne FRank and Joordan. The people that worked in the hotel were lovely and helpful. The only negative was that the room was a liitle small.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good”
Reviews.Author: Kelly_126
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend stay at the Hotel Pulitzer with 5 colleagues. I have to say that I think the other peole who have posted on this site must have been staying at a different Hotel. The location is perfect, the staff were very helpful, the rooms were immaculate, although they varied in size, each one was clean and of the standard you would expect in a 4 star hotel. The food was great, breakfast really is worth every penny. We had a really wonderful time and would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone. At the end of the day if you aren't happy with the size of your room just ask to be moved?!

Reviews.Title: “We loved The Pulitzer.”
Reviews.Author: McCluggage
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a very relaxed break in Amsterdam having stayed at The Pulitzer for three nights. Reading some of the most recent reviews I wondered if the authors had stayed in the same hotel as we had. The hotel was first class. It was our 25th Wedding Anniversary and we had a very nice room overlooking the canal. The room was very clean and we were provided with robes, slippers etc which all contributed to our comfort.On our first evening the duty manager telephoned to ask if everything was to our satisfaction, which it was. After long days of sightseeing the room was a liittle oasis of comfort to return to. The hotel is a series of old canal houses joined together so obviously it does not have some of the features of a newly built hotel. However this all adds to it's charm and the public areas and passageways adjoining the restaurant,bar etc are all bright and airy. During our 3 days spent there staff were constantly cleaning and hoovering these areas. I was astounded by a previous reviewers criticism of the breakfast service. We can only say it was first class and relaxed. Lambert, who seemed to be the senior waiter, could not have been more helpful and always found time for a little chat with us no matter how busy he was. We were always seated immediately upon arrival , as were all other guests whom we encountered.The choiceand quality of food was first class.An example being freshly squeezed orange juice, cereals,breads etc. Smoked salmon, various types of cold meat and cheeses. Hot breakfast consisting of scrambled eggs, bacon, hash browns, mushrooms etc. We found everyone from the porters, check-in staff, conscierge, cleaners etc to be efficient and friendly. Whilst the hotel is pricey it is worth paying for that extra comfort and attention and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: J01970
Reviews.Content: Really dissappointed with this Hotel. It was clean, comfortable and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly, but the rooms were SOOO small. If you are looking for a hotel in a beautiful setting away from the hustle and bustle of Dam Square then I would recommend it, but beware inside the hotel is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pulitzer is a Filthy, Filthy, Filthy luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsDollar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a weekend visit to Amsterdam. We were so excited as my partner had stayed there before just after it was renovated and was impressed. We could not recommend this hotel to anyone in its current state and it desperately needs to be renovated, cleaned and extra staff hired. 1) Check in was prompt but the staff didnâ€™t smile or welcome us 2) The room at first seemed cozy but there was a layer of dust on all the furniture like it had not been cleaned 3) We requested a quiet room but we got the noisiest next to the main entrance and a window next to the entrance was above the bed 4) One bottle of water supplied between two people so for the price it was a bit mean for two people to share one bottle 5) We went to the bar for the last drink the first impression was that it was dirty so we had no choice but to sit at a dirty table, then the waiter came to wipe the table and wiped the dirt on top of us. We ordered wine and it was terrible (like the bottle was opened for a month) Then the waiter was really pushy with the bill but we wanted to order another drink. 6) On the way back to our room the receptionist was carrying blankets and duvets in the public lift even though there is a service lift (lifts only hold about 2 people) 7) The worst of all was the breakfast; it was filthy like a garbage bin. There are notices up to go to breakfast between 7am-11am (as far as I remember the times) as it gets extremely busy after these times. So we went down at 10. I was shocked. There was 2 staff in the entire restaurant so there was a 0 star service. Again, the tables were filthy and the waiter wiped it on top of us (previous dirt was in the grooves on the table already and smelled terrible). There was nothing on the table and it took 30 minutes for someone to come and ask us did we want something to drink no chance for us to grab any one to order morning coffee! The coffee was like tar. There were no glasses to get orange juice then when they finally came direct from the dishwasher a couple of people burned their hands â€“ OJ, hands and hot glasses don't mix well. Next came the cereal which I had to eat with my teaspoon. There was just no staff to ask. At one point another man got up and went to the chef's kitchen to ask for some cutlery and something to eat off. 8) We ordered a taxi from the hotel to go to a restaurant and the taxi man left us waiting in the reception for 30 minutes and it wasn't even busy 9) The cleaners were sitting around in the hallways with vacuum cleaners lying in harms way. 10) When our room was made up the bed looked like someone else had slept in it and watched TV for a while and all our belongings were moved around 11) Check out was peaceful they didn't ask us how our stay was and we didn't bother to comment we knew we were not going to stay there again 12) Out with a bang - we collected our carry on luggage from the Concierge and asked him to book us a taxi to the airport - we saw this hugh luggage trolley in the reception with our 2 tiny bags sitting in the middle of reception unattended. He asked us to wait in the reception. There was a glass table and I have never seen something so filthy in my life. There were crumbs on the table and everywhere around the table. They just needed a mouse to come and help and clean them up. It was the most unsightly thing I have ever seen at any hotel reception

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, dirty, frenzied”
Reviews.Author: MarthaF
Reviews.Content: This hotel was highly touted by friends, and although my non-smoking room with queen bed was confirmed by the hotel, I arrived and was told that I received an "upgrade". A room with two twin beds pushed together was not satifactory, so I was moved to a smoky section of the hotel, with room service trays from the previous occupant still languishing outside the door. The room was smelly, and the lobby was dirty - and had still not been cleaned the following morning. My wake-up call for a very early flight was not made. All of this for 260 Euros a night? I asked what the upgrade was for, and they responded: "historical details." How about delivering just what was promised, no less no more???

Reviews.Title: “Never go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArmanMoscow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 3 nights with my wife when visiting Amsterdam. This was the worth hotel of this category we've ever stayed: 1) 1h (yes ONE hour) to check in 2) we booked a none smoking room, we got one that was smelling very heavily the cigar (so an other 20mn to change and get an other room) 3) they were sorry for this, so gave us a voucher for 2 free drinks at the bar.... 4) when wanting to use it, i left the paper in the room, told it to the barm tender that wanted anyway to see it "or you pay". I said that i was not willing to pay, and that he could call the reception> His answer :"you pay or I call the security"....which HE DID !!!! This was the first day, nice....unfortunatly we pre-paid the 3 nights (325 euros per night...not cheap for Amsterdam), so were not willing to move. I told in their survey what i was thinking about their hotel, the answer " we are very sorry, and hope to see you again at the Pulitzer". Are they joking ?!? Everybody now that i meet, i tell them to NEVER go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: loverealale
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 2 nights at this hotel and would definitely return. The reception and door staff were extremely friendly and made us feel very welcome. Our room was on the front of the hotel and we had a lovely view of the canal, our bed was probably the most comfortable one we've ever slept in and it was very quiet at night so we had a very good nights sleep. Room service was quite expensive but it was worth it to have a lovely pot of coffee delivered to our room in the mornings. I can't really say any more, it was great, can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: NYCBeachLover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pulitzer during a weekend get-away to Amsterdam from the States. Since I was in Amsterdam for the first time and only for 48 hours I spent no time in the hotel other than in my room. I booked the lowest level room. It was small, and with all the furnishings was crowded (to reach one side of the bed I had to climb over a sitting chair). The bed was queen-sized and adequately comfortable, but a little firm and lumpy - not what I would expect given the focus high-end hotels are placing on their beds these days. The pillows, however, were great. There was also a small desk, a large closet, a regular TV (not flat-screem), and a Bose Wave radio/CD player. Lighting was adequate, but not great - with all the lights on the room was still a little dark. The bathroom was also small but very nice. The tub was large and accomodated me easily for a bath (I'm 5'11"), but it was narrow, as seems the norm in Europe. Each day I was left a complimentary water bottle and cookies, and turn-down service was accompanied by some chocolates. My room looked out over an inner courtyard of sorts, but all I could really see was other parts of the hotel. Since I was on the 2nd floor of a 4-5 story building this meant very little natural light. The front desk staff were very understanding when I asked to be moved, but they could only put me in a different room for the 2nd night (I declined). One of the best things about the hotel is its location: in the heart of Amsterdam, but just far enough away that it's quiet and feels more residential. There are many nearby restaurants and shops, the Anne Frank house is a 5-10 minute walk, and the tram is only 3-5 minutes away. Overall, I was happy with my stay in Pulitzer, but not thrilled. The location is great and might convince me to return, but not at their current high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii_son
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay on Starwood Points. Myself and two teenagers. The Good: Location: Excellent on Prinsengracht. 7 mins walk south of Dam Sqr. 20 mins walk from Centraal. The excellent Amsterdam tram service also goes right past end of street. Getting there: Train from Schiphol to Centraal (3.6 Euro) taxi to Hotel (10 Euro) Alternative: Connexxion Airport/Hotel Shuttle bus 12 Euro single. Centrally located this Hotel is ideal for business or Tourist. The other choices (Hilton etc) are not so centrally located. The neighborhood is great, very old world Amsterdam, with shops and cafe's adjacent. Safety: Good. Avoid the overpriced Hotel breakfast, turn left out the Hotel door, and go half a block to tiny Cafe Hoek on the next corner. Owner speaks great English and serves an international breakfast and outrageous coffee. Noticed a few Hotel guests there. Warning: Locals all smoke in here. What to do: Take a 10 min tram ride from Dam Sqr to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. Old Masters in their authentic setting. What a feast. The Anne Frank House on next block 2 mins away. A must if you have never been. Window shopping down the Damrak essential. Canal boat ride from Centraal or Leidsplein. 1 x hour 10 Euro. (Goes directly past the Pulitzer Hotel) Centraal Station currently undergoing major renovation....so a little harder to negotiate at this time. Hotel Property: Needs some updating, corridors and stairway areas worn and faded. Small lobby, small gym, expensive restaurant. Wifi in rooms and lobby. (Relatively) Good value at 5 Euro per hr or 19 Euro for 24 hours. The not so good: Check In: Handled by trainee. This property is meant to be 5 star. It's not. It's a somewhat unusual property in that it's very old world, occupying 25 canalside homes. This in itself makes for a wonderfully authentic Amsterdam experience, albeit at the 4 star level. It's an uncomfortable bedfellow, the expectation of a modern 5 star rating standard in a 16th century property that retains much of the original architectural features. The Room: Upgraded to an exec king, two level canal front room, with two more beds in the attic area. Unfortunately the smell of smoke pervaded my entire floor (4th) although in my Frequent Stay Starwood profile, a non smoking experience is required. There were also ashtrays in my room. Being tired after a long flight, I demurred and stayed put. Bathroom: Small Overal comfort: 7/10 Elevators: Yes x 3 - Older and small. Stairs: Oh Yes. Restaurants: Did not use Concierge: Competent. Directed me to Pharmacy in neighborhood. Smoking: The Dutch like their tobacco. Value: Not great. Stay again? If I wanted a 5 star experience - No.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite but maybe dated...”
Reviews.Author: Tartan_Totty
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Pulitzer before and this booking was a last minute weekend break. Our two night stay cost around 500 Euros excluding breakfast. The Hotel is quite remarkable with an antique style combining deep wooden finishes and rich fabrics - this is not really to my taste as I prefer modern and minimalistic! I can definitely see how others would like it though. The room I had this time was not a patch on my previous stay which had been beautiful. It was rather small with a poor view of other hotel rooms only. The bathroom however was lovely and the shower was fabulous. Everything was well maintained and house-keeping were attentive to detail. Parts of the Pulitzer are a bit dated and as it is built from a row of Canal houses it is like a rabbit warren inside - the passages could use a complete make-over. The Bar is nice and the service throughout is impeccable. I didn't eat at the hotel as there are so many fabulous restaurants in Amsterdam and breakfast weighed in at 27 Euros per person which I thought was a bit much. I doubt I would go back, favouring a more modern property but would have no hesitation recommending it if your preference is a more traditional style establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad.”
Reviews.Author: starwoodfan782
Reviews.Content: As a frequent hotel guest and business traveler, I was horribly disappointed at the level of Hotel Pulitzer. I'm normally not picky at all, and don't normally write reviews, but I felt compelled to write this to warn others. Yes, the location is great. However, tt was incredibly noisy and the room that we were should not have been considered part of the luxury collection. The hotel was merely ok--but not something special or that should be considered part of Starwood's Luxury Collection. I've stayed in many a Sheraton--or even Four Points--that are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable quality and poorly set out.”
Reviews.Author: SDParis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice recently and have to say I am extremely disappointed in it. I always stay at Starwood hotels and I have found the Luxury collection to be uniformly very good, except for this one. I stayed during the week on a business trip. The general running of the place was poor and reception was often unattended, when it is they seem to do the minimum they can for you. For example they don't serve food in the bar or restaurant after 11.00pm. Also, simple requests are never followed through and this includes my wake up call which didn't happen and asking for an iron which never arrived. The rooms are also hit and miss, the first time I stayed I was in a great room with a canal view and the second one was tiny and looked on to a white washed wall. For nearly 300Euro you do feel a bit cheated with the whole experience. I really can't see how it gets away with claiming to be in any way a 'luxury hotel. It's a row of houses converted into a hotel which is run in a poor to decidedly average manner. Overall if you stayed once you might get lucky and have a decent experience, equally you could be let down by poorly trained staff and find yourself looking at a white wall in your tiny room. Itâ€™s quirky and unique but if you want a reliable standard of room and staff quality I would advise you to go to one of the better know chain hotels, at least you know what to expect. If you want something a bit different I am sure you will find a Bed and Breakfast of better quality at a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: ldscjpcat
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is one the best hotel I have stayed in. I travel frequently and have been in many hotels across the world. The Pulitzer aces it on every aspect I consider important. The staff is exceptionally helpful, the rooms are wonderful and interesting. The bar is exceptionally nice and the staff there very friendly. And, they get the little touches right- like the stroopwaflen on the bed at night. The location is cool and an easy walk to things- although a bit longer to the museums. Our business doesn't approve the hotel for my level anymore which could almost make me cry! However, for anyone else that can- you should.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: rbwii
Reviews.Content: Ok, ok . . . this may not be a 5-star hotel but it was WELL worth the money. Compared to other nice Amsterdam hotels, Pulitzer can hold its own, believe me. Wee took the train to central station from Schiphol (3.5 euros) and a taxi to the hotel (10 euros). We were assisted by the bellman immediately and then waited about 3 minutes for the front desk attendant. We arrived at 1PM and were told that our room would not be ready until 3PM . . . but it was a canal view room on the 3rd floor so waiting was NO problem. We wandered around the city for 2 hours . . . (if you have never been, the ENTIRE city is accessible on foot and is absolutely amazing). Our room was awesome . . . spacious with an amazing bathroom, hardwood floors, etc. There was also a bottle of water and delicious chocolates waiting for us. Now, the Dutch are not known for their service, or so I've heard . . . but the staff at the hotel was great. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Angelyvonne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband late December for 3 nights. I would agree that this is definitely not a 5 star hotel. I was disappointed that we did not get a canal view room, but thought the room size was okay. The hotel does seem a little dated, but I thought it was clean and the amenities were fine (but the Internet was quite overpriced). The room was however, very dark and dim in general. The bathroom marble floors were heated, which was a nice touch. I did not think the service was up to par. The concierge was helpful, but not great. We wanted a walking tour, and they offered us their own which was over 160 euros for 2 people. I had learned about another organization called Mee in Mokum, which is staffed by local retirees and they supposedly do great walking tours for 4 euros per person. When I asked the concierge about this, they simply said, well if you want to do that they usually meet at the amsterdam historical museum at 11am, so you would need to go there. So when we went there, we were told that Mee in Mokum did not give tours at that time of the year. It was annoying and I thought the concierge should have helped us confirm before we scrambled to run out there. I did feel they tended to be fairly dismissive if we wanted to seek out tour options that were not created by the hotel. The location was great and very central to most touristy spots around town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kehlen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 3 children for 2 nights and agree it's a fantastic hotel. Having lived in Amsterdam for 5 years it was wonderful to be back and think the location of this hotel is perfect. We had a family room which was very small but beautifully laid out with a ladder type staircase to a mezzanine level with 2 beds and seperate TV for the kids. As the kids are watching re runs of 'Little House on the Prairie' they were comparing it to the Olsens house! The only negative I would have is that the breakfast charge is in addtion to a rather expensive room, we ended up paying 135 euro for 5 of us to have breakfast and my youngest son is only 2, there is no discount for children!

Reviews.Title: “dutch canal are so lovely...”
Reviews.Author: travelmaddy
Reviews.Content: This is a very cosy hotel and whilst very hot outside in amsterdam, inside the airco was great. Very nicely decorated rooms, beautiful bathrooms. wonderful view; the dutch canals. Friendly staff, of course... we are in holland after all. Location is excellent, close to everything, walking distance, no car needed for anything in holland. Public transport is fantastic and cheap. Very easy to get to from amsterdam schiphol to the hotel, just take the train to the centralstation and than a 5 minute tramjourney and you are in front of the hotel. about 65 euro in a taxi from the airport. Food is good, breakfast great. Good selection and such a cosy area with again great views overlooking the canals whilst the sun is beaming in and you see all the people outside. They have this huge painting in the breakfast room, which my kids just loved, kept them very entertaint. The courtyard is lovely. You'll love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and best location!”
Reviews.Author: Sailinggal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights before a river cruise...loved the hotel and location. About 25 canal homes all connected together in three rows. We had a room on the third floor, inter court yard. I did not like this location as the lights were on all night long in the hall way that were across from our room. If we ever go back to Amsterdam, we will stay there but a different location. I would request the garden or canal rooms. This hotel is central located to everything. Anne Frank home, Dam Square, museums, and near great places to eat. The hotel is prices for the food are expensive, but very very good. The rooms are amazing. Wooden beams on the ceiling, wood floors. The bathroom has heated floors! Amazing bathroom too. Loved this hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anymore. The only thing I wished they had was coffee makers in the room.

Reviews.Title: “one of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: jessshuz
Reviews.Content: I travel globally about 75 days per year for business. This is one of the most unique and charming hotels I have ever stayed in. It is so cozy that I never want to leave my room. The staff is wonderful.Fabulous location!

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, relaxed atmosphere, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: Him-and-me
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pulitzer for 3 nights November 2006. Have been to Amsterdam several times before, and this hotel is superbly located, just a couple of minutes walk from Anne Frank's house and 10 minutes from the main central attractions! Peaceful location and beautiful peaceful hotel. Smart but not 'up itself', the staff are amazingly friendly, courteous, and everything from reception to room service carried out efficiently. Great bar as well! Thoroughly recommend. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Exeperience in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: ChristianK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed over the years in many business hotels in Amsterdam (Swisshotel, Gran Hotel NH, Mariott, Hilton, Renaissance, Okura) but the Pulitzer has become my favourite business and leisure hotel in the city. The location is great, hotel staff very polite and helpful, the design very special, the price within the same range like the other mentioned hotels.The only downsides are in my view the breakfast (expensive and at the best average) & room size in some part of the hotels. In case you have problems with stairs stay in a different place or ask for an easy accessible room. Being in one of the nicest streets in Amsterdam you are walking distance from fine restaurants around Prinzen- and Singelgracht and to the train station and tourist highlights on the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: skibuff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pulitzer for two nights. We arrived at 1400 and were immediately assigned a very nice room with a king bed overlooking the Garden Area as I had requested. The room was very large for a European Hotel with a very high ceiling. As is known, this Hotel is a collection of canal houses so the path to the Room was somewhat involved but easy to remember. The king bed was very comfortable and firm and if more pillows are desired, a call to housekeeping results in prompt deliveriy of same. Our room had two windows almost from floor to the ceiling overlooking the Garden area. The Bath was very nice and included lots of top shelf toiletries. We did not use the Hotel Dining room but it appeared well appointed and the staff appeared attentive as we passed by on our way to and from the room. We did enjoy the Bar area which was in the style of a "Brown Cafe" with dark paneling and low light levels. Drinks were reasonable priced and service was exemplary. A main Tram Line is about 50 yards from the Hotel as a day pass costs about $7.50. The Hotel is located very near the Anne Frank House and the West Kerk along with the Jordaan area of town. It makes a good base for seeing Amsterdam via Tram of foot. We very pleased with the Hotel and with an internet special rate, the Pulitzer gets high marks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgr
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate for this hotel on hotwire ($195 per night) so was really pleased to be staying here. This hotel is about a 10 min walk from the Dam square in the center of Amsterdam, right on the canal. We got upgraded to a canal-view room (#175) which was small-ish (in the european style) but had high ceilings and a balcony and got sent some complimentary champagne for our honeymoon. No coffee or iron in the rooms - but all arrived on request. For a lovely breakfast, turn left out of the front entrance - on the next corner is a cafe with fresh baked breads and cooked meals. The porter organized a car service to the airport for a lower price than a taxi (E35). Highly recommended, nothing to complain about here.

Reviews.Title: “not my first time there, and not my last”
Reviews.Author: nunununu
Reviews.Content: I love the Pulitzer and everytime I can get a good deal for it, I stay here when I travel to Amsterdam. It is a nice get-away from the tourists who come to Amsterdam only to indulge in the green, as they cannot afford it. Everytime, we get different rooms with different arrangements. This past time we were traveling with older relatives, and they were more than willing to accomodate their inability to deal with stairs, and gave them a room right near the elevators and recognizing that we were return guests, gave them a wonderful canal-view room... certainly made their trip a little more romantic. We "kids" did not get such a lovely room, but we still enjoyed it. The property provides a lovely place to meet with guests - we have family in the Netherlands. It is well located just a few steps from a tramline, a short walk to central areas, and some of our favorite restaurants. All the times that we have been there, we have yet to try the in-house restaurant. We do, however, love the cookies that you get in your room upon check-in. It is a race to the room to try to steal the other person's cookie each time, although the tolerant atmosphere of Amsterdam usually makes the winning party relent and share. As I mentioned before, it is nice to not smell the aroma of weed in the hotel, although some guests will go and enjoy the nightlife of Amsterdam and sleepily wander back to their rooms, but there have never been any problems with unruly, bothersome guests. This past time, we drove to Amsterdam, and parked our car with the hotel garage. We did not realize though, even though it is printed on the ticket, that it could take an hour to get the car! Eeek! Put a little delay in our return home, but just wanted to put it out there for those who really love sticking to a schedule.

Reviews.Title: “It really depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: j1mb0b
Reviews.Content: Having now been back to Amsterdam about 6 times in as many years, and tried others (the Krasnapolsky customer service was just dreadful, although the rooms and location were great), I find myself drawn back to the Pulitzer every time now. And I think I've now discovered the reason for the variety of reviews... There is a *huge* variety in the rooms in this hotel - even those of supposedly the same class. There have always been the two of us visiting and we've always asked for a double room. So it's been quite surprising to find that we were once offered a split-level room with two twin-beds "upstairs"; we've had a suite which was a good size but rather strangely had a sink and electric hob in the hallyway of the room (can't see many people who can afford to stay there cooking up an economy breakfast - but there you go - especially when little amuses bouches are brought round mid afternoon); the garret room had literally no space (one shelf in the wardrobe) and was very dark; the room on the ground floor had wonderful exposed brick work and a newly decorated bathroom with a heated floor. That worked very well. So a lot of it is, unfortunately, down to luck of the draw. I would recommend this hotel strongly though. The staff are almost all helpful and polite (not used the concierge but did notice the golden keys on his jacket), and the breakfasts are very good. Not eaten there in the evening, but the bar does very good cocktails in convivial surroundings and has a fine cognac selection too. The hotel's location is roughly central - and if it seems that 10 minute extra walk from Dam square is a bit far in the evening - you'll welcome the peace and quiet when you arrive back. There's definitely a good "feel" about the hotel. The hotel seemed to go through an economy drive during 2005 (removing things like the complimentary slippers and the welcome cookies, and not refilling the breakfast containers... Cold dregs of scrambled egg anyone?), but someone seems to have come back and got things back in order. No longer will the traveller have to experience this. The hotel's not cheap - but that's fairly typical for Amsterdam - and I agree its grip on a 5* rating is up for questions (it's a fine 4* hotel though) - but (like Amsterdam itself), I think everyone should experience it for themselves and not necessarily rely on what others have told them. I suspect you'll enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: dawabbit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Europe (although we are American), & travel a great deal. So when our daughter & husband were joining us for holiday, we certainly wanted a COOL, clean & spiffy place for two nights. We usually only do Amsterdam in day trips, but a co-worker of my husband's recommended this hotel. After reading the June Trip Advisor reviews (several) in which very unhappy guests were beseiged by rats, my daughter & I approaced our rooms with caution! What a surprise, though. We were in an inner room, very updated, neat, clean excellent lighting (a problem in Europe), and the best selection of high-end creams & lotions in the bathroom I had seen in a long time. We were delighted that the A/C was working perfectly, since this was during the "great heat wave of '06", & our home had intererior temps of over 100. The bed was comfy, the bedding soft, the bottle of water FREE! , and even though we put our feet down very carefully in the middle of the night --- NO rats. The desk was helpful in arranging a boat tour & museum tickets for us. Since we enjoyed our stay so much, we are returning in 2 weeks with some American friends of ours. Even though we did not eat the hotel food, breakfasts of great coffee & everything else are in little shops all around the hotel for about 1/4 the price, and a lot more atmosphere. A

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: nycrunner5
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I just stayed there for our honeymoon, and we were impressed. The service, and rooms were excellent. The location is just great, and they have a wonderful breakfast. There are also many other restaurants in walking distance. The only thing I would not do is make a phone call or use their internet service. If you leave the hotel make a right, and then a right, and you will see a phone internet cafe that is 1/5 of the pulitzer's prices. Lastly, if you have a car that is taking you to the airport, make sure it is your designated driver, and not someone who the bellboy or conceriage has sent you, so they can get a big tip from the driver

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pulitzer is a pretty hotel very well located in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TheLion
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer in Amsterdam for 4 nights, from August 1-5. I agree with most of the reviews that this hotel is probably not a 5 star hotel, but at the very least it is a great 4 star hotel. After all, the hotel provides robes, slippers, and turn down service, which includes fine chocolates. It also has a free gym, and a beautiful art gallery on its premises. The location is superb, as it is located right on 2 major canals. It is easy walking distance from both Dam Square and the Leidesplein, two of Amsterdam's major night life locations. There are several stores and small eateries just around the corner. It is just down the street from Anne Frank's house. Although I did not have a canal view, I still very much enjoyed the fact that the windows fully opened to a beautiful courtyard, nestled next to an old church. I found the room size reasonable, and the king size bed was in fact full sized. On the negative side, I had a room with beams that seemed to have rotted away and the room sloped down towards the bathroom. The only real negative comment I have about the staff, is that having arrived on an early flight, I was not accomodated with a room until a full five hours later. Although the hotel staff stored our suitcases, what we needed the most at that point was a qucik shower.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pulitzer, good retreat in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: phillyboys
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Pulitzer in July at the end of a river boat cruise on the recommendation of our travel agent, who had stayed there herself. We were a little apprehensive after reading the mixed reviews, but now we can only agree with the positive remarks on this site and fully endorse our travel agents recommendation. A good room on the interior gardens (very quiet!) â€“ and big enough for our standards and luggae. Staff was very welcoming and accommodating despite the hectic check in (there were at least 10 other couples from the boat). The weather was superb and restaurant service took place on the terraces. Lovely! Our room was on the ground floor with direct access into the gardens (room 136). We sat there for hours in the evenings. What more do you want after a day of sightseeing and museum visits than a fine wine, a nice book and sitting on your own private terrace in a secluded garden in the middle of the old town of Amsterdam. On our days in the city we passed by plenty of non-descript American chain hotels in Amsterdam. Submerge yourself in the real city, go to Hotel Pulitzer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not worth 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: ClareCollins
Reviews.Content: Although our stay at the hotel Pulitzer was relatively incident free (compared to others who found mice in their rooms!!!!!!) I do not think this hotel is worth 5 stars, and it is certainly very over-priced. Our room was lovely and a bit on the small side and we were given 2 single duvets on a king size bed and no tea/ coffee making facilities until we asked for them... I don't think I would stay in this hotel again, unless there was a special offer (e.g. half the mormal price!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: vps5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer at the end of a family trip to Europe from 26 July to 29 July 2006. From our greeting by the doorman to the friendly assistance we received at the desk, our check in was a breeze. Unfortunately, on the internet I had booked two of the wrong types of rooms for our family of two adults and three teenagers, but not only did the desk person find a combination of rooms that suited our needs, but she upgraded us as well, at no additional charge. The Pulitzer is old, quirky, and charming. There were exposed beams in our canal-view room. If you want the feeling of staying in a well-maintained, clean, Amsterdam-style home in a quiet neighborhood, the Pulitzer is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Rats and many other problems”
Reviews.Author: romejune2005
Reviews.Content: First of all this is NOT a five star hotel! We stayed in the Pulitzer for 3 nights and our experience was not good. When we arrived at the hotel we were informed that despite being SPG platinum members we would not receive an upgrade, fair enough. We were checked into a room but when we walked there we found out that there was already a guest staying in that room!
