Since we were not looking for additional room mates we went back to the lobby, we were allocated another room, when we reached this room we found out that the AC was not working. We were asked to stay in this room and wait for the engineering department to fix the AC. We politely declined saying that we prefered to be checked into a room with a functioning AC. We were then allocated a third room which was not exactly impressive but it was ok. Just past midnight when me and my wife were about to go to sleep a big rat was running across our floor. I was so upset, surprised you name it.... However when I called the reception they did not seem surprised at all so I guess this is normal for this hotel. In my book it is not normal for a hotel where prices starts at 300USD to have rats in the rooms!! We were therefore moved to yet another room half past midnight, this the duty manager insisted was an upgrade (which was not available a few hours earlier). However the "upgrade" was to a room without any ventilation what so ever where the air had been standing still for a very long time. Me and my wife instantly came to think of the air in the catacombs under the st peters cathedral in Rome. Anyhow we were now so tired of moving rooms and my wife is in the 7th month of her pregnancy so we did not want to walk around this hotel any more. However one staff of the hotel said herself about the air in this room(474) "this is emberassing" and indeed it was, then she told us "good luck" and left :). The next morning I called up the hotel manager and complained about our first day at the hotel and he was very appologetic and was the only person that I talked to during my stay who made any sense. He offered us complimentary breakfast and tickets for two museums. The first morning we had roomservice and before leaving our room we called room service for clearence. When we returned more than 6 hours later our trays had still not been collected and the left overs from our breakfast was now smelling really bad (this was during the July heat wave). Next morning we went down for the breakfast buffet, there was only one person seating guests during the busiest time of breakfast and a long line was building up. We were seated in the garden where probably 40-50 people were sitting. In the entire garden there was one! waiter who served coffe and cleared dishes etc. We were offered tea or coffe after 30 minutes into our breakfast and piles of dirty dishes were building up since the poor guy had no chance to clear them all by himself. Since nothing had worked out during our stay I called one day before our departure to check that the front desk were indeed aware of that our breakfast would be complimentary and this was confirmed. The next morning when we checked out the front desk was completely unaware of this and insisted that the breakfast was chargable and it took some discussion for these charges to be reversed. In general the hotel staff seems unwilling to help or to take initiative and I also think that the staff are not properly trained. This hotel has a very very long way to go before it will be worth the money that it charges. I can not believe paying 300USD a night and we were not comfortable to return to our room at the end of the day and on top of that the service is very poor. If you are considering staying in this hotel I can only say like the Pulitzer's staff told us "Good Luck" :)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Worth a Prize!”
Reviews.Author: KMG8
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Pulitzer recently and boy, did we love it! It is a pricey place, but worth every penny. It is in a great location that is walking distance from restaurants, shops, etc. We had a great bi-level room for us and our two small children. The stairs were pretty steep, but it was a very comfortable room and the bathroom had heated floors! We would derfinitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Under no circumstances a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jlar1
Reviews.Content: You will have read from other irrate clients that this is not a 5 star service hotel. The prices are very high, even for a 5 star hotel. My problems began when i arrived early for check in- 10am. Despite being told several times over the phone that I would not have a problem getting a room with a canal view, on arrival with my girlfriend for a special stay in Amsterdam i was told that the only way of getting a room at 10am was paying an additional 30 euros. As you can imagine i refused- not a good way to start your holiday. The room was rather mediocre. Once again for 290 euros a night this room was rather depressing. Views looked out to another building almost immediatly opposite and the lack of light was depressing (no ceiling light). Their was a tray of dirty food when we arrived to the room, two hours later still there. Someone came to fill the mini-bar whilst still sleeping, fair enough, it is a job that needs to be done. However, it does take the micky that someone else knocks on the door offering the same service whilst someone is already in your room. The staff were ok, nothing amazing, once again, a 3/4 star service. To all their fairness they refunded back 1/3 of my fee, that still leaves 200 euros for the night which is still a ludicrous price for that hotel- My advise? Don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “A Liittle Mouse with Clogs on !!”
Reviews.Author: Euroqueen
Reviews.Content: I can only echo the review of Trip Adviser Member NY. My partner and I recently stayed at The Pulitzer. This is definately not a 5 Star Hotel. It is overrun with rodents. My partner and I had to move rooms at 2 in the morning because of rodent in room. At reception they did not seem to think this was a problem even though we were staying with our dog! We could only be downgraded for that night. Next day we were moved to another room of the same standard as the first but it also came with resident rodent. On check out we had to ask for a refund on the first nights stay we were then offered a 30% discount. This is a shabby establishment. Staff are rude, lazy, unhelpful. I have stayed at this hotel before and on reflection cannot remember a time when I have been in the lobby and a guest is not having a problem at reception. It's awful. My top tip for Amsterdam is stay at The Grand Demure Sofitel. This is 5 Star, a fabulous hotel with wonderful staff. Irritated of London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facilty”
Reviews.Author: Jill in Florida
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent and very clean. The breakfast was the best we have had in our 8 trips all over Europe. The only two negatives were location, that it was a bit of a walk to the Dam sqaure or Leipzsen square, but right next to the Anne Frank house. Second the canal tour they recommend for 38 euros had very limited vison compared to the main tourist canal boats that have glass all around. They also sold us "no line" tickets fro Anne Frank House" after 5 and Van Gough museum "no line tickets", which were heloful. I would stay here again becuse of the cleanliness and breakfast, just expecting to walk more or use the more complex tram system. The taxis are expensive. Personally Amsterdam is not my favorite city, but we truly loved the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “luxury? a five star rat in my room !”
Reviews.Author: cristianonyc
Reviews.Content: Don't get fool by book reviews and movies, this hotel is not a five star luxury experience, it dosen't even have sanitary standards! I planned a trip with my parents who are 70yo, and I wanted to treat them with a nice experience in one of the best hotel in Amsetrdam. We were having drinks in my room when a rat walked by our feet! I could not believe my eyes! The manager said that is common in old houses by the canals in Amsterdam! Do you think that's an appropriate answer to give to a guest to pay more than 500 euros a night? Orrible experience! I never had rat in my room, not even in India! My parents were shocked! The hotel, on top of the rat, is totaly overated: the decor is standard, the room are like a sheraton hotel by any international airport, the concierge could not find me tickets for any concert in town, the staff is tired and not helpfull. Trust me save your money, this hotel it's a total joke!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel... a very good choice”
Reviews.Author: ckjnewhaven
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Pulitzer, and we thought it was terrific. We travel often, and enjoy upscale hotels, and this is definitely in that category. We were with our 15 yr old son, so we requested adjoining rooms. We were overlooking a canal..... truly lovely. The breakfast was absolutely beautiful and delicious. No need to eat again all day.... eggs, crepes, bacon, cheeses, breads, fresh wonderful fruit, etc., etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old-style european hotel, not a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonProf
Reviews.Content: Think old Europe. This hotel is old row houses - every room is different. Mine was very small, small bathroom, and a step down from the bathroom so extreme that I had to put a chair in front of the door to remind myself so I did not fall. All of the services you would expect from a top hotel, but not the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but 5 star???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer on our first trip to Amsterdam. The hotel was very nice but I can't say it is 5 stars or that it is really worth the $$$$. It is very quaint and the rooms are nice enough. Our room was tucked away by the bar, service stairs, and the gym. So it was noisy and very smoky when the bar was busy. It looked out onto a very nice courtyard. The maid service and turndown services were excellent. The bathtub in the bathroom was fabulous, if you like baths. It was very close to a lot of fun things to do and plenty of restaurants/cafes. I wasn't disappointed but at the same time it wasn't any nicer than a Marriott. I did expect a little more from such a highly rated hotel and would probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: theresama40
Reviews.Content: We loved being in a townhouse in the heart of Amsterdam with a room overlooking a canal. We also loved the very warm and very helpful staff. We loved the price -- good va lue for an expensive city. Things we didn't love: Breakfast: Neither the food nor the room was up to the quality of the hotel. The quirky housekeeping: Our room was immaculate but a wine glass in the hallway stayed there throughout our stay, ignored by housekeeping. The slightly run-down air: Lots of dings in the paint and a whiff of drains in our room. And be forewarned: this is a hotel just chock full of Americans, so if you're looking to immerse yourself in a European experience, you may want to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: BETH V
Reviews.Content: After traveling for 2 weeks in Netherlands, France & Belgium, I must write a review to praise this hotel. It really has everything...location, wonderful staff and well-appointed rooms. I would much rather have a beautiful room containing absolutely everything one would need than a large, non-functional, typical, boring hotel room. In praise of the staff and the care taken at this hotel, the maid noticed that our curtain wouldn't close properly as the mechanism had broken. We received a note of apology from the manager, advising we could either call for help with the curtain or switch rooms. He then sent up a bottle of wine for the "inconvenience." Needless to say, if we are ever back in Amsterdam, Hotel Pulitzer will be our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experince”
Reviews.Author: posterguru
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Pulitzer, very clean well appointed rooms with outstanding service and hospitality. We travel all over the world, and spend alot fo time in hotels and I can honestly say, for the money , Pulitzer is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business & for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ginge66
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Pulitzer 3 - 4 times now in the last 6 months, and it's been a wonderful experience each time. The only reason I don't rate it as excellent is that the size of the rooms is extremely variable, with some boasting romantic views of the canal, and others pokey views of back walls. That said, every room has character, and has been spotlessly clean and well appointed. By Dutch standards, the service is very friendly and helpful, and the hotel remains an oasis in a desert of mediocre, standardised business hotels. If you're visiting Amsterdam as a (romantic) tourist, try to get a canal facing room - unless you like to sleep with the window open...

Reviews.Title: “They mean well . . .”
Reviews.Author: PNSGirl
Reviews.Content: I had some reservations about booking with the Pulitzer after reading the mixed reviews but was talked into it by my travel agent who books high end travel. I must say it is in a good location and one of the nicer hotels in Amsterdam. The bathrooms are small but like every one else said are nicely done and meet all the needs. Both the rooms I stayed in were well appointed and fine for a nice holiday room. However, we did have several issues. We were woken up by a mouse scratching at the door trying to get out of our room. Needless to say we were immediately moved to an upgraded room with a view of the canals only to find out the mini bar was broken and never able to be fixed during our stay. Also the mini bar is electronic and make mistakes at the slightest jiggle The buffet breakfast was included with our package but would have been 25 euro each if not included- which is way too high. It is one of the nicest hotels for Amsterdam but I can see where it gets spotty reviews. If you catch them right your in a 4 star hotel - if not -your going to get pot luck on some services. The hard part is that is a far better hotel than most amsterdam hotels so..... the question is what are your compromises.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: welshrosie
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at The Pulitzer for two nights. We arrived on 29th April 2005, Queens Day which is a National Holiday in Holland. We arrived ay 9 a.m the reception staff were very helpful, they gave us a room straight away where we were able to leave our luggage. I must say that the room was very small like a shoe box. The two following mornings when we went for breakfast we were extremely dissappointed, we waited 20 minutes to be seated,there was no hot food at all, we had to wait approx 25 minutes for the food to arrive. I must say they are very short staff. I can't say that this is a five star hotel. I have stayed at better hotels in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & Nice hotel & GREAT Shower!!”
Reviews.Author: mkhollis1
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because it had more of an "Amsterdam feeling" than others, being 2 canal houses connected together. It was a nice location, but our room was a bit loud (#160), because it was next to the service stairway, bar, and gym. We asked about upgrading to a canel view, but they didn't really encourage it (very odd to not want to get more money out of you!) saying you only sleep in the room anyway and can see the canals anytime you go outside (which was true). Also, I think the canal view rooms may have had lots of traffic noise as well. While the hotel was fine for location and service, it was pretty old & dated. Our bath was obviously recently rennovated, which was great -- the shower was one of the BEST!! However, the bathroom was very tiny (one person at a time, please), and the location of the toilet was such that you had to sit sideways! lol They had robes in the room, which was a nice touch. Our maid service & turn down service was well done, but we were woken up early a couple of times (before 8am), so be sure to put out the "Do not disturb" sign until you leave for the day. They left yummy chocolate too! The hotel was a maze of hallways, but it was enhanced with a small art gallery and pretty gardens (though it was too cool to want to go out to enjoy the gardens). The bar was nice, with pleasant staff and comfy chairs. The bicycle rental place was very good (only a couple of blocks away, and decent/newer bikes with good locks). We had no issues at all and enjoyed seeing the city like the locals. There is also a wonderful laundry place a couple of blocks from the hotel where we were able to dump off a bunch of cothes and pick them up clean & folded a few hours later -- no time wasted doing our own laundry -- priceless!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Just Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Doomster
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel in a fantastic location. I've stayed in numerous luxury hotels all over the world, and this one was one of the best. Staff could not do more to be helpful, polite and charming at all times. Rooms were spacious and extremely comfortable. A definite "must-stay" for that special trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, terrific hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cinebard
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend spent a wonderful three nights at the Pulitzer in Oct. of 04. Amsterdam is a beautiful, old city with incredible charm, and the Pulitzer is a great match. We had a well appointed room on the third floor with great views of the canal. The room was clean, quiet, with a modern marble bathroom, and a very comfortable bed. The Pulitzer had been recommended to us by friends and family, and for very good reason. The staff was friendly and professional, and saw to our every need. The hotel bar is really cool and deserves a special mention. Great place for a drink or two after taking in the sites. The hotel is also perfectly located and allows you to walk everywhere. While in Amsterdam, the Pulitzer is a prime location on the canal, and is a great pick for understated European luxury. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Double Charged!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Good location and rooms very comfortable. Very relaxing stay. We had breakfast included which is of high quality. The problems? 1, We were doubled-charged for our bills which was a nice treat when we returned and checked our bank statements. No sign that this was going to happen at the time of check out. It's still being resolved. 2, Large number of guests are intolerent of European countries where American is not the first language. If in doubt, do try to speak the native tongue rather than shouting louder and louder. Would I stay here again? Maybe, if the double-charge gets sorted out. If not, no way!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: wrstark
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay at the Hotel Pulitzer for six nights, scheduled to fly home on September 12, 2001. Even before 9/11, I found the hotel charming, my room lovely (my only complaint: the marble bathroom floor was so slick I slipped every single time I bathed), the staff was very friendly. The front desk folks were always smiling and helpful with advice, directions, etc. The restaurant was good. I ended up spending extra nights at the hotel because the airspace closed up in the US so I couldn't go home. A NY'er, I was very shaken up by the attacks, and the staff went above and beyond the call of duty. I ran out of my Rxs during my longer stay and the concierge hooked me up with a doctor who spoke English, fit me into his schedule that AM, and was just wonderful (he surmised I was not sleeping well with the stress and asked me if I needed sleeping pills). Everything I asked for, they hooked me up with, and I feld handled with kid gloves.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pulitzer Has Charm”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer on my first trip to Amsterdam and several times afterwards. I am a fussy traveler and I own up to that quite readily. The very first trip I took to Amsterdam I stayed at this hotel and I complained the entire visit about the size of the room. It wasn't until I stayed at a larger more impersonal hotel that I came to appreciate the Hotel Pulitzer. First, put aside any notion of American style hotels when you stay here. If its a large room you're after- give up when in Europe. The rooms are much smaller than I am accoustomed to, but the embroidered details in the bedding and charming wood floors and the water pressure in the bathroom makes up for any failings that the hotel might appear to have. The staff is multi-lingual and very accomadating. My first night in the hotel we did not check in until after midnight. After walking to a nearby coffee shop for a bag of smoke and returning to the hotel, we were famished. Although the kitchen was closed, the staff put together a cold plate of sandwiches and delectable cheeses and sent it up to our room without complaint. During subsequent trips to Holland, I have stayed elsewhere, but have been drawn back to this hotel over and over again. I highly recommend this hotel for the leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: livefully
Reviews.Content: My colleagues raved about this hotel. It is not at all what I expected for a luxury hotel. The noise was horrible. The walls are very thin and they gave me a "quiet" room. I barely slept as there is a door next to my room that was loudly used at all hours of the night and early morning. Music blasting into my room early in the morning also didn't help my jet lag. The rooms are not set up for business travellers. While the location is great, if you are hoping to get some rest after long days in the office, this is not the place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: fgaliber
Reviews.Content: I've heard good things about the Pulitzer from my friends, so I decided to stay there for New Years. The hotel was very nice, the staff was friendly, and the location was great. Like most hotels in Amsterdam, the rooms are very small. Make sure you get the Executive or better. My only real complaint is that finding your room can be a challenge. The hotel is comprised of multiple connected buildings, so you may have to find your way through a maze in order to get to your room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Venue”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 2 day business meeting at the Hotel Pulitzer in Amsterdam.I had a phantastic stay! Although my room was very small I felt very much at home in it. I had a great view on the Prinsengracht, and I liked the wooden floors and the beams. Our meeting was in the Garden room, a very bright greenhouse type of room. Food and service were excellent throughout the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: visiting_cali_girl
Reviews.Content: This is promoted as a luxury hotel, and was recommended to me by a co-worker. While I admit that the location was quite good, the actual conditions of the "Starwood Preferred Guest" room I was booked into were unacceptable and certainly not that of a luxury property. There was a foot long gash in the wall that was all black, and horrible looking, and water stains on the walls throughout the room. Because of the water, and despite the cold, the room was infested with mosquitoes. If this is a preferred guest accommodation, I hate to think about the conditions of the rooms of the other guests. This would be a bad hotel for someone in a wheelchair, or for people with other mobility issues. It was a long walk from the lobby to the elevator for the wing/building I was in.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my stay at the Pulitzer and I have to say It was great. As soon as you come in you feel like home, The reception staff was verry friendly and helpfull. The room was on the small side but ok Concierge I think his name was Andre he helped us finding restaurants he was verry helpfull and he can help you find all the hot spots in town!! The bed was very comfortable, the amenities are great, the heated marble floors in the bathrooms are a nice touch, especially in chilly Amsterdam. The Joordan area is the best for nice walks, unusual shops and galleries and good restaurants. The hotel breakfast is hugely overpriced, but there are lots of nice little places for breakfast in the immediate area. Amsterdam is a great city and I would definitely go back and I might give the Pulitzer antother chance when I do.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Amsterdam and knowing the reputation of some areaswe tried to be careful in picking which hotel to go to. To start with the few negative points. The hotel room was a little on the small side but then what do you expect for a hotel made up of houses that have been merged together and it certainly made up with it in charm. Whilst it was in a good state of repair some parts of the hotel did feel a little tired/ dated but not enough to spoil the stay. The one poor incident was when after the cleaner had been in a tissue with pink lipstick was left next to the sink when my partner had not used any lipstick whilst we had been there. Wouldnt have been a major issue but when reporting the matter to the duty manager they said it must have been us that left it there. We ate our evening meal in their dinner one evening and whilst the food and wine was exceptional the table we were given felt as if it was in a coridor with all other guests walking within a foot of our table to be taken into the main seating area or going to the bar/ toilets. The staff, with the exception of the above incident were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is ideally placed for all the attractions but is just far enough away from the likes of Damn Square not to suffer from the evening noise. Booking directly through the Starwoods website produced by far the cheapest price and all things considered it only just misses out on full marks.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good overall, a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: PedroLisbon_Portugal
Reviews.Content: Since I had heard good things about the Pulitzer before and got a good internet rate, I booked without even looking at what people had written here (not my usual behavior). So I confess I was worried when I came to check what people had written here and found so many mixed reviews. Having just returned from a five day stay with my wife and 2 year old son, I must say my personal experience was very positive. The hotel is quite tastefully decorated, feeling definitely upscale without going over the top as it happens in so many "luxury" hotels. The Pulitzer's particular arrangement (several 18th century buildings internally linked) makes you feel you're staying at a small hotel, altough it has more than 200 rooms. Warned by some of the reviews here, I asked for a room facing the inner courtyard when I got there. It was a good choice. Absolute quiet, indispensable for my son's naps (and we stayed in a room with wooden floors, and heard absolutely nothing from neighbors - we stayed in the 4th floor, though, and maybe that's why). Rooms are indeed small by the standards of other 5* hotels, but hey, that's part of the package of staying in renovated 18th century houses. Charm comes with that price. In any case, our room had an extra bed for my son and still felt spacious enough. And the location is just absolutely perfect. 10 minutes walking from the Dam, 10 minutes walking from the shops in Leidensplan, 15 minutes walking from the Rijksmuseum, and plenty of very nice shops and restaurants in the streets crossing the canals. Without being located at exactly where the busiest places are, it was equidistant from all of them, and thus quieter and still convenient. Breakfast was excellent, the staff always courteous and helpful. And the concierge, well, it depends: we talked to at least four different people behind the desk. Some were very helpful, some slightly less so, but the difference was in degree and not in kind. Overall, no complaints here. The canl trip with Pulitzer's boat was very nice, although the skipper's/guide's dry sense of humour may not be to everybody's tastes. It was to mine. The only problems were: - the bed was not King size, unlike advertised. Just two smaller beds put together, with a slightly annoying gap in the middle. Still confortable, but could be better; - after the first three days, the turndown service ceased to exist. What happened? I wasn't bothered enough to complain, though. Overall, a very nice experience, even considering how difficult it becomes sometimes to travel with small children. The charm of the place and its perfect location are its greatest assets.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: leswiegers
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. ALL of the staff were friendly, helpful and made you feel welcome. For example, we missed housekeeping service one morning and received a card that said if we needed the room made up, please call Guest Services. We chose not to call. However, one of the housekeepers way down the hall noticed me putting away the "Do Not Disturb" sign, and our room was fully cleaned when we returned! These little touches (along with the delicious carmel waffle cookies they provided each morning) made our stay wonderful. Beds were so comfy you didn't want to get up, and the heated bathroom floors were a great idea. We liked that the hotel was comprised of multiple buildings. It was initially confusing to navigate. Yes - my husband and I both had to get directions to the restaurant, but it gave the hotel character. We travel a lot, and this was one of the best hotels we've stayed in. HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “so so Pulitzer, not a prize”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a trip and stayed at the Pulitzer in Amsterdam. This was my forth hotel in Europe during my vacation, staying at properties such as Leading Hotels and Rocco Forte brand. The property is beautiful, and quite (for Amsterdam). When I started my trip, I stayed at Hotel De Lâ€� Europe. This hotel was nice, but noisy. Your front desk staff was lovely, your concierges rude and unhelpful. Your rooms without carpeting were horrible. Can you imagine staying in a room with a woman above you walking around in heals on a wood floor? What were you thinking? Even in most second rated condoâ€™s in New York, they require xx % of carpeting in the apartment. The roomâ€™s base board was coming off the wall, and were badly scuffed around the room. I was moved to room 480, a very nice space (needs to be refreshed). Your bartender in the Pulitzer told me about a â€œdiamondâ€� poured Martini. I never new that existed, he was delightful. Your service in America seems much better than Amsterdam. I am not sure I would recommend the hotel/visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: swaffy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The location is on the canal, within walking distance to everywhere. The tram is just up the street. It couldn't have been more beautiful. The hotel is a group of canal housed connected together. It can feel a little maze like, but we were toward the front of the hotel on the first floor. We didn't realize how big is was until we went exploring! Our room opened up on a courtyard. I'm sure in the summer there are tables out there to eat on, but it was a little cool for that in September. The conceige(s) were very helpful and very cheerful! The were able get us tickets to all the major events and museums. I would definately recommend theis hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Bedford
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a number of canal houses converted into a hotel - it's on one of the quieter canals and easy to walk to the centre of town, to the museum quarter and to numerous bars, cafes and restaurants. The restaurant in the hotel is overpriced and there is a lovely restaurant with a set menu just round the corner which was great. My room had a huge bed and was right up in the attic - not particularly large but an interesting shape, and lovely views, loud church bells in themorning though! The staff were helpful until we asked about the prebooking service onto KLM flights - nobody seemed to know what the service was - although it was prominently displayed in the in-room guide. Absolutely recommend The Supper Club - a short walk and an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: warlok7
Reviews.Content: Not your usual hotel, but a fascinating design that one has to see to fully understand. If you want big flashy lobbies and rooms that nicely fit some mold of comfort, then the Pulitzer will make you complain like the others on this forum. The restaurant and bar are surprisingly good; not gourmet, but good. The rooms are European comfortable. But, the prize is the courtyard cafe. In good weather, this is an unexcelled hideaway from the big city around you.

Reviews.Title: “Great days in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel early September on the basis of the reports, and enjoyed it all the way. After a very long trip we arrived early in the hotel, hoping for an early check in. The welcome was very warm from a gracious young gentleman at the reception, but unfortunately the room was not ready yet (there were many more people trying to check in early, all Americans presumably arriving from the overnight flights like us). Waiting for our room we decided to have a lavish breakfast to get us started.We can highly recommend the breakfast, it includes everything you find in the US, but also some great Dutch additions. After breakfast the room was ready. We stayed in a room overlooking the canal at the other side of the hotel (keyzersgract). (room 262) Very picturesque and very quiet. Indeed, the rooms are not the biggest but are very well appointed with luxurious fabrics, a good hifi CD set and large TV. It really made us feel landlords of a Dutch canal house! The bathroom was equally well appointed but not oversized. Compared to some other luxury collection hotels we have stayed in before (Danielli Venice, Imperial Vienna) this hotel is more understated but I suppose this has to do with location. Amsterdam is northern europe after all. Reading the remarks about the concierge we were a little hesitant, but we found both the elderly gentleman (he apparently is the chairman of the concierge association in Amsterdam) and the young lady totally charming and very helpful in showing us the way to the well known places as well as the hidden gems, that are all around the hotel waiting to be found. They did make our visit to Amsterdam so much more special. We particularly recommend renting bicycles through them and taking one of the recommended cycle routes through town and into the countryside towards Volendam. Altogether the Pulitzer lived up to it's reputation of a high class understated hotel that wraps you in a comfortable blanket of Dutch culture that a modern built hotel simple cannot deliver!

Reviews.Title: “Not what one expects”
Reviews.Author: reffin
Reviews.Content: After much research, I finally decided on this hotel because of its position in Amsterdam and being classed as"luxury" seemed an ideal choice for my daughter and I to spend a weekend as her special birthday treat. I had warned her not to expect a very large room as the hotel is situated in the old canal houses along Prisengracht, what we did not expect was a small room in the attic which had a very noticeable odour.We tracked it down to the AC. The ceiling and upper walls showed obvious traces of damp along the tapes of the plasterboard,even a puddle shaped seepage onto the top of a pelmet over a (very) small window.Obviously the roof is leaking above this gable and the AC is blasting tainted air into the room. At Reception the Night-Duty Manager(female) whose name I have noted, appeared to resent being interrupted whilst in conversation with a friend, her expression when I told her what we thought was the cause; practically a sneer of disbelief.Her solution? To spray the room! This was not acceptable for health reasons.At no point did she seem interested,I could feel my "professional" face about to develop. Because I did not wish to spoil my daughter's first visit, I did not pursue the matter as vociferously as I would normally, or when with my husband. When we arrived back after an evening out, the curtain fabric had obviously been sprayed with a deodouriser!! Our own solution was to keep the AC off,which was only possible because the weather grew cooler. I do not expect this level of disinterest in ANY hotel. Also, the hotel would be advised to forget the waffles, chocolate and water "freebies" and provide tea and coffee making facilities. In conclusion, a disappointing choice when one compares this hotel with others experienced, of a supposed lesser category. The room had one window above head height, the other at desk height and faced a wall.

Reviews.Title: “If only I loved Amsterdam as much as the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoVuitton75
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four-night stay at the Pulitzer and I can say that we were thoroughly impressed with this hotel. We had secured four free nights at this hotel with our Starwood Preferred Guest Program. I would gladly have paid the stated rate for this hotel given the service we received. The hotel is located on one of the nicest canals in Amsterdam, in several dozen canal houses that have been refurbished and converted into the hotel. Everyone from the front desk workers to housekeeping staff to the bellhops were very welcoming and attentive. We arrived around 3 p.m. and were originally assigned a king bedded smoking room with a canal view. As we had requested a nonsmoking room, we went back down to the front desk and requested that we be given a nonsmoking room. None was available at that time, but one was in the process of being cleaned and would be ready in 30 minutes. Only caveat was that it would not be a canal view, but a garden view instead. We decided to go for that room anyway because the smoking issue is crucial for us due to health reasons. While we waited, we decided to have lunch at the hotel's restaurant, Pulitzer's. The restaurant has a lovely outdoor eating area under umbrellas. While we were having lunch, the front desk agent that had checked us in came by with the new keys and even comped our drinks with lunch. I thought that was a very nice touch and exceeded my expectations of customer service. The new room was perfect. In retrospect, we were very pleased that we ended up with a garden view room instead of a canal view room because it was so quiet in our room. We did not hear a single noise during the four days that we were there. The room was very nicely decorated, with hardwood floors, a comfortable sitting area and a nice-sized bathroom with a shower curtain(!). We received a complimentary bottle of Evian Water and two yummy carameled waffles every day, replenished without request. The housekeeping staff was wonderful and very attentive to any requests. Turndown service was a nice touch. The only part of the hotel that we felt could use some improving is the concierge. Every individual we encountered at the concierge desk did not provide us with any more information that we had already gleaned from our travel guides. If anything, they were extremely pushy about trying to get us to take one of the hotel's planned tours rather than providing us with the information to allow us to do what we had requested. There are several restaurants in the area that are worth noting. Walking toward Westkerk from the hotel, you will come across a small Spanish Tapas restuarant called El Rincon Andaluz. It will be on your right as you walk on Prinsengracht toward the church from the hotel, before you reach the church. It had wonderful food and excellent service. A bit further down Prinsengracht from the Anne Frank Huis is a great little restaurant called Spanier and Van Twist with most of its tables being outdoors along the canal. We had lunch there twice during our stay and it was very good and extremely relaxing and enjoyable to eat outdoors under the trees and watching the boats sail by. Try the quiche- it was excellent. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel if you are seeking a true luxury experience during your time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: vivvy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at this superb hotel. Centrally located but in quiet tree lined avenue beside a major canal. Luxurious rooms with turnback service, chocolates left on pillows and slippers beside bed. Large fluffy dressing gowns and ample toiletries replenished daily. Very pleasant staff who couldn't do enough for you. Buffet breakfasts were excellent and carried you over until the evening meal, with all tastes catered for. Our friends stayed in a different 'town house' from us but both rooms had their own charm. My sense of direction is lacking, so I could have got lost in the corridors but my partner had no problem whatsoever. Our only grumble was the cost of drinks in the bar - but you probably expect these prices staying in a large city e.g. London. Our friends booked the break through Broadway Travel, who gave us an excellent deal over the August Bank Holiday, travelling from Birmingham. Can highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again, if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review”
Reviews.Author: SuccessJoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed there August 17th - 20th as a tourist, based on the reviews here. My experiences were quite different from some that I read! First, contrary to some reviews, the room I had (executive) was quite large by European standards. I requested a quiet room and got room 199 which overlooked the courtyard. It was very quiet indeed. Because of my request, the room selected was carpeted which also helped rather than having a room with wood floors. But really not that much character. The concierge, contrary to reviews here, was not very helpful. Sure they get the same questions all day, but she always seemed to give the quickest answer she could and in every case was no better than if I had tried it without her. The boat tour, also highlighted here, was poor. The captain spoke very poor English and really wouldn't say much. I stood next to him to get any information, and he just wouldn't say a thing! It's a nice and quaint boat, but I would recommend using a commercial line. It was also expensive at 33 Euros each. So almost $80 (couple) for a non-descriptive 90 minute tour. Buy yourself one of the self powered boats and do it yourself! The location is certainly good, but so are many others. Breakfast came with the room which was good because I certainly wouldn't have spent 50 Euros each for it! They also nickel and dime you for a lot. Pick up a USA Today (even as a Starwood Gold member) and its 2 Euros on your bill. Use the internet in the business center - 8 Euros for 15 minutes! Add that to a 220 Euro (plus taxes) and I feel like it was a shake down.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's supposed to be.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the other reviews are talking about, but The Pulitzer is definitely not a 5 star hotel. The rooms are small beyond European standards and the bathrooms are something like you would see in a Days Inn or similiar (cheap products). The worst was the beds. It was like the pushed together two ancient box springs which were doubled up instead of using a mattress. When I asked for a switch I was informed all of the beds were like that in the hotel. For 300 Euro per night I should be sleeping on a cloud! I had to ask for 3 comforters to make it bearable. They did give me a nice fruit basket to compensate for my lack of sleep and aching back. Also, the hallways were very institutional like you would find in an American elementary school (painted over cinderblocks...bizarre). Elevator was tiny and slow as well. Concierge was always flustered and could never seem to get you into any restaurants. Overall, I will not be returning. I've had much better stays at The Grand or InterContinental...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in August 2005. The hotel staff was friendly and the location could not be better. The room overlooked a canal and the view was perfect. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. If you stay here, you have to have the awesome breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. Everything perfect except for the gruff (echoing another review) concierge. We stayed in one of the better rooms, and it was very spacious with a sofa in front of the tv. very clean and very interesting place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pulitzer for three nights. Room was very comfortable and very quiet. We were provided with tea and coffee facilities at request but these were not automatically replenished daily. Breakfast was excellent in a light airy restaurant. The location is superb as other reviewers commented, the hotel is located on a quiet canal but only a short walk/tram ride to the hub of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel, and great location”
Reviews.Author: travelman123
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer is comprised of several former homes on one big block to form a bigger hotel. The hotel is filled with charm, but it can be quite a process winding your way up and down the hallways, to find your room, due to the pathways that connect the former homes. The standard rooms are very nice. They're the quaint size of the average NYC hotel, and not the room size of some of the bigger hotels in the middle of America. I chose a garrden room, only because I wanted quiet, and I did not know how much noise there might be near the canal. The queen size bed I had was split right down the middle with two separate duvet white comforters on top of the queen bed, so that two people could each have their own blanket for their own "side." It was somewhat annoying, as the blanket for your side is small. But the room is very clean, and very up to date. BOSE speakers next to your bed, nice lighting, and hardwood floors. There is turndown service, great bathrobes, slippers, chocolate by your bedside. The bathroom is also clean and sophisticated, but small. The marble floor is heated! There is a mini-bar with motion sensors, so don't take anything out if you don't want to be charged. The concierge of the hotel is hit or miss. Some of the staff is very courteous, others are somewhat stuck up. They did recommend buying a ticket in advance to Van gogh Museum, and I was able to buy it there. Great advice, because the museum is mobbed with ticket buyers. There is usually a wait to get help at the concierge desk. Hotel Pulitzer is incredibly close to the Anne Frank House Museum...but further away from the center of town. But everything is within walking distance. Ultimately, a hotel I would stay at again, and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Imperfections Forgiven --- We Had a Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: DavidSBush
Reviews.Content: My son and I just returned from a one week stay at the Hotel Pulitzer and a father/son pre-college trip to Amsterdam. The hotel is centrally located on a quiet street, directly on one of the major canals and surrounded by lovely neighborhoods with shops and many excellent cafes and restaurants. It is a very short walk to the Anne Frank House and close to yet far enough from the bustling city center and Dam Square area. We had an "executive" room on the top (5th) floor with wooden floors and a nice view of the canal. The room was very comfortable, but not really luxurious. The hotel is a series of very attractive inter-connected canal houses and has a charming European ambience. There is a beautiful sculpture garden, which is an extremely plesant setting for a late afternoon drink when the weather is nice. The staff was courteous and efficient, though the concierge seemed a bit slow to respond to requests for dinner reservations. By the end of the week, I was booking restaurant reservations myself to avoid feeling aggravated. The week we were there, the vast majority of the guests seemed to be American. I would likely stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I know this is meant to be a 5 star hotel, but it feels more like a 4. But it's in a good location, over looking a canal and about 10 mins walk to the main Dam square. The rooms are not huge but big enough, but they have been put together nicely and there are a lot of nice touches. We didn't eat in the hotel but the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights at the Pulitzer a couple of weeks ago. I don't know if its standard practice or we just looked like beautiful people but we had a spacious, stylish canal view room just one floor above the bar. I think the location is excellent, easy walking distance to main attractions but not surrounded by the crowds and the hop on/off boat stops about two minutes away. The bar is cosy and well run, breakfast was fresh and plentiful and all the staff were pleasant. If you can afford to stay at the Pulitzer don't bother with anyting else

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: twestover
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 503 at this very nice hotel. The staff was attentive (though the concierge could be a bit gruff), and the breakfasts were out of this world! Be sure to get a rate that include breakfast - it will keep you going all day! The rooms that end in -03, are in an old warehouse building and are so cool! Brick walls, hardwood floors, windows that open on to the canal. They are executive rooms, but are worth the money and worth asking for that specially. Room 502 is interior, but also charming. We loved the local of this hotel, easy walk to most everything but away from the craziness. You can be crazy and come home to quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShawnF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pulitzer on July 16th, 2005. This was my second stay at the hotel. Overall, I like this place. I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for an upscale place to stay in the heart of Amsterdam. I will try to organize my thoughts below in terms of PLUS (things I like) and MINUS (things I did not like) about the Pulitzer. PLUS * historic property with lots of character * modern rooms * a certain panache; well deserving 4 star hotel * location: right on the canal, nice neighbourhood, short walk to restaurants and shopping MINUS * price - I find the room rates to be expensive * parking - if you have a car, you will park it offsite - valet parking was 40 euros for the one night * service was lacklustre all around. Don't expect exceptional service from front desk, concierge, porter, or valet. Although they WILL expect a tip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel In A Perfect Location But Not A 5 Star!”
Reviews.Author: NikiC
Reviews.Content: We were on our last few days of a 2 week trip starting in Paris and picked hotels according to location. Wanting to be within walking distance of most everything. We were happy with the location, room was on the small side.faced nothing (we got a good internet rate) bed was not a king or queen for that matter (comfortable), amenities were there but not Starwood quality, all in all good, however, what did turn us off...the prices at the bar and the fact that they make you pay for a newspaper and don't tell you till you check out...can you imagine the Four Seasons doing such a thing but then again it is no Four Seasons. Do yourself a favor and eat at the DE PRINS, out the hotel turn right, 2nd bridge make left, great for eating anytime of the day except they don't open before 10:00a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and child friendly!”
Reviews.Author: martina83
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice now (most recently in July 2005) and been very pleased. Both stays were with 2 rooms and we were all very comfortable and enjoyed the uniqueness of each room. Our rooms on the back side of the hotel were closer to the nearby church, so bells could be heard, but it did not disturb our rest. The second stay was canalside (4th floor) and absolutely beautiful! I would highly recommend the upgrade. We even had one room with a loft that had 2 single beds! Travelling with a 2 year old can sometimes be a challenge, but she was given just as warm a welcome as we were - including a trip to the back office to retrieve a coloring book and crayons. The restaurant has high chairs and there is even a child's swing in the courtyard! Will definitely be returning to the Pulitzer on future trips to A'dam!

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The entrance is nice, staff seemed welcoming and the view over the canal was lovely (room 280). The room has beautiful furniture and it's charming by traditional European standards. Now the problems are: my bed sagged, so it was uncomfortable for two people to sleep together, furniture and bathroom seem to be cramped in little space, the corridors are somewhat laberinthic, there is some AC or pipe noises in the room at night. Breakfast is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a deluxe 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: Louise068
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for exploring Amsterdam on foot. My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Pulitzer in an executive room. The first room we were given had someone else in it! It looked very small and dark so we were quite glad we had the chance to get another room. We had a canal view room that was reasonably spacious although the bathroom was on the small side. We had no problems with noise (we were on the 4th floor) and housekeeping did an adequate job. Breakfast was included in our rate and was well worth it. Breakfast does not finish until 2.30 pm at the weekend so you could have this as a brunch and set yourself up for the day. Pulitzer boat trip was good and the guide was excellent. Hotel bar is VERY expensive - 2 doubles cost us 38 euros!!!!! Try the local bars and restaurants for a quarter of the price. I think this hotel is a little over priced and not 5 star/deluxe but OK for a one off weekend.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: suefish
Reviews.Content: I just assumed if a hotel is listed as Five Star and is a member of the Starwood Luxury Collection that one can expect a good experience. We had anything but that at the Hotel Pulitzer. Although the location and architecture is superb - the rooms are poorly maintained, the staff is snobbish. Even housekeeping didn't live up to the standard we would have expected. The curtains in our room were filthy and the walls were desparately in need of a paint job. Beware if you have a canal view room. Every weekday morning at 5:45 a.m. the linen service truck makes a delivery using equipment that is so loud it jolts you out of a deep sleep. The noise goes on for at least 30 minutes. The manager on duty told me this happens every morning and there is nothing they can do about it. I think Hotel Pulitzer is over rated.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could say perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Rajrouj
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely architecture, good breakfast, A1 staff, but... tiny rooms, not enough closet space, microscopic bathroom; in short, not worth the price, despite the upgrade to "executive" with canal view. If you do stay there, the boat trip with the hotel's boat is definitely worth it, the captain a great guide !

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pulitzer for business at the beginning of June 2005. The 'Executive' room I got was small and rather basic. Not even an internet connection! Breakfast for Euro 20 was OK! The location is great! But the service patchy! I do not believe it deserves to be in the 'Luxury Collection' of Starwood. Might be a good place for tourists, but try another place if you are in Amsterdam on business.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel Great location but could have been better

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: SharonHD
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Pulitzer in October last year. The room was lovely, beautifully decorated, comfy bed and pretty bathrooom, we didn't have any view from the window (aside from a brick wall) but this didn't concern us as we were out sightseeing most of the day. Staff were professional and courteous at all times and most helpful when booking tours or enquiring about tram routes etc. The bar had a nice atmosphere and the staff there were very friendly and service was anticipated. Would recommend this hotel to others, a relaxing place to come back to after a long day out.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights in this hotel and i have to say it was simply superb. The room we had was a luxury, it had wooden beams and floors and the most fantastic views over the canal. The staff without exception went out of their way to be helpfull and provide that little bit extra to make your stay special. Especially the bar staff in the pulitzer bar...they were very entertaining as well as helpfull. The hotel has a wonderfull garden area in the centre of the building for lunch or just chilling with a beer. Food was a little expensive but worth it for quality...especially the club sandwiches and the butterballs. The hotel is 5 mins walk from dam square and ideal for viewing the city. The concierge arranged all of our excursions and was most helpfull. Also you must take the boat trip on the hotels private boat. The captain is an expert on the city and very entertaining. All in all i cannot recommend this hotel enough...Five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pulitzer, Amsterdam--Massage, Food, Etc.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer over Easter weekend. While my room was small and rather dark, the hotel is in a great location and convenient to all. There is no spa at the hotel, but while wandering around near the Anne Frank House I discovered Body Healing by Ronen massage & body care. Ronen is originally from South Africa and he was very professional--plus his price for a massage was about 1/2 the price of two other day spas I later checked out. His website is ---- and he is located at Eerste Bloemdwarsstraat 1. ---- A couple of food tips--there is a huge foodmarket near the Magna Plaza (close to the Hotel). Great for picking up a snack and you can find those wonderful cookies (stroopwaffels) like the ones they leave in your room at the Pulitzer (you can't get the exact brand they give you in the hotel in USA so if you find them there, buy them!) Also, if you walk out of the hotel's front door and go left. On the right side of the canal on a corner about two blocks down is a take out place that sells authentic Dutch food. I couldn't read the menu but since the food is right in front of you it's easy to point at what looks good. Lastly, I don't know if it was just because I was there over a holiday weekend, but the stores seemed to close very early. I hardly did any shopping as by the time I got back from sightseeing nothing was open. If you have time to see a movie, make sure it's at the Pathe Tuschinski Theatre, an art deco masterpiece. It's near Rembrandtplein at REGULIERSBREESTRAAT 26

Reviews.Title: “We had a small "delux" room with no storage”
Reviews.Author: Newcast_eUKK_2
Reviews.Content: What previous reviewers said about the location of the hotel is correct. It is in easy walking distance of all major sites, yet in a nice, relatively quiet canal setting. (Watch out for the cycleists when you are walking - they are deadly!) We booked a delux room. This turned out to be very small with a very small bathroom. My partner complained that there was nowhere to sit and do her make-up, cloths storage was extremely limited and we lived pretty much out the suitcase for the 3 days we were there. It would appear that all delux rooms are small - the larger rooms are the executive rooms, and of course the suites. Having said that, the furniture in the room was nice, the bed was extremely comfotable, the staff were efficient and the hotel is clean. Luckily the weather was good and we were out most of the time. Had we had to use the room more it would have been less fun. If you add breakfast to your hotel stay at Euro 25 per person it becomes a fairly expensive stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer for 3 nights in March and had a wonderful first experience of Amsterdam.Firstly it is within walking distance of nearly all attractions and set in the middle of two canals adds to the ambiance. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful, always available and courteous but unobtrusive too. Our room, although small, was lovely and we felt happy not to be in a hotel where every room is identical- it really was charming. Breakfast was included in our deal and it was fantastic-in fact the whole price was a good deal.We would certainly visit the Pulitzer again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Emmapeelmeagrape
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews before my trip and used the advice on the room. It seemed some liked the canal view while others wanted the quiet courtyard view. I called the day before and requested a canal view since that's more important to me and they honored the request (didn't promise it though). It wasn't noisy to me but I live in NYC. We booked an internet only deal (no changing possible-only do this if you're sure on the dates) that included breakfast and drink at the bar one night. We arrived at 9:30am thinking we'd have to wait to check in but the room was ready-so our early check in phone request also paid off. The room was lovely-not huge but just right. Brick walls, big arched window looking onto the canal. Staff was great, room was great and the location is perfect. As far as it being part of the "luxury collection"- It is not the St. Regis and this is an old property with uniqueness, character and a total european feel. If you want american style everything you may not be happy, but if you want to have both the conveniences of a luxury hotel w/ the charm of Holland, go for the Pulitzer-or maybe don't so it's available for me next time...

Reviews.Title: “Booking agent did not give correct information”
Reviews.Author: 124David
Reviews.Content: Six friends and I stayed at the Sheraton Pulitzer in August as the last stop on their European holiday. Although the hotel itself was very nice, there were a few problems. First, I made the booking by phone which turned out to be a big mistake since I didn't have written proof of what the agent had told me. She said that breakfast was included in our plan, so the first morning we ate there. The breakfast was delicious, but certainly not worth 25 Euros which we were charged. When I tried to explain to the staff that we were told that breakfast was included, everyone told me that I must have misunderstood - no one would even acknowledge the possibility that the Sheraton booking agent actually made a mistake. The second, and more serious, problem was that there was a huge concert taking place on a makeshift stage set up just in front of the hotel. This blocked off the street, forcing our taxi to drop us off a block away. That was no big problem, but on Saturday, the day of the concert, the hotel was mobbed with people attending the concert. Throngs of unsupervised children ran at will through the bar, preventing us from having a quiet drink and conversation. When I complained about this noise, the person at the desk said, "certainly you were told about this concert and the disruptions it would cause when you booked." Once again, I had not been told. We were able to hear part of the concert from an upstairs hallway window - tickets were impossible to obtain - even for hotel guests. I would stay here again - the location is hard to beat - but I would not even consider staying during that concert weekend.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: whistler2005
Reviews.Content: this hotel is truely the best in amsterdam and an enjoyable place to stay. This is the 3rd time my wife and i stayed there and this time was flawless as usual. We had a big room and our own little private terrace with private entrance, our 3 pound little dog just loved it and felt like home immediately. The staff is just great and they bend over backwards to assist, i honestly cant find anything bad to say about the pulitzer and staff given the price/reward ratio. In fact by looking @ price/reward i find the Pulitzer to be in the highest category of 5 star hotels ive been to... truely a bargain. Location just cant be beat.... you want to be on prinzen/heren/kaiserstraat simply bcs its a true pictoresque neighborhood and best of all is close to everything and anything. This place is killer and happy to return shortly...

Reviews.Title: “small, but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: LauraJHodson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a well needed 3 night break over the christmas period (26th-29th december 2004) The building is charming and the intricate walk up and down the corridors to your room is a delight provided you have no mobility issues. The room itself was well appointed and luxurious in a discrete sense- exposed brickword, glossy floorboards and heavy curtains. The size of the room we were first appointed to(standard, facing other buildings) would bring about claustrophobia in anyone who felt they needed space on the floor to both put their bags down and move around...needless to say, we asked for a 'tour of the available rooms' and were obliged- and relocated to a room with a canal view that was slightly larger, although we were shown other much larger rooms, these were down a tunnel of corridors which necessitated going past the restaurant (and then some more). There were some pleasant touches- there is an alarm clock with a cd player, chocolates and other pleasantries left beside the bed, a bath which expels water from three different sources and so forth. Location- a 5-10 minute walk from the following: A large shopping centre and market place, tram stops, the grand krasnapolsky, dam square, Anne Frank's house. Further afield by tram you can find the Van Gough. There is plenty to do- we enjoyed our trip to the zoo, which was very easy to rech by a tram stop close to the hotel. The concierge helped us with this- they always proved themself to be courteous and informative. The brakfast room was gorgeous-they had some lovely breads. Ignore the idiot who complained in a previous review about the orange juice machine making a noise- you will find several freshly squeezed juices already prepared by the attentive staff and I can't say I heard anything worth mentioning! Now, in terms of value for money- we paid Â£168 per night (per room, including breakfast) and were hoping for something rather special. Perhaps our expectations were too high, but we didn't feel, on reflection that the hotel merited such an amount when other perfectly good hotels were available for half the price. If you feel quite comfotable parting with around Â£6 for a gin and tonic from the in-room then cheers and enjoy but I tend to opt for more ecomical options ( you can always knock yourself out a bottle or two of 3 euro '98 spanish red from the local equivalent of a rather diverse primark as we did) We had a really fantastic time, but I can't say I would return to the hotel again, as for all its character it was essentially just a slightly above average hotel in a nice location. We value the reviews submitted on tripadvisor and use them to inform our choice of hotel, and hope our feedback is of assistance to anyone considering a trip to 'dam.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - Everyone EXTREMELY friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Feb 4-6, 2005 as a 50th surprise birthday for my brother in law. The staff was extraordinarily friendly and helpful......especially Esther at the concierge desk. The room was beautiful with a gorgeous canal view. Even a heated floor in the bathroom! Extremely comfortable bed and pillows.....best we've had at a hotel in years. Would go back again in a heartbeat. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights last week. Found all the staff very friendly. We had a standard room, which had a safety box, mini bar, tv etc. Bathrobes provided in the bathroom. The only complaint we have with the room was the lighting- romantic - but difficult to search through the suitcase at times! Each evening, on our return to our room, we had a turnback service, with chocolates on the pillow, along with the next days weather forecast with throwaway slippers provided next to the bed, and gentle music playing on the cd player . We didn't eat in the hotel other than breakfast which was included in our package. Wouldn't pay 25 euros for it, but you can fill up for the day on the amount of food available. There are plenty of restaurants/ bars close by and walking in the evening, with the lights on the canals it was worth eating out of the hotel anyhow. Within easy reach of so much, we walked everywhere. Close the Anne Franks house and the canal stop. I would love to stay there again should I make another visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be deceived”
Reviews.Author: theoilbaron1978
Reviews.Content: At your service? 3 attempts before a pick up. Room service? It took 45 minutes to russle up a burger and chips, which was so disgusting I couldn't touch it - limp chips and bad cheese. Could I get some ice to have with my drink, please? Yes, in about 40 mins. Turn down service arrived promptly at 7:30, the only good thing about my stay was the chocolate they left. The room was shabby and the bathroom absolutely tiny, although the view JUST about made up for it (it was picturesque, but nothing fantastic). The furniture was old, ugly and all together uncomfortable. I was on the Priznengracht side and the windows didn't hold much of the sound out, making for a fairly disturbed sleep. Luxurious? Don't make me laugh. There is absolutely NOTHING commensurate with this hotel being a part of the Starwood luxury chain - I've stayed in better motels. If you're looking for a good Starwood hotel in Netherlands, try Westin Rotterdam. They are SUPERB.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller10101
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers I have mixed feelings about my stay at the Pulitzer. Stayed there for 3 nights on August 2004, after a lot of checking. Booked the more expensive larger rooms(Executive) 260 Euro including breakfast. Mind you the Deluxe rooms are the standart rooms. The room was large and comfortable but not fine, the bath was very nice but small. Had a garden view. The long trips to the room did not bother me. Very nice breakfast, the staff was very efficient but not at all friendly, kind of cold. The late night meals we ordered to the room were very disappointing. Almost uneatable. The location is great. Very close to attractions and quiet. Itâ€™s a nice hotel but not what I had expected for that price. We were a little disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Hotel is a joke”
Reviews.Author: HotelGourmand
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice, but won't be coming back. The front desk staff are rude and we all agreed that the rooms needed renovating. You need a map and a guide to find your room as the hotel is a bizarre maze. Go to Blakes if you can handle the attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: DairyQueen
Reviews.Content: We were planning to stay at this hotel but our flight was cancelled due to a malfunction of the plane. This malfunction made us cancel our trip to the Netherlands. Every other hotel in the Netherlands agreed to refund our money, but not this one. They made no effort whatsoever to show any understanding or compassion. In fact, they were very rude and nasty to us when we tried to explain the situation to them. We even provided them with proof that our flight was cancelled and they still didn't care, they just kept saying that it is "company policy". In fact, when we talked with Starwood about this policy, they actually told us that it was up to the local manager to make the determination. So, stay away from this hotel, the management is aweful and rude.

Reviews.Title: “That Was Then, This Is Now....”
Reviews.Author: TravelLovinMan
Reviews.Content: I guess I just don't have the proper appreciation for the difficulty in joining 20 odd canal houses together to make a hotel. Or maybe it was just my expectations of what I would find in the way of a five star property. But in any event, I was underwhelmed with the Pulitzer. Not that it's a bad hotel. It's just not 'Luxury Collection' material. The room I had was very large for Amsterdam. In fact, there are many apartments that are considerably smaller (okay, so I peeked in the windows of way too many apartments as I walked along the canals). The bathroom was nice (big tub, heated marble floors), hotel room was relatively quiet, and the staff was very friendly, though a bit lacking in their knowledge of restaurants. The place is just very disjointed. No central lobby to speak of. Horrible art. I mean awful. You have to jig and jog (and jig and jog) to get to the only bar/restaurant (both of which are nice/just okay). And heaven help if you need to go to the bathroom while at the bar/restaurant (over the river and through the woods, to grandmother's house we go...). Would definitely stay here again, but only if I get a very good deal. Starwood?? Are you listening??

Reviews.Title: “A disappoitment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times in the past, in the front part of the hotel, but this time was very disappointed. The original room we were shown was awful, in the attic and a bathroom so small you couldn't stand in the shower or even get to the loo. Hardly a 5 start experience. We requested a room change, and the staff were very helpful and let us see 2 more rooms, tho hardly any nicer but at least you could stand up in the shower. The back part of the hotel feels very shabby, and is definately not a 5 star standard. Overall, despite it's great location, I am not sure I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Pulitzer 4* but not 5”
Reviews.Author: MicheleParis
Reviews.Content: We just stay in Amsterdam this week end. It was my 5th visit in Amsterdam but my frist stay at the Pulitzer. Thanks I got a special price "endless week end" wich make the price for the room at 215 Euros the night. It was a Deluxe room (normal rate 450 Euros). Thanks I did not have to pay this price !! room was OK but the bathroom is so tiny that 2 people could not move. No hairdryer !!! I you want a canal view they charge you 30 Euros per night (which was not mentioned in the Starwood hotel reservation). Anyway. Location is nice, bar is nice, staff friendly but I'd rather put my money in another hotel next time. However, people should know that the rating in Amsterdam is different. I have experienced Renaissance Amsterdam and I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visit a bit disappointing, but still has charm”
Reviews.Author: minniemouse
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the Pulitzer September 21-24, 04. We had stayed there in 2001 and loved our room, which overlooked the Prinsengracht Canal. We booked the same room. I had several emails with the hotel reservation agent and I guaranteed the room with my credit card. When we arrived, the reservation clerk insisted we had not guaranteed the reservation and our room was no longer available and the hotel was overbooked. I insisted that I had guaranteed the room with my credit card and she did give us a room that overlooked the same canal, but was in a different building and wasn't as nice as the room we had reserved. I called the reservation agent the next morning and she offered us a different room, but it was no nicer than the one we were in, so we declined. They did nothing to compensate, such as offer us a free breakfast at least, which I thought would have been appropriate. We were a bit disappointed, but still, the hotel is very nice, and the location is great. The bed was very comfortable, the amenities are great, the heated marble floors in the bathrooms are a nice touch, especially in chilly Amsterdam. The Joordan area is the best for nice walks, unusual shops and galleries and good restaurants. The hotel breakfast is hugely overpriced, but there are lots of nice little places for breakfast in the immediate area. Amsterdam is a great city and I would definitely go back and I might give the Pulitzer antother chance when I do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice Staff, but, 5*???”
Reviews.Author: judymol
Reviews.Content: We used our Sheraton points for our entire stay and upgraded from the initial room given us which was very tiny and a little shabby. It was only 40E more a night to get a large room that was quite nice. The staff was very accommodating in helping us and showed us three rooms to pick from. We sat out in their little garden which was charming --- We each had 2 drinks and our bill was 40E. That was the last time we did that. Also, breakfast was way over priced... The concierge was very helpful and suggested some great places to eat. We had a walking tour our first day (just my husband and myself) arranged by the hotel and he was great. Learned a lot about the hotel itself which explains why the hotel rooms and the hotel itself looked different by wing. Did not really get a chance to check out the other 5* properties so really can't compare. It wasn't a stuffy hotel and the staff was very friendly and nice ambiance. But, don't feel it is a 5* property. All in all, we enjoyed our time there and loved the location, but, if we had to pay rather than use points - would we? NO.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; friendly staff; not quite a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer for a couple of nights. The hotel is in a great location in Jordaan and sits between 2 canals. Staff are very helpful and friendly. If the weather is good, there is a peaceful garden at the centre of the hotel. However, parts of the hotel are really on the shabby side, particularly some of the common areas byond the lobby - not what you'd expect of a 5 star hotel; and you can't help feeling they could create a bit more character out of the very promising start of a set of canal houses.
