Our room, though well-appointed and with views of the canal, was on the small side and did not justify the cost. All in all, a safe hotel but lacking in the touches and details that you'd expect at the price, hence the average rating.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: CraigJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pulitzer for 3 nights, the first week in September - very nice hotel - our room was a little small, but very well appointed - I had requested a garden view room which was granted - no view but the room was very quiet - the location of the hotel is perfect as it's in an upmarket residential area of Amsterdam - close to restaurants and cafe's and a short walk to Dam Square - don't bother with breakfast at the hotel - there are plenty of small cafe's with great breakfasts, close by for a fraction of the price

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Redmadrid
Reviews.Content: A touch of luxury but delivered with good humour and without the 'stuffiness' you might expect from such a renowned hotel group. Great location in one of the prettiest parts of Amsterdam, surrounded by excellent restaurants and bars. The room was spacious and beautifully furnished. Breakfast was a real event and all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We would have no hesitation in returning to the Pulitzer or in recommending this great Hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Pulitzer Hotel WOW!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer for Queen's Day was the best experience imaginable!! The Hotel is exquisite, clean and the staff is not be be beat. OUr room overlooked the canal and were were able to see the parade of boats on the water from our double wide windows. It is a Sheridan, but you would never know it. Very European and unlike a chain. We were there for Queen's day (Like USA's Fourth of July and Mardi Gras combined). Everyone was well-behaved and partying. It was a blast. The Museams are awesome (Van Gogh, Rikjsmuseam, etc.) The Heineken Experience was just OK. The best was the Kuenenhoff Gardens in Lisse. The tuplips were in bloom, along with agazilion other beautiful bulbs. Meticulous grounds that would take your breath away. The trams are fun and easy to take around the city. The trains are clean, fast and safe to take you to Lisse and the Hague. People are sweet and friendly. PLUS, they were filming"Oceans 12" at the Pulitzer with Brad Pitt and George Clooney. What else can I say? Go. Go, now!!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: bax52
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, but not great. Not as good as the Amstel in Amsterdam. The service is excellent, not stuffy. Very friendly and quick. Just about right. The location is brilliant. In a nice, quiet and upmarket part of Amsterdam, but only a few minutes walk from the nightlife. The rooms are quiet, but ours was a little small. Seems to be quite a variation in the rooms as the hotel is made from old canal houses. I considered asking for a bigger room but decided not too. We had a garden view room Breakfast was way overpriced and poor. For the price charged and the 5 star rating, I didnt appreciate the self serve buffet. You have to make your own toast and fetch your own coffee. Avoid. Go to a local cafe. Far better bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - take a garden view room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel early May. We used our SPG points to get an upgrade and stayed in a large room with a beautiful view of the Keizers canal. Unfortunately rooms on the canal can be a bit noisy with the traffic and as my wife has difficulty sleeping with traffic noise we asked for a room move. The receptionist was very helpful and showed us 2 large rooms overlooking the gardens. Both were suitable, we opted for an attic room with lots of character, wooden beams etc. You even had to get there via a passage way created across part of the roof! We found the staff courteous and helpful and felt the hotel was just what we needed to get a good feel for the city. Location cannot be beaten, staff and services are good. A good bar to sit back and relax after a long day. We only used the restaurant for breakfast, which was good and filling with plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “A great week”
Reviews.Author: MBLMcLean_Virginia
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son and I spent 6 days Easter week 2004 at the Pultizer. We arrived very early in the morning (7:00) due to our flight from the US. We knew our room would not be ready but we wanted to check in so we could tour. The minuite we arrived at the Pulitzer we were assured we had made the right hotel choice. Every staff member was accomodating and helpful. Our room was ready when we returned to the hotel that afternoon. The concierge was remarkably helpful. I had general ideas of how to spend the morning, but he was so helpful and assisted us in planning our day. He immediately informed us that we could buy our tickets to the Riijksmuseum, Van Gogh, Anne Frank and the canal boat bus from him, and could put them on our hotel bill. Thus alleviating our standing in hour long lines for the Van Gogh, or Anne Frank Huis. Even with tickets for the Riijks we had to stand in line. The concierge staff were instrumental in making our trip so successful. They arranged a private limo trip for us to the Dutch country and seaside which was expensive but well worth the cost. Every night they assisted us in finding a resturant or making our dinner reservations. They were very professional, helpful and pleasent, I have nothing but wonderful accolades for the concierge and their staff. Since we were going to be in Amsterdam for a week we had a suite. It was not plush, elegant or large like a suite at the Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton, but it was SPECIAL. It overlooked the Herengracht Canal. We had floor to ceiling windows on 2 levels. My son had a loft with a ladder leading to it where he set up his computor and was able to work and download his pictures every day. The setting room was confortable and the bedroom and bath room small with no storage space, but so quaint. I felt like I was living in a Dutch doll house. The room sevice and maid service were excellent and our views delightful. We never heard any street noises or other guest. We could hear the beautiful and lovely chimes of the Westermarkt, the same ones Anne Frank listened too. It was enchanting. We had breakfast at the hotel once I wasn't impressed but my son liked it. All the staff were friendly and helpful. I was so worried about smoke but I never smelled it or was bothered by it in the hotel, even in the bar. I only have good things to report about this hotel and think that staying there enhanced our stay in Amsterdam. However a suite was just big enough for the 2 of us. We loved it and do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Curate's egg; good in parts”
Reviews.Author: Robert-J
Reviews.Content: I do not think this is quite up to the 5 star standards of some Hotels I have visited - e.g. Gritti Palace, Venice. I felt the accountants had been called in to save costs and at the prices charged did not appreciate having to make my own toast at breakfast or fetch my coffee from a central dispenser. On the other hand, lovely building and great location with some good restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Nice sized rooms. A real treat. We didn't eat there so no idea about the food. The location is perfect. Staff is very friendly, although I found the concierge staff either snobby or clueless, but that's not a big deal. Lots of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nicky101
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel 5th March 04 -8th March 04. The location is excellent and the hotel is very grand. I was a little disappointed with the room consideraing the rate it was small and nothing special, but very clean and confortable beds. The worse thing was the noise from the room above, my husband and I were on the third floor the people staying above on the 4th could have been in the room with us. You could hear their voices quite plain and every footstep, at 4am I was not amused having had no sleep from 1am. I would stay there again but would make sure I was on the top floor.
